review_body: My first trip to Prague, and it was amazing, This hotel is smashing, very friendly and helpful staff, very good location, just across the road from a tram stop, and the room was excellent. Only remark is that the hospitality tray was a little lacking. Only 2 sachets of coffee and 2 tea bags. I would recommend taking a few sachets and tea bags with you, but its not a complaint, just a remark. The breakfast was superb, so much to choose from, you really couldn't fail to fill up before a long day sightseeing. I would highly recommend this hotel,

review_body: The great thing about this hotel are the staff, a big thank you to Irena and Katka for been so happy helpful and for sorting out our room which our travel agent messed up on, also thanks to Tereza Seifertona for all your swift e-mails and confirming our transport to & from the Airport, all went perfectly well, and the restaurant Manager who was exceptional, the food was very good and so was the breakfast too 10/10. The Hotel & room's are very clean and the food was fabulous & drinks both very reasonably priced we ate there every night after a long day in the city, the trams stop's outside the hotel so it was easy to get to the main square number 6 tram 7 stop's same back too. My wife & I both enjoyed this hotel and would not hesitate to stay again. A big thank you to all the staff and wish you all a Happy New Year

review_body: Decent room for a good price.Friendly staff and a location 15 minutes away from the old town centrum and the tramstation is Just 100 meters away. Staff also know their english so communication is no problem. Breakfast is in english style and has enough to enjoy.

0    Plaza Prague Hotel

review_body: Have just returned from a fantastic weekend in Prague. 9 of us stayed in the Plaza Alta hotel. The location is perfect for exploring the city. The hotel is located across from a tram stop that will take you to Old Town Square or the castle in around 10 minutes. Rooms are clean, spacious and well equipped. Breakfast is served in the restaurant attached and offers a wide variety of cooked foods, pastries etc. Staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. We will definitely return to Prague and use this hotel as our base!
hotelName:
0    Plaza Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Party of 9 just returned from a 3 night stay at this immaculate, brilliantly placed hotel & it was so, so close to being 100% perfect. Lets get them out of the way - 2 small gripes - the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in standard rooms & slightly draughty/noisy windows - BUT, even these cant tarnish our view of this hotel which we would wholeheartedly recommend to anyone. Just a short walk to the underground metro station or the tram stop - we got around the city easily with 7 children, hoping on & off their fantastic public transport with tickets available at the corner shop opposite the tram stop. (Any tram takes you one stop to the underground metro c line ‘nadrai holesovic’ station) The 3 rooms we had were all modern, comfortable, spacious and very, very clean. Rooms were cleaned daily & fresh towels provided where required.The included breakfast was served in the 7 tacos restaurant accessible through reception and its was superb. Frequently restocked, buffet style, it included continental, full english, pancakes, a selection of fresh fruit & breads with teas, coffee and a selection of fruit juices. All very relaxed, we were never rushed but the staff were attentive and friendly. The location is the real bonus - approx 10 mins from the very centre of town in a residential area, which means you’ll pay more local prices in the surrounding restaurants & bars, rather than the capital city prices you find in town. We never paid more than £9 per person for a meal including 2 drinks in local restaurants. We used 3 of the local restaurants, all less than 5 mins walk - the adjacent Chinese, classic Czech cuisine at Zlata Kovadlina & the imposing but amazingly cool Cross Club. Great food, great beer, great prices.
hotelName:
0    Plaza Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My first impression was not excellent tbh because of it’s dated green Color facade, the small reception desk, the dark coloured carpet and the antique looking furniture in the room. BUT these were all changed on my 2nd night. I looked into the details; impeccably clean grout lines, clean siliconed areas, no cracks on wall, toilet marble top, no peeling of furniture, wall paper. This hotel is actually in really good shape. To maintain this level of upkeep throughout the years, it’s not easy yet plaza Alta does it really well. Breakfast was simple fare, not alot of variety BUT I had the best croissant (not even in Vienna) and honey from their spread. One other good thing is this newly opened restaurant, 1min walk from hotel called The Eatery, they have the best garlic soup and deep fried celery I ever had. Total 4 fab nights stay, thank you plaza Alta.

review_body: I stayed here with my daughter for her birthday. I would like to thank all the staff for the flowers and wine. Rooms could be bigger and Vetter lightning. We also had a late checkout till 2pm for a review. Thumb up!

review_body: Nice hotel, clean and very friendly staff. Rooms are OK, not brand new but well cleaned. My room was very silent. Only recommended to change the shower curtains against glass doors.Good restaurant with super service.

review_body: Check in very quick. Went down for evening snacks expecting Mexican food only to be told it is now an Italian bistro with no live music. We did not eat but those who did said it was bland and very small portions.Room nice , sixth floor, clean, free safe, but tram noise could be heard until 2am and started again at 6am. Breakfast very good with lots of choice.No money exchange or purchase of tram tickets at reception. tram stop 200m from hotel to town ( 7 stops ), or one stop and then metro into town.Well positioned for travel but nothing else in area apart from very good Chinese restaurant next door which we used twice.

review_body: I stayed for 5 nights at the plaza Alta hotel . Rooms were clean but small . Towels and rooms cleaned daily . Dressing gown and slippers in room which was a bonus . Great WiFi . Breakfast was ok self service buffet . Only downside was I asked for a breakfast teabag one evening as there were none in the room and I never got it. Which was pretty annoying . The tram stop outside was great a number 6 takes you directly into town . If u buy a day ticket you can travel about once in town on any tram for 24 hours . Also a bonus the trams run 24 /7 .

review_body: The hotel itself is good, breakfast was a real plus. Room spacious and clean, however the double glazing didn't keep the noise at bay, every vehicle & tram could be heard pretty much thru the night. Staff very helpful, very pleasant. There's a nice little Chinese restaurant 25m away where the food is good, only real issue was that the lass had a young child that took her attention (we don't eat late). My main issue with the hotel was their evening meal, either they can't tell the difference between pork & beef or they were just trying to offload pork. The food was good but rather than make a point I let it go - don't trust kitchen staff when they are criticised if you get my drift, take it on the chin and move on.
hotelName:
0    Plaza Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very clean and the service was perfect. I had breakfast included in my packaged and the breakfast was always fresh and good. The room was a standard, but it was very big and also included a mini bar. I loved that everyone who worked there was so friendly, seemed happy and very eager to help us. The rooms were cleaned everyday on time and if ever we were in and needed the room cleaned later that was no problem. all information needed was always given to us if needed and the hotel is only maybe 15 minutes away from the centre of the city centre. the tram is right outside of the hotel and everything is so easy because of this. bikes are available at the hotel to ride and tours are also available. overall the experience there was perfect and I will be booking with them again on my next trip to Prague.ps: being an English speaker I had no troubles communicating. pss: I never heard any other persons living there. it was so quiet!
hotelName:
0    Plaza Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We travelled with our 8 year old from England. The hotel is in a great location, short journey by tram number 6 (kids love the trams!) to the city centre. Even getting to and from airport so easy. From airport take the regular bus down to the underground station and Praha Holesovice is the nearest underground to the hotel. It is 8 minutes walk to the hotel or take the tram.The room was spacious enough and comfortable for 3, nice bathroom, quiet hotel, reception staff was very helpful, friendly and courteous. Also it was very hot outside (30 degrees) and air-conditioning was important and worked.  Breakfast was amazing, full English as well as Czech and freshly baked breads, Czech cakes, croissants. Choices of teas and coffees. It really was more like a Breakfast-Lunch. Also you have a little shops around if you want to buy "picnic" for your trip around Prague.Tip: if you travel with children: As you walk across Charles Bridge towards The Castle, before you exit on your right hand side is a little children playground, a real gem for kids to rest (next to Kampa restaurant)We enjoyed the hotel so much, that will not be looking for anything else as we will be back.

review_body: First off I arrived at this hotel with a your group consisting of people from all over the world. We all made long flights and went through major international airports and security. When we got to the reception desk all the non whites were required to show their passports or they would not be given keys to their room. I immediately asked for another hotel but it was not possible as this was the one Trafalgar chose.The food was awful and some of us were sick next day. This was one of the 5 countries i visited from June 2 to 16 and one thing i can say is, this part of the world never heard of customer service.If you like your creature comforts and are non white then I suggest avoiding this hotel!

review_body: The hotel and room was okay, it is basic hotel, my opinion is that, this is 3 star hotel.The location is maybe far at centrum, but tram is nearby, it's easy to navigate from place to place.Only minus was hotel taxi system, we say to the reception, can they call to us taxi because we need to go to the airport, they say yes and she call immediately taxi, first group ask, how much taxi cost to the airport, taxi driver say 750 czk, and when we arriwed to the airport, the price was 1000 czk, so i say, do not use hotel taxi service!The taxi did not have a taxi meter, taxi tickets and of course we did not got the receipt.When I read the price of the taxi in Prague, then the "trusted" hotel taxi was pretty expensive.
hotelName:
0    Plaza Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I did a land tour and one of the hotels we stayed in was Plaza Alto Hotel in Prague. I requested a shower and traded with the coach driver with the approval of the desk clerk. Our room was sub standard. Night table next to bed was missing. We went to the desk. As I approached the desk, the women desk clerk looked at me and said "you are the women who had to have a shower" in a loud and nasty voice. Then the male clerk started shouting in a loud and nasty voice "you got a shower what more do you want"? I asked nicely if I could have a night table for my side of the bed. You could see that at one time there was a table from the indentations in the carpet. The male desk clerk kept yelling. I told him this is no was to treat guests. As I walked away the female clerk yelled "you can't have a table from the lobby". We have traveled for many years and have stayed in many hotels and have never been treated like this. It has never occurred to me to ask for a lobby table or receive one. I did not tell them that our TV did not work or the toilet seat was falling off. I waited for the night clerk to come on duty and told him about the toilet seat. He said someone would be there in the morning to fix it. It was never fixed and we were there for 2 days. In the morning our coach group and other guests were having breakfast in the dining room. When one of our fellow tour guests asked the busboy if he would clean off a table since there was no other place to sit. His response was to yell"OK, OK, OK". This was disruptive to the other guests trying to eat their breakfast. These people need a course in How To Treat Hotel Guests. We do not recommend this hotel to anyone and we will never stay there again.
hotelName:
0    Plaza Prague Hotel

review_body: Modern hotel with big room, lots of storage and a safe. Room was on the main road but the AC worked great to drown out any noise. No tea or coffee in the room. The bathroom needed a new shower head, the one there swiveled around in the wobbly holder. Water was hot. There was a SOS button on the wall above the tub which was interesting. What happens if you press it? Whose job is it to run to save you? Do they get danger pay? Breakfast was good.

review_body: Stayed here for three nights as part of a short break at the end of April 2018. We had the only room which had a balcony which overlooked the front of the hotel. The room was lovely and big with a separate toilet and bathroom. There were tea facilities available in the room.There was a small fitness room on the first floor and breakfast was provided as part of the deal. The staff were very helpful in terms of advice about trams and trains which passed near to the hotel. There were limited restaurants in the area but food and drinks were very reasonably priced. Really enjoyed the experience but then we did have very good weather.

review_body: Lovely and clean, very relaxing surroundings. The Mexican restaurant attached has a limited menus but good value and the food is good. The best pork T bone stake ever in a restaurant. The hotel is within easy reach of the tourist areas but far enough out not to get stung, some good local bars etc around
hotelName:
0    Plaza Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I spent a weekend at the Plaza Alta and I have to say it is a lovely hotel. Jan who works at reception is very friendly and very helpful and knowledgable about the area. He is a big asset to the hotel. The breakfast was lovely bacon, eggs, sausage, croissants, ham, cheese toast. The coffee although from a machine was very nice. Selection of hot and cold food. The room 212 was comfortable, clean and the location is very quiet enabling you to sleep. Overall a lovely stay I would definitely recommend and stay there again. The only issue I would point out and this is nothing to do with the hotel but there are some unscrupulous taxis in the city centre who charge you a ridiculous fee of 500 korunas to bring you a short distance journey from the city centre to the hotel. Please be careful regarding this and use the tram if you can, or speak to Jan to arrange a taxi. Prague is a beautiful city and the Plaza Alta hotel is great.

review_body: Though this hotel is PARA 7 but very close to Old City Square, 5 stops in tram and then walkable; decent breakfast fast internet speed along with clean beds. Value for money must recommend for anyone. Also the hotel’s recommended site tour is quite reasonable. Some good restaurants are around.

review_body: We arrived at 11am but we got checked in straight away. The reception staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms were fine and good value for money. Breakfasts are perfectly sufficient. The hotel is located about a 10 minute tram ride from the centre, buy your tickets from reception as you can't get them from the tram stop which is just across the road from the hotel. There is a restaurant attached to the hotel but it seems to be packed out each night with overnighting coach trippers.

review_body: Our standard room was very nice. We had way more than we needed for our trip, but took advantage of every thing we got. The room was clean and every time we needed our towels washed, we had clean ones the same evening.The staff at the reception was helpful and spoke good to excellent English, depending on who staffed the reception at the time. At the very least, the reception offers stamps, postal services, tickets for the zoo, tickets for public transport (30 minutes and 3 days only) and a cute, glass duck that supports the local zoo.The hotel is really close to public transport, which is a boon for anyone who wants to visit the city, but not get a hotel in the city proper.Trams 6 and 12 stop within 200 meters of the hotel and you can get tickets at the stop or even at the hotel.We didn't use the access to the fitness, though.

review_body: Stayed at hotel with friends for 4 days..rooms were fine .breakfast wasn't much but probably because were spoilt back in uk...but food at hotel was really good and not expensive.neither was alcohol...all in all not a bad hotel...bout 15min via taxi from airport and 5 stops from hotel via tram into main town.square..

review_body: This was one of the host hotels for a key international sports event outside Prague. Everything OK. Nothing exceptional. Clean. Twin beds. TV limited. Too far to walk back from Old Town (I tried) but good trams or Uber. Restaurant integrated with next door. Cheaper to buy snacks from neighbouring small shops than use minibar. Free wifi.
hotelName:
0    Plaza Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights. To my surprise the hotel has 4 stars, well in my opinion it is more like 3 star hotel. The hotel is situated few tram stops from old town. Public transport is near and it made very easy to go around the town. This is the most positive thing about the hotel. The room was clean but quite small, one of the sheets in bed had a hole in it. The pillows needs to be changed also. Unfortunately we got room on the 1st floor, right above the service entrance and every morning I woke up at 6 AM due to the loud noise coming from the service coridor. All the laundry and carbage containers made terrible noise while dragged on the floor early morning. This was quite annoying. As it was very warm outside I wanted to keep the window open during the night, but it wasn't possible due to the noise. The room had conditioner, but I don't like to use it much. Even with the window closed the noise was terrible. One evening we decided to have dinner at the hotel restaurant. There was some issues with electricity and we waited the food at least 1,5 hours. We wasn't informed in any way that the kitchen had problems, just waited and waited. Breakfast was the same every morning. Not bad, but nothing extra good either. Some negative experiences unfortunately and I probably will not book this hotel again.

review_body: We stayed two nights at this hotel we found it to be old,tired and overdue for a makeover the food presented to us for dinner on the first night was terrible, the breakfast was ok but have had better at other 3 star establishments. I found the staff rude and unhelpful on two occasions with two different staff members. I will not stay here again.

review_body: This hotel is situated in walking distance from the tram lines. They provide clean rooms and free wifi. The wifi signal strength is very poor in the room. You need to get out to the common area for better reception. Their breakfast buffet is good; but the coffee is served from vending machines and you have to stand in a line to get your coffee. The staff are very friendly and courteous.
hotelName:
0    Plaza Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: How lucky was I to stay at this cool, hip hotel on a very quiet street, away from the crowds, but only a 5 minute walk to Old Town. My upgraded room was huge and oh so chic. The staff were always helpful and gracious. They assisted me with directions and suggestions and would investigate to get any information I needed. Prague's major sights are within walking distance or a short uber ride away, including the Jewish Quarter, Charles Bridge, Mala Strana and Castle hill. Dlouha street with it's amazing restaurants and food shops is also a 5 minute walk. You must try tiny Sister's Bistro, Michelin quality open face sandwiches and pastries with take-out prices, Nase Maso with delectable sausages, sandwiches, housemade charcuterie & steaks, cooked to order and Lokal, a charming beer hall with delish, traditional Czech dishes. I rarely eat breakfast in the hotel, but did so on my first morning and it was yummy with an enticing selection of both cold and hot dishes.. The prices for all this quality is extremely reasonable. Hope to stay again! One last tip if you love to eat as well as take in the history and current culture of Prague is to take a dinner tour with Prague Food Tour. Our guide and owner, Leona, took us to restaurants showcasing both traditional and new Czech food and was was a fascinating guide to the city. She gave me additional tips on Czech restaurants and sights away from the tourist hubs that immersed me in Prague's culture. Visit Prague and stay at the BOHO!
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at boho for past 3 nights, both ourselves and friends got a free upgrade to superior rooms which was a lovely surprise. Hotel is clean, friendly and in the perfect location. From the moment you book In and get a free glass of Prosecco to the moment you leave the staff are exceptional. Rooms spacious and clean and free bottle of water each day. Breakfast has a great choice of Cooked and buffet style food which was all of high quality. Library room is lovely and they offer free wine tasting each evening. Which unfortunately we did not manage to take advantage of. Would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked at the Boho Prague hotel. Gorgeous hotel with great comfortable rooms and best staff. They are really nice and welcoming.A four star hotel with a five one category.Worth staying. Perfect location, down town but quiet place.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I wish all the hotels we are visiting on our road trip were as nice as the Boho Hotel. Very clean and modern. The service was top notch. The rooms were super nice, which features robes and slippers. Free coffee in room with brownies. Turn down service with chocolates. The free breakfast was a full service, with made to order omelettes, baked goods, oatmeal, etc. super friendly staff. Very reasonably priced. You will not regret staying at this boutique hotel.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a nice centrally located modern hotel. The only strange thing is the bathroom that has see-through windows throughout. So if you are using the bathroom or taking a shower there is no privacy. Otherwise, everything was a clean and good concierge.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect in every way, but pricey. Wonderful very helpful staff who spontaneously cancelled half our reservation when we were delayed for medical reasons and provided us with great guides for our much abbreviated stay. Beautiful breakfast. Like most eurochic rooms, a little idiosyncratic.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having had a nightmare experience with another hotel in the old centre, I booked this having not slept at 0530! So glad I did, the BoHo was an Oasis, quiet, comfortable, contemporary, with staff to be proud of. All in all, a great experience! My only problem was not being able to stay longer!
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We got a triple sharing suite. It’s very spacious. Room is clean and very comfortable. The hotel is in a quiet area, walking distance to shopping areas and around 20-30 minute walk to the famous bridge ü we love this hotel and would gladly go back.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What we liked most about this hotel:* Away from busy streets but still great location - you can walk everywhere.* Nice little spa dowstairs - every morning it was like private spa - no other people there :)* Well appointed rooms* Attentive staffWe would definately come back!
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room and the hotel were super clean, loved the modern style and upgraded rooms and the location cant be better. The staff is very friendly and brought local brownies and chocolate as a courtesy. If I go back to Prague this will be my hotel
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently stayed here for 4 nights in June and can honestly say this hotel does not fail to impress. On arrival we were greeted with a lovely welcome drink in a gorgeous setting, we chose to get the bus and metro to the centre which is in easy walking distance to the hotel. We were shown to our room even though we were earlier than 3pm check in which was an added bonus. The lovely lady explained the room to us. The cleanliness and overall style of the view was worth every penny. In the library downstairs they offer free pastries and coffee through the day that you can help yourself too. The breakfast was also lovely with a variety of cold options (overnight oats, chia seed and mango, yogurts, fresh fruit, avocado, sweet pies, muffins, sandwiches, breads, meat, cheese etc, as well as a selection of hot food that they make to order. They also have sandwiches wrapped up in cling film which is ideal if you are going on a trip for the day and want to take one with you, we also did this on our return journey to the airport as we were not sure of options available. At 5-6pm every night the hotel also offers you a glass of wine complimentary and crips, we were also greeted with mini brownies on our first night in the room. They really do spoil you and make your stay extra special. They also provide you with a large bottle of water every day in your room which is lovely.In terms of location it is honestly ideal, within 10 minutes you are in the old jewish quarter, or Charles Bridge, we only got the metro once to the television tower as this was a few districts away but everything else is in walking distance from the hotel. If you are considering booking this hotel, 100% go for it as you will not have any regrets.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautifully designed, boutique feel. Relaxing areas, especially the library with readily available coffee and pastries, very unusual as most hotels charge for coffee. Breakfast in a peaceful small restaurant, with outdoor seating. Our room was so comfortable and quiet. Location perfect, minutes walk from Old Square. Spa was really peaceful and massage excellent.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 night in this superb well-located hotel. Very warm welcome, professional approach. Received a glass of cava during the check-in process, we got as well very valuable info about the area around the hotel and the landmarks to visit.The rooms are superb, well equipped, all amenities provided and nicely decorated.Breakfast is amazing, different breads and pastries, fresh orange juices, prepared sandwiches, a lot of fresh fruits, eggs on demand, in a nutshell, a lot of choicesBeside the lobby area a bar is available for a refreshing cocktail in a nice setting.Good service!Good WIFI
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nothing to say about the confortBut after one night every towel was changed, no ecology at all !!Good breakfast Very bad room service : awful salad with dead lettuceAwful seasoning and bread had no taste of bread
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: BoHo is a small (50 rooms) boutique hotel in the centre of Prague. It has spacious modern rooms with well equipped bathrooms and quality furniture and fittings.The spa area, jacuzzi, steam and sauna looked very modern too. The fitness room is fairly limited but has four aerobic machines and mats for stretching. The addition of dumbbells, medicine balls and a clock would be very useful.I did not have time for breakfast (£18) but the breakfast room looks very attractive, bright and airy. Food wise, I only had a burger at the bar but it was super delicious and exactly how a burger should be (pic attached).All in all, BoHo is highly recommended although it is not for those on a budget with rooms averaging at around €200/night.TIPS: It, better to book direct, there seems to be a bigger difference than usual in price (lower) when doing so.Coffee and croissants are provided free in the library from 10:30 a.m. so if you miss breakfast you won’t starve.If you found this review helpful please give me a helpful vote, thank you.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 3-year-old boutique hotel, with 57 rooms. Impeccably located about 5 blocks from Old Town Square, but out of the way of the tourist hordes! Comfortable contemporary decor, friendly and efficient service, and a shower that I wanted to take home with me. Nice breakfast spread, great bread, although unchanged from day to day. Can’t say the same for dinner; food was just so-so. Wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed three nights in this true gem of a hotell in the heart of Prague. The staff were excelent and did their best for us the hole stay! The rooms were clean and silent. The library offered crosaints and refreshments 24/7. Lovely breakfast and superb location! Next time in Prague I sure will stay here again!
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here as the location was perfect for the start and finish of the marathon. It was a good choice. The hotel is close to the metro and main railway station but i would recommend getting a taxi from the airport, it is a lot easier and reasonably cheap. The hotel is very modern with a welcoming reception area and bar. The hotel has a library which is cosy and serves complimentary pastries and coffee throughout the day, a wonderful gesture. There is also complimentary wine between six and seven every evening in the library, we were enjoying the bar experience so much we forgot to go. Breakfast is very good,with a large selection of buffet items and some hot specially cooked items. The rooms are absolutely wonderful , clean and spacious. We had a tub as well as a walk in shower and we felt like a king and queen. All of the staff are helpful and friendly and they were great tour guides. They gave us some great recommendations for local restaurants and we could not fault any of the three we chose. We had a simply wonderful experience and we think it should be anyone's first choice for a hotel when staying in Prague.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s been quite a while since we stayed at the BoHo Prague. However, my fond memories of the hotel warrants a review. The BoHo is a little oasis in a side street just off the bustling heart of scenic Prague. The tasteful décor, both in the lobby and rooms, provides a calming atmosphere. The room offers ample packing space, and our bathroom, with bath and shower, was spacious. I quite like its different design of smoky glass walls; when it's steamed up and the curtain drawn, enough privacy is provided. Unfortunately, there was no time for a leisurely bath while staying there, but the complimentary bath salt’s scent is heavenly – I would buy a bottle if I could! I don’t want to spoil all the special unexpected surprises but suffice to say there are many which guarantee an extraordinary stay. Our highlight was definitely the free walking tour with the lovely Gabriela Gogová. I ordered room service once and portion size is generous. We also decided to dine at the hotel’s restaurant before heading off to Municipal House; dinner was just lovely. Breakfast is generous and beautifully served. The staff were competent and efficient.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just got back from a lovely stay at the BoHo Hotel. I had read the great review about this hotel beforehand and we were not disappointed. As soon we arrived a member of staff immediately came outside to take our luggage. We then checked in and were offered a welcome drink of Prosecco which we had in the lovely bar area before being shown to our room. The room itself had a lovely big super king sized bed and was very modern and spotless. The bathroom was also lovely with little extras like slippers, a dressing gown and some lovely toiletries. The only issue we had is the lack of privacy in the bathroom as the walls were all glass, including the area where the toilet was. This is a matter of personal taste but for us it was a little bit odd. It could do with a thicker curtain perhaps. Other than that we had no complaints at all about this hotel. Amazing service - all the staff were lovely and extremely helpful which made our stay an absolute pleasure. The extra little touches like the complimetary wine tasting in the evening and complimentary danish pastries and coffee in the library were much appreciated. We didn't try the spa area but it looked lovely. The breakfast was also very good with plenty of choice with proper freshly squeezed orange juice. I would not hesitate to recommend the Boho Hotel and we would definately stay here again if we returned to Prague.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited Boho Prague for four nights to celebrate my husbands birthday. Stylish rooms, attentive service, fabulous breakfasts and a very cool library where we received our complimentary glass of wine before dinner. I would definitely stay again, the hotel and staff were all wonderful and location was in the centre of Prague, easy walking distance to all main attractions
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely first class hotel in excellent location. Staff extremely helpful. Very comfortable spacious clean room. Breakfast excellent quality food. Bonus of welcome drink on arrival, complimentary pastries and coffee available all day in beautiful lounge area and free wine tasting daily between 5.00-6.00 p.m. Highly recommend hotel and will definitely return.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Boho was such a find! It is conveniently located, impeccably clean, absolutely amazing sized rooms, bathrooms and the best service ever. We were travelling with a child and usually the rooms feel smaller and cluttered. That wasn't the case at all! Really Spacious and clean rooms, stylish and an absolute pleasure to live in. The designer bath was just divine and they really do a lot of small details for the guests that make you feel really special. There is an eye for detail and quality that reflects in all aspects. The breakfast was perfect too! loved the hot selection... and we are vegetarian and still managed to find enough options. I WOULD 100% recommend staying here. The staff is just so friendly and so eager to please... its really refreshing. The cleaning ladies are great at their job too, absolutely spotless. The extra large bed and the crisp linen really add to the whole experience. Thank you BOHO! we were staying last week in rooms 101 & 102. We are pleased to bits...!
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: BoHo is a lovely hotel right off the busy streets around the historical district of Prague. The staff were always pleasant and ready to help with any requests. Upon arrival, after a long flight from Chicago, we were offered a glass of champaign and were able to check in an hour early. We also needed to rent a car which they assisted with by having a rental rep come to the hotel with the car. They made it easy! The room (standard) was great with a comfy king size bed, great bathroom with great water pressure in the shower and just overall classy. The hotel is really new and trendy with no wear to be seen. The Breakfast room was really a wonderful sanctuary to go to in the morning and had a great selection of breads, yogurts, sweets, cheeses and meats. They served us a carafe of fresh squeezed OJ every morning along with our choice of coffee. In addition, we were able to order omelettes and other short order menu items! Great service, peaceful location to come home to after walking thru the crowds all day and trendy/comtempory decorations.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What to say.. the place is flawless! The standard room is so well done that you don't wanna leave. Location is perfect, staff great (special thx to the man w long blonde hair), the interior court nice for a spliff, the spa superb (sauna need improving though... where do you put the water?). I will def. come back here another time. Prices fluctuate greatly though. So far I was lucky to keep the damages limited ;) The same room over Easter would have costed three times as much. But again: the room, especially the bathroom is absolutely unpretentiously luxurious, well though-out and stunningly beautiful!
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 5 days at this hotel. From check in to check out the service was excellent. The hotel is in a very quiet street but only 5 minutes walk to the old town (ladies don't wear heels as there are lots of cobbles). We had a superior room which was large and had everything we needed (enough hangers, mirrors, magnified mirror). The beds were large and comfortable and we both slept very well. The shower was powerful (a bugbear of mine is a powerless shower!) and there was enough light in the bathroom to put make up on! The breakfast was delicious. I loved the fact that a carafe of orange juice was placed on your table and the coffee was perfect (so many hotels have bland, weak coffee). The steam room and sauna, fitness room and plunge pool were well maintained and clean and quiet (we had the whole place to ourselves most of the time). I would thoroughly recommend this hotel if you are staying in Prague. PS - Visit the Museum of Communism - it is much more interesting than it sounds and gives a great insight into the recent history of Prague both moving and inspirational.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is absolutely lovely. We ended up leaving a different hotel that was very uncomfortable and checking into Boho. I was thrilled! I was greeted with a complimentary glass of wine and taken on a tour. In my room there were little brownies waiting for me. The service was fantastic and the hotel itself was just what I was hoping for. The only thing I will mention is the bathroom in the room is very modern. It's beautiful but does not offer much privacy. This was no problem for me as I was with my husband, but could be a little uncomfortable for a different situation.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything from the moment I got there was a pleasant surprise. Probably one of the best hotels I’ve stayed, great value for the price. The location is the best possible, the room was very clean and comfortable, the staff really helpful and kind except for one very rude man at the bar - I stayed for a week and he was rude to every guest I’ve seen him talking to. That mans rudeness managed to ruin dinner some of the nights I decided not to go out. Breakfast was probably the best I’ve had in hotels- not huge but had many different options even for people with food restrictions. SPA and sauna were pleasant, but a bit small so it got crowded sometimes. The only downside is the gym - pretty much just a treadmill and a bike, can’t do much in there.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely beauiful hotel, amazing room and service. Food menu was slightly limited but what we had was delicious. There was a complimentary drink upon arrival and turn-down service which was a nice touch. Loved the spa area, small but lovely and when we visited we had it all to ourselves! Good location in Prague and nearby everything we wanted to do/visit. Can't wait to come back!
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the first friendly greeting we had the most amazing stay at Boho. Lovely rooms, generous bathroom and a library for guests to just hang out in. Would completely recommend. Easy access to train station, old town and all of the sights
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: THe Boho Hotel in Prague is a great little hotel. It has all the good service and attention to detail of a 5 star hotel, very pleasant and attentive staff, and a lovely ambience - but with only 50 rooms. The interior is modern with a neutral palate that means it is timeless - and it was perfectly presented as if it had just opened. The rooms are very spacious and well presented. The breakfast was very good and the bar has a nice atmosphere. One very nice touch is the complimentary wine served between 6-7pm each night in the library which was like an adult social room. Just a few minutes from one of the gateways to central Prague it is in a great location.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything you could need is included, definitely go for the “with parking “ option. The front desk staff was awesome, complimentary Prosecco while they work your access, valet parking and luggage service was totally unexpected and amazing. The rooms are outstanding and stylish, turn down service was perfect. I would choose a BoHo in every city available. One note, the breakfast option is better left to the local fare, not just price but diversity and...well... Prague!
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a fantastic little hotel. From the moment we arrived the attention from the staff, quality of the room we could not fault. The room was perfectly appointed, great bathroom with all the toiletries you could possibly need. Breakfast was more than adequate, fresh fruit, yoghurts, pastries etc and hot cooked food prepared to order. 5 min walk to the main square in Prague. Would not hesitate in recommending this hotel for anyone visiting Prague
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great hotel ,centrally located,all the staff are extremely friendly and helpful ,20 minutes from airport by taxi ,lots of bars and restaurants within walking distance .Beware of anyone in the street offering to change money .
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nothing to complain, absolutely friendly stuff, great room, nice little spa, very clean, good location, wonderful breakfast, a little paradies. We enjoyed the weekend very much there! Maybe just one thing, it's annoying that chargers nomore work if you take your keys with you. A luxury hotel should not save money on this.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Calm atmospheric hotel, beautifully designed, lovely ambience (the photographs on the website don't do it justice). The staff were so friendly and helpful, our room was delightful, very clean, wonderful bathroom. The choice at breakfast is huge, fresh and very healthy, with discreet prompt service. We loved sitting in the bar/reception after a day out and about, reading in the soft light and very comfortable chairs, hot wine, tea..... thoroughly recommended overall. The location is marvellous too - close to everything yet tucked away from hustle and bustle.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a lovely hotel. Very helpful staff and excellent service throughout our stay. We enjoyed the spa facilities and the general sense of peace and relaxation throughout the hotel. Would love to come back.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just had a perfect weekend in this heavenly hotel - we were in a superior room on the first floor at the front of the building. The room had everything we could need, was SO quiet and an extremely comfortable bed. The breakfast was the best that we'd ever experienced in a hotel - a huge choice, and the library was lovely to relax in at the end of the day with a fire, coffee and pastries to help ourselves to, and a glass of wine if required! Most importantly, the staff were, without exception, charming and helpful. Thank you to them all!
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Found this hotel by accident and booked it because it just looked cute. We couldn't be happier! It is located walking distance to all the places we wanted to visit. The city center, Charles Bridge, and many other cool places. We had the car parked at the valet when we arrived and never needed it until our departure. The car was not parked at the property, I don't believe they have a parking garage, however, they have an agreement with a nearby Marriott, and park it at the secure parking there. The rooms were very clean, modern with some traditional touches (think: Restoration Hardware). Simply BEAUTIFUL! Bathrooms were spotless, robes soft and towel fluffy. Comfy bed and delicious European style breakfast. Every single staff member was kind, helpful and friendly. We loved out stay. It was a treat!
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 1 night, but it was amazing. Its a small boutique hotel in the centre of Prague. The invitation at the reception was warm. The receptionist was very polite and helpful. The room was smaller but nice and clean. Bed was comfortable. There was coffee and water prepared. The hotel is situated in the city center. It was a great stay and will come back.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a hotel completely worthy of being part of the SLH chain, and a five-star rating. It has beautiful rooms, with great contemporary details and comfortable beds. High ceilings, nice public spaces. Welcome drink upon Check-in. Library with free coffee/pastries throughout the day. But most of all, it is the staff who make this hotel so amazing. They are all positive and all requests are fulfilled instantly. Need an iron? It’s at your door in less than a minute. Need a vase? At your door in less than a minute, pre-filled with water. The price of this hotel is truly a great value - I wouldn’t look elsewhere in Prague. Location is right next to where everything is, without being completely in it - so the hotel is easy to reach by car, close to train station, but a block away from pedestrian area.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: from arrival to departure we could not fault our time and experience at the hotel, would recommend it without hesitation. there were so many little touches where the hotel go the extra mile to ensure your stay is enjoyable. However as a city Prague is not great fun in winter and the people in nearby pubs and restaurants could definitely be more friendly, perhaps it was the weather making everyone miserable as it was well below zero.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A chic modern hotel in a perfect location to explore beautiful Prague. Hotel breakfasts were first class as was the service. The Hotel certainly prides itself on a first class service. Would highly recommend.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, super nice and chic. Staff was super kind and helpful. Room was nice and clean. The shower was amazing. The hotel was within walking distance of everything we wanted to see. Would highly recommend.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a brilliant stay at the Boho hotel in November. The room we stayed in was very spacious and beautifully decorated and we loved all the added extras - chocolates on the pillows, free welcome drink and the happy hour of free Czech wine and nibbles was very well received. We also loved the small yet luxourious spa which was great to come back to after a day in the cold. Also very helpful and friendly staff. We will definitely be back and highly recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I could not fault this hotel, it’s in a great location with fabulous staff. Our room was spacious and comfortable with a wonderful modern bathroom. Having a jacuzzi to end the days walking is a brilliant way to unwind.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel as part of a package and wondered if it would be a compromise. It was nothing but impressive from the beautifully design and spacious rooms, friendly and excellent service to the unique touches you will find around the hotel. It is also in a quiet street which is just 5mins walk from the old square so you can walk to all the sites you want to see. Highly recommend staying here.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: BoHo hotel is a trendy spot located in the middle of the action in Prague. It is near the train station, the Paladium and old town, but not in it. It is near a number of trendy restaurants. The hotel itself had the best bathroom/shower hands down in Europe. Wonderful tub too. The service is very professional.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel staff make you feel very welcome with an offer of a lovely drink on arrival and check in. The lobby and bar area itself is very stylish, all dark and sultry with comfortable velvet sofas and upholstery. The restaurant, also stylish is completely different, light and bright with a Scandinavian feel to it. The staff also offer guests a free glass of wine and nibbles (pretzels) between 5-6pm before dinner, regardless of whether you are eating in the restaurant that night or not. This feels very nice, as does the library with open fire, lovely coffee table books to browse through and coffee available throughout the day/evening whenever you fancy.Breakfast is delicious and there is a huge choice. The bar is elegant if a bit empty. I was given a glass of corked wine and when I queried it the barman said it was fine. Needless to say, we then went out! It's in a great location near the Christmas markets and central square so you really do not have to go far to enjoy the beautiful streets and architecture. There are some nice places to eat nearby.We appreciated the Spa facilities in the Hotel, and the décor in the bedroom and bathroom is fun. Personally, I don't like looking at my clothes hanging and seeing my boots or shoes on the floor when I'm in bed, as it feels like I'm sleeping in a shop, but the smoky glass is pretty. The bathroom was very spacious, warm and bright. We didn't take a bath but it looked inviting. The shower cubical is large, but the hand shower unfortunately is positioned directly at the gap in the shower doors so the bathroom floor beyond gets a bit wet unless you use the overhead shower or angle the shower attachment so you are standing very close to the wall which is a bit awkward.Overall I would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a very pleasant stay at the Boho Prague this past New Years. The staff is wonderful and the location ideal. They made us feel very welcome as soon as we stepped through the doors. The breakfast buffet is the perfect start to a day of exploring this beautiful city.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel with great service, nice rooms and good breakfast. Location is also great, within walking distance from all major attractions, but still on quiet street. Rooms were nice and bed was comfortable. This hotel will be the prefered choice on future visits as well.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went to the Boho for a quick kids free getaway. Great hotel, lobby, room, breakfast. I do wish the receptionists were a bit more knowledgeable in helping plan sightseeing and tours for that boutique hotel experience.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I could not say enough great things about this hotel. The location was very convenient for walking to all the places we wanted to go to in Prague. The staff was fantastic in their recommendations for activities and places to dine. We will definitely be visiting BoHo the next time we are in Prague.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel in package with Secret Escapes and it did not disappoint. The Hotel Rooms were great the staff very friendly. The Breakfast was excellent and the bar is good, but a bit pricey compared to local bars in the area. The location of the hotel is great, just a 2 minute walk to Galleries, Theatres and Shopping Malls and just 5 minutes from the Old Town Square. The welcome drink and free glass of wine each day is a nice touch that was much appreciated. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
1    BoHo Prague Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is just 2 minutes walk from city center, great location, very clean, nice rooms and mostly excellent service!Nothing to complain about from the reception to the concierge to the room and back. Everything was really great!!
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a honor to stay in Alcron for a week. I had expectation but i was suprised in good way. Bar and bar personal were great as cocktails were too. Special thank to Beata and to her smile. Location of hotel is the great. Breakfest was great and fresh They make me feel like a king during my stay. They have airport transportation on demand. Thank you Alcron
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location in the city center few steps to Mustek & Museum metro stations, in the heart of the most famous square, the hotel has two type of rooms one of them is very small and the other type is spacious with a living room , make sure you get the big one especially if you have kids . The hotel is clean , its old though , use to be managed by radisson but now its only Alcore .
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been staying at this hotel for a number of years now. And on each visit the staff never fail to impress. I needed some specific assistance on this trip facilitating receipt of a new passport. They rose to the challenge and helped me out. Jana and her guest relations team including Magdalena were fantastic. Barbora ensured my booking was secured and as requested. Karel the service manager ensured we were made to feel at home and also helped get the job done. Milan at the bar helped us ease some of the stress when the passport delivery was delayed. I cant say enough about this hotel and its incredible staff. It is very close to all the main attractions and the hotel itself is top quality. Thank you all. I will see you again very soon.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Peace be upon you, I would like to thank you with all my heart for the surprise you showed in our room (323). No doubt you deserve all the compliments and all the support for your wonderful work. We have already recommended your hotel at Boxing.com. Special thanks to Miss Leyla, who gave us excellent service and concern for all of our questions and requests. Leyla is an outstanding girl, pleasant, good and smiling, who does her work with devotion and love. Well done. Once again a huge thank you for leaving us with a great feeling and a desire to stay in a hotel again in the future. Thanks and congratulations to everyone. From us Yaakov and Amalya Amoyal
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in Prague for the first time and couldn’t have been more delighted. Perfect service- attentive, friendly, courteous. Little things like complimentary shoe shine, free breakfast, room credit for bar (but I think that’s because of the site we booked it through). Giant room, wood floors, ultra comfortable bed, lounge area, tons of space to put bags and toiletries and other belongings. Large spotless bathroom with two sinks, separate bath and shower, multiple Molton Brown bath products.Bar downstairs is super fun with the friendliest bartenders who make original cocktails that all come with little props to make you laugh. An excellent stay and an unbelievable level of quality for the price. Highly recommend and I would absolutely go back.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked Alcron Hotel based on trip advisor ratings and we were not disappointed. Service was excellent, Alena checked us in and was friendly and full of information. The room was very nice, with a nicely redone bathroom. Bed was extremely comfortable. The location is about a 10 minute walk from the Old Town Square!
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay at the Alcron. The location is excellent, half a block off of Wenceslas Square and within an easy walk of the old town. The rooms are very nice and the service was terrific. I highly recommend the Alcron for a stay in Prague.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Alcron already for a few times and will always come back. All staff are extremely friendly and that without an exception. It makes you feel very welcome and looked after in a pleasant and comfortable way.The scent in the loby is terrific.After our first stay, there is only 1 option in Prague for us and this is Alcron.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we where 10 bikers with no booking but the hotel found us rooms and safe parking for our bikes.we had an issue with one of the bikes but they helped us find space a to repair it and loaned us a battery charger with no problems.Jana Dzurnakova who is the guest relations director and is a biker herself was rely helpful so ask for her if you stay.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I came to this hotel because EasyJet cancelled my flight to Amsterdam. But could not have be more grateful otherwise I would never had experienced the great service of this hotel. Thank you Tomáš for letting me use my room until 4 pm. And thanks to lovely Jana for the nice talks about travel and dogs and the gift I have got. And last but not least cool Jenny who takes bar tending to the next level. What a great asset these people are for the hotel.And of course the room was perfect too ❤️
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had the best experience with the customer service here and I have been to some very nice hotels around the world. Bea is the best host I have had at a hotel. She genuinely made me feel welcome when I arrived and provided perfect recommendations for restaurants, activities, etc. Lobby bar host was good and made me a cocktail I will remember for a long time, it is must try. Front desk staff (Peter) was very courteous and genuinely caring. I had a minor issue but the whole staff worked collectively to get it resolved to my satisfaction in an efficient manner. Hotel location is the best in the city and room was very comfortable and peaceful.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent Location, clean and great service! The concierge 'Bea' was a tremendous help in setting up reservations and making plans, her knowledge of the city was a big help and she provided outstanding suggestions. I will definitely return!
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Among so many places in the world, prague is my favorite. Among so many hotels in prague ,Alcron is my top choice. This hotel is not just about a place to sleep. But Like a home and family with this beautiful staff either in main reception, concierge, and the lounge.I would like to mention someone special I had met and honestly received kindness, smile, service that is exceptionally outstanding. The Concierge Manger ”Bea”. She had served me within the hotel and anything I needed in Prague during my stay. Thank you for all staff members I met and thank you for her.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the hotel with a baby and got upgraded to a suite. When they heard our baby was a bit sick they quickly recommended a pharmacy nearby and gave us a gift(bottle of wine and chocolates). The staff couldn't have been nicer and more welcoming. It is a truly five star hotel. The food was excellent as well. Will definitely stay there again if we happen to be in Prague in the future. Thank you for a lovely stay. It was a highlight of our stay in beautiful Prague on top of a lovely wedding we attended outside of the city too.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thanks to all the staff at the Alcron Hotel , Zbysek, Frank, Jana, Karel, Petv, Milan, the Bellman and all the other staff members of the hotel who names I was not able get who helped make our trip to Prague so memorable, In my book the Alcron Hotel is five stars on all counts. The Staff, The Service, the Room and the Location were awesome. If you plan on a trip to Prague this is the place to stay,Keith & Vina HarveySanta Monica, CA
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All of the people were very friendly and helpful. We felt like we were leaving good friends by the end of our stay. They helped us navigate the street cars and the sights. They were very accommodating with directions on money exchange.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my wife were travelling in couple to prague and came across this hotel and booked it because of the amazing reviews it had got.By far one of the best service i have seen in terms of staff and hospitality, When we reached the hotel we were greeted by the receptionist and their PR director Jana, she was so warm and amazing, she explained what we could do in the city, what we could avoid, she gave us almost 2 hours of her time just to explain everything. They had decorated the whole room for us with a champagne bottle. all 4 days of our stay we had them constantly asking us what else could they do for us to make our stay more pleasant.the hotel bar, old fashioned with great cocktails. throughly enjoyed it. we got some bar credit during our stay which was nicely utilised at the bar.highly recommended, walking distance to all prime locations of the city, the station, old town, charles bridge and lots of bars, pubs and restaurants around us.For any travellers would highly recommend the hotel.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights at Alcron Hotel Prague and really enjoyed it. The staff was very helpful (Barbora as well as the receptionists - forgot their names :( )fantastic location, great room and facilities. Should I get back to Prague I would definitely stay again here.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This property is well located close to the main square. There is so much to see in walking distance. The room was nice and comfortable. Breakfast was excellent. The restaurant was good with a nice selection and reasonably priced.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent a couple of nights in this centrally located hotel.Perfect service throughout from telephone bookings to reception. Art deco features throughout the hotel including the rooms. There is a gym onsite, though we didn't use it. There is also a cocktail bar and a couple of restaurants though we didn't try these either.Our classic double contained a huge bed with an exceptional mattress and nice linen. Very nice bathroom with shower/ bath. Molton Brown toiletries.Lovely place, had a really comfortable stay. Would definitely return when next in Prague.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Alcron Hotel in Prague provides incredible customer service. From the management to the staff, I couldn't have wished for a better hotel experience in a new city. Every single member of the staff was so accommodating, attentive and kind to me. My one-day visit was exceptional because of the hotel staff! The property is well-maintained, my room was very clean, and the guest experience team cared to make my short visit special by coordinating a guided tour on the same day. This hotel was recommended to me by a colleague several times. I am happy I finally made the trip and my only regrets are that I didn't come here sooner and that I wasn't able to stay longer. But next time, I will!Special thanks goes to Zbysek, Beata, Karel, Lucie, Frantisek, Valentina and Dominique. Again, everyone there, in case I forgot a name, was so great.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would like to recognize Hotel Alcron in Prague! Not only is the hotel situated in an area close to all main attractions, shopping area, nightlige and cultural area’s but the staff and management are there to please you (me ) but they also recognize you as a person, remember your drinks, and service you with pleasure and dedication... For sure a place to be and to check out!The rooms are amazing, THE bar and the people working there are awesome!Special thx and recognition to Bea, the gentleman at the door(s)! Thank you once again for the good times/stay(s)Greetz from Holland!
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed our stay , everything was good! Very good staff, especially (Bea).She was so helpful with us we’re thankful we found such person.Definitely i would recommend this hotel to a friend and i will be back soon!Such a pleasant stay !
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had an amazing experience during my stay in this hotel. It has a great location, high level of safety. I loved how cooperative is staff, especially miss Bea. I'm looking forward to visit it in my next vacation❤️
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed the judiciary in the hotel..Every things i liked .. Everything is beautiful.. Everything is great.. Hotel staff are seeking to provide comfort to guests and satisfy them .. Thank you very much “ BEA “ for the warm reception and good treatment .. Thank U from the heart
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a wonderful vacation in this hotel, the service and the staff was too collaborative with the visitors, the lady that was too helpful and collaborator with us is bea. I hope that i will visit it again.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The stay in the hotel is wonderful and comfortable and the staff treated it excellent and in particular the worker lyse was helpful and respectful.I would visit the place again.I loved the place and thank lyes for their respect
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First thing is mention, everyone is very nice and accommodating. Barbara was wonderful. Great location, safe walk in evening. Bar is fun. Breakfast was very good. Bathrooms small, they carry Molton Brown products.Would definitely return and recommend.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was large, well equipped and perfectly looked after. It was a great experience and staff were really attentive. The hotel is lovely with grand stairways. Very pleasant public areas. Quaint customs for serving cocktails surprised and delighted us. Food was lovely with an especially good breakfast.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On May 15, 2019 we arrived at the Alcron Hotel in Prague. It was a 4 day extension at the end of a wonderful 15 day Viking River Cruise. We could not have been happier with any other hotel. It is impeccably clean, modern and the staff is wonderful. One gal at reception came to our room to help us find and work everything, one gal in the restaurant was beyond courteous and friendly, but the star of them all is the beautiful Beata Glovacka from reception, who took us under her wing and mad us fel as if we were part of her best friends and family. It could not have been a more wonderful stay. Thank you Beata and Alcron.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first trip to Prague and was a little nervous about what to expect following very basic Hotel customer service elsewhere in the country at a similar price/quality. Within 1 minute of arriving, our fears were dispelled and frankly, one of the friendliest and genuinely warm receptions I can ever remember - and I typically travel 50% of my time on business. From the valet parking to checking in, room allocation, recommendations, nothing was too much trouble. A special call out to Jana, their Guest Relations Director, who really went out of her way to ensure our stay was memorable. Reading some of the views, its clear that they mirror our own experience that customer service is front and centre focus of all the team that works there. Breakfast is superb and our room, the 'classic' was above our expectations. Prague is a beautiful city and the experience of discovering it was enriched by the Alcron Hotel. I would go back there in a heartbeat.. and even as we were leaving, had already starting working on when we could get back! Thoroughly recommend to anyone who wants to experience genuine Customer Service in a very nice hotel.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel muito bem localizado, quarto muito confortável e uma concierge incrível Jana obrigada pela atenção e carinho conosco.Voltaria nesse hotel com certeza Hotel very well located, very comfortable room and an amazing conciergeJana, thank you for your attention and your kindness.Would return to this hotel for sure
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don't usually leave reviews, but the service here was so great I had to pass on my compliments. From the time we were greeted at the door to the check in process, to the restaurant staff and the bartenders at BeBop Bar (Jenny especially) were absolutely fantastic. Each and every person takes pride in their job and goes out of their way to make the guest feel welcome and cater to every wish. From a service standpoint, this was one of the best hotels I've stayed in across the world. They responded immediately to any requests and I am grateful for their outstanding service. I highly recommend and would definitely return.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I have traveled all over Europe in the past few years and I promise you will not find a more attentive, helpful and nice staff in any other hotel! They are outstanding! Hotel location is good as it is possible to walk to most attractions or quickly catch the tram. Stayed at the hotel over Easter weekend and although Prague was packed, the hotel never felt crowded. Wonderful breakfast and don’t miss a drink or two in the Be Bop Bar!
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You will see what you have not seen before, staff, hotel, place and breakfast were wonderfull.I promise i will return back to prague just because this hotel. They make me happy to repeat the visit again
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very cozy place, excellent food, friendly people professional services at the heart of Prague!! In all hotels that I have checked in for the last 40 years, I haven't seen a dedicated person who escort you with the bell boy to explain to you all the facilities in your room in a very professional and delicate way!! It was not only limited to that but also you are also offered a very fine chocolate when you checked out !!! Special thanks to Ms. Beata, for sure you are the right person at the right place. She was very fine, helpful and much more than the best concierge that one can think of. Simple, the whole team are excellent, so friendly ,and they give the feeling that you are a "KING IN YOUR PALACE"...Thank you all for a very lovely experience....
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was wonderful The hotel, the staff and the food. The staff was friendly and helpful and they provided me with bigger room as I am a regular guest. This wasn’t my first visit to the hotel and will not be the last. Thanks you alcron team for everything.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Alcron is a place to stay when visiting Prague. Quiet rooms in the center of Prague and very confortable. The staff team is superb and helped us with all enquires. Also, having Molton Brown toiletries is well appreciated :) We look forward to be back soon!
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for four nights over Easter in one of the Castle View Suites. We experienced top class customer service, nothing was too much for the staff including the concierge advice for the booking of restaurants and transport. The suite was spacious and the housekeeping service very good indeed. Breakfasts in La Rotonde offered a good buffet and table service. The Be Bop bar was great for pre-dinner drinks and again, we were so impressed with the quality of the service. The location is perfect, one minute walk from Wenceslas square and ten minutes from the Old Town square and the Charles bridge. We highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked at Alcron after some research on Trip advisor and some other sites.. we weren’t disappointed.The staff are extra friendly and helpful, they were extremely helpful in planning our time in Prague. They suggested some very good restaurants and helped plan how best to cover all the hot spots and sights to see, the rooms were nice and spacious, bathroom could have been bigger.The location was okay, only 7-10 minutes away from the old town.Recommended for a stay in Prague, Enjoy!
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm kind of ambivalent. Locations is amazing, Be Bop Bar is just amazing, the staff is really amazing here as well, breakfast is quite good but not as earth-shattering as some said. However, no pool and paper thin walls (at least in the "economy" class), with really high cost is not something I'd absolutely recommend.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located very near to the center. Lots of restaurants and cafes available. All important sights very near. Room was in a very high level and very clean.Breakfast was excellent.  .Hotel bar was very comfortable and rich. We even had a very good dinner in the bar one evening. Hotel staff was extremely friendly. Most recommended!
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Can’t rate this hotel highly enough. It’s beautiful, well situated and the staff are amazing. They couldn’t do enough for you. We were celebrating our silver anniversary and they made it so special, especially Jana who went out of her way to give us a fabulous time. The only down side was the air conditioning wasn’t as effective as the room was warm. Thank you again to all your hardworking staff!
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot rate this hotel highly enough. My husband is in a wheelchair and the help we have received has been phenomenal. Beautiful decor, great accessible room, staff incredible. I was nervous of travelling alone with him but no worries coming here. Thank you.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a part of our Euro trip, we stayed at the Alcron Prague (Radisson Blu Alcron Prague) for 5 nights in September. What really set the property apart was the service excellence of the staff. The Senior Service Manager, Mr Peter Koumal was extremely helpful, knowledgeable and an all round asset for the hotel. We can't thank him enough for a lovely stay at a lovely property! Thank you Peter! - Mr and Mrs Rohatgi.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow, what can I say except that this hotel is fantastic and the staff are beyond amazing. From the door men, to the front reeception, the bar staff and the cleaners. All were bright and happy and willing to assist you. Our room was HUGE!! Bigger than my apartment and the facilities were clean, crisp and very welcoming. Loved every bit of our stay and would highly recommend to anyone.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very nice and the service was great. The person who welcomed us Zbysek deserves a special thanks - he was super nice and friendly and took a lot of time to explain to recommend various sites and touring options. He made our stay very special.When we arrived we were upgraded to a suite, which put us in a great mood. The bed was very comfortable, and the shower and bathroom were clean and in good taste.When we mentioned its our anniversary we received a complimentary bottle of champagne and a delicious cake to our room!The hotel is walking distance from all the sites - and from the metro station which makes it especially convenient for those coming in from the airport with public transportation (which is actually the easiest, fastest and most convenient way to get to the canter of Prague).All in all a great experience and highly recommended.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
