Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The perfect hotel ! Very clean quiet rooms , perfect gym and great sauna .Not sure why I have to wright 200 characters review if 87 is really need it , we really loved alcron and look forward returning soon
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for a weekend in a luxury room, which was beautifully decorated in art deco style. The bathroom was fantastic with both a shower anda bath, as well as a separate toilet booth. I always love it when there are Molton Brown amenities in a bathroom! A Nespresso machine makes me very happy, too. The overall look and feel of the hotel is luxurious but approachable, due to friendly and helpful staff. We were told about the availability of a sauna, and on Saturday it was turned on as per our request. (It was a proper Finnish style sauna!) I love a good breakfast where the staff seats you. Cappuccinos and smoothies and everything you can hope for. One thing I was not so happy about was that our room was on the 2nd floor. I woke up on Sat at about 5:30 AM due to apparently garbage haul underneath us. I’m not happy to have my sleep interrupted on a short weekend break. Also there were conference rooms on the opposite to our room, so there was banging of the doors and loud furniture arranging noises on Saturday afternoon when I tried to take a nap to compensate for the loss of sleep at night.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An absolutely fantastic hotel! A very warm welcome, The staff here were great very attentive, helpful and everything was done with a smile, Breakfast was really delicious and our room was lovely, the bed was super, Great location just off wenselous square Molten brown toiletries were a nice touch, The bebop bar attached is great well worth a visit, the snack menu was fabulous, best club sandwich ever! Nice wine and really fun cocktails. Places I’d recommend to visit while in Prague are Prague castle it’s beautiful and a jazz boat cruise definitely worth the money see the river at night and our meal was lovely.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 nights at the Alcron in September 2018 as the first stop on our 3 city tour of Prague, Vienna and Amsterdam.The hotel is really well located as it is just off the maim road leading to Wecenslas square and a short walk to the magical old town square where the astronomical clock is situated.The rooms are spacious and well equipped, on arrival we received a chocolate desert and a bottle of sparkling grape juice in our room - a great pick me up after a long journey from South Africa.The art deco design of the hotel has that old world luxurious charm that Prague as a city is well known for. The staff were incredibly helpful throughout our stay, they were friendly, attentive and Leyla at the front desk really impressed my wife.Things to do in Prague:Charles Bridge (worth buying the ticket to go to the top as you get great views of the city) and the walk to Prague Castle. Make sure you where good shoes as the cobblestones and stairs do get slippery when wet.The old town square is something out of a movie - some of the best photo ops you’ll ever get.Have a meal at the Hotel U Prince rooftop - incredible views and the food is good too!
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Alcoron had very good staff and fantastic service. Very service minded all the way from restaurant to the reception. Also flexible and let me keep the room to late afternoon when I had evening flight. Central location.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Both Rotonda and Alcron are wonderful restaurants. The bar has creative cocktails.However, the hotel overall looks quite dates. Some rooms have view to interior which allows almost no daylight in the room.
hotelName:
2    Alcron Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location was right near the tram and close to the river. It's about a 15 minute walk into old town and the new town. Really lovely hotel - staff were fantastic and helpful. Breakfast had a huge range of options and was good value for money (we ate loads and weren't hungry again until dinner). The extra large bed was SO comfy and the room had blackout curtains so I slept really well. The room was very clean and had lots of little special extras to make us feel very looked after.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel!Room was big, comfortable and clean. Restaurant/Bar had delicious food and the service was great. The staff was exceptional! I had a problem with my Hop On Hop Off tour. Several staff members made calls to the company to rectify my problem. However, since I had left the hotel for the day to do some sightseeing I was not there to get the final resolution. So, one of the staff members actually got into a car to find me at a bus stop to relay the message to me. Beyond my expectation and very much appreciated!
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good hotel, great location - near the River and very close to the city Centre but at the same time at the very quiet spot. Good breakfast, with a wide choice of food. Very nice and professional service. I would recommend it to everyone.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my first visit to Prague, im so happy that i chose Park in hotel, a very nice hotel you can walk to the old city if you want and with a taxi its just take 10 min, the room was so clean and so quiet with a very professional staff, very nice breakfast with allot of choices, Stan who is working in the reception he was just perfect and so professional, he helped me with everything. Smiling all the time and seems that he likes what he do. Another girl was working in the reception she was in trining period i don’t remember her name she was so helpful. I recommend this nice hotel for all, its just one comment that you need to have a lactose free milk or any kind of milk like almond or oats. but it was not so big deal for me.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all the staff are fantastic, very friendly, helpful and that makes a big difference to me. Location was good because it’s a short walk from the tram line that gets you to the center of old town in around 10 minutes, 3-4 stops. We didn’t like the room very much, seemed a little beat up with shabby carpets and AC wasn’t cooling as much as we would have liked but they offered to change rooms but we didn’t want to mess up another room so at check out they gave us free parking which would have been 15€ and we were happy with that, inside parking would have been 22€ I believe. Now the breakfast was insane, everything you could imagine, absolutely fantastic and we enjoyed it very much, much better than most of the better hotels we stayed at on the trip, so all in all we were very happy with our stay.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean hotel with a very good breakfast selection. The location is about a 20 min walk to old town. The walk is along the river which is beautiful or you can take the tram which is a short distance from the hotel for a less than 10 min ride. I would stay here again.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i love that the hotel is near a tram station which makes it easy for us to travel going to old town and other famous landmarks. And it's a very good place to rest and escape the hustle and bustle of the crowded old town.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel while on business and was very impressed with how welcoming the staff were. The hotel is nice and clean and the rooms a decent size. When I couldn't find anything I liked on the room service menu (bit limited for vegetarians) the chef created a special meal for me which was much appreciated. For breakfast there is a lovely large selection of just about everything you could think of - plenty of choice for everyone. Rooms are nice and quiet - you don't really hear your neighbours unless they are really banging the door loudly! Definitely recommend and would return. Just be aware that if you are here for the congress centre, it's about a 15 minute walk uphill - but there are plenty of Uber cars around if needed.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel, value for money, good breakfast ,extremely hospitable staff. We had some issues with the room the staff went out of the way to resolve it. Special thanks to Stan, Natalie, Ondra and Lydia at the front desk..all very helpful... Certainly worth a stay in Prague
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is lovely, and thanks to Prague's excellent public transport very easy to get to from the airport - the instructions of which are on the hotel website and really easy to follow. The hotel is about a 30 minute walk into the busy centre, but I actually quite liked that as it meant an opportunity to walk off any beer induced fuzziness / dumplings! It is close to several tram and train stops, so if you don't want to walk, that is an option too. The hotel is quiet and the area it is in are quiet, which I loved, the rooms are clean and the beds super comfortable, I slept very well the time I was there. I would also like to compliment the front desk staff who were very helpful on arrival.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed one night for business meetings in Prague. Modern room. Very clean. Great sound proofing in the rooms as it is near a busy road. Breakfast was vast and well serviced. I will return when next in Prague. Check out was fast and painless
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice, clean hotel with excelent breakfast. Polite staff, good garage for car, nice organisation. The staff upgraded our reservation to room with a view and terrace, for free. The location of the hotel is good, 3 km from city center. Near is river, where you can walk, take a drink and enjoy!
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently had the pleasure of staying here for 5 nights. Check in was fast, professional, polite and courteous. We were given Prague maps, and the tram network was explained to us how to catch the trams and buy a ticket from the hotel to the center of town. The main tourist sites are only four tram stops from the hotel. We were upgraded to a king bed from a queen bed which was nice. The hotel rooms are clean, spacious and the shower facilities modern. They include beautiful shower gel and hand wash, nice. We had the breakfast buffet daily included in our room rate the only criticism is that the temperature of the food was lukewarm and the coffee also was lukewarm. However the breakfast buffet had a vast selection of food which was great, pastries, fresh fruit, dried fruit and nuts.  We would definitely recommend this hotel for your Prague stay as the location is excellent as mentioned only a short tram ride away from all the major tourist sites i.e. town center and Charles Bridge.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Park Inn for 3 days at the end of a 2 week European trip. It was great. We’re very sensitive to noise and always concerned about hotels in cities. The Park Inn did it right with their remodel with thick, double-paned windows, great insulation and very quiet air conditioning. Despite having tram lines close by, it was maybe the quietest city hotel room we’ve stayed at. Very clean and modern and an excellent breakfast buffet. The front desk staff were all helpful, but special praise goes to Stan who speaks excellent English and was especially friendly. We stayed in one of the Superior Terrace rooms, which was very spacious and had a big bathtub. Easy walk to the riverfront, but not in the overcrowded Charles Bridge and Old Town area. It was right near the Vysehrad Castle complex, which has great views and beautiful buildings in a park setting and was a wonderful respite from the crowded Prague Castle area. Our only regret, is not staying longer in Prague since there is so much to see. Thank you Park Inn and we will definitely recommend it to friends.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed one day at this hotel. Well endowed room, although very tiny. Little to no sunlight in the room. Big bathroom. Breakfast is modest. For the price (125 Euro per night) I think I could have found something better.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my 4th stay at park inn Prague and definitely won’t be out last!! Beautiful hotel and the staff are on hand to help 24/7. Very clean and spacious rooms. Great mini bar. The breakfast was very nice good selection. We order dinner one day and it was delicious. It’s s little far out from old town Square but well worth aLittle extra travel. We walked into the town but you can get s tram at the end of the street. Don’t use the local taxis that pass if you want a taxi ask reception to call you one. There is a Tesco just around the corner which was very convenient they also have a cash machine which is the only one I use as I know it’s one you can trust. Thank youTo all the staff. Ps try a mojito they are very good.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very nice hotel in nice location. The rooms are very large and comfortable. The bathroom is quiet large with shower. The hotel does not provide any bathroom amenities and there was not a hair dryer in the bathroom. I found it the work desk drawer. The bed provided an excellent night of rest as well. The wifi is very good and fast and no interruptions. There is good workspace desk in the room and a small refrigerator. There is an in-room safe. There is a coffee service as well with pot and some selection of instant coffee, sugar, etc. There is bottled water, but you have to pay for it. The breakfast is excellent with a huge selection of everything you would want from fruit, breads/pastries, meats/cheeses, scrambled/fried/hard boiled eggs, with sausages, tomatoes and baked beans, potatoes. There is coffee machine, but only has expresso, cappucino, hot chocolate selection. If you want instant coffee in large cup suggest you take the small instant coffee packets in your room and use the hot water at the breakfast service for instant coffee. The breakfast service might add these small instant coffee packets with the tea bags for people who prefer the instant coffee. The hotel is very close to the river and there are good restaurants in the nearby. The hotel restuaurant, RBG, is also good. There is plenty of trams available nearby for transport. The hotel is a little too far from the center to walk, unless you like to walk. Overall, a very good hotel and good quality for the price.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's located around a 25 min walk from Charles Bridge. It's maybe 35mins at a leisurely pace. The trams are plentiful and run till around midnight if you don't like to walk. You can get a 24hr ticket for about £4. It lasts 24hrs from the time you buy it so it's not just for a specific day. There's a market by the river which opens around 8am on Saturday, I think. It's a market which seems to be used mostly by locals for food shopping. There are a few things other than food but it's well worth a visit and the coffee we got from the mobile cart was great. Back to the hotel. It was very well staffed and they were all very helpful. A special thanks to David behind the bar who looked after us very well. He also worked in the restaurant in the evening and we saw him at breakfast too. Despite the fact he, and the rest of the staff worked long hours, he always had a smile for us when we saw him. Thanks David!The room was very clean and tidy and the shower was excellent. A well-stocked mini-bar is there if you need it also. The bed was comfy and large. Tea/coffee facilities are there along with the usual hairdryer and sewing kit! It was also a very quiet room which suited us perfectly. We were a little worried about noise from adjoining rooms but we hardly heard a sound from anywhere. We were located in room 440 which looks out to the side of the hotel so perhaps that's the place to be if you like quiet.Breakfast was also excellent and a good variety of things were available. No matter what your tastes are I'm sure you'd find something you liked.We ate in the restaurant on one occasion and the quality of the food, and the service was excellent.I'd have no hesitation recommending this hotel if you're planning to visit Prague.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were only booked into this hotel due to a cancelled flight by Easy jet. Although we received no support from either airline or travel agency, the staff bent over backwards to help us out and showed considerable warmth and humanity in a difficult time. Natalie, a trainee found alternative flights for us and printed off boarding passes, whilst the front of house manager arranged taxis and ensured us a discount through the taxi firm. The room was spacious and clean, with a large walk in shower and the breakfast was good. We had been staying in a 5 star hotel prior to the cancellation and found this hotel to be considerably friendlier!
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nicely appointed hotel that has clean modern comfortable rooms. Restaurant and bar onsite. supberb breakfast buffet daily with hot and cold foods as well as fresh pasteries to fuel your day. Buffet included bacon, eggs three ways, potato pancakes, fresh fruit, meats and chesses as well as muesli. The restaurant located in the hotel offers a varied menu for dinner. The costs are similar to what one would pay in the states for a good dinner. Service is a bit slower than what we are accustomed to. There is a small but comfortbable bar area that serves beer wine, hard cider as well as standard cocktails. The hotel is just a few blocks from public transportation (trams), and the river.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff in this hotel are ALL amazing from the cleaning staff through the kitchen staff and the front desk they all show a decided pride in their work and it shows in the way things work at this Hotel. The hotel is located close to a major train line but the hotel is very well soundproofed and there was no noise inside. Rooms are clean, quiet and well equipped with loads of available electrical outlets.The breakfast is absolutely awesome both in the variety of selection and in quality. The restaurant has a nice blend of Czech dishes and more international fare with great service and good hours.While the hotel is a bit outside of the tourist attractions downtown there is good tram and underground connections nearby; to say nothing of a great place for a walk along the river (and a great little ice cream shop). The area around the hotel has several nice cafe/pubs that are great quality and very reasonably priced and appear popular with the localsThis hotel is a great place to stay!
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a family of 4 stayed here the nights of 6/7 may 19 in two rooms. Hotel is excellent though a little isolated from main markets but in city centre in a very peaceful location. Our check in was excellent,were give an early check in for one out of two rooms. Staff at the reception and every where else is friendly full of smile and speak good English. We needed a doctor for our daughter who had very bad cough n cold and they arranged for it immediately. Breakfast is also good. Would definitely recommend
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel staff very friendly and helpful when checking in. The bar staff were very welcoming also. Local only one mile from the main part. The nice walk down the river is a must. Would definitely stay here again
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel would definitely recommend in a very good location handy for trams into centre running every few minutes and for river walks. Very nice polite helpful staff, excellent buffet breakfast, and Tesco mini shop right beside it for forgotten items and grocerys second time I've been to this hotel and would definitely go again.weather for time of year was excellent too.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited the beautiful city of Prague from Monday to Friday and stayed at the Park Inn. I found the hotel to be situated in a good location and within easy reach of all the places to visit. The only problem we found is that when a couple stays in a room you would expect a double bed in the room instead of 2 single beds put together. The pillows also are not the best as too soft with not filling in it despite using 2 pillows. Apart from that everything else was very good and we enjoyed our stay. Food in the restaurant is also very nice. Thanking all the staff for being informative and helpful.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel twice - once in August of 2018 by myself and then again in March of 2019 with my husband. I found the front desk staff exceptional in offering guidance for tours, great restaurants and transportation (both calling a taxi and teaching me how to use public transport). What made Denisa and her colleagues stand out is the follow-up when I would return. They were genuinely interested in my adventures and sincerely wanted my feedback on their suggestions. The neighborhood was quiet and away from the hustle and bustle of tourists yet close enough by public transport or walking to be right in the middle of everything. The accommodations were comfortable and the breakfast was amazing. The lobby was comfortable to relax in and enjoy a cup of coffee. I enjoyed a dinner at the restaurant as well.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent a week here for a business trip. Not located in the city centre but Taxis are cheap. Extremely friendly staff, very spacious rooms and served a very good breakfast.Either if you come as a tourist and are out and about the entire day or on a business trip this is a good place to stay.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel in April 2019 for 2 nights and were not disappointed. The hotel is spotlessly clean in a quiet neighbourhood and the staff are both welcoming and friendly. The bathrooms are lovely and equipped with soap and shower gel so no need to bring your own. The room is air conditioned and the windows also open for those who like fresh air. Even with the trams and trains passing outside the hotel, you can not hear them through the double glazed windows. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the centre using the pathways along the river for a pleasant walk with lovely views. On a Saturday morning there is a local market selling local produce, coffee, cakes and bakes as well as groceries and meat. There is a tram stop just along outside the hotel for those who do not like walking much. As we arrived late on Friday evening we had missed the hotel's food service and had a walk around outside to find somewhere, there is a tesco local store within the ground floor of the hotel, the entrance is on the opposite side to the hotel entrance and this is open until 9pm, there are also a selection of bars and restaurants nearby. We found a pizza takeaway just round the corner from the tesco entrance and a huge pizza was only the equivalent of GBP4 and it was superb. The place was called telepizza. On Saturday we ate in a local restaurant which was again superb. Prague itself is a lovely city with lots to explore and well worth a visit.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you re willing to stay outside the historic Old Town, the Park Inn is iocated in the New Town, a block from a convenience store, three blocks approx from the tram to the Old Town andto the farmers market on Saturdays. There are a number of restuarants within an easy walk and the hotel's restaurant is better than average. The rooms are also quite spacious compared to many we have had in Europe.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel under radisson blu. There are quite a few nice restaurants around within walking distance. I’d suggest improvements in in room service such as movies on the tv, separated shampoo and body wash not all in one ones, and maybe hair conditioner and more body lotion.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location: 1.5 miles from the Charles Bridge / 30 min walk, so not super-close to the main square. However easy and cheap to get there by tram or Uber. The hotel rooms are really nicely appointed. We stayed at a slightly larger room with a terrace so it was spacious and with a good view (not to the river but to the East part of the city). It is very well kept and the service was always outstanding. Very close to a tram stop where a line that takes you to the old town (#17) passes by. A short walk gets you to 2 more tram stops for other lines. There’s a Tesco mini-market for basic groceries around the corner. Restaurant food is good too. The only comment for improvement I have is the availability of USB charging ports. With the ubiquity of cell phones and other devices I’m surprised that such hotel didn’t have a single direct to USB charging port. Even smaller / not as modern or new hotels have them. So a little thing for the hotel to improve/upgrade. Overall a great value.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing roomsWonderful BreakfastNear to city centerFriendly staffEasy check in and check out proceduresNearby Albertov Tram Station20 Mins. walk to the old town squarenear Vltava river Just a great experience.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there for 2 nights for a weekend escapade. The check in was super welcoming and we were even informed that our room was upgraded. We had a big room with a balcony. Reception staff were super helpful for anything we were looking for.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Park Inn Hotel in Prague is a clean and comfortable home away from home! The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly! The accommodations exceeded our expectations. And access to the city sights and public transportation was easy! Whenever we are back in Prague we will definitely stay at the Park Inn Hotel! Stan in Guest Relations is amazing!
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent choice of hotel for our City Break.Good location as the tram stop is a few minutes walk and four stops away from the Centre.The hotel staff were excellent, really welcoming and nothing was too much trouble .The staff on reception deserve a special mention for a warm friendly and extremely efficient service with a smile! We celebrated a Birthday during our stay and returned to the room to find a cake and a bottle of fizz courtesy of the hotel. What a lovely surprise , a really special touch. Thankyou to all. Would definitely recommend a stay at this hotel
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s new property with modern and comfortable rooms (although not very spacious). The railway just outside the window gives a unique feel of the past. Good breakfast and helpful front desk staff. Had a comfortable stay here in March 2019
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Don’t get me wrong, a very nice hotel, staff are very helpful, polite and friendly but the room is very uncomfortable! From the bed to the air condition! The bed is hard, the pillows old and stuffing knocked out of them, asked for two more but they are the same! Would so rather a Premier Inn for their comfort, the air conditioner - not sure what it thinks it’s meant to do as it certainly does not blow out cold air, have to sleep with the window open and hear the traffic and rail noise but better than being so hot and this in March!The breakfast is amazing !!
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Park Inn Hotel for two nights. The room was clean and big, the bed comfortable and large. The staff was amazingly friendly and kind. They suggested us some restaurants and they were a nice discovery.The hotel is located in a nice area, not far from the Dancing House and the riverside. The breakfast was just a dream, continental and well organized, heaven for sweet tooth. Lovely stay, hope to came back soon at Park Inn.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband & I travelled to Prague & stayed for 4 nights for my birthday in Feb. Our room was on the 5th floor & was great..Spacious,light,airy,spotless,comfortable,bath/double shower..you could go on & on. It also had a very large balcony which we did use a couple of times. In the morning the choice at breakfast was amazing, the best we have ever had & we travel quite a lot. The staff were all very polite & courteous & I was very surprised on the evening of my birthday to arrive back to our room to see ice bucket with bottle of champers,birthday cake & card..lovely touch & very unexpected as we had not mentioned we were staying for my birthday..would definitely recommend this hotel as you can catch the tram to the centre, at the end of the street, beside the river or just follow the river as it's a lovely walk. Eating out is very inexpensive as is the beer..There is lots to see & we had a fantastic time. Happy times...
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for three nights. The hotel is in a great location being about 20 minute walk down by the river into the old town centre. There are also tram and train stops close by. There is a Tesco just around the corner which was open until late. The staff were very friendly, helpful and speak very good English. The room was lovely and very spacious. We ordered room service and ate in the restaurant a couple of times because the food is delicious and everything is reasonably priced. Without telling anyone it was my birthday, when we returned back to the hotel after a trip out there was a small bottle of champagne and a cake with a birthday card on the table from the hotel which was very nice of them. We will definitely be returning to Prague and the Park Inn Hotel.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Prague with family and stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. Rooms were so beautiful and clean. Hotel managers and other executives were so polite and helpful throughout our stay. Few key pointers-1. Tesco- Tesco is just few steps away from hotel where you can take general items , beers or snacks or anything to eat and off course hotel has rgb grill and bar.2. Train stations- very near by and excellent connectivity from hotel3. Breakfast- Great quality ,peace and with different varieties.4. Gym- Gym is well equipped with all necessary facilities 5. Rooms- Spacious rooms with organised decor and furnishing items. Regulated temperature.6. Wardrobe- enough space7.Additional- you can buy adult train passes from hotel itself and can easily book taxi servicesReally really enjoyed stay with comfort rooms.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in room 209 clean,tidy, comfy beds, powerful shower. 15 -20 mins on a tram to the town centre... grest breakfast lovely staff. Modern rooms speak better English than at most hotels in the UK....faultless try and see a Slavia Prague match great too friendly but awesome atmosphere.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Park Inn Hotel Prague was fantastic! We travel 4-5 times (internationally and domestically) each year (leisure) and this hotel exceeded our expectations. Everything (and I mean everything) about Park Inn Prague was terrific. First, the reception desk staff - friendly, accommodating, knowledgeable, pleasant (especially Stan). All staff, from front desk to bar to breakfast area to restaurant were exceptional. Next, the room - large, clean, had everything you need and quiet. The breakfast area was very, very large and had everything you could want or need (every day we found something new that we didn't know about the day before). The location was very good. Not in the "old town" but only a 10 minute tram ride away (you can buy tickets at the front desk) which was nice because it was away from the "tourist" area. There's a grocery store (Tesco) just behind the hotel which will save you some money for water, pivo and wine (as well as other things). Park Inn Prague was exceptional and the staff and people who work there were exceptional as well. We had to leave at 4 a.m. and they even provided us with a "breakfast" box to take to the airport with us. I couldn't wait to write a review (I just returned from Prague yesterday) and wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it to all.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a place! Myself and my partner had a fabulous experience throughout our stay. Exceptionally friendly and helpful staff, trendy interior and the room was just perfect.We had a top floor room with a view over Prague, pristinely clean and spacious, stocked with everything we needed.Perfect location, a very short walk from the tram stop. Great breakfast! And a very nice bar with delicious drinks. Would definitely recommend this place for couples visiting Prague, but also for business trips or families/groups of friends. They cater for everyone!
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and my fiance stayed here for 3 nights in February. Rooms are clean, with a safe, large showers and a safe.Staff are friendly, helpful and welcoming.Breakfast is good with plenty of choices served between 6.30 and 10.30 (approx.)Only 30min drive from the airport and 30min walk from the main square a long the river.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the hotel for five nights both for work and pleasure. Our room and bathroom were both very spacious, comfortable and clean. The huge window is a great plus too. All amenities in the room. The breakfast buffet is varied and ample and will suit most diets or wishes. Staff is very professional and efficient and were very helpful in arranging taxis or helping us choose the right room because of a physical disability. The hotel is easy to find, close to a metro station and Vysehrad. Also perfect if you travel by car because it has its own parking garage in the basement accessible from within the building.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel! Awesome service and friendly staff, breakfast was incredibly good with lots of choice, rooms were clean and well equipped! The hotel provides parking and WiFi. I strongly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our flight home was cancelled at the last minute, so EasyJet booked us (and a couple of hundred others) into this hotel. Our expectations weren't up to much (we'd just had a lovely weekend in a very special hotel in the city) - but we were very pleasantly surprised! Considering the hotel had had 1/2 hours notice of 200 (unhappy) guests arriving - they were amazing! Not surprisingly, a bit of a queue to check in, but the staff were unfailingly polite and helpful. The room was excellent - clean, spacious, comfortable bed, etc (and quiet!) and the breakfast was very good. The hotel is located maybe a mile or so out of the centre, but it is a very pleasant walk along the river into town, or a short tram ride. There is a Tesco Express (surprisingly!) around the corner for anything you may need. The bonus extra 48 hours we had in Prague was not a disappointment - well done to the staff for looking after us so well!
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Park Inn Prague for 4 days and had a very pleasant stay. The staff were very attentive and professional and I even received a birthday cake and bottle of champagne for my birthday, despite never letting any staff know prior to booking. The only food I tried was the breakfast, which was brilliant, it’s buffet style and had a great range of choice. In all, Park Inn is a great hotel choice for anyone looking for a good quality and affordable stay whilst visiting Prague.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was the first time in Prague and afterwards I can confirm to have chosen the right hotel. The location is perfect. Not directly in the old town but still central. The member of staff was exceptional. A thank you to Stan, Honza, and all other staff members I haven’t mentioned but still have been amazing. It was also my birthday and the surprised me with an amazing cake and sparkling wine. I can’t wait to go back againThanks so much
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing hotel and not to far from everything you want to see! A team just around the corner that takes you to centre just 2 stops away. Staff were also amazing and friendly. Stayed in room 551 and was lovely size with a huge terrace. Will definitely return and stay in this hotel again.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is modern and very clean. Very nice and quite location.Breakfast is amazing. You will find everything you want. The staff are very friendly and very helpful.The rooms are large and nicely decorated.
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and Cosy :)Comfy bed, hot shower, nice dove soap and shampoo, helpful and friendly staff, airport transfers, a great restuarant called RBG attached for buffet breakfast and dinners. A Complimentary drink during your stay. Ideal location close to the river and local transport stops. A tesco express round the corner if needed... I would stay in a park inn hotel again :)
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very cozy and well-located hotel (10-15 minutes to the Charles bridge and the Dancing house). Tram station nearby. Nice restaurants around. We were granted with early check in when came. Contemporary and clean room. very good breakfast worth the money. The reception is very professional. We enjoyed the Christmas time wonderful in Prague!
hotelName:
3    Park Inn Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel provides you with all the comforts that you can hope for. It may not be a 5 star luxury hotel but has all the amenities that one would need. The room is spacious and nice. There is a bathtub in the bathroom which is much needed after the long walks. The breakfast is lovely. The bar is nice too. Another great thing is the location. You find a tube station almost as soon as you come out of the hotel. The fact that all of this comes at a very reasonable price makes it just awesome.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean, spacious rooms and lovely bar area. Beautiful decor throughout- the pianist was an elegent touch. Strict about check in & out times- but understand why. Location is a bit of a haul to city center but transit is very close.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for two nights for our anniversary. We arrived late, which we notified them of in advance. We had a great room on the 10th floor. My wife really struggles with mattresses being too hard - or too soft - and this one was perfect. Breakfast was excellent, gluten free bread and muffins were available. Located right next to the metro station so you are in Wenceslas Square in 10 minutes. Not sure I could pick a better hotel for the stay and for the price in Prague. 2 minute walk to the really moving Jewish cemetery where Kafka is buried which we found by mistake when we took the wrong exit from the metro. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Don Giovanni Hotel is a wonderful hotel that more than met our needs for two nights earlier this week.From the easy to use below ground parking garage, the check-in, breakfast, dinner, and large rooms with AC, all made for a great stay in Prague.The hotel’s easy proximity to easy transport, and even the gift shop added to our experience in Prague. We needed a hotel with easy access to the airport, and found the 30 minute drive quite easy.Our three rooms on the 11th floor all had great views. The WIFI seemed quite slow, which wasn’t quite as much of a negative, as this kept us off the laptops.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just back from a 5 night stay at Don Giovanni and what a lovely hotel.The hotel is situated within minutes of all public transport ( about 15€ for 3 day pass) and takes at most 10 minutes to centre of city. The breakfast is fantastic with lots of choice .Rooms very comfortable and serviced every day.The hotel is kept very clean.Would definitely recommend Hotel Don Giovanni .
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Easy to get to and from airport and to Prague centre. Line A is just outside the hotel.Executive room is a good choise, gives acces to Executive lounge.Executive room suggestions: More high tables and chairs on roof top terrace to enjoy the beautiful view. A place to deliver used service.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great hotel ! And location was perfect, easy to take the subway to city! 2 min from Hotel.. Good breakfast, big rooms, Nice and clean ! Its Good for teams and family or just för Anthony.. would love to come back here again!! Good also for bus parking! If u can pic a room from floor 10 and up!!
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited Prague for the first time and stayed at this lovely hotel. Biggest plus was the location...easy to get and from the airport as well as explore all that the city has to offer.Room was a good size though the air conditioning didn't quite work as well as we needed it to. Breakfast was delish and never failed to please. Had the buffet dinner one evening, which was good value but disappointing.The sauna, steam and jacuzzi cost an additional 10 euros for two hours but was well worth it!We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the DG and would recommend for a short city break in Prague.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and three friends arrived to a pleasant surprise of live piano music, a stunning entrance and a level of standard that felt insanely good as the price was extremely low. Room was great, service was great both in bar, restaurant and reception. The breakfast was super cheap at 5€ per day and was very satisfying. I highly highly recommend staying here just be sure to use the great and fast metro that you can find 50 meters from the hotel!
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Easily accessible by tram and metro although a little far from the center. The unlimited breakfast was good, the price is reasonable, the hotel is well decorated, and the rooms were clean. Would definitely consider staying here when we return to Prague. We also loved staying at their Amadeus Café Bar.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent two weeks here for a work assignment. Hotel is nice, very clean. Staff is friendly and helpful. Included breakfast was good but focus was mainly eggs and breakfast meats. Nice lobby bar with good prices and semi excellent. TV in English is limited to mainly news channels and sadly the WiFi was unreliable and slow. In this day and age, high speed Internet is a must.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We could not fault a thing in this hotel and it is the first time in our many hotel stays that we have been offered a choice of mattress firmness as well as pillows. We were nicely entertained by a pianist in the foyer lounge each evening but this did not deter normal conversation. The Don Giovanni is excellently situated just a few yards from the bus terminus and the subway. The trains are clean and run every few minutes so we used them for all our commuting. The Old Town where most of the visitor attractions are located is just a quick 5 stops to Mustek from the Don Giovanni. Over 60s travel for half price and over 70s travel free! We would definitely recommend Prague and this hotel for a short break or holiday and would have no hesitation in returning there. We found all the prices very reasonable, even in the visitor hotspots.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just a few steps from the metro station this is a very good place to stay, for a fair price a great value.We had trouble with the reservation as our rooms were booked twice due to an error in the reservation system but Lucie was very kind and sorted it out. Breakfast is really great with lots of choices, even english breakfast can be made from the choices if you like, pancake, grilled sausages, cakes, hot and cold drinks. Definitely will go again.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall very good. Disappointed the cups & glasses weren’t replaced daily in the room so we had to make our tea in dirty cups and use the same glasses for water & beer/Prosecco. Would stay again though
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The lobby is super cool and stylish, and very big but the rooms are so outdated. Our toilet bowl was cracked and sorry, but smelled badly . Horrible.They set up only 2 sets of towels although there were 3 of us.The safe in the room didn’t work. I called the reception right away, they didn’t send the worker , I had to ask for that the next day, and they sent someone only after third request.The breakfast was nice.The location is the worst for me.Although the hotel is conveniently located right to the subway station, it doesn’t say anywhere in the hotel description that it is right next to CEMETERY!!!Should I knew it while booking, I would not book this hotel!!!- [ ]
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is very easy to reach from the main airport about 50minutes with bus(119) and metro(A) no need to switch to another line and metro stops near hotel. Checking in and out was very easy good service and help. Breakfast buffet is good but if you're not a big eater it's best to go to the city or the 15min walk to the shopping mall(metro stop Flora). Cleaning daily and had no trouble with bath running out of hot water, airco in the room. Overall I'm very happy with the hotel. Also their is a Lidl across the street
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked an executive suite, beautiful room with living area with two single beds for the kids, dining area, office area and a large bedroom. Great room. Access to exec lounge was also nice. Location is a little out of town but metro was easy to navigate and very efficient.Only downside was being asked for €20 per hour for a late checkout.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this on online based on the reviews, I was not disappointed. Upon arrival check in was straight forward. We got upgraded to a suite which was quite unusual as it was on a curve. We got access to the executive lounge. We were expecting run of the mill stuff, however this was way above that! Unlimited hor d'oeuvres, beer wine and prosecco. Breakfast had every food group that any person would want. The Metro station was minutes away and took us into town quickly....very inexpensive. The people in the hotel were nice and polite, not overly engaging but that's okay. Would totally recommend this hotel to anyone who is ok with public transport
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel as a surprise for my partners birthday and what an excellent choice it turned out to be.i booked a junior suite,with access to the executive lounge on the 12th floor.the room was big enough for the two of us,with a massive bed in it.the hotel location was ideal,just 3 minutes from getting off the metro to walking through the front doors of the hotel.breakfast was really good and varied,you would have to be really fussy to find something to moan about, the breakfast.we were always greeted with a smile off the girl on the breakfast entrance,as we were off the rest of the stafff,especially the cleaning staff.i asked for some flowers to be delivered to our room for my partner and Sophie the guest relations manager,came up trumps with a beautiful bunch of lilies,which my partner loved,so thank you Sophie. We did go up to the lounge,for a drink and a sandwich before we headed out,which was very welcome. If we come back to Prague,which I am sure we will,we will be booking the Don Giovanni again,it might be a little way,out of the centre,but the rides on the metro,were good,and meant we saw more than just the centre of Prague. If you are debating,whever to book this hotel,do it,you won’t regret it.we didn’t.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I booked this hotel to celebrate our birthdays. Our room was clean and a good size with comfortable beds and a decent shower.A slight downside was the location which we found a bit noisy as we were close to a main road.The .The staff were all lovely and spoke English. Particular thanks to Lenka on reception who was very patient and helpful and went out of her way to find a solution to an issue we encountered with one of our travel documents. The breakfast was a delicious highlight. You could have anything from eggs and bacon to delicious pastries and fresh fruit and yogurt. The metro was just around the corner and brought us straight in to the centre of Prague in about 10 minutes for less than a £1. I Would highly recommend this hotel for a weekend break and hope to return with my husband later this year.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we stayed for 5 nights at this nice hotel in prague from the 26th of april to the 1st of may 19.located very next a metro station with easy access from and into the city centre.room was quiet,clean and we’ll appointed.staff friendly & pleasant.breakfast was good with several options - including for those who prefer vegetarian or vegan food.bar & room service( did not personally use) had a good menu.there was a gift shop on the ground level which had the normal items that one would purchase on a short trip.all in all a good hotel & we enjoyed our stay.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: service room at the highest level. hearty breakfasts! easy check-in and check-out. Unusual decor of the hotel and room. Metro station just 50m from the hotel, underground parking. I definitely recommend it!
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Don giovanni is 45 min from the airport.It is the first musical composition of Mozart...which was held in prague.The hotel is decorated with is statue. Lot of musical instruments..2 grand pianos in the lobby area.reception staff is helpful.lobby gift shop is also well stocked..and not very pricy.Rooms are utlitarian.. we had a triple sharing room..the double bed is actually two mattrrssess in two beds which are stuck together... making it a bit inconvenient.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very good quality hotel both for buiseness and pleasure trips. Nice, comfortable rooms with all what one may need during the stay. Fine restaurants with a decent selection of meals. Competent and helpful staff. All in all I would recomend the place.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This simply is a great comfortable hotel. Fabulous location for tube, trams & buses.Our room was very spacious beds were comfortable. Breakfast was lovely. Bar prices was very reasonable. Would definitely recommend and return to this hotel.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Unfortunately we only slept 2 nights here. What a great hotel for a few days prague. The hotel is situated a little outside the centre but right next to Metro. The green line brings you in a few minutes to all the hotspots in Prague. The welcome was nice and easy. We have been given a room on the 10th floor with a nice few. A plus is also the wellness on the 12th floor after a long day walking trough the city. Rooms were nice size with comfortable beds. In the morning we enjoyed a great breakfast. A lot of choice.. The hotel was fully booked for a extra night but we will definitely come back. Great money value. Highly recommended !!
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is really nice, it has big and spacious rooms, well organized, the staff is very friendly and they are talking very good english.The breakfast is delicious and you can choose from different types of foods. The location of the hotel is very closed to the public transportation
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All I can say is that everything was perfect. The hotel is away from the noisy and crowded city centre, but it has great connections. Few meters away there is a tram station and metro station 'Zelivskeho', so you can get to the city centre and to many other sights very quickly. The connections are very good and it is very easy to find the hotel (they also have instructions how to find them on their website). Hotel is maintaned very good. The room was big and comfortable and it has everything you need. The room was also very tidy and had a really pleasant smell, just like the hallways and the rest of the hotel, which is a big plus for me. The breakfast was just amazing, so many choice and everything was delicious. You can find something for every taste. The staff is nice, friendly and very helpfull. I was amazed and the hotel has overcome my expectations. I couldn't be more satisfied. Thanks to everyone! We will come back for sure!
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a very nice 4-day stay at the Don Giovanni Hotel with my kids, the room was super clean and everybody there was helpful and kind. The hotel is next to a metro station, which makes it super easy and fast to go downtown. The buffet for breakfast was fresh and tasty, with plenty of choice. A place to recommend in Prague!
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very clean and the breakfast was excellent. The hotel was very close to the metro station so made it brilliant for a family. The staff were very helpful. I would definitely recommend going back again.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I mainly chose the hotel for it's location near to Slavia Prague's football ground. Turned out to be well placed for public transport too as right next to the Metro and plenty of trams. Room was comfortable and certainly large enough for one. But I suggested it to two friends and they both ended up with suites! Breakfast could be a bit busy as breakfast area a bit small for a large hotel.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a very easy hotel to find, metro right outside the door. The lobby is bright and clean & gives the impression you are going to have a nice stay. The staff are friendly & extremely helpful. The room was clean & well maintained. Although on the outskirts it is easy to get into town either by metro or the many buses that stop outside, (10 mins on the metro).Facilities are great, wellness center, games room, bar and restaurants.I especially liked the pianist playing in the lobby in the evenings.The restaurant was very reasonably priced and the food was very good.A good relaxing place to stay.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've had high expectations about this hotel and really wanted to like it! However, this wasn't the case. If I ever visit Prague again, I will most definitely stay somewhere else. Here is the breakdown for you:PROS:- close to the metro (green line)- close to a supermarket (Lidl is across the street)- nice looking lobby- the Spa is decent, but a bit pricey for PragueCONS:-The mattress and pillows in our room were horrific- too soft and squishy. I couldn't sleep at all. There was a notice right next to the bed saying that you should go down to reception and ask for a different pillow and mattress if you don't like the current ones. I did...they said they don't have other ones! This is NOT a 4-star hotel answer. Don't advertise options, If you don't have any!-the twin delux room is just appalling. I've never seen such a budget room.- the ''executive rooms'' are what you would expect a normal room to be in a different hotel- the breakfast doesn't have much variety for a 4-star hotel. Sausages and eggs all day long.- the reception staff are not the friendliest by any means- the cleaning staff never replaced the shower gels and bathroom amenities - breakfast is until 10:30am and they start clearing-up on the dot. VERY LOUDLY- the toilets are weird
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel on the outskirts of the centre of Prague. Comfortable beds (we had 4 in our room...2 pushed together as a double and a single either side)...don't know why we were given a family room...there were only 2 of us. The hotel was spotless. There's a Lidl supermarket right opposite..handy for water, snacks etc. The first time out of the hotel we didn't have a clue where to go or what tram/bus to get, or even where to BUY tickets for the tram/buses etc. Then we walked towards what we thought was a subway to cross the road and found to our amazement that it was a tube station! We asked at the kiosk in the station for a map (not sure what the kiosk is for - they DON'T sell tickets!) and we were given a map of Prague with all the tube stations, tram stops, bus stops clearly marked on it...along with the attractions. Fantastic! You cannot get lost..there are only 3 tube lines..A, B and C! We bought an all day ticket from the machine at the station that cost about CK105 (about £4) and that covered everything. Tube, trams and buses. Don't think it covered the main trains...you won't need those if you are staying inthe centre of Prague anyway. You can pay for the tickets by cash or credit card. Don't know what time the trains finished...we always were back at the hotel by 10-10.30..exhausted by then! Had breakfast once at the hotel...on the last day. We went out for breakfast, lunch and evening meals at various restaurants we looked up before we left home (we are vegetarians.) Lovely hotel.....very convenient for local transport to get to the centre of Prague within minutes...very quiet. Would return in a heartbeat.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights during the Easter break. The hotel is very easy to get from the airport - the hotel does offer a shuttle but we got a bus and metro which took around 35 mins and cost around £1 each! Rooms are very spacious, we had an executive room so we had access to the executive lounge which serves food and drink until 10pm - all included in the price at no extra charge! Breakfast is very good! Only downside we found was that there isn't ant air conditioning so all we could do was open a window, the hotel itself is very hot. Gym is not that big and well equipped so we went running outside instead.The hotel is next to a metro station (A) and has bus and tram stops outside, it's only around 15/20 mins to the main centre so really convenient!
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this hotel for my birthday so paid for the Executive room with Lounge access as a treat. On arrival was given a room on the 5th floor which on inspection was obviously not an executive room went down to complain and suddenly the receptionist couldn't speak English. After about ten minutes receptionist finally reappeared with a card for the 8th floor which actually said executive floor when we arrived. Went up to the 12th floor to look at the lounge to be refused entry because the entire Czech National football team was staying at the hotel and they took priority. Never got to use the lounge the entire 3 days we stopped there we got put into a little games room in the lobby with a few wilted sandwiches and a couple of bottles of beer. The hotel in general was ok but i wouldn't rush back too far from Old Town and traveling on the underground wears a bit thin after about 10 times back and forth.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was really good, it has a supermarket very close. Transportation was really easy to take from the hotel and the room has a lot of space and it was very comfortable. The bar was good and loved the person that played the piano in the evenings
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay, very comfortable parking, tasty breakfast quiet room, high standard of fernitures and bathroom, live music in the main lobby (thete are two pianos - black and white), services eager to help.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great weekend in Prague, booked a Junior Suite, shame that the Executive Lounge wasn't available during our stay. We also had a electrical fault in our suite at 10pm and it took 3 telephone calls to Reception and an hour's wait till a technician arrived to fix it.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: highly recommended, everything was excellent, service, cleanliness of the rooms and hotel itself, value for money, location close by Metro station, very good and tastefully breakfast , spacious rooms.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived late and got some story about being overbooked due to burst pipe. Transferred to what can only be described as a crap ibis. Single beds and crap view. Really not like for like as they say. Bad start hopefully get better...
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's an amazing place, with pretty comfy rooms. We stayed in a junior suite which was huge and quiet. The Wi-Fi was OK in the living room, but terrible in the bedroom - we got disconnected every other minute. The breakfast was outstanding with copious intercontinental options - the music was annoying and loud in the restaurant though.There was a Lidl nearby as well as a metro station and couple of trams.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent stay in executive room for 3 nights. Hotel is convenient located next to Underground to get to the Old Town in 15 minutes. Very friendly staff in the lobby and also in the Room Service . Breakfast is standard.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently a specialized nearly "industrial" conference was held here and The Hotel Don Giovanni prooved it was a champion in that kind of venues! Everything was prepared to satisfy guests, presenters and visitors. We were very satisfied, thanks to all who organized the event, the staff and all involved!
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived last nite tried to say have not paid for one room I am staying here with my fiancée my mum an 2 young brothers 16 and 13 my youngest brother has autism and adhd at 21.45 tonight manager knocked as we all in pjs sayin talking to loud was my mum tickling her son's playing he's at 22.35 knocked again sayin talking to loud elderly couple below us.. well I'm sorry we decided to stay indoors with kids and enjoy our nite!! Prague in a whole sucks an this hotel is absolutely disgusting vile
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is nice, just landed from Dublin. To be told in the restaurant that they have no vegan options, and no a simple tomato pasta cannot be made for me. So unfortunately I'll be here for 3 days with nothing to eat. Great start!
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I have just returned from a 3 night city break in Prague which we booked ourselves, as opposed to a package. The Don Giovanni was secured through Love Holdays at the unbelievable price of £108 for 3 nights b&b in a standard double room.The hotel was undoubtedly (especially by Eastern European ratings) a 4* facility with first class amenities and catering options. Our standard room was more very spacious and more than adequate (they do more superior categories plus the option of the executive lounge facility) as a base for the frenetic city break scenario!The Don Giovanni staff were extremely helpful and the hotel, whist in the suburbs, had bus, tram and Metro stops tight outside, so the Prague Old Town was easily accessible in 10 mins for less than £1 each way.All-in-all a great spot that we fully recommend and will certainly stay at again, should we return to Prague.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a wonderful experience! The room spotless and beds comfortable. The buffet breakfast was fantastic! That in itself is a reason to stay there again. The service received from all members of staff was commendable. You will not make a mistake to stay here.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have visited this hotel 3 times and always great!! Breakfast very nice in the both restaurants,room spacious &very clean.hotel is so close to the tube station, newly opened Lidl opposite the hotel is nice!also always great price for the room and kind&helpfull recepcionists.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well maintained hotel with attentive, courteous and efficient staff. Well maintained. I would rate it as a 3.5 Star category. Location superb. Right opposite metro, bus station, tram station and on main Street. Breakfast has a good spread with good quality. Airport barely 25-30 minutes drive. Main station 10 mins drive
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a lovely short break in Prague, clean and spacious rooms with an extensive buffet style breakfast. Easy access to town and the main site seeing attractions, via Uber or tram, we did walk a couple of times. Staff were friendly.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff is so friendly and helpful, the buffet is varied and tasty, a comfortable and clean room and plenty of great facilities such as the spa, restaurant and live music in the lobby. No complaints, just many happy faces! Not to mention it’s about 2 minutes away from the metro, bus and tram station. Would absolutely recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I first arrived, although I had an email reservation confirmation they told me the payment did not process so I had to pay again in cash. I better not get charged for the hotel on my credit card. This was extremely puzzling, why would the hotel send me a confirmation email if the payment had not processed? The concierge who was “helping” me had horrible service, talked in a rude tone, and refused to explain to me why I had received a confirmation email despite the payment not being processed. The hotel has 1 outlet. None close to the bed. So you would have to alternate charging of phones. Also the room reeked of cigarette smell????? In a non-smoking room???The cook during breakfast was literally racist. I asked him to make an omelette for my mom, and he just pointed at the pre made omelettes beside him. While, a Caucasian male asked for the same request, it was granted. This was a disgusting behaviour. This hotel is very far from city centre, would rather pay more to stay somewhere closer next time and not go through this humiliation next time.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights at the Don Giovanni last week and got off to a fantastic start by having our room upgraded to a Executive Junior suite. I had emailed before going enquiring about things they could do for a birthday as it was my husband's 40th, and they took this on board and upgraded us and also put balloon's in the room and left us fruit, water and wine which we thought was so lovely. Also we had access to the Executive lounge which has free drinks and snacks from 10am -10pm. The hotel has excellent links direct in to Prague as the underground is literrally behind the hotel. Just hop on the Green line and Prague city centre is only 6 stops away which took less than 10 minutes. Breakfast had more than enough choice to suit everyones tastes. The hotel staff were really nice and very helpfull, always giving you the time you needed to answer any questions and give directions. Big thank you to Sophie the general manager who must have arranged the upgrade, you really did make our holiday one to remember. One thing to keep in mind before going, which i wasn't aware of is you have to pay a city tax at the end of your stay, not very expensive but worth keeping a little money extra to one side for.
hotelName:
4    Don Giovanni Hotel Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location, location and friendly staff with great rooms! If you want to be close to the heart of the tourist area, this is it. Right beside the Charles Bridge, under the Tower, which by the way is the name of the hotel in Czech.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were amazed with every touch of this hotel. The price was so affordable, that I wasn’t expecting much to be honest. Literally one min walk to the Charles Bridge, which means you can walk anywhere in the city. No need for taxis or public transport. The city is on the opposite side of the bridge than all the main sight seeing, and let me tell you that you’ll prefer it this way. Less tourist, less overwhelming. The hotel itself was very nice with a portable AC in it along with a fan. Each day when they made up our room they gave us special treats, cookies, chocolates and champagne. The front desk, Phillip, was very helpful and had the best recommendations. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has the perfect location as it is right at the end of the Charles Bridge. The room was spacious, clean and well-fitted. Breakfast had a great variety and the coffee was excellent! I would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location to get to many tourist sites. Enjoyed our stay there What really gets a five star review is the personnel there, they were very helpful with everything. Good breakfast buffet and outdoor dining area.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel Pod Vezi was the perfect hotel in a perfect location! The room was large and comfortable. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. We had a problem with the air conditioning in our room the last night and they did everything they could to solve the problem, including bringing in a portable AC unit and fan, along with a voucher for a dinner in the restaurant. Can’t ask for more! The restaurant was excellent, as well!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Pod Vezi during our Honeymoon and absolutely loved it. Every detail was perfect and they even decorated our room with roses and champagne when they learned it was our honeymoon. The front desk staff were very thoughtful and gave us excellent travel and food recommendations. During our stay there was a record breaking heat wave but our room was perfectly air conditioned. We look forward to visiting again for an anniversary and recommend it to all our friends.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the Annex building about 1 minute across the road which has a lift. The hotel reception staff are superb, very helpful, walked us across the road to our room on check in without any hint of wanting a tip. Hotel and its associated restaurant for meals including breakfast are right at the start of Charles Bridge in the heart of the old town, busy yet quiet in our room. Breakfast was first class, including pre-cut fruit in glasses, hot and cold food buffet, and on Sunday they even had complimentary Prosecco!!! Each day they had a treat for us in our room. The air con system was not modern but considering how old the rooms were it was understandable and it certainly was fine, although we chose to open the windows for lovely fresh air at night. Highly recommended, top hotel!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed At This fantastic hotel for 4 nights..situated next to the Charles Bridge.....Comfy beds..lovely and clean throughout...hairdryer in bathroom as well as complimentary toiletries , excellent continental breakfast something for everyone..staff more than helpful and very welcoming..lovely and quiet area at night..nice little suntrap roof terrace ,would recommend this hotel to anyone..and I will certainly be going back there.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First, the front desk staff was incredibly gracious and helpful. Secondly, our room was unexpectedly spacious and attractive for such a reasonable price. Perks such as robes, chocolates, a small bottle of champagne, etc. generally come with higher-priced hotels. Because we had booked directly with the hotel, we were given a 500 crown credit for the restaurant which we used in the main restaurant for dinner one evening. The Creperie, a second restaurant connected to the hotel, was also good. The complimentary breakfast was excellent and included espresso drinks made to order. Our windows overlooked the street leading to the Charles Bridge but there was no noise. We stayed in the main hotel. Our friends stayed in the annex or second building and their experience was similar to ours. They had booked through a third party service and feared their room may not be as nice, but they were very happy with their accommodations as well. I highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this delightful hotel for four nights from June 22 2019 - our room was large and comfortable - air con worked a treat given the high temperatures that we experienced whilst there - the was also a fan in the room to keep things even cooler. As an early morning coffee lovers we really appreciated the Nespresso Machine in our room.We particularly enjoyed the delightful breakfast in the outdoor seating area and of course the manditory post exporing beer before heading out for dinner.We only ate at the restaurant for dinner once (as there are so many nice restaurants close by) - our meal was excellent as was the wine (red).On advice from my travel agent I had the hotel organise for us to be picked up from the Train station on our arrival which they were more than happy to do (15Euro/350CZK pay the driver cash) they also organised a car to transfer us to the airport for our early morning flight home to Australia. We were offered a breakfast package to take with us -which I regrest not taking with us as I am sure it would have been much better than the offerings in the airport lounge.As others have mentioned the hotel is situated under the Tower of the Charles Bridge - so it's a quick work across the bridge to visit old town and loads to expore on both sides of the river within easy walking distance (we are both over 60)With only 12 rooms this is a small hotel so book early so you are not disappointed.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot say enough good things about Hotel Pod Vezi. From the impeccable service, to the amazing location and incredibly gorgeous rooms, there cannot be a better hotel in Prague. Each day, they even left little gifts for my friend and I, which is definitely not the norm for a European hotel, in my experience. The front desk staff is beyond helpful, and gave us recommendations on what to do during our stay, and the rooftop terrace of this hotel is one of the most beautiful views in the city. Breakfast was also very delicious. Whenever I return to Prague, this is where I will stay.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
