review_body: The location and service is outstanding. You can walk to Old Town in a few minutes. This hotel is at the end of the Charles Bridge. The breakfast is outstanding! I loved the fresh waffles in the morning. Front desk service is top notch. Take advantage of the roof top over the reception office. We had beer there and watched the sunset. Beautiful.I would stay here again!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were very friendly and the hotel was really convenient to see all of old Prague. We had a lovely few days despite our dreadful journey to get there. We had a meal in the restaurant and the food was really good. Our room was large and a welcome refuge from the searing heat of our last day. Would recommend anyone to stay here.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An absolutely delightful hotel just at the end of the Charles Bridge. Our room (number11) was really a corner suite and looked out over two busy pedestrian streets and the restaurant. However, the room were superbly well soundproofed with double windows. It was beautifully appointed with lovely wooden furniture, fast and efficient wi-fi and air conditioning, which was certainly needed during our short stay. You get a gift certificate for the restaurant and the excellent breakfast buffet is included. At the front desk they were a gold mine of information and they could not be more helpful in recommending where to go, and when to go to avoid crowds. They will make restaurant and taxi reservations and will sell you tram tickets that you can charge to the room. In fact they almost make you feel part of their family. Chocolates, or a bottle of sparkling wine appear in the room when you are out.I can’t imagine being treated any better at a grand five star hotel. Very, very highly recommended. Ask for number 11 and you will be delighted.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Pod Vezi for four nights, arriving on the evening of 24th June 2019 and departing on the morning of 28th June 2019. A week or two before arriving, I contacted the hotel via email to say it was my partner’s birthday the day prior to arriving and that was the reason for our visit – then asked if they could provide anything for the birthday. They offered flowers but with the stay only being four days, I declined and went for the other offer of a lovely Czech chocolate cake and bottle of fizz. My partner Jo was overjoyed when she saw them, plus “happy birthday” balloons on the bed. Well done Pod Vezi, it was a lovely gesture.On arrival, we were allocated room 115 in the annex, which is less than a minute walk from the main hotel reception and building. The annex is a tidy and quiet building. The room was quite a lot smaller (it seemed) than many shown in the other pictures. Additionally, although an air-conditioning unit was in the room, it was a portable and not a fixed unit. With the temperatures reaching 38C in the daytime, the unit being on most of the day/night was a must. However, it was quite a noisy affair, not too dissimilar to having a tumble drier in the room rumbling away all day. The other negative was the lack of English-speaking TV channels on the television. Now don’t get me wrong, I rarely watch television at home, never mind when I’m on holiday so it wasn’t an issue to me but I can imagine it being a big problem to others. The only British channel available didn’t work either, leaving one American channel as the one single thing available.And so, to the positives. The most important hotel connected thing to me on my travels is sleep quality. The beds at the Pod Vezi are very comfortable and the rooms are so, so quiet at night. I slept like a log throughout each night. There was an ample supply of complimentary drinks & snacks in the fridge and the prices were reasonable. Likewise, the bathroom was well kitted out with complimentary shower gel, soap, shampoo – plus a hairdryer – everything you could need really. Breakfast each morning was excellent. The hotel is superbly located at the side of Charles Bridge, extremely handy for everywhere really. The staff simply couldn’t be faulted. We had a fabulous four nights there and will jump at the chance to stay at the Pod Vezi again. Highly recommended, don’t just look at it, book it!!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Pod Vezi! The location is unbeatable right under the Charles Bridge Tower. The rooms were large and the hotel was quiet. The staff was very attentive, they arranged rides for us from the train station and to the airport. The restaurant served delicious food with very good service. Highly recommend!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel mainly due to the reviews on Trip Advisor & wasn’t disappointed on any level. Location was perfect, staff ever so helpful, breakfast was delicious & room was spotless & spacious. Would highly recommend.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff. Accommodations. Breakfast. All were excellent. The location made our stay easy. Even provided pass to climb the tour. Definitely give this the highest of reviews. If going to Prague this makes an excellent base for your visit.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nothing too much trouble fantastic stay and highest quality stay... Centeral location with easy access to the main areas whilst been surprisingly quite. Fantastic food and service. Will stay again every trip to Prague ;-)
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Pod Vezi in one of their Superior Double Rooms located in the adjacent building. It is literally adjacent and right off of Charles Bridge which comes in handy to sneak out in the early morning or later in the evening to try to grab a photo without so many people on the bridge. The room we had in the adjacent building was very nice and had a window AC unit that cooled the room down in minutes. The breakfast was delicious and the staff at breakfast was very attentive and friendly. The front desk staff was also accommodating and offered suggestions and help on two different occasions. Location Good: I would say the right and perfect location for me because I wanted to be near the bridge and the Castle on the hill. I would say the food choices on this side of the river are not as much, BUT the restaurants they have on this side seemed to be the best. There were still hundreds of choices to select from.....basically if you are looking at the bridge from the hotel head right and any neighborhood before or after the local park alongside the river you will find some fantastic food options – one of the guided food tours I took had us going to five different places in and around this park, and all were great). Location Not as Good: If you like nightlife and the wilder side of Prague then anything near Mustek would be better for you. Old town and most of the other sites are on the other side of the river away from Hotel Pod Vezi but with that said the majority of them are very close and the walk across the bridge and to the start of let's say old town only adds on a half mile at most. I personally would try the other side just once and just to try it out, but I would most likely keep coming back to the Hotel Pod Vezi because it was a great experience with great staff and in a great location itself!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We picked this hotel because of the excellent reviews on trip advisor, and I’m so pleased we did!They arranged our transfers both ways. Our taxi driver was so lovely, full of information, very prompt and professional.Check in went very smoothly. All the young men on reception are so nice. We were given maps, information, trip advice, 15% discount of everything in the hotel restaurant, plus a voucher for 500 cz to use in restaurant also!We booked a suite, number 14, and it’s one of the most beautiful rooms we’ve ever stayed in. Looking out at 2 different aspects right next to the Charles bridge tower!Massive bed....so comfy, 5 large windows, lovely and light, sofa and desk, table and tub chairs, mini bar, ( reasonably priced), tea and coffee, (nespresso machine), bathroom with bath and shower, lots of toiletries, hair dryer, fluffy white towels. Absolutely everything you need.Housekeeping came in everyday, and we were left little gifts each time, which was a lovely touch. Flowers, chocolates, macarons, fruit bowl, cava, postcards. Very nice.Breakfast was great. Something for everyone. This was served from 7am TIL 10.30am.We thought the food in the hotel restaurant was fantastic, and very reasonably priced. We also tried a couple of other places nearby,...Tri Stoleti. Lovely ambience, fantastic service, but food was just ok. Best of all was Piknik Park. Beautiful setting by a small river, so pretty, and tranquil. Had the best Italian food, lovely wine, and service was excellent also. Would highly recommend this.We booked a couple of tours through the hotel. River cruise and guided walking tour which included boat trip, and medieval lunch. Great!Had an absolutely wonderful stay at Pod Vezi!Thank you to all the staff there, that made it so memorable.Prague perfection!x
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came here for a romantic 2 nights before attending a conference in Berlin. We arrived exhausted after driving in the heat from Slovakia and found ourselves at this charming, lovely hotel in a magnificent position. We were welcomed warmly and were very pleasantly surprised to receive an upgrade to a junior suite. The room was absolutely lovely and very large with 2 rooms ( no. 22 in the main building). There were delicious chocolates and water in the room on arrival. After a big day exploring the castle and surrounds the next day, we found a bottle of champagne and some macaroons waiting for us in our room- what a lovely surprise! And much enjoyed!! The restaurant for dinner was also great and I would recommend. The breakfast was really lovely also, as were all the front desk staff. Would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just what you could ask for when visiting Prague. Historic building with lots of charm, well located near all the sights - Charles bridge at your doorstep, old town, Prague castle. But the highlight is the staff. Every little detail taken care of. Even warnings of where to do currency exchange and taxis to avoid being scammed. Great English and even housekeeping managed all the little things to make your stay comfortable. And the food!!~ Fabulous buffet breakfast, and outside patio if you choose. Dinner was fantastic and well priced. A table next to us had Champagne and the waiter did a sabre bottle opening. Very impressive. When we arrived late they even recommended a great local spot for eats... enhanced the experience. Also since we had early flight to catch provide breakfast to go. Highly recommend Pod Vezi.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our second visit to the Pod Vezi and we simply love being back here. We love all of the things that we loved the first time around - the proximity to everything, brilliant breakfast, fabulous staff and lovely rooms. All of the small details are taken care of fabulously. We are again in the annex building of the hotel and it’s very convenient to have the luxury of a little bit of extra room. The one thing that really sticks out is the cleanliness of the hotel. Nothing (and I really mean NOTHING) is out of place and the staff really look out for all of the small details. The extra touches such as fresh fruit, biscuits and chocolate are lovely and I love the convenience of tea and coffee in your room. The hotel has good WiFi throughout and there are discounts offered to both the restaurant and the creperie for guests of the hotel. One other benefit is that the hotel is really quite quiet, even though it is at the end of the Charles Bridge, where every man and his dog visits and that’s because of the lovely little square. Limited parking is available (but it needs to be booked in advance and available). But of course, a hotel is nothing but walls and beds without its staff and the Pod Vezi has some of the finest. We were very lucky that on many occasions we were assisted by Jerry. His knowledge and recommendations were excellent and he even sat in the car with me and assisted me navigate to the correct parking place. This genuine desire to assist is what will keep me choosing the Pod Vezi for any future stays in Prague.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved this hotel. It is small (12) rooms and the rooms are large-suites. The staff goes off it way to be helpful-restaurant recommendations and reservations, cars to airport, suggested sites. A nice touch was the small gifts left in our room each day-candy, sparkling wine , etc. Don’t let the location, next to the crowded Charles Bridge, deter you. It is very quiet. We highly recommend.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our introduction to the hotel was its taxi service from the airport. Although our flight was delayed by about 2 hours, we were met by a smiling taxi driver and no extra charges for the time delay. How nice that they manage that! There were four of us and we had two rooms in the annex. Once settled in, I was looking at my map as we exited the building saying, "Now, which way to the bridge?" My clever child said, "Look up Mom, It is literally just steps in front of you." One pleasant surprise was an umbrella stand inside the building's front door. It rained our first full day in Prague. It was so thoughtful of the hotel to provide more than enough umbrellas for each of us to have a free umbrella for the day (on the honor system). Sometimes it is the seemingly little things that perk up one's day.The desk clerks were very helpful. We ate at two restaurants they recommended, which were perfect for what we had requested! We also bought tram tickets from them and arranged for our taxi to the train station when we left. We took advantage of the abundant free breakfasts, as well as a discounted (for hotel guests) dinner. Our room and beds were very comfortable. It was especially nice to be greeted upon arrival with fresh flowers and some chocolates in the room. We weren't in our rooms very much. When we did have a break in our main touring events, it was so convenient to go out for a little stroll on the bridge or along Kampa Island or to get a beer in an outdoor cafe. Our stay in Prague was simply charming. In a large part, that was due to Hotel Pod Vezi. Thank you!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great hotel. The location is perfect. We were in the annex which is probably quieter than the main hotel but our room was very nice. The restaurant with the hotel is very good too. Every day we had a small gift left in our room from the staff. We had to check out early morning and leave before breakfast and the staff prepared a to go breakfast for us. They speak perfect English and are very helpful in suggesting sights, restaurants and anything else you might need.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It takes quite a bit to impress me but Hotel Pod Vezi did just that. The location is terrific, right at the Lesser Town end of the Charles Bridge. Even though it is in a fun, active area we found both rooms we stayed in to be very quiet. The breakfast was ample, we were greeted with small gifts in our room every day, and the buildings themselves were quite charming. Note that one of our rooms was in the 2nd building and this was not a problem. Having said all this, the best thing about the Hotel was the staff. The front desk staff were terrific. They really went out of their way to be kind and helpful, explaining the tram system, dealing with our luggage during a room move (my fault, booked the wrong dates), and dealing with our transfer from the airport during multiple flight delays. The breakfast room and cleaning staff were equally good. If I had to come up with one criticism it would be that it was quite warm for our stay and the A/C in the room didn't quite keep up. I like it cool when sleeping.I highly recommend this hotel for a memorable stay in Prague.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were guided by the TripAdvisor reviews of this hotel and were not disappointed! The hotel is in the perfect central location just at the Mala Strana end of the Charles Bridge. So convenient for all of the major sites and close to plenty of good restaurants. The reception staff are excellent and cannot do enough to ensure that you enjoy your stay - giving advise on the must-see's, organising taxi rides with their own driver, advising and booking restaurants. Nothing is too much trouble.The room itself was large with a high ceiling with all the emenities you need - plus the lovely extra of surprise gifts each day. Good quality toiletries, an affordable mini-bar, large screen TV, plenty of wardrobe space...Breakfast is varied and plentiful with a wide variety of hot and cold food. The hotel restaurant is excellent plus you get 15% off as a hotel guest.We took advantage of using the hotel's driver to and from the airport which was another positive offering - again at an affordable cost.We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would fully recommend it...
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Simply could not fault anything. The BEST location in Prague, next to Charles Bridge. Amazing service from pre-planning all the way to check-out, they go all out, so much so that they organized bottle of champagne and chocolates for my birthday. Great breakfast and dinner. Restaurants and tours that were recommended to us were amazing. All in all we would recommend anyone who's visiting Prague, to stay in this hotel
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights in the annexe building of this excellent hotel. It was very quiet particularly as it was so close to the Charles Bridge. Great location for exploring the castle and other central sites. The staff at the hotel were friendly and very helpful. We also received daily treats in our room such as chocolates, biscuits and champagne which was a lovely touch. Would highly recommend for a stay in Prague.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What can I say, we visited for a short city break after visiting a few years ago and what a time we had. We cannot find fault with the Hotel. From the moment we arrived until the moment we left the service was excellent. We had rooms in the hotel annexe just across the road from the main building and they were spotlessly clean had every facility you could need. The location is excellent right next to the lesser tower which you can go and visit with vouchers provided by the hotel.I would thoroughly recommend this hotel as a great base to visit the beautiful city of Prague and we will be back!!!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I came to this hotel with my sister, as she had stayed here before and said it was really good.It wasn’t just good it was wonderful. It is located in a fantastic part of Prague just by Charles bridge, the area around the hotel is bustling with tourists.Back to the hotel, really clean, the rooms are large, beds really comfortable, and have lots of little extras, tea making and a coffee machine tv and at reception u can borrow dvd’s, toiletries, hair dryer and safe. Breakfast is a delight and so much of it and keeps you going for the rest of the day.The staff are so friendly and will do anything to make your stay extra good, they are so knowledgeable about where to go etc. Definitely a recommended place to stay. Every day you get a little treat in your room, chocolates, biscuits etc such a lovely touch.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You have come to the perfect selection for accommodation in Prague, perfect hotel. We are a couple that travels a lot around the world and this hotel will rest one of our good memories. warmly recommended.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall we liked this hotel. Good location near the Charles bridge, and in walking distance to the Old Town and the Palace. Nice restaurants around. The service was quite good, as were the restaurants. I found the staff to be very helpful and accommodating. Do take advantage of the free pass to climb the tower.A couple of quirks and issues.1. The restaurants allow you to charge the meal to the room, but not the gratuity. Thus be sure to bring some extra cash to pay the tip.2. I booked hotel transportation from the train station to the hotel and from the hotel to the airport by e-mail. No problem with the pickup. There was a disconnect with arranging the transportation from the hotel to the airport. Thus they expect you to reconfirm the transportation to the airport.3. They were kind enough to give me a courtesy late check out because of some health issues of my father, but must not have communicated with the maids, since one of the maids walked in on me without knocking during the extension period. Thus, be sure to lock the door.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice Hotel, breakfast great, staff very kind and professional, room clean and spacious, location is perfect, in the heart of the city, but quiet. I recommend this hotel 100 percent. My husband and i had a great time there.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed here for a 70th birthday present for the mother in law. We were not disappointed. The hotel organised our taxi, the driver was very informative giving us useful information about Prague and the hotel. At the reception the lady was really nice and also gave us lots of information that was really helpful. Rooms were big and spotlessly clean, everything you needed and mini bar was reasonably priced. Chocolates and water in the room on arrival, lovely touch. Breakfast was excellent and lots of choice. Prosecco served at the weekend which was also a nice touch! All the staff we met during our stay were very polite, friendly, really helpful and went the extra mile. As it was a birthday celebration we asked the hotel if there was anything they could do to make it special! They organised some balloons and table confetti for breakfast. Sparkling wine on ice and champagne flutes during the day, which we took up to the roof terrace.That night we ate in the hotel restaurant....make sure you book as it was full and people were turned away without a booking. Fantastic food from start to finish, it really was superb and the waiting staff were friendly and couldn’t do enough for us. Dessert was finished off with a sparkler for the mother in law and the staff sang happy birthday! What a top hotel! Great location next to the Charles bridge. You get free entry to the tower which is definitely worth going up. I’m glad we picked this hotel as it really was simply the best. Thank you to the hotel staff for making it extra special. I would 100% recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is perfectly situated at the base of the Charles Bridge. It was easy to walk to most everything we wanted to see. The hotel staff was helpful and breakfast was very nice. I was in the annex, which was just across the street.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great time in Prague and much of this was to do with the hotel we chose Pod Vezi. Location, was brilliant right next to Charles Bridge so you could walk easily within 10mins of the main attractions. The hotel organised our taxi to and from the airport which was prompt. The boys on the front desk were amazing, they did couldn't do enough for you. They helped us book the electric bike tour we took all with no fuss. We stayed in the anexe across the road, but this didn't detract from the service at all. Breakfast was great just what you need before a full day of walking around Prague. Little treats in the room when you returned, we enjoyed the wine but not so much the fruit!!. We shared the wine on top of the hotel on the roof terrace, small but lovely. We ate in the restaurant one night and the food was wonderful. Would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Pod Vezi is conveniently located by the Charles Bridge, is quiet, quaint and run by an extremely helpful and friendly staff. Upon arrival, there were complimentary chocolates in my room and the staff delivered cookies and champagne the next day. It's little touches like that make this an ideal place to stay.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Pod Vezi is a tidy, immaculate hotel in the Mala Strana district of Prague, with a superb location. Out the door and around the corner, and down the lane a few yards is the Karluv (Charles) walking bridge to the other side of the river. Once inside the hotel, you may hear conversation and laughter from the outdoor cafes, but you won't hear traffic and crowds of rowdies as you might on the other side of the river! We were surprised upon arriving that the staff had upgraded us to a suite in the main building: a very spacious room with high ceilings, a generous sitting area, large bath, and many windows for air and light. Large comfortable bed, and a vase full of big red roses made this accommodation a lovely place. The breakfast area is small but the offerings are excellent: hot and cold items frequently refreshed, appealing to both European and American taste. Computer access in the lobby, with advice from the front desk, made it easy to get maps and directions. Please know that this is a small hotel without a 24/7 housekeeping staff, and any requests go to the front desk which is minimally staffed at night.(We observed one lady who was frustrated at having to get her own ice, for example.) The hotel is not an American-style mega hotel, thank goodness, nor a cookie-cutter limited service budget property (I stay in plenty of those for work). But for people who want a warm, welcoming intimate setting, we recommend Hotel Pod Vezi highly.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Last year I stayed here with my husband; this year I came to Prague with my sister and stayed here again. The great things about this hotel are many. The rooms have everything you will need for a great stay. The beds are mega comfortable, they provide everything (safe, hairdryer, toiletries and other bits) and including little treats every day. The staff are amazing; friendly, mega helpful, they remember everything and they will do anything to help you. It makes it so personal; unlike chains of hotels which can be quite impersonal.Breakfasts are delicious and plentiful. (Try the waffles!)So, the downsides of this hotel are.....absolutely none! Even the location is superb. Right by Charles Bridge.I would highly recommend it.Thank you to all the staff there.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just heading home from 3 night visit to Prague. Cannot recommend Pod Vezi too highly - it’s just fantastic ! Great location, beautiful building and room, fabulous breakfast buffet, lovely friendly staff give just the right level of attention. Gave us a huge bowl of fruit on one day when we came back at lunchtime due to rain and bottle of bubbly on my birthday. We sat and drank it on their lovely roof terrace admiring the view. Just perfect !
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were on honeymoon trip and spent 3 nights at Hotel Pod Vezi. We did send an email to ask about parking area, the staff immediately replied to us with detail-oriented information for the first visit tourist, it was very impressive. We also mentioned our special occasion which when we arrived, we found a beautiful setup in the room. As the first time traveling to Prague, Mr. Jaroslav provided us necessary info regarding the city and surrounding areas. Very attentive and service-minded. We both work in hotel industry for over 15 years, we really have to give big compliment to him. Also, Mr. Ladi who proactively helped us with internet connection and offered assistance to recommend choices of transportation to us. The room is in a very good and clean condition, water pressure and temperature are extremely convenient. Dining experience was also excellent. We will definitely stay in this hotel when we return to Prague. Thank you!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 2 days before I had a business trip scheduled in Prague. We took a chance and relied on the reviews we saw Trip Advisor!! The reviews were spot on. This wonderful little Hotel at the base of Charles Bridge was perfect. They arranged for a driver to meet us at the airport, we asked for some fresh fruit in the room which was delicious and they surprised us with a small gift. They gentlemen at the desk were polite and very helpful. Our room was appointed very nicely. The ceilings in our room were at least 12ft high and had incredible woodworking details on the ceiling. We stayed in one of the suites with a separate sitting room which made for a comfortable stay. Breakfast was plentiful and let of our package stay. We did eat at the hotel restaurant. My husband said his veal steak was one of the best he had ever tasted. The hotel provided complimentary umbrellas, which we needed. The location of the hotel is perfect if you want to be in the thick of the sightseeing action. We loved our stay and would recommend it to anyone making their way to Praha!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I just stayed at Hotel Pod Vezi (“Under the Bridge”) for the past week, and our experience was fantastic. The location is just off the Malá Strana side of the Charles Bridge, literally in the shadow of the bridge tower, but just enough off the Main Street to feel a bit quieter. Prague is very walkable, and we only needed to use the tram system a few times—this is a very central location for the main sights. Our room was in the Dependency building across the street, and it was quite comfortable, with a very modern and clean bathroom, but also high ceilings and exposed timbers. We enjoyed going up the old wooden steps with a sag in the middle, reminding us of the age of our building.The staff was great from start to finish, everyone we dealt with, but special kudos go to Milos, who we dealt with the most. When pharmacies were closed for Labor Day holiday, he came up with some Zyrtec for my daughter. Also, there were daily special treats left in our room, of both the edible and artistic sort.I believe this may have been our best hotel experience in a European country, and at a very reasonable cost. Don’t hesitate to book.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m a little late in writing this review but wanted to let trip advisor users know what a gem of a place this is.We went to celebrate our 10th Wedding Anniversary (we were married in Prague in 2009) and from the moment we stepped through the front door we were treated like royalty.From front desk, to breakfast staff, nothing was too much trouble.The hotel itself is gorgeous, in a fantastic location, (but quiet at night) with all the services you’d require.The little rooftop terrace is worth a look, even in February, and we took our celebratory bottle of the fizz from the hotel and tried to identify all the landmarks.The room was clean and spacious as was the bathroom.Breakfast was great, fabulous choice, with fresh coffee, and waffles you can make yourself! Even some more fizz to be had on the weekend.We did get varying treats throughout our stay, but I won’t ruin the surprise!So glad we chose this hotel for such a special occasion!!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super helpful staff, especially Milos on reception. Excellent breakfasts with tremendous choice. Comfy well appointed room with daily extras (chocolates, fruit, sparkling wine). Only slight downside, interior of hotel always really warm, bedroom especially so and with no aircon meant windows open (too much street noise) or fan on all night to get decent sleep. Wouldn't fancy it in summertime.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location -- everything is walk-able. But also very quiet. Large, clean room. Very friendly staff. Read many of the reviews and was not disappointed. I'd would definitely return to this gem of a hotel.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this beautiful hotel in February and it was absolutely beautiful. From the location to the friendly staff, the cleanliness and the beautiful breakfast we couldn't find one fault! Will definitely be returning to Prague and no doubt staying in this little gem of a hotel!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Pod Vezi was amazing. They met and exceeded all of our expectations. The hotel location can’t be beat in Prague. Steps from the Charles Bridge but you never hear the chaos inside. Our room was immaculate. Big bed, sitting area, spacious bathroom. Very nice place to stay. The hotel is situated very close to the trams at malostranské náměstí, which you could access the metro using it at Malostranská. Hotel restaurant was really really good and all the waitresses at dinner and breakfast were excellent!! They even provide you with free passes for the Charles Bridge tower! Such a great place to stay, and so happy we did!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely hotel, in a great location, with super friendly staff. Situated on the west end of the Charles Bridge, this lovely decorated comfortable hotel is ideally placed to explore Prague. The room was quite big and had a rooftop view of the city. All of the staff were super friendly, especially the reception staff who were very knowledgeable and helpful to guide you around this lovely city. Thoroughly recommended.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from a marvelous stay. We took two rooms-one in the main building and one in the annex and both were awesome. You should not worry if you’re in the annex. In certain ways it’s even a nicer room. Location is the best. Stafff is perfection. I had considered an even more expensive hotel and am glad I chose this one because this was perfect in every way. If i am lucky enough to return to Prague I only will stay here
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first visit to Prague and I don’t think we could have chosen a better hotel. Perfect location just before the Charles Bridge and although the area itself is very busy, our room was very quiet. All of the staff are so friendly and helpful and each day they left a little gift in our room. Either chocolates, biscuits or wine. Such a lovely touch. On our first day it was my partners birthday. We mentioned this to the guy on reception. When we got to our room, they rang us and said they had a present for us. They brought up a bottle of fizz on ice. How nice is that?! The breakfast each morning was delicious with a very varied choice. I genuinely can’t fault this hotel and will most definitely be returning.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Pod Vezi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For the price we paid this is by far the best hostel room I have stayed in when travelling, the breakfast wasn't cheap but is of a decent standard. The room is of a very high standard and the kitchenette was far beyond what was expected of it and due to sectioning off of the room allows for a bit more privacy. Staff were friendly enough too.Location is a bit removed from the dead centre but is easily accessible by public transport that stops just outside the hostel.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I came here on my solo trip and stayed in the 6 bed apartment style suite room. Each “apartment” has two bedrooms of beds with a shared common area and shower. Very comfy and spacious. The bar is great with happy hour beers going for about $1.50. Made lots of friends there. As most hostels in Prague are, it is about a 30 minute walk from most of the Old Town tourist attractions. However, the tram has a stop right outside the hostel. Ubering anywhere you’d want to go is around $5 or less, depending on the time of day. The only con is the wifi sometimes isn’t great from your bed, but it works fine in the common areas and everywhere else. I fully recommend this hostel!!!
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the second time I spent in Czech Inn Hostel. The standards here are very high compared to many other hostels I stayed in around the world. The location is great for a vegan, transportation around the corner, quiet neighbourhood because not really in the city center though very close. I could definitely recommend this place if you want to stay in Prague with a small budget.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel was the WORST I’ve ever stayed at. If you can’t sleep in the heat DONT book. It’s way too HOT! All the guest complained about the heat and they have no fans NOR air conditioning. All the guests I talked to said they woke up every hour. Everyone was sweating. The only fan they had was at the front desk for the WORKER — so your workers are comfortable but not your guests?! Screw this hostel. It’s also super far from the city center 30 minute walk,
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had booked 2 beds in a 6 people room in an apartment and really enjoyed our stay. The room is clean, cozy and you feel at home immediately. The staff was helpful and friendly. The location of the hostel is good, you get to the city center by tram in around 15 minutes. The only downside are the room key cards. 1. they demagnetize quite easily when in contact with your phone, 2. we needed two seperate key cards in order to get into our room and 3. you need key cards quite often to access several doors or the elevator which is overall quite inconvenient. Otherwise great hostel!
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The place is alright for budget accommodations. I wouldn’t rave about it being so incredibly amazing. They at least switched us to the 4th floor double private we booked from a dank nasty 3rd floor room that felt like a dungeon. Breakfast was mediocre, go grab food down the street, much better elsewhere. Location is decent because it’s on the tram line. You can find better value in a hotel if you’re a couple in your 30’s, most the rave reviews are of hostel packers staying in dorm beds looking to get in at the cool joint.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Unbelievable that this was a hostel. Had a private room booked via euroventure & did not have grand expectations but this hostel was superb. The staff were amazing, the room was phenomenal, & the vibe was still chilled out & unpretentious. The shower was a wet room style rainfall shower, the bed was so comfortable, & the room although not big, oozed style. We had a fridge & a kettle too, huge bonus for a hostel. Actually can’t wait to go back, would 100% stay there again. Oh & we walked there from the station, took about 30 mins, & walked to town too, also about 30 mins, but there is a tram stop directly opposite, with teams running every 30 mins. All night! Honestly could not recommend this place enough.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Czech inn is the very best hostel in Prague, I don't really know any other but I don't need or want to. What makes Czech inn a very nice and comfortably experience is basically everything... It is always completely clean and hygienic, the space itself is super cozy, both in the corridors and the rooms and the reception. Their breakfast buffet is awesome, for really cheap you can eat a real banquet, it has all you can imagine. The people who work there are friendly and professionals, I have to highlight the service of Alissa, Adam and definitly Simona, who ALWAYS worries to provide the best customer experience... I am still delighting with this Hostel and their workers and I also want to come back again, well, you can always do that because they have one of the best bars in the area where you can go as a hostel customer or just someone from outside, there's a different shows almost every night, the decoration is fantastic and they have every kind of drinks and of course the best beer... Czech inn, just thank you for all <3 Martín, from Chile.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently visited needing a room for myself and rooms for 4 undergrads, so had the opportunity to experience both "hotel" and "hostel" rooms.Quite pleased to find that the website is spot on as to what to expect: so no surprises... it's a hip, clean, fresh, modern hostel/hotel! Modern renovation of classic rooms mean for high ceilings and bright windows overlooking the neighborhood. My room was above the tram line which stops running at midnight...I had no problems. Reception staff are excellent, and there is English fluency. I had a last minute problem with a student with no reservation, no plastic, and no crowns and they were still able to give him good shelter with Euro. Despite what it says on the website, the older traveler who is comfortable with hostel travel will find this an enjoyable stay. Prices reflect the Francouszka neighborhood which is just a short 3 stops on the 22 Tram from I.P. Plavlova metro. Frankly, given the crowds down in the Old Town, this place is a quiet relief. Friendly Bar at night, Breakfast available in morning. Quick access to a good ATM in lobby, and several minimarts and good neighborhood cafes in the surrounding neighborhood. Overall a perfect launch pad for the cost-conscious Prague tourist (students, families, and young at heart will enjoy this place).
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Would highly recommend staying here if you want to get the most value for your money. The room was very clean and all staff were really friendly and helpful in highlighting the best places to visit around Prague. The bar downstairs also has a great atmosphere and you can't go wrong with some Czech beer.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First: I did not stay in the hostel floors but in the hotel classic rooms. Staying here quite regularly as it is close to the office & restaurants while still being far enough away from the tourist crowds. Clean rooms and very friendly staff. Nice small bar in the cellar. Only drawback (as with most hotels in that price range): mattress is only ok-ish if you stay for longer - and the ceilings allow quite a lot of the neighbor's noise to be heard.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my second time stay here at the hostel. The location is ok as its bit far from the City center but there is good transport connection from the hostel. The hostels room was simple but had everything you need & very clean and tidy. The hostel has a buffet breakfast which I didn't opt for at the basement bar. The bar at the basemant is amamzingly fancy bar with an cool bartender named Nisant who will never let your beer glass to stay empty, very good at making cocktails and made me JinFizz which was off the menu without hesitation. The hostel has very intersting events which can be seen at the reception. I'll like to stay back here on my next visit.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and comfortable hostel with friendly staff, excellent breakfast and individual locker for each bunk. Tram stop is right in front of the hostel.Thanks to Nisant for recommending me this place to stay!
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our double room with ensuite was perfect, very clean and spacious. We both slept soundly, the room was quiet and warm. All the employees we had contact with in the hostel were friendly, helpful and engaging.Breakfast was simple and tasty, excellent value for money! We were able to withdraw cash and also buy public transport tickets from the reception area which helped us greatly. On our last day we were able to store our luggage in a locker and reception staff arranged our transport to the airport. Nothing was too much trouble! Thanks for a lovely stay!
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely nice warm cheap and clean hostel, with kitchen, lobby, laundry and bar wich closes early but our first day we met Nisant the bartender who give us a lot of advices about the city, make us feel like home and we finish going out for beers with him so we decided to stay 2 more nights. The next days we enjoyed a funny comedy show in the bar, free if you stay in the hostel, but the staff wasn't the same, it was the like other cities, drink eat and consume as you can, money before service.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was due to stay at this hostel for 6 nights but extended it another 3 as I was having such a good time! Adam, Diana and Alissa made me feel very welcome and looked after and the hostel is a very social place in it's entirity.There is a well stocked bar full of great and cheap beers and cocktails. Most nights there entertainment in the form of comedies and quizzes and shows. The tram stops right outside so you can get to Old town really easily and you can even buy the transport tickets from reception . I stayed in a premium girls form which was really nicely decorated and had a kitchen /communism area which was pretty damn great. The showers have the large shower heads which are awesome and there is always hot water.I the moved to a private twin room which had it's own sink and was also pretty good.The breakfast is pretty cheap and and can be bought on the first night slightly cheaper. It's on until 12.00 which is fabulous that a hostel has started to notice that we don't want to get up at dawn!!! I will be back. This is definately a place I will recommend to anyone who wants to go to Prague
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was originally staying somewhere else in Prague but wanted to change after I didn’t have a god experience. So booked Czech inn very last minute and it did not disappoint. For the price, the quality of the hostel is unreal: spacious bunks with huge lockers and reading light, big showers, huge kitchen and very clean. The only negative was that I wasn’t staying for longer! Don’t hesitate to stay here when in Prague!
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited Czech Inn this September and I can't say anything bad about the hostel. It was clean, there was no noise and the service was always respectful, attentive and helpful. They also organised tours at the city and activities at the hostel as karaoke.They also offered box-offices to leave your luggage, laundry, shared kitchen and breakfast at the hotel paying a chep supplement.The hostel is in a great location, near the city centre. It was comfortable and economic. I would highly recommend it!
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the room with 32 people. We were a bit hesitant to book this room in terms of privacy. Turns out, there was nothing to be worried about. The beds each have a little curtain and a big locker for your luggage. The bathrooms were very clean and modern. Overall, we got more than we paid for. The only negative point was the fact that it is still a room with 32 people in it. It was common to be woken up by people coming in. But that's nothing to blame the hostel for.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I took a spontaneous trip to Prague and could not have been happier with the Czech Inn. My boyfriend and I stayed in the private room and it had the cleanliness, space, and beauty of a hotel with the warm, friendliness of a hostel. The tram is right outside of the hostel so it is easy to get into downtown Prague without constantly being in the chaos of tourists. Would definitely stay here again and recommend!
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: During my stay at the czech Inn, they were really polite to me. Gave me amazing tips on where the locals go to and stuff. The rooms where clean. There was a nice breakfast and since it's a hostel you have the ability to meet amazing people there. I had a really expencive hotel booked my final night of staying in Prague and I canceled it to stay here for another night. I think that says enough
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In October 2018, we organized a group trip to Prague for students of our university. The hostel was extremely helpful and assisted us in making a group reservation. They were very responsive to our e-mails and they did their best to take into account our wishes. The group had a wonderful stay at the hostel and we would definitely recommend booking a room here!
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect hostel with a min budget and best for a solo traveler to save money for other things. Easy to find the location and less than a min walk from the tram/bus stop.DON'T FORGET TO TAKE A SAFETY LOCK (TO LOCK THE STORAGE BOX) ELSE YOU CAN COLLECT AT THE RECEPTION FOR REFUNDABLE AMOUNT
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's a little bit different from other hostals but it is really cool. There are big rooms and there is always something going on in the bar. Therefore it is impossible not to meet new people there. The stuff is really nice and helpful and the hostel is clean. The next team stations right in front of the door so the location is perfect. I would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really enjoyed the bar, amazinh cheap drinks, great music and great organization of events! Lovely bartenders, especially Maru and Alisa made my evenings! Highly recommend and I will return back for sure:)
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We got the apartment, it was clean and spacious.The Hostel is next to tram/bus station, around you can find great bars and in the hostel itself there is nice bar. The workers at the reception desk were very helpful and kind. I truly recommend this hostel
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spacious rooms, nice design, comfy common areas and kitchen, good location very close to train station. Perfect service. This is definitely going to be my next stop in Prague. So far the best hostel experience from this city.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its my second time staying here and i just can get enough!.Its more of an hotel than a hostel if you get a private room :PIts close to a tram that will get you right into the city center.The staff is really great and so helpful and nice ,they even gave us everything we needed (thank you ANIA).Very secure, truly best in town!
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first hostel experience on our interrailing trip and it did not disappoint. The room was really spacious and clean. The bathroom was huge with a really great shower. We stayed in a private room with private bathroom and it was better than some hotels we have stayed in! Although it is slightly outside of the city centre there are great transport links just outside and you can buy the tram tickets from reception. The private room was on one of the top floors so it was very quite. Would definitely recommend if visiting the city.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Basic but very friendly and functional hostel. Good atmosphere in the bar and communal areas. Breakfast in the mornings were good and the hostel offered a free walking tour with transport to the meeting point. It Czeched all the boxes!
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Czech Inn in Prague as part of our interrailing trip and we were not expecting how incredible our private room turned out to be! The bathroom had a waterfall shower and the double bed was extremely comfy. After travelling on a hot train all day, we felt completely spoilt by the room. Staff on the reception desk recommended that we explore the area of Vyšehrad that evening which was beautiful and so I’d recommend asking them for any tips for hidden gems! Breakfast was cheap and the selection was great. I really can’t fault the hostel at all and I would definitely stay here again when visiting Prague!
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in a private room, which was very spacious for two people. Cafe on first floor had nice sandwiches and coffee drinks. Bar in basement had small, but good selection of domestic beers. Staff organizes many social activities, so if traveling by yourself there are several opportunities to interact with other guests. A free walking tour is also available to guests at the hostel. Located in a residential neighborhood that is farther out from the central city, so commute can be long to the sights. However, it is a much quieter area, which makes it more restful.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a nice hostel if you want to socialise, holds many events weekly and the staff are very helpful. We met people from all over the world who were so nice. The beds were clean and well equipped with a plug and a lamp, toilets were also very clean. Our only problem was the location, to get to the centre we ubered or took the tram which was a bit of a commute.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If every hostel could be as efficient, clean and awesome as this one, we wouldn’t have any problems. The variety in room choices and the cooking and social spaces is perfect. Prague has so much to see and do and this hostel has the perfect location that takes you away from the centre of it all and gives you a chance to explore another area. The vegan around the corner and the Mexican down the road is awesome too. We will be coming back again!
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really nice hostel with a good bar and cafe/social area. A free drink token is given on arrival to be used at the cafe or at the bar and there are plenty of maps and the people on the desk are very friendly and happy to give advice. Showers were really nice and powerful (great if you have long hair like myself) and the whole place felt very clean.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I thoroughly enjoyed my trip to Prague.Good PointsThe Hostel is clean, well presented, modern and quite fashionable if that is the right word. It's very nicely designed. The floors are very smooth, clean and nice to the touch. Showers were also good and just outside of the rooms so you don't have far to walk. The rooms are very cheap as well.It was easy to rent towels, buy shower gel or soap from the desk which was great as I forgot something. The bar downstairs provides drinks and very basic food. The bunk beds have solid lockers under them to keep your luggage safe.The mexican restaurant down the street was superb and highly recommend a visit. We went for steaks twice.My sleep was good as it's not a noisy part of town. The other guests were considerate. Obviously you do get usual hostel issues such as people coming in from airports in the middle of the night but that happens in all locations unfortunately. The hostel mainly has younger guests in it like many hostels.The trams go right down the side of the hostel. But this allows you to get around very easily once you have found the place.Bad PointsThe rooms smelt in the morning but opening the windows sorted that out.It's a long way from the city centre so you have to get a tram into town and cannot walk it. We got a taxi from the airport which helped us to get there but cost us extra money.My friend stepped out in front of a car by accident as we were coming out of the hostel so be careful as the front of the building.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed my time at the czech inn. It has a pretty great ambiance, is relatively central (you can hop on the tram right outside and navigate easily). The rooms were clean with large lockers, as well as charging ports (usb ports included) for your phone inside the bed bunk. The washrooms were all clean and surprisingly aesthetic. The floor layout was a bit confusing but this is hardly something to complain about. The bar downstairs seems to have a lot going on, and the staff keep a list of events going on around the city. You can borrow a hair dryer with a deposit.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On our way to a nearby movie we found the Czech Inn was still serving coffee at 9:30 pm. The espresso and cappuccino were delicious and the people at the front desk were friendly and spoke great English.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First let’s hit the good. The double room was spacious and clean. It included a sink and the beds were ample. I liked the individual charging stations with each bed and table and shelf space in addition to the under-bed lockers. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful (if not always truthful) and were sympathetic to our complaints. Now the complaints. Most everything was broken most of the time. No stair access and you had to use the elevator. Until it broke. No pancakes at breakfast, the pancake machine was broke. No laundry facilities, broke. Problems with internet in rooms, broke. When we arrived, the only men’s stall, broke and disgustingly clogged. Lock on said door? Broke. In fact, on a floor of 12 dorms and rooms, one men’s stall, one urinal and one unisex bathroom (which often had women in it). Not my first hostel by any means and maybe this passes for a “Great Hostel of Europe” (advertised) in Prague. I was not impressed.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Coolest hostel I've ever stayed in. We booked it at the last minute, and never expected it to be as good as it was. Our room had a hammock in it. It also had a roof terrace. The shower was a waterfall shower. The views from the room were amazing all across Prague. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Prague.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I stayed in the 34 bed basement dorm- which we were nervous for, but was surprised! It was very cozy, and it did not feel uncomfortable or anything. The beds were very comfy and clean as well as the bathroom which was modern and spacious. My only issue was the underbed storage, which was a little annoying to keep pulling out and unlocking when someone was sleeping in the bottom bunk. It was also very social, the bar was good fun and there were events often. The old town was a tram ride away and it felt very safe around the hostel. It also had a kitchen and laundry if needed. Overall it was a fun place for students in a good location!
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The private rooms are excellent, but it takes about 10 minutes for the water to get hot in the shower. The staff is nice and kind. The only drawback of the stay is most of the people in the hotel are around the ages of 21-25. If you are looking for an older crowd, then this might not be the place to stay. Another thing I noticed that the staff hangout with the guests on a daily basis. The staff drinks with the guests in the bar downstairs, which I thought to be a little strange and unprofessional. When staff gets off, they hang around the hostel and drink with the guests. It is definitely a great place, if you are around the ages I previously mentioned.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in one of the private rooms for three nights. First of all, I was impressed with the staff who took the time to ask me about how my room was and making sure that my stay was going well. The rooms were clean and bed was comfortable. Also, the bar downstairs was a good way to meet new people. The only issue I had was with the Wi-fi as the connection wasn't too good in the room. If this could be improved then this would be a 5-star review.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was clean and the location - close to transit and not in the heavily trafficked tourist center - was great! Nice cafe in the lobby, but it doesn't open until 8AM. Breakfast was adequate, but it was not available before 8AM.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great environment overall. The cafe was nice to have. It was located near some of the best pork in town, Conductor. Breakfast could have had more variety. The windows need to be closed for the AC to work and one of our windows was slightly broken. So that needs to be fixed. Overall great stay.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is optimal for solo-duo travellers on a budget but not particularly into partying. The residents were mature and the receptionists were helpful (extra thumbs up to Sam for his lobby playlist). We stayed in the basement and that was a bit dark but really can't complain. I would recommend this for people intending to stay for longer time periods as well.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I are backpacking and stayed here for 2 nights and absolutely loved it! Great value for money and staff were extremely helpful! Close to both the tram and bus so getting into town was a problem!
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Definitely different than any hostel I have ever stayed in. Loved the rooms, loved the customer service and loved the way they have a bar and a cafe. The front desk and the bartenders were the most friendliest people I have met in prague! Definitely reccomend!
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Czech Inn was the best hostel I've stayed in. The facilities were excellent - comfortable beds with big pillows, a coffee bar, downstairs bar, kitchen, fast wifi, and chargers everywhere. The free map the hostel gives was great and had really good coffee shop and food suggestions. Ask for the free drink coupon to Krcna at the front desk - its a medieval tavern with good Czech food.The fact that the bar was in the basement helped me be able sleep at night and the bar was never too noisy anyway. My room of 8 beds for girls only had a bathroom, sink, and shower inside which was so convenient compared to the walk to bathrooms in other hostels where you have to carry all your stuff back and forth. I found that I couldn't stand the tourist trap center of Prague - the location of the Czech Inn in the Vinohrady/Vrsovice neighborhoods was awesome to get the daily life feel of the city outside of the crazy center with tons of summer school trips and tourists.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful place for weary travelers, solo or in groups!Amenities are plentiful, staff is courteous and helpful and always willing to help.You can buy transit passes here, which is one of the tricky parts of navigating the city since you can't find dispensers are readily as tram stops.Also very well located with easy access to tram and bus stops (the 22 line is particularly useful), a park across the street, eateries and bars close by, and plenty to explore on foot in the area!
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the wine cellar dorm and it was awesome! Surprisingly was not loud at all. The location is awesome, with some great shops, bars and parks in the surrounding area. Tram line 22 is right there which is helpful when trying to get into the city centre. Super easy to get to from the main train station. All you need to do is get a transit ticket once at the train station, you can also get them at the hostel. The buffet breakfast was totally worth it if you like to eat a variety of stuff. Had hard boiled eggs, crepes, fruit, bread, sandwich meat, yogurt, tea, etc. Staff was very helpful with any questions we had. Each night there was also something fun going on at the hostel. The Happy Hour is AMAZING! It wasn't that busy but the pricing on the certain drinks is worth it before heading out to drink.Clean! Even though the shower and bathroom area is quite dark in the basement it is super clean and the showers were awesome. Always had hot water and incredible like rain shower head!Take advantage of the free tour, takes you around a lot of the city and guide talks about a lot of the dos and don'ts, different pubs, history, etc. From that tour we signed up for a Beer Tour... TOTALLY WORTH IT! We had such a fun time, learned a lot and drank even more!FUN FACT: Book on the Czech Inn website and you can receive some discounts - such as a free drink at the bar or kafe that is there and sometimes a certain % off your entire stay.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel is apart of the St Andrews chain. Their facility was clean, modern and spacious. I was in between here and sir Toby’s hostel. I’m comfortable with my decision though wonder what the other would have been like. The bar downstairs was nice. Their happy hour beers are dirt cheap for anyone coming from euros, pounds or USD. I didn’t feel a communal hostel vibe that I’ve had at others but not a big deal. Hostel is located right across the street from the tram. The map they give out at check in is surprisingly an immense help. Be sure to ask them what deals they can provide on attractions. Wound up getting a free beer coupon for the ice bar which is where I was already going. The hostels breakfast was....sad. For the price you can step next door and get something better. I appreciate the effort but hot dogs being passed off as breakfast sausage is a crime.I stayed in a solo room. It was clean, had a vanity which was super nice and the bedding was comfortable. The communal showers were nice and cleaned daily. The laundry facility onsite cost $5usd for wash/dry (total). The (cute) brunette at the counter was a terrific help and always had the best recommendations. I have nothing bad to say about this place but suggest their breakfast improve and possibly the staff be more involved to get hostel guests to mix and mingle more. (There are bar activities in the hostel bar but they’re more karaoke style). Tram ride into old town was maybe 15 minutes. Never had transportation issues.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights and I absolutely love this hostel. Firstly, the staff were quite helpful with providing the information you need about the city. Furthermore, I forgot to bring a safe lock but this hostel provides free lock rental (refundable deposit needed) and thumbs up for this. Secondly, this hostel lies in a good location whereby the tram station is just a stone throw away. I was able to go to most attractions via this tram station. I feel that although it's not exactly right smack in the middle of the city, it's actually as good as being in the city in my opinion.Last but not least, I stayed in a 30 plus pax shared a room but I don't feel that this place is too crowded or rowdy at night. The toilet and washroom are AMAZING I have to say. It really exceeded my expectations and was also very clean (I saw housekeeper cleaning every afternoon).The only downfall is probably their pancakes during breakfast (you've to pay for it). I didn't quite like the pancake batter and I felt that maybe it could be improved on? That's all and I really enjoyed my stay here thank you.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve stayed in plenty of hostels in Europe but I have to say the cleanliness of this hotel and the amenities/facilities were of a very high standard. There were no issues with staff, very accommodating! Would recommend.
hotelName:
6    Czech Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I warmly recommend this hotel for your stay in prague. The location is great, only few minutes from the wenceslas square and few more from the old city center. The rooms are big and clean and the bed is very comfortable. The staff is nice, especially umberto, which helped us a lot and was always willing to advise. The breakfast was good also, more than we expected
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is perfect..very close to Old Town and Wencelsas Square. The staff is very friendly and helpful....specially the concierge. The hotel has an Exchange and an ATM within the premises. The rooms are beautiful, well-appointed and clean. The bathroom was beautiful, with a welcome kit of L'Occitane toiletries. The breakfast buffet was great...with fresh waffles and omelettes. Loved every part of our stay at this hotel!
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: rooms are comfortable, food is great and service is more than perfect... breakfast with a wide range of food types, in addition, the rooms are equipped with good amenities. the decoration is a bit strange... the hotel location is more than perfect...
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a great hotel - very friendly staff, comfortable beds/rooms, excellent breakfast, Walking distance from the train station, quiet neighborhood away from the hubbub of city center, but still walking distance. Only small caveat - make sure to bring an eye mask - the huuuuge window that bends with the ceiling is covered by a window treatment that doesn't keep the room dark - and the sun rises before 5 am in the summer.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was the sister of the other hotel we stayed at while in Prague, the Majestic Plaza Hotel. Nice property, tiny lobby and too many cruise companies - but it was one we would stay at again. However, the Hotel Majestic Plaza was a much better value - and location was in a better location for independent travelers.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The GrandiumA modern and minimalist hotel trying to accommodate a wide range of people. The service upon check in is efficient.We were given a small room , meaning can’t open up two suitcases at once. And you are likely have to make way passing each other by in room.The room is very clean, with a comfortable bed. The windows and curtains are 12 ft. high and the only to privacy is to yank the curtains closed everyday.. no cords so, no easy task if you have shoulder problems. Our room (230) was adjacent to the outside duct work and other rooms. Views terrible.. and the rain and noise was amplified by the metal duct work. So that’s all that is in in my craw. Lots of positives: Because the reason you travel to Prague is see Prague.The hotel is central to everything.Hop on Hop Bus takes you everywhere and is located two blocks from hotel as are major stores, restaurants and concert venues. The breakfast buffet is excellent and the bar cafe offers a limited but tasty menu with excellent service. After spending three days here, I give the hotel 4 stars despite our bad room location.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very nice hotel. The rooms are spacious, modern and clean. The breakfasts are excellent with a great variety to choose from. The location is very good with a short stroll to nice restaurants and a little further into Prague old city itself
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Grandium hotel in the center of prague is a positive surprise. The rooms are well appointed, modern, and clean. Their size is fine and beds are new and comfortable. Breakfast selection is good ranging from European breads to asian dishes. The one point of feedback would be to have a broader range of cut fruit on offer.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights and we were extremely pleased . Hotel is in the center of everything.Train station is within walking distance . Breakfast is very good.The best part is the staff, which is very courteous , pleasant and helpful. We did not get our bags from the airline and they helped us a lot in retrieving our bag. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel in Prague
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While this hotel is not in the Old Town Square, it is very close. The rooms are cozy and the hotel service friendly.A truly comfortable hotel that has all the amenities.The breakfast was decent with nice selection of items and a hot egg station.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is nearby a subway station and many restaurants. It's in good and clean shape. Wifi works. Bed was good. Pillows could be better (they were too thick). Breakfast is ample and good. Enjoyed our three night visit.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Due to a mishap during booking we were out of rooms at arrival, but staff handled it excellently and we were not disappointed.Breakfast was very good, but music was to intense to my liking at breakfast time. Very good location to explore Prague from!
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here 2 nights prior to beginning our river cruise. Very clean, modern and comfortable. Coffee in room, robes and slippers, complimentary bottles of water. Very nice restaurant on first floor and bistro/bar, both with lackadaisical service. That seems to be the norm here. Definitely would recommend, though.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just got back after a four night stay at the Grandium. Was very pleased with this hotel. The location was great for sightseeing. Very easy to walk to major sights around Wenceslas Square and the Old Town. Also, the breakfast buffet was really good with many choices available.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Grandium Prague Hotel for 3 nights and enjoyed the friendly staff throughout. Great breakfast buffet every morning got us started on our tours of Prague. Easy walking to many sites including the Astronomical Clock and Charles Bridge. Finished off each day with drinks in the bar lounge.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Grandium Hotel from the 6th to the 9th of April 2019. We were celebrating my dad's 65th birthday. When we landed at the airport, we were met by Thomaz, who on the way to the hotel took us around the sights and showed us where was best to go and how to get the trams to these places. On arriving at the hotel our first impressions were it was beautiful. It had a great central location and ideally situated to get out to restaurants and shops. We had an issue when booking in due to a fault of our own, the staff were amazing and had it sorted in minutes and we cannot thank them enough. The room was comfortable and had everything you may need, I suffer with a bad back and the beds were comfy allowing a good night’s sleep. There was building work going on at the hotel when we arrived but you wouldn't have been able to tell. The hotel screened off the builders and it didn't interrupt the stay one bit. Breakfast had a verity of food and there was something for everyone. All in all, we were very happy with the hotel and the staff complement it very well. We would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to stay there again soon.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Grandium Prague is in the down town and there are many interesting places near the hotel. It is very quiet at night.It takes a few minutes to Prague Square, Charly Bridge and Prague Museum.There are many luxury shops for ladies to choose their favourite goods.It is a very amusing travelling in Prague.My wife and I will come Prague again soon.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Grandium Hotel from the 14-18th of June, it is situated on a side street in the main town area , within easy walking distance to sightseeing , we were impressed right from word go ,extremely clean hotel reception , staff were polite and attentive, our room was not ready as we arrived early but the staff took our luggage and stored safely for us , after a couple of hours we returned. And our room was ready, our luggage was taken to our room which was on the 3rd floor, the staff member told us everything we needed to know room wise.Although our room did not have a view it was not a problem as we would only really be sleeping in it! , our room was a spacious Deluxe room with ensuite bathroom , flat screen tv , safe , tea/coffee making facilities, immaculately presented throughout, bed was extremely comfortable as were the big pillows. We ate at the Hotel InGarden Restaurant on the first night, we weren’t disappointed food was excellent as was the service, special mention to Mirka our waitress, she was attentive polite and smiley.
