Breakfast in the hotel was also great, wide choice of breakfast foods, cooked buffet, omelettes made to order, juice, pastries , fruits , bread , cereals , as well as hot drinks choices, Mirka was working again and made a point of coming over to us to wish us good morning etc, she works extremely hard and was there everyday , morning and evening apart from one! , everything about this hotel was wonderful , thank you for a lovely time
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For a business trip to Prague I have booked this hotel and the hotel did not disappoint. Great central location, spacious hotel with very clean rooms, soft beds and lovely breakfast. The hotel was very busy but still very quiet overnight. It seems like a lovely restaurant/cafe within the hotel but with plenty of choices around the hotel we didn’t have the chance to try any food apart from breakfast. I will definitely book again for my next trip to Prague (business or pleasure)
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Immaculate Hotel situated in a side street close to the main centre. Walking distance to all main attractions.Ingarden food excellent, breakfast good. Staff very attentive and quick.Bar service spot on.A great hotel and we would highly recommend it to anyone.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great breakfast - Great hotel , excellent service .Step out turn left and retail shops are 5 minutes away . A bit further to walk into old town , I did get lost so -If you prefer old town location for heart of town book hotel closer.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My second stay at this hotel and I was not dissapointed this time either. Even better service this time, the staff are so nice and helpful. The room was perfect again. We asked for an iron at check-in and it took 5 min and they had delivered it to the room. Please try their lobby-bar - AMAZING coctails!!! Will not stay at another hotel in Prague again, will always book here!Next year we will be 3 ppl and then book their 3 bed room which looks even better. :)
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is by far the most luxury hotel I‘ve ever been. The hotel is very central, but the street in front of it is very quite. Everything was clean and you don‘t have to worry about anything - we‘ve had no problems at all. The bed was super comfortable and the breakfast is excellent. You can even have your own omelette, there is like a small kind of bar, where someone does the omelettes and you can choose what you want inside. The food quality is a high standard. I fell in love with hotel grandium! THE PERFECT STAY.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is walking distance from the train station if traveling by rail. Close to everything. Great breakfast and very helpful conceirge. Travel groups will pick up there and the Pub across the street has amazing local cuisine.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my partner booked a random trip to Prague to get away for a little while and wanted to see a beautiful city. Luckily for us we booked this hotel and it was a perfect place to be in between days out. Everyone on the desk was lovely, waiting and bar staff were perfect, food and drink at both breakfast and in the restaurant were spot on. Bedroom was quirky and really comfortable. Would recommend to anyone travelling to Prague. Within walking distance of all key monuments and situated a stones throw away from the old town and the astronomical clock.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very stylish art deco style hotel. You get the feeling of a well run hotel as soon as you walk through the door. Hotel staff are so friendly, polite and very willing to go the extra mile to make your stay amazing which it certainly was for us. Breakfast was very good. The hotel can arrange taxis at reasonable prices we held on to our taxi driver (Rudik) who was very good arrived at the time agreed at several locations. Hotel just behind Wenslasas square less than a minute walk away also old town square just a 10 minute walk. Loved Prauge beautiful architechture, great cafe culture really a very good place to visit.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really an amazing hotel. we felt so comfortable and at ease through out the site. the staff were amazing and did not argue or object to any of our reasonable requests. the morning breakfast was amazing, well organized, tasty and of high quality. the location is very convenient to many old town destinations. we highly recommend
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff horrible - rooms disgusting - the po manager sienna is the most nasty person I’ve ever dealt with extremely rude and could care less for the guests - housekeeping tries to enter room very early when you’re trying to sleep and lastly they try to overcharge you on absolutely everything -AVOID this hotel at all cost
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I arrived early on my first day, and was allowed to check in immediately, as my room was ready. No fuss, no hassle.My bed was very comfortable, with a well mini bar (with prices clearly shown) and lovely toiletries in the bathroom, a welcome pack full of ideas of what to do, the excursions, map and a menu for room service. The room was well ventilated, with air-conditioning, a huge TV, spotlessly clean, and well decorated.Breakfast was excellent, with a waffle and omelette station, and lots of choices for hot, cold, pastries, cereals, yoghurt, fruits choices. Oh, and for the fellow Brits, there were baked beans available!The concierge service could not be more helpful in helping me get the most out of my stay in the city, and made recommendations on how to best get about on foot or using public transport. Excursions can be booked in Euro or Czech Crowns.My flight was late, so they allowed me to leave my luggage while I got the most out of my last day in Prague. Would happily recommend, and will definitely return!
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it was my first time to prague acutely i was lucky to stay in this hotel clean tidy everywhere, rooms are modern, clean you can say perfect. Thank you, Jana from reception the perfect one, you can make your vacation happy, strongly recommend, will come back
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on May 30-June 2, 2019. It was my wife who booked our stay. I am very pleased that we stayed here as it is in the city centre. Very close and within walking distance of the popular tourist spots in Prague like Wenceslas Square, Astronomical Clock, Old Town Square, Charles Bridge, Prague Castle et al. The hotel itself is clean, the buffet breakfast was great with a variety of food choices. Our hotel room was like wise neat and tidy and the amenities were excellent. The hotel is also just a 6 minute walk to Prague Central Train Station. I would recommend this hotel to all planning to go to Prague.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Most hotels with all the A list items are two to three times the money. My sister stayed at a hotel that was three times the money and I still like this one better. Location is one block off a major shopping boulevard and a fifteen minute walk to the old historical area and the Charles bridge. If you decide to take a taxi it was very reasonable. Save your money for a wonderful dinner at Kampa Park and stay here. One thing to note. The breakfast buffet is amazing here every morning. Don't miss this. There are eight elevators in this hotel, yes, I said eight and you have to pay attention which elevator goes to what rooms. This hotel is full of mirrors and hallways that all look alike, so there is a learning curve to find your way around. A room key swipe is necessary to activate the elevator. We noticed quite a few Americans confused and finally giving up thinking the elevator was broken.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights pre and during an Evergreen tour. First time to Prague and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We had a problem with our room but we were quickly moved to another room with the help of the bellboy.Room was very clean and nicely furnished. The whole hotel looks like it has had a renovation as there was not one thing we could find that didn’t work. no chipped tiles or damaged paintwork.Buffet breakfast was included and it had a great variety. Omelettes could be made to order as well. Only thing I could ask It would be nice to have a mug of tea instead of a small cup. Wifi was also included and worked perfectly.Hotel was close to everything shops cafes restaurants all attractions like Prague Castle Charles Bridge Wenceslas Square. Also walking distance to the river so you can do a river cruise.Staff were helpful especially the cleaning staff for our room.Would thoroughly recommend this hotel
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good location in city center. Easy access to railway station, metro and Old town. Room was comfortable, clean, standard size. Very well decorated.Breakfast was fantastic and rich.The staff was helpful, professional and friendly. My next stay in Prague will be again in this hotel.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve stayed with family at this wonderful hotel for a 5 day city break trip. We were very pleased with our stay on all aspects. The hotel staff were friendly and extremely helpful upon arrival and throughout. The hotel was immaculate and beautifully designed - very stunning design with spacious rooms and areas in hotel was spotlessly clean everyday. The buffet breakfast was the most amazing thing we’ve ever had and seen- highly enjoyed this everyday!!! No other 5 star hotel we have stayed at has provided such a delicious variety of hot, cold, continental and sweet desserts- completely spoilt for choice of freshly prepared food tasted amazing!!! As well as juices/wine/ coffees and teas- breakfast was always perfect and we looked forward to this every morning. Food was so fresh and well prepared and staff were ever so lovely and attentive. Eating area was gorgeous too and spacious. Highly recommend this hotel for any stay and it’s location too- perfectly close distance to all main sights and attractions if you want to travel by foot/tram/underground trains. Thanks Grandium Prague, we’ll definitely come back and recommend you to others.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: there are many things to take into consideration one is the price for a 5-star hotel the price is very good borderline cheap, the place looks great, the staff was amazing from the pick-up driver to the reception, just excellent, the driver had to wait a lot for us on the airport due an issue they had there and he was so nice about it , the concierge helping me getting a last minute massage on a busy night all of them really great, loved the touch of the piano player during breakfast it made it feel so luxurious, bedroom and bathroom were super clean, not to the less good thingsthe hotel is pretty big and it doesn;t have enough lifts and the one it has are too small the day we wanted to check out it took us around 20 minutes to get down! I have been on 5-star hotels and also on 3-star hotels and the room wasn't that big amenities were only given once (for a 4-day stay) and breakfast was ok but not too many options for vegans or healthy eaters
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Grandium hotelThis is definitely not a 5 star hotel. More like 3.5. The rooms are actually ok and the bathroom decor is fine but the shower is a joke. It’s a shower head over the bath with really weak pressure, but worse than that is that you can’t avoid getting the bathroom soaking wet if you have a shower. The shower door only covers about 30% of the bath, so water just pours out onto the floor. There was a lot of noise from a building site nearby, hammering and drilling. This started at 7am in the morning. We like to sleep late when we’re on holiday and this made it impossible. They should have warned us in booking that there would be a lot of noise in the morning. The breakfast buffet was fine if you avoid the hot buffet which wasn’t nice. Cold buffet was ok, as was the fruit and pastries. The worst thing was the hotel restaurant which was just depressing. We should have realised when we went in on a Saturday night and it was empty, despite the hotel being full. It serves mainly reheated Chinese food cooked and served by Czech people. Even the waiter looked embarrased to be serving it. It’s a very popular tourist hotel, with a constant flow of Chinese and American coach parties, but way off being anywhere near 5 star. Lastly, the staff are not that friendly or helpful.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay at the Grandium Hotel. Its in walking distance to the main station and city center. The rooms are very modern and clean. The breakfast has a good Selektion of food including an Omlette station. The nice atmosphere was supported by piano music during breakfast.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location 10( it is near to old town, Charles bridge, train station 5 minutes walk, shopping street)Cleanliness 10Breakfast 3 ( very limited items, it is not a five stars’ breakfast ) We were hearing sound from other roomQuiet audible
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In my family trip (me , my wife & two kids) , found the location to be more than perfect , every thing is nearby.On the other hand, the breakfast was really limited , this is not what a 5 star hotel should have for breakfast, it doesn’t reach up to a 3 star hotel breakfast in Turkey , not to mention All-inclusive hotels to compare with , you guys need to work on that
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel is in a great location, 3-4 minutes close to city center. I had a great experience with the late night staff! Super helpful when it comes to directions.The hotel it's beautiful. I must say for been a 5*hotel, the rooms were too small. The best was the breakfast. Tons of choices and loved my prosseco in the morning
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After being picked up at the airport by an Emerald Waterways representative (as part of a Danube river cruise) and taken to the hotel, we were jet lagged and tired (~15 hour trip) and what a pleasant surprise. No delay at the front desk, our room was modern, clean, spacious and comfortable. A wonderful breakfast buffet was included which had everything a person could want to eat for breakfast (including a sparkling beverage if so desired). Hotel was close to many attractions, museums and plaza's. The front desk staff were particularly helpful when I had to make a few 1-800 phone calls to resolve a problem I was having - which I was very appreciative of. We tried the restaurant for a late snack and beverage and it was very nice.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spend 2 days at this hotel and everything work accordingly. Great facilities,good breakfast and friendly staff. However when i arrived at my next destination, i realized i left a small purse in my room with my prescription glasses and some Dominican pesos in cash.When i called to question the receptionist told me to email the hotel and upon further questioning they will instruct me on what to do. Im still waiting to see how this is going to end.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just spent 3 nights at the Grandium Prague and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.LOCATION:One of the key selling features for us was that it's located within short walking distance from the main train station so it's very convenient for rail travel. There's also an Airport Express bus that travels to the station and for less than $2 you can easily get to the hotel. It's around the corner from Wenceslas Square, a 10 minute walk from Old Town Square, and 20 minutes from the Charles Bridge. BREAKFAST:Our stay included a breakfast buffet that was really good with lots of selection of both hot and cold items, pastries, waffles, and a made-to-order omelette station.ROOM:We booked a classic room which was no frills, but it was clean and met our needs. However, if we return I'll likely try moving up a room category. What we didn't like:1. The mattress was very firm making it a bit uncomfortable for sleeping, but the pillows were great. It was fine for a short stay, however I wouldn't be able to sleep on it for a week.2. The bathroom had a tub with high sides (this may not be suitable for seniors who have mobility issues) and the shower head (while removable) was placed too low for anyone who's tall. There was also no shower curtain (just a half glass wall) resulting in water sometimes pooling on the floor. You may want to inquire about a walk-in shower instead.3. Our room faced an interior courtyard which was quiet at night, but the door to the room is quite thin so hallway noise was a problem at times.SERVICE:The staff are professional, friendly and service-oriented. You can tell they are well-trained to take care of guests. Cleaning staff also did a great job maintaining our room.The only other comment I'll make is that the Grandium seems to cater to large bus tours so it gets very busy at times, especially the breakfast buffet between 6:30-7:30 am. That being said, we never had issues finding a table.Overall, you can't go wrong staying here. Prague is a very walkable city with lots of transportation options so don't feel that you need to stay right in Old Town Square.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice clean rooms, plenty of serviceminded staff. Fantastic breakfast, one of the best ever and I have been travelling globally for 35 years. Close to Metro and walking distansen to Most highlights in Prague.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I arrived to Prague to find that our original reservations fell through at the last moment. We started walking through the city with our maps app / booking.com, carrying our bags, and on the verge of panic. In scouring though locations decent in price, reviews, and visually appealing photos, The Grandium stood out the most.We had only walked into one other location prior and decided that The Grandium was telling us to keep walking.Day 3 of 7 and we couldn’t be happier!!!This place meets expectations in any measurable way!!!We would both recommend The Grandium to anyone and everyone!!!One special note, the breakfast is amazing and will save on time and money immensely!!!Also, the restaurant is mind blowing good!!!
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent three nights in a very nice room. The buffet breakfast was excellent with a wide choice and an omlette station with good variety. We lleft too early for breakfast (5am) but the hotel prepared a box breakfast that we picked up in the lobby as we left for the airport.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Grand in every way! Service , people , the hotel , food I give it an A plus . If you want to buy garnet , they have a jeweler in the lobby they give good discount .I am very impressed. My first time in Prague and couldn’t be happier with this stay .
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location & a great hotel the Grandium really does do it all. Myself and my partner arrived late on a Thursday evening and the staff were great and very quick at getting us checked in! The rooms are large and as modern as they can be - my only slight issue was the black marble bathroom which, when it was wet,got very very slippery but they always provided enough towels to cover the floor so this again wasn’t a deal breaker.Their bar is great, unfortunately we never sampled the food as we tended to go out for dinner, but their happy hour and cocktail menu was fab- the staff were lovely, even letting us continue drinking until 11:30pm when we had definitely had enough! Location is PERFECT, it’s just far enough away so you’re not in the middle of the madness but it’s still close enough that everything is in walking distance. Concierge in particular are incredibly attentive and will help you with any queries, recommendations and travel bookings.Overall we had a lovely 4 days and I would definitely recommend! ✈️
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check in was fast and efficient,The hotel in good location 10 minute walk from old town square,breakfast is ok however gets bland and repetitive usual offering for European hotel, gets very noisy at night and early morning with slamming doors and noisy corridors. The bar is very small and bar staff very slow and dour. If wanting taxi don't use hotel despite what they say in their welcome pack as twice the price of one on street or at ranks, their price to zoo was 460kr we paid 242kr on street.metro just few minute walk.go to kantyna restaurant just opposite and down, amazing food for meat lovers, choose your own from butcher and have cooked, great atmosphere.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room fairly large, lobby well decorated, buffet excellent. The closeness of the hotel to downtown was a bonus and enabled us to walk everywhere. Lots of restaurants and coffee shops nearby and bonus, lots of shopping to be done.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is well located. It offers a lot of services. The breakfast buffet is great with a big panel of choices. We only regret that the room was to hot and without stores (so not dark enough at night).We would recommend this hotel !
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. Warm, bright, modern. Comfy clean rooms. Ten minutes from the old town square.The staff are wonderful and the facilities are excellent.Beautiful bathroom. And all at a fantastic price. Will definitely return here.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this pricey hotel via Expedia and it was totally worth it. The spa which i used 5 times during my stay was truly brilliant. The breakfast is excellent and i really love the dedicated omelette and waffle counter. The location was great too, not far from the old town, and there are 2 mini markets and currency change shops that offer great value. Also the main train station is 10min walk away and the nearest Metro station is 5 min away. The room was nice and very comfortable (see pictures), the aircon and heater was effortless to use unlike other hotels. The tv channels were decent and the wifi setup connections was fast, justas effortless as using wifi in Apple stores. Only issue i had with this hotel is the slow lifts, they take ages to open & close doors, and even the staff along with other guests have to wait long to use the slow lifts.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had what was called a junior suite for four nights, but was just a larger room with some small furniture in it. The couch and arm chairs were so small and low to the ground that they were almost unusable. The room was at the front of the hotel overlooking the entrance. The road outside is all cobblestones and we heard every vehicle go by as if they were in the room. Add to this the garbage trucks turned up at 5.30 every morning making sure we could not sleep in. We could hear every conversation taking place outside on the footpath each night and in the room next door as the wall are paper thin. We had a group of men with raised voices next door going on well in to the night and calls to reception about the noise were ignored. This went on for three nights giving us little sleep.The reception staff were polite and helpful with maps when we arrived. The breakfast has a large variety of choices with the breakfast room being very busy with tour groups etc. The dining room is temporarily located next to the front door so you see and hear all the heavy foot traffic while dining.This is not a five star hotel, it struggles to be a four star hotel compared to our stay in Berlin at the Steigenberger hotel or the Hilton in Munich where we also stayed on this trip.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, friendly staff, comfortable rooms and really fresh breakfast with a variety of options and a glass of bubbly or beetroot fruit juice on entry. Also includes a cafe and a cocktail bar. I would recommend this hotel for travellers to Prague
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a weekend in March 2019.This hotel was really good value for the price that we paid. Location is just off Wenceslas square and is about a 15 min walk into the old town centre. It’s a much larger hotel than we first thought with a big reception area and always lots of people coming and going, though there once in the room there wasn’t much noise to disturb at night.Breakfast was included in the price and again it was always busy there, though there wasn’t a wait for tables and the buffet provided pretty much everything one could want. There was a bar and restaurant at the front of the hotel too, though looking at the prices they charged we didn’t bother using them.The room was well appointed, a good size and was clean. Bed was comfortable. All the staff we dealt with were helpful and the reception staff gave us lots of free maps and guides when we first checked in.Overall very pleased with the hotel and we would stay here again.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed two nights at this very central hotel about ten minuters walk to central old town, room very nice and comfortable bed, cleanliness impeccable, good breakfast. Quic in and check out I really recommended this fine hotel
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located within walking distance of old city and Charles Bridge, this is a perfect location to see Prague. Staff were lovely and breakfast excellent, accompanied by beautiful live piano. Everything is nearby, including a reputable money exchange, and a bar across the street, where you will find the locals enjoying wonderful Czech food.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 4 nights at the Grandium. The room was quite large with a king size bed. The decor was modern. There was a good size closet with hangers. The safe was located in the closet. There were also some shelves for foldables. There was not a dresser with drawers. The view from our room was of the other wing of the hotel. The room was very quiet.A breakfast buffet was served every morning and it was excellent. It came as part of our tour package so I don’t know what the cost would have been if traveling alone. It was fairly close to the old town and museum, however we did walk over 10,000 steps every day for the time we were there.There were many local restaurants close by if you don’t want to eat lunch and dinner in the hotel but they do serve dinner there.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is quite anonymous on the street except that it is painted pale yellow. The entrance has the restaurant to the right and the bar/lounge to the left as you approach the reception area. Plenty of shiny, bright mirrored walls make it look enormous. Our room wasn't ready so we left our bag with the concierge and went to explore. It probably is approximately 7 minutes to Wenceslas Sqaure by foot and perhaps 15 to the Old Town. Check in was at 3.00pm but our room was ready by 2.00pm. The lift is operated by your room key and after discovering that floor 2 was only 1 floor up we used the stairs after that. The corridors were very modern with large photos of the city between the rooms. The room was clean and modern with some very strange angels. The bathroom was tiled in black with l'occataine products. There were towelling dressing gowns and slippers to use. One comment really was that the towels could have been newer and more fluffy and when they were changed they were not the same size as the previous ones. There was tea and coffee making facilities and a mini bar. Tip: buy your water from around the corner for 49czk for a 1.5 litre bottle instead of 1 litre for 90czk. The instant coffee in the room was horrible and bitter so we didn't try again with that. There was quite a lot of noise that was too easy to hear from the room as people passed by and opened and closed doors. The curtains didn't keep the light out so early morning the room was really bright. The breakfast service was in a restaurant at the back of reception and it was busy. Really well stocked and multiple stations located around the full area of the restaurant meant that queuing was limited. There was an omelette and waffle station and a pianist playing in the corner. The best way to describe it was if you have ever been on a cruise ship then this was very close to the breakfast service. In the afternoon of the second day we returned to the room about 3.00pm and there was some work being carried out close by which was noisy and disruptive. We went down to reception to point it out and after a short discussion were given vouchers for a drink in the bar which was fine. Apparently this hotel has 98% occupancy year round and whilst we were there, there must have been at least three tour groups in. The staff were helpful and friendly and there were plenty of smiles. I do know that there is no definitive star rating internationally and would probably rate this 4* rather than 5* and we chose it because it included breakfast as well as the location. In the corridor an appliance was plugged into the wall with a cable that ran the length of the corridor to what we don't know but it was there much of the day and we had to step over it. Some guests might not be able to see it and it was a hazard. I would have no hesitation recommending the Grandium for a short visit to Prague.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To celebrate the birthday of my wife on the 3rd of April we had arranged to take a city break in Prague.We travelled out by Easy Jet on an Airbus 320 aircraft. The flight was uneventful save that when we left Gatwick the weather was miserable and when we landed at Prague it was a lovely spring day, and stayed like that the whole time that we were there.Our transfer to the Hotel was by taxi which gave us our first sight of the city, which looked more than promising.. The hotel entrance looked plain but once inside the lobby area it opened out into a modern, much mirrored reception area where we were soon welcomed and given our room, I think it was number 355, which faced out onto the road that we had just arrived on.. The room itself was simply but comfortably furnished and had an excellent bathroom with all the usual facilities.. As it was by now latish in the afternoon we went exploring to find a restaurant for our evening meal. My wife used her smart phone to track down a place called "Meat Beer". On entering it seemed that we had entered a cellar. We were shown to a table and our waitress presented us with a menu, fortunately in English, for us to choose our dinner. We both choose duck pate for a starter and duck breasts for our main course. The food was excellent and was washed down with a large glass of the local brew. Next morning we had breakfast at the hotel and were pleasantly surprised at the vast choice available. We were greeted with a glass of sparkling wine which we both agreed was a charming touch. We were within a steady walking distance of Wenceslas Square, he of the Christmas Carol and his tomb is in St. Vitus Cathredal. The weather was warm so we restricted our travels that day. Prague has a marvellous tram system, also a metro and bus service.It was only 110 Kc for a 24 hour transfer ticket valid on all three. Pensioners over 70 travel free but you may need to carry some proof of age, I used my UK bus pass but was not required to show. it. We took a trip on tram route 9 right to the end of the line and then back into the centre of the city. During the journey we passed a large tram depot and saw a museum dedicated to the Trabant car!We had booked in advance a two day ticket on one of the tourist Hop on - Hop off buses. We thought that as we were no longer in the first flush of youth, that we would see most of the city in comfort and could listen to the commentary in English. There were three different routes and over the time available we covered them all.Prague is such an interesting city that I would urge you all to go there. We only managed to scratch the surface of Prague, with a country of 240 breweries and goodness knows how many different beers. We learnt that the good citizens of Prague drink at least one and a half litres of beer a day. To uphold the Spirit of Great Britain we did likewise and hope to return for a longer stay in the future..
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Grandium is indeed a 5 star.When we arrived to the hotel we had to deal with a very pleasant Smiling receptionist Eli'ska, who is not just Pleasant but very helpful. My self and Husband stayed for 4 Nights . In room 355 or 335 cant remember. It was a very good and rooms are cleaned very well everyday . Our Bathroom was a wet Room because of my disability The Hotel is spotless, VERY CLEAN. A Very Good Breakfast daily with nice glasses of Bubbly on offer Shout Out to Aida by the tray of bubbly filled glasses who gets guest sitted for breakfast with her Gorgeous smile the hotel has a Good Bar to Unwind.This Hotel is very well Located for attractions and various bars and Restaurants.Grandium keep up the Good Work. Hope to be there again.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was really nice and easy to find. The lobby is very nice but the room is very simple, especially the cheaper rooms (which were overly warm - even the air conditioning didn't help with this!), so it didn't really feel like a 5 star experience after leaving the lobby. When we arrived in the room, we were a bit shocked to discover some small spatters of blood on the bedsheets but we phoned down to the lobby and they sent housekeeping to change them straight away. They also sent up a fruit plate as way of an apology. The best part of this hotel is that they offer a very good driver service which you can book in advance. This is very cheap and an excellent way to get around the city.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from staying 5 days over the Easter holiday. Hotel is beautiful and our room was HUGE (and spotless). The Easter bunny even left our five-year-old chocolate treats. Those little touches make a difference.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a good and convenient location within easy reach of a wide choice of restaurants. It is also only about 10 minutes walk from the station. I travelled to the airport from the station by the frequest bus service costing CZK 60: the hotel transfer service would have cost CZK 750.00.My room was very comfortable but not with the best view as it looked directly into an inner area of the hotel: I would have preferred a street view. Breakfast was excellent - one of the best breakfasts I have ever had at any hotel! The choice of cereals, hot and cold food was very good and there were plenty of staff available to offer assistance.Check-in and check-out was very efficient. All in all, I would very highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is so stunning! The interior is beautiful, clean, modern yet charming. The bedrooms are a good size, as are the bathrooms, ours featured a walk in shower, complete with bathrobes and slippers! There are lifts to every floor. Breakfast is buffet style and vast. Honestly the amount of food on offer was insane, there's even a waffle and omelette station! Perfectly located less then 5mins from the main train station, or about 40mins in a car with traffic from the airport. For venturing out on foot, you couldn't ask for a better location, 5mins walk to the main square, 10mins to Charles Bridge, surrounded by plenty of eateries and shops. It was my partners birthday while staying at the hotel, and they surprised us with a bottle of wine, which was a lovely touch. Fantastic customer service from every single member of staff.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a two day stay at the hotel, hotel looked amazing the staff were friendly and helpful. On arrive our bags were taken and brought up with us to our room, the room was clean and had lovey touches with shampoo and conditioner, tea and coffee etc. Breakfast was lovely, variety of hot and cold food, had a pianist playing whilst eating breakfast lovely touch! Hotel was in the perfect location very close to restaurants, bars and attractions. We are definitely coming back to this hotel!
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent Christmas period at the Grandium and we had a wonderful time. The breakfast buffet opened early at 630am and they serve champagne and other speciality items. The staff are welcoming and friendly. Good value.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We contacted the hotel a week before our arrival date, in order to book a transfer shuttle from the airport to the hotel and vice-versa but unfortunately we waited approximately half an hour for the driver but he didn't arrive.We contacted the hotel receptionist and he said he was sorry and we had to wait 20 more minutes for the driver.By the end we found a random taxi to take 8lus to the hotel instead of waiting for 20 more mins.The bright side is that the hotel is clean, rooms are comfortable and breakfast is good.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a perfect choice for both busses and pleasure. Conference facility was great, comfortable and well equipped. All food was top quality. Breakfast is one of the best layouts I have seen in Europe. Well located and within walking distance to most popular sightseeing activity’s. Highly recommended hotel.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We would rate this hotel a 5 on 5 on location and the breakfast . The hotel is in the old part of the town , very close to the Wenceslas square . Lots of options to eat nearby. Nearest metro station is Musetec and Mueseum. You can even walk to Charles Bridge and Astronomical clock area. The only downside of the hotel was the room . We had booked a triple room but we got a double room with an extra bed put up which made the room very cramped . The plan of the room is not very good with no full size cabinet to store your luggage near the door. There is a cupboard next to the bed to keep some stuff but suitcases have to stay on the floor itself . There is no shower cubicle , rather just a bathtub with only half of it covered by glass enclosure . There was no view in the room . Beds were not very comfortable and would shake anytime one moved while sleeping . However breakfast was great with lots of options and live piano. Staff in the restaurant was pleasant and efficient . Staff at the hotel reception can be more polite though !!
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ideal hotel for a weekend break, few minutes walk from the centre, beautiful hotel and spotlessly clean Staff were fantastic and very helpful Stayed in a standard double room, they are small but have everything you need Stayed on a bed and breakfast basis, plenty of choice, seating and all freshly cooked
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the 5 time i have viit this hotel iin Prague. The location is very good- The standard is very high and this this i got a room in the new buliding. Breakfast was exelent. If you to to Prague- please try this hotel- you will be happy to find this hotel
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great ambience, Breakfast was good, staff was very friendly, rooms & washroom are big and clean. Nice location, Just 2mins walk from Wenceslass Street.For me it’s value for money , Definitely recommend for everyone to stay.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Situated adjacent to Wenceslas Square this hotel is ideally located. The rooms are lovely, the staff very pleasant and helpful and the breakfasts varied and plentiful. A lovely extra touch were the beetroot and apple drinks and the sparkling wine offered at breakfast time.MaryWe would like to offer our gratitude to the lovely gentleman who took our luggage to our room. He was extremely helpful and offered advice about places to visit and meals to try. Sorry, don't know his name but he is tall and slim with grey hair and a beard.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was perfect for a family. We travelled with a two and half year old and this hotel made things so much easier for us! So family orientated. Extremely clean and the beds were comfortable too. Well done to you all on offering a first class service!! Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Prague and especially with young children. All staff were so welcoming and friendly with us. A huge thank you!
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was lovely. It was immaculate, well located, with attentive staff and an excellent breakfast offering. There was lots of variety of breakfast, with cooked breakfast, continental, fruit, waffles and omelettes and the standard was probably the highest I’ve seen abroad. Tables were cleared away immediately and the cutlery (always a sign of cleanliness!) was put on tables using white gloves!! Would definitely recommend this hotel and if I came back to Prague, wouldn’t think twice about returning here.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is nice and clean located in the center. Very comfortable bed, pillows & etc...I would recomend it for any kind of stay.Breakfast is fine but the same food served each morning. In my opinion this nice hotel deserves better breakfast to be offered there, enough but boring when each time the same BB. All the rest is fine- you can go on with booking without doubt! :-)
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great location in the middle of town. About 1 mile from the river and easy to walk too. People were very nice and rooms were comfortable and roomy for European standards. The breakfast in the morning was amazing!
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is perfect for a couple for a few days in Prague. We arrived by train from Berlin and the main station was only a 3 minute walk from the hotel. Usually that means it’s far away from all the centrally located attractions, but the astronomical clock was also only 10 minutes walk away, along with the Charles bridge, etc. The hotel itself is beautiful, the rooms are great, the staff are helpful and polite, and the bed was the best hotel bed I’ve slept in years. The breakfast was also absolutely perfect- set in a beautiful dining room, champagne/Prosecco reception, usually a live pianist playing, and the food was very much up to scratch. They had a huge amount of staff serving so that the buffet was always fully serviced and nobody had to wait for anything. This hotel was an absolute 10/10, so I’ll give it 5/5!
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights. Everything about this hotel is brilliant. The location is perfect for exploring the city. The staff are all amazing, so friendly and helpful. Our bags were taken when we arrived and delivered to our room, the front desk booked taxis for our return to the airport, the concierge even posted a postcard for me. Breakfast was seriously yummy. The room was spotlessly clean and comfortable. I want one of the huge pillows! If I ever return to Prague, this is where I will stay!
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotelClose to everythingNice and clean Very serviceminded and helpfull staff Great selection for breakfastHuge disabel-roomsAlways clean and always refill at breakfastMinibarSafeTaxi-service to AirPort Can order massageCan reccomand
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Grandium Hotel is in a great area of the city. Five minutes walk from the airport express bus which drops you at the rear of the main train station. Just walk through the station out of the front entrance and you're nearly there. Also within easy walking distance of all main attractions, Old Town, Wenceslas Sq. etc.The hotel is kind of Tardis like - a small entrance, in keeping with the architecture of the area, but once inside it opens out to a really large reception .Check in was easy, all staff were very helpful and pleasant. The room was on the small side ,but perfectly fine , with mini bar and tea/coffee making facilities.Breakfast was included in the price - and it was pretty good with a wide choice of cereals, hot and cold buffet and drinks.We really enjoyed our stay in Prague and in this hotel. Would definitely return.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, located in the city centre - walking distance to the old town. The breakfast is very good, and in our room was very quiet. Friendly staff. There could have been more gluten free alternatives at the breakfast buffet, and there was only one elevator. Although, perfect for a weekend trip to Prague!
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Some aspects were really good, general service, breakfast, concierges. However rooms were odd shaped and quite small and the room service was not as good as it should have been.We asked for bed linen to be changed (due to coffee spillage) by leaving card on bed as instructed but then it wasn't done, the cleaning, tidying and restocking of items was not as good as expected - nothing major but not 5 star. Position was great, good and pleasant stay just let down by a few incidents.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very good. the whole staff was very friendly and we got a very good service. If we had a question we were helped immediately. The room was clean and taken care of. Dinner and buffet in the morning were also great.
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for a long weekend! We’ve had a fantastic stay. Hotel staff couldn’t do enough for you. And one of the cleanest hotels I’ve stayed in!The reception staff are extremely helpful, and will answer any questions. They ordered all of our taxis for us, the hotel taxi’s are very good value, better than getting on off the the street. We also recommend the airport transfer taxi the hotel offers, as it is great value.Prior to our visit I emailed the hotel a few times, and they would respond almost immediately, great communicators.Highly recommended!
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Terrible experience, my computer, headphones and some money were stolen from my room! I was organizing a conference at the hotel for more than 150 people... never before I have been robbed in a hotel. The Same day another guest was robbed too... so not an isolated case. Lets see how the hotel reacts in following days, still no apologies...
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is great...staff were friendly and professional , room was clean ,good variety of food in the buffet and the best of all the location.For people who look for halal food opposite the hotel there are couple of great halal food restaurantsHighly recommend
hotelName:
7    Grandium Prague
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our recent stay at the Arco guest house was superb. The rooms were cozy and we felt as if we were at home. The owners are so so kind and they explain you the most interesting things about the city. Besides, the location is very good (few minutes by tram to the city center). The breakfast is very good. They really take care of you. Our stay in Praga was awesome thanks to them!
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Luxembourgish -Turkish coupleThis place is literally idyllic. The decoration is unique, the room extremely comfortable and functional ( shout out to the snacks !). Our host were fully available to answer to our questions. Jan suggested us nice place for shopping out of the touristic-trap shops. Guenther is responsible of the fantastic breakfast and took the time to discuss with us about Prag history, literature, intellectual life and more... If you are looking for an authentic place far away from superficial artifice, you go book without hesitation.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was nice and totally quiet! The area is nice too, nearby there is a wonderful park, where you can rest.Günther, the owner, is a living history book, he knows everything about the town and is so friendly and kind!
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The ARCO Guesthouse was a fantastic place to stay for our four-night trip to Prague. The place is clean, quirky and well-appointed and its quiet location is within a short tramride of the city. The host, Guenther, is a mine of information about Prague and its history - and is happy to chat over an excellent continental breakfast in the ground floor space. We felt very welcome and will go back again the next time we are in Prague - four nights was nowhere near long enough!
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing people. A small and intimate place, really a B & B in Prague. Very quiet, clean, nice breakfast. Suitable for couplesGuenther and Yan, they were so warm, explained and recommended where to go and when, where to change the money, what transportation to get anywhere. They really made us want to come backThanks for all.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice first experience in Prague, Gunther is lovely, helping at maximum by giving all the non touristic tips you need to enjoy the quiet and charming Czech city. I particularly enjoyed the second hand decoration and the room is very all in one: we had a microwave, forks and knifes, a chopping board...Very interesting conversation with the owner who is always ready to help. Would definitely recommend!
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ... you have found the right place to stay -if you really want to experience the beautiful and mystical, full of cultural treasures- side of Prague. Located in the district of Vršovice you will not run into masses of tourists before you've even had coffee, but have some very nice breakfast (homemade jam, vegan options etc.) and get excellent tips on how to spend your day or have an interesting conversation with one of the hosts.The tram stop is 1 minute away and it will bring you right into the center within 15 minutes. Staying in the area is also a good idea, as there are lovely cafés, restaurants and parks around.The rooms are cozy, clean and also funny (you will see), the beds are big and comfortable. I've stayed for several months, so I know what I'm talking about when I say I've felt very much at home there.I cannot say enough good things about this place, so just find out for yourself!
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This guesthouse is homely with big rooms in a quiet neighbourhood. Nice breakfast. Walking distance from a tram station which takes you all the way to the castle. Guenter is a fantastic host who can help you discover all the hidden gems in this amazing city.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Host was very helpful, spoke many languages and gave us lots of tips where to go. Location was excellent and close to Krymska tram stop fifteen minutes from the main train station. Comfortable quiet rooms. Breakfast was very good.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is wonderful. Funky, local-feeling area out of the tourist chaos but a quick bus ride away with excellent restaurants and bars. The room we stayed in was huge and homy. Breakfast was an epic spread and the hosts were exceptionally kind and helpful.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay in the ARCO guesthouse was just wonderful! Our decision was made based on other reviews and also the pictures made the impression that it's like home. And it is! The rooms are cozy and we really liked the decorations. Guenther and co. are wonderful people and he really knows a lot (not just about Prague) so it's a pleasure to listen to him. The location is very nice, a little outside of the city center so it's not that loud, but the connections to the center are very good. We also love the fact that they recycle and make decorations out of plastic bottles etc. All the insider tips we got were also great and we met some awesome people there! Oh and the breakfast was, as everything else, great too. We especially loved the coffee :) We can only recommend it and will definitely return! :)
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I feel very lucky to have found this wonderful Guesthouse. It was perfect for my needs; a quiet location, comfortable room, excellent transport links and a superb host in the person of Guenther Krumpak. Guenther’s “Walking Seminar” was the highlight of my trip and added a whole new dimension to my understanding of Prague’s position both in geography and in history. I will happily recommend ARCO Guesthouse to my friends and look forward to returning soon, to explore this beautiful city further and to learn more from such an excellent and inspiring teacher.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really impressed with this place. Guenther is an amazing host. The room was spacious and clean. The location close to Krymska tram station on Line 22 makes travelling to Old Town and Prague Castle really easy. Neighbourhood felt safe even at night. Overall very happy
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have written a review before, though when visiting Prague, The Arco guest house really is the only place to stay for me. Again, such friendly staff that always make you feel welcome and nothing seems to be a problem. Full of information about the city and very knowledgeable. Very spacious and comfortable rooms with everything you need with very nice bathrooms too. Furthermore very clean and tidy. Very close to the city around 10-15 minutes walk and is situated in a very nice part of town. Breakfast is a mixture of items and is typically continental breakfast. Again, very highly recommended and very reasonably priced!
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a great stay at ARCO Guesthouse! The room was very cozy, clean and bright and silent as well. It is provided with everything that man can need- plenty of bath clothes, hairdryer, microwave, small fridge, tee, some utensils. Günther was very kind and could answer at whatever questions we had. The breakfast was good as well and he took care of our comfort absolutely! The location it out of the center but a tram which stops ext to the guesthouse can bring you in the center for 10 min. I would definitely recommend a stay at ARCO Guesthouse and hope to visit it again by myself one day. :)
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was the perfect accommodation for me. I was looking for an "economy class" place, clean, comfortable and in a reasonable distance from Praga POIS. I discovered plus an "Arts and Culture" place, with a lot of books, guides, maps, info etc (even umbrellas!!!), not only for Prague History/Architecture/Arts but furthermore for Czech and Europe. It was really awesome to discuss every morning at breakfast with Guenther about many things. I think he is the best by far to introduce you Prague (especially with his "walking seminars") and, though I spend 8 days in his pension, I feel it was too little to learn whatever I would.Pretty good and enough breakfast, with home made jams from Guenther's sister (credits) and some local products. And always with the really kind reminder from Guenther and Jan (his colleague) "if you need something else, feel free to express it"I estimate also the environmental sensitivities they run their pension.Really, very nice people with quality and many services they offering, without to press you. No matter for me some lack of maintenance in secondary parts of the building (corridor). It was a very positive experience, and I will be there in my next visits in Prague.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Arco Guesthouse for a month in November/December on our honeymoon and we LOVED it! We were constantly impressed by the hospitality and kindness of the hosts. They provided excellent advice/recommendations of sights to see, places to eat, and things to do! Every morning there was a delicious breakfast spread that is included in your stay, there is so much food it fills you up and leaves you happy! One of the hosts is always there during breakfast so if you ever have any questions or requests they are happy to help you and have interesting conversations with you. They keep the rooms very clean and would schedule times with us to come in and clean for us which was very nice! They also have laundry service on site, and kindly washed and dried our clothes as well as folded them. We would put the clothes out in the morning and they were often back by the evening! The location is also excellent, it is in walking distance of many grocery markets, restaurants, and a tram stop is just steps away. If you want a true cultural experience with amazing/knowledgeable/kind hosts then Arco Guesthouse is the best choice for your stay in Prague! We will be staying here again one day when we come back.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything about our stay was perfect. The room really an apartment was large and comfortable. The location ideal in a trendy but non touristy area. Most importantly Guenther the owner was beyond kind, helpful and incredibly knowledgeable. Our thanks for adding one more positive to visit to beautiful Prague.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed 3 nights in Arco and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Guenther was there to greet us, even though we arrived late in the evening. He had loads of helpful information to help us have a wonderful experience in Prague. Our room was well appointed including fridge and microwave. We especially enjoyed the mini bar and welcome pack on arrival, after travelling all day.The website gives a good honest indication of what to expect and we weren't disappointed. Everything was as expected and better.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed three nights at ARCO guesthouse in july. The rooms were nice and clean, the area very quiet. The host Guenther and Jan was very helpful with tips what to see, what to avoid and were to eat. The guesthouse was just a 10-15 min ride with tramp from the old town center. The breakfast had everything that we need. We will certainly stay at ARCO our next visit to Prague, good value for the money!!
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A perfect gem of a place to stay in Prague. It was easy to find and comfortable and cozy and clean. Guenther is a remarkable host. He knows so much about history and culture and the tour we took with him was fun and informative. Even my 13 year old enjoyed it. We felt like we were at home and enjoyed every minute of our stay. Would definitely stay here again if we return to Prague. Thanks for making our time in your lovely city so wonderful
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was there with my Dad for 2 days/nights. This is a simple, good and cozy place. The room was really good with a neat and clean toilet. The team was quite friendly and helpful.The best part is its's just about 3 min walk from Krymska, the nearest tram stop. This helped us a lot in the local commute. Tram No 22 takes one through the Old City and right through to the Royal Castle. The breakfast was quite good, given the fact we are vegetariansI would strongly recommend ARCO Guesthouse. It’s kind of a value for money place that is quite open and honest about being a Guesthouse and not a regular Hotel.Having strongly recommended, I feel there should be a caretaker 24x7....just in case there's some kind of emergency.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The honest website and Günther's friendly email were a good start. Excellent location, a lot of information on touristic and non-touristic things (what to see & where to eat, also in the neighbourhood) in which we weren't disappointed once, clean & tidy room and fair breakfast. Great choice for people not wanting to spend their days at the accommodation, but needing headquarters for their Prague adventures!
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our trip to Prague very much, but maybe it wouldn't be so good if we weren't staying at ARCO Guesthouse.The room #1 was quiet and cozy, the bed was comfortable and big enough, the breakfasts were delicious, the library (yes, there is quite a voluminous library that consists of a lot of books, guides and albums) was great and the hosts were really hospitable and friendly.I'd definitely recommend to stay here.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited this guest house for 3 nights in February 2017 and what a pleasurable experience I had. The staff are very welcoming. so friendly and it seemed there was nothing they could not do for me. I was simply amazed with the size of my room and the cleanliness with all the trimmings. The guest house is situated within walking distance of Prague centre and for such a nice place the cost of staying there does not break the bank and you get so much for it. I would recommend Arco guest house and I am so impressed I am going back to Prague in April 2017 and returning to Arco guest house.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nestled down an alley my friend and I shuffled in the snow to Arco Guesthouse. We knew we’d landed as there were the telltale plants hanging outside, which was one of the reasons I chose to stay here. I trust green fingered folks.Guenther was kind enough to meet us in the middle of the night and let us in. Our EasyJet flat meant we landed at an awkward unsociable hour after 10.30pm. The reception both from Guenther and the place was exactly as anticipated, warm, friendly and inviting. Guenther gave us a stack of leaflets, a Fodor’s Travel guidebook of Prague (more comprehensive than the one I bought – Lonely Planet Pocket Guide), picture book of the architecture in Prague; great information on Churches/the Castle etc. No one could say we were unprepared for Prague. We were armed and ready to…take photos and explore.We were given three keys to our access our room, the outdoor key, a key to get into the apartments and our flat key. It felt super safe.The room itself was clean, fresh and heated up when we arrived, with soft lighting. I could have easily moved in permanently! If you want to see Prague on a super tight budget, there’s a kitchenette that comes with fridge, sink, pots and pans and hot plate. There’s a little area for table and chairs, a desk, a library, free coffee and coffee making facilities. The beds were a dream to sleep on and we were nice and toasty in the night. The street is quiet and far out of reach from rowdy stag and hen dos. The only thing I had to contend with was my mate snoring like a bear!Wholesome breakfast consisted of bread, cheese, salami, tomatoes, cucumber, yummy biscuits, yoghurts, apples and coffee to die for!Jan and Guenther recommended some veggie restaurants which were delicious; Maitrea and Lehka Hlava. Krčma was another awesome suggestion for a local authentic Czech restaurant. Highly recommend.Please visit – it’s lovely. :)
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The people working in this place are making each stay a lovely and comfortable time. I have never met such helpful and open minded people. Rooms are cosy, there are towels and the staff u need,even a microwave oven ! Good location for both relax and see the town. Great pub in the neighbourhood.- Anita
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ahoi, we went in July 16 for a small Cachetrip to Prag. We highly recommend this clean, cheap, friendly, very good located and all so friendly place to stay.The room was big enough and was tiped with plenty information about Prag and surrounding. Even the clean bath had the nice wodden interior. Breakfast in the nice and cosi atmosphere, with selfmade marmelade and variety of bread (not only plain white). The way into the center is easy. Best you buy a ticket for several days.Günter and his friend Jan run this beautiful place with pure joy and you feel it. With his very charm from Austria Günter gives you, if you like, very detailed Information of his beloved city he stranded. It ranges from arcitectural to historical to cultural backround. Jan is also the creative part in the house. We loved his kind of decoration. He also gave us a warm welcome, thanx for that.Thank you guys for some really nice days from germanyIrene and Kay the geocachers
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arco Guesthouse is a wonderful pension in an emerging neighborhood, away from the throngs of tourists. It's well run, the owners are super flexible (as in, I arrived two days early and they were welcoming and fit me in... I stayed a month and took Guenther up on TWO personal tours of Prague. I can say: Guenter's tours are the only way to really understand Prague, get an insider's peek at hidden gems of the city, understand the complicated and interconnected history of Czech Republic, get an overview of the architecture, and enjoy the company of a charming and interesting local! (OK, he's from Vienna, but he's lived in Prague for a long time!).It's a great option for someone who wants to live (and know) like a local!
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ARCO guest house is a great place to stay in Prague. Nice, clean rooms, good location and most important ,very nice and helpfull owner who knows the history of the city and will guide You not only through the popular sites but direct You to not so known, yet worth visiting places. What is more he will tell You very interesting stories about these places. Tasty breakfasts.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were late getting to ARCO--delayed flight; late car from the airport. But Guenther was waiting for us, keeping the lights on, as welcoming as if he hadn't had to wait until midnight to welcome us. And that set the tone: the room was just what we needed (comfortable, clean, quiet); the location is perfect--outside the crush of Old Town, etc., but a very easy tram (#22) that goes all the way to the Castle)--when you stay there, make sure to explore the neighborhood, especially the vineyard park. Breakfast was lovely and enough to keep us going through our perambulations (great coffee!) and included the company of Guenther or Jan and as much (or as little) advice and direction as one could wish for. And, to cap it off, we asked Guenther for one of his tailored and reasonably priced walking tours--just the two of us with him for 7 hours and now I understand *so* much of Prague's history--political and cultural--as well as its geography. Finally, we feel like we made friends we want to visit again. If you don't require multi-star accomodations and don't have to be right in the center and *do* want to stay with hosts who are interested in you and are there to make your stay as interesting as can be, ARCO's the place.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A perfect place, nicely situated close to the tram 22, taking you to all the hightlights of Prague allthough the district ( Vrsovice ) is not a tourist hotspot ( which is nice in a way and well appreciated ). A good breakfast buffet is offered in the morning going with a friendly service and a fair chance to share your experiences of the beautiful city with other guests or get a lot of detailed " insider Information " from Guenther.Thanx a lot. Hope to be back soon.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We're not in need of four-star hotels. We are more interested in people and places. At the Arco, our room was quiet, clean, modern enough and the breakfast was great. The original, quirky lamps and decor are charming. Jan and Guenther were wonderful hosts, really hosts, who care about the city and their visitors. Full of good tips and advice, they were a great help for us in our three-day stay. We really made the most of our visit, not leastly because of the guided walk Guenther took us on, on our last afternoon. We highly recommend this Guest house to anyone interested in art, history, architecture or culture in general.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Warm welcome, we stayed 3 nights. Large clean and quiet room, including kitchenette.Break fast good,, service and ambiance very nice. The area of Donska is really nice with sympathic bars and restaurants and easy and quick public transport to city center by tram. We will for sure come back here during next visit of Prague!
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our experience living one month in ARCO Guesthouse was perfect. The room was big, quiet and if some of the you have an small kitchen for cooking. We used a lot! The owner Guenther is very kind and if you have question about Prague's life, different place outside of tourist tours or something related about the culture in Prague, Guenther will resolve your doubts and you will enjoy Prague much more :) We were with our dog and it's a place very very very pet friendly (like Praga). The Breakfast was very good and the Guesthouse is in one of the best part for live in Prague, not so far to the city center and you have some options of take public transport 2 minutes far from the place. Totally recommended.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it is well situated in an area with lots of cafes and bars, plus a beautiful park and vineyard around the corner. Room is clean with a fridge and kettle. Breakfast is delicious. Hosts are very knowledgeable about the area and places to visit.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While the hotel is situated in a not so picturesque area of Prague, though very convenient, inside it is friendly, bright comfortable and very secure. Guenther and Jan who run the hotel are two of the most genuine, friendly and welcoming chaps you could wish to meet, nothing is too much for them to do. There is 3 locked doors to get to your room, so very secure. Its clean and tidy, lots of info on things to do available, quirky décor and art with a lovely breakfast to boot. Would recommend to anyone especially though who enjoy culture and history. Excellent value for money!!!!
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 4 nights and really enjoyed our time! ARCO is a nice, quiet place with only a few rooms. Decent location, not too far from points of interest, a few cool restaurants close by as well.ARCO's greatest asset is Guenther! He is very helpful and kind. Use his knowledge of the city!!
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Guenther is an amazing host, friendly and helpful, and made us feel very much at home. His love for Prague and knowledge of the city's history and culture are impressive, which made everyday's breakfast extra-enjoyable as it felt like an interesting history learning series. Each morning I would ask him for advice on what to see, where to eat and how to travel to and from those places. He helped us plan our tours around Prague, taking into account the weather that day, what exhibitions we could be interested in, which museums were open and what concerts or jazz places we could go to see in the evening. Our first time visit to Prague was amazing largely because of his great recommendations on our areas of interest: art, history, culture, music and food. Many of these we would not have known of through typical touristic sight-seeing. I would recommend people to stay at ARCO because of Guenther, he makes your Prague visit a better experience :) Just as seen on the photos of ARCO Guesthouse, the breakfast included pretty much everything to make a great start of the day, ranging from meat, cheeses, bread, fruit, cereal, yogurt, juices to home made jams! Guenther offered coffee/tea too :) The room: We stayed at Guesthouse Room 3. It was a quiet room, the bed was comfortable and we had very good sleep. The kettle and microwaves in the room were convenient. Bathroom was clean, shower is good, although you have to buy shampoo and gel yourself. There is a tram 22 stop within 2 minutes walk from the guesthouse, this tram takes you to old town and the Prague castle too (most sight-seeing places within 30 minutes). Two convenience stores close by (where you can buy tram tickets too). We also enjoyed a nice cafe down the street and a lovely vegan restaurant (Plevel) around the area. At night it felt very safe too, nice and quiet. Airport travelling: from the airport to the guesthouse was a pretty straight forward combination of tram, metro and bus (although the metro's do not have lifts, which can be slightly problematic for carrying heavy luggages up and down), totaling about 1 hour of travel time.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a wonderful stay at ARCO guesthouse. Everything was exactly as described. Room was clean and was equipped with all amenities required. Location is just perfect with direct trams to the city center. Guenther was very helpful and kind. He even gave a small surprise as it was my birthday. The breakfast he laid out was awesome and he even arranged an early breakfast for us as we had to catch an early morning flight. Will definitely recommend this place.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable bed and clean room; accommodations with great amenities - hot water pot, microwave, small refrigerator, a few dishes, and a WIFI that worked! Guenther (the host) was the commensurate host offering assistance in a kind and effective way. Breakfast was a nice combination of meat, cheeses, bread, fruit, cereal, yogurt, juices and coffee/tea.Convenient to the city center and easy to get to and from the main train station via metro and tram.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While searching for a place to stay in Prague, the Czech Republic, we came across ARCO,it is located close to the tram and bus stop making it very easily accessible. It was within our budget and on reading the reviews and the description, what attracted us further was the information we could get on history & culture. ARCO accepted our reservation for 20th & 21st May, contact was established with Guenther. He is very prompt in responding and gives information on sights to see even in other cities,he guided us regarding intercity travel, very detailed guidelines on how to get to ARCO even suggesting sites we could look out for when travelling to ARCO. On our arrival, he was waiting outside the door of ARCO & had kept ready brochures & books on Prague for our reference. We booked half a day walking tour with him & my children found it most interesting & informative. He also buys tickets for local travel for guests if required and is always at hand in the morning to guide you about your travels during the day. He pays equal attention to all guests. We loved our stay in Prague mainly because of all the guidance he gave us.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gunther the host was very friendly and welcoming, he has a wide knowledge of Prague history. Although just out of town in Donska the number 22 tram stops100yds from the Arco, it takes you through the new/old town all the way to Prague castle. We would definitely stay at the Arco again.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are not searching for a luxury place, that pension is definitely a very good solution. Prices are raisonnables, breakfast is good and the room confortable. Free wi-fi. Not far from Namesti Miru metro station, you can be there in 7 minuts walking, or in 30 minuts to the old town. A special thanx for Mr Guenther allways kind and helpfull for the guests.
hotelName:
8    ARCO Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
