What can I say... go there when you are in Prague next time. We, as a family, were very pleased to find this place.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Herrmes has a great location, 2 minutes from closest metro station( Janonice). Direct connection from Florence train station where our bus landed.However the hotel is a bit hidden behind the greenery, and we would never have found it in the dark had the staff not come to show us the way- the hotel should put up a sign board facing the station!The staff was wonderful, very helpful and courteous. They didn't have tea/ coffee kettles during our stay but offered to make our tea and heat our food in their microwave oven, any time of the night or day. We also used the hotel to exchange our Euros- I only wish they had also agreed to buy back our Czec Kroners!Wi fi was a bit weak, phone didn't catch signal in the room. We had to come close to the reception for using wifi on the phone every time, which was not very convenient.Breakfast was decent and served in a very pleasant, green ambience , but there was no variety from day to day, not even eggs made to order.Over all a very pleasant stay. Would definitely recommend to family and friends visiting Prague
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've spent a week in this hotel with my wife.Everything was great and we were absolutely satisfied!It is a new and modern hotel with great and helpful staff.Rooms are very clean, housekeeping service is great, breakfasts are good, parking places are in the inner court!The hotel is situated in a quiet and very convenient place, it's just in 1 minute walking to the metro station and 10 minutes to the city centre by metro.When I visit Prague in the future I will stay in Herrmes with great pleasure!Thanks!
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have spent 2 nights in this hotel. Rooms and hotel in general is nicely furnished and kept clean. Parking in hotels back yard with cctv is a welcomed extra - included in price of the room. Generous choice in brakfast bufet is also a nice touch that is not always the case. All in all this hotel provides nice experience with maybe a bit sterile atmosphere. Downside is definetly WiFi connection that kept playing up and the WiFi signal was not great in the room. On the other hand, weaknesses of this hotel were compensated by their receptioniost Klaudia, who put an extraordinary effort in looking after me and my colleagues. With smile on her face and always ready to get out of her way to make our stay as comfortable as possible. With an important business meeting ahead of us she made sure we have every support for our preparation from beverages to technical assistance. This hotel is nice, but if there is a reason to recommend this place, it would be the service we received from Klaudia
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is near Jinonice metro station and it`s easy to reach by car or from airport or railway station. Also, from Jinonice station you can get to Old Town in 10 minutes. Hotel is modern and have all necessary amenities. Rooms are spacious and clean, simply designed. Partially covered parking in the secured hotel courtyard is free of charge. Hotel staff are helpful and professional, so I would love to come again.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is located next to the metro station so you can get to the city centre in 10 minutes...Friendly and helpfull staff, clean rooms, great breakfast buffet...If you are looking for a clean and quiet place to stay this is a great choice with good price.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 5 nights, from 28th December 2015 to 2nd January and we can say that it was a very pleasant experience. The hotel is very clean with good services, very close to subway station - only 20 minutes from center of the city. The room is quite and breakfast was also good. The staff was very friendly and helped us with many information. Also we had free wifi and free parking. The only thing that we can recommend is a fridge in the room.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff is lovely and helpful. The hotel is super close to the Jinonice metro station which is very convenient. The location is quiet, which is nice and much needed after spending hours in the busy city centre. Breakfast is lovely as well, plenty of choice, all very tasty and fresh. Overall - highly recommend! Minor issues, however, this is why I did not give the hotel 5 stars. Things for the hotel to consider: -there are no kettles in the rooms. I can live without a free coffee, not a problem, but no hot water in winter months is inconvenient-the blinds are very thin - not for people who are used to sleeping in the darkness. Fine with me, but not for everyone.-no additional pillows in the rooms - I find this unusual, I've always had extra pillows in 3* hotels around the world -restaurant - there is no space for dirty dishes. Tables are not big enough to store them if someone uses more than one plate or e.g.: has cereals and then a sandwich. It would be useful to have a table on the side to enable your guests to remove them or alternatively have waiters who remove them.- it gets too hot in the rooms. We had a radiator off and kept the window was open regularly too and despite that it was hot in the room all the time. Not sure how this is possible. It's great that the hotel is warm in winter, but too warm is no longer pleasant. I don't want this to come across as picky or demanding, I just think these are simple and cheap improvements you could introduce for your guests. Otherwise - brilliant place and service, I would stay again.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have chosen that hotel because of the workshop which took place in the hotel´s vicinity premises (Butovice business center).Pros- solid, frequently replenished breakfast- easy accesibility by public transport from the Main train station, Jinonicka subway station is located just 2 minutes walk from the hotel- easy accesibility by car, especially if you are arriving from Pilsen highway - nice, fresh design of the hotel- faultless staff- quit, efficient air con- free bottle of water on arrivalCons- new, fresh design with lot of glass and stones, spreads sound quite a lot. - allow approx. 20 minutes by subway for Prague sightseeing- I came at 9 PM, the access road to hotel was badly lit (perhaps some breakdown)In a nutshell, i would choose that hotel again, if i need short stay in that part of Prague.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: PROS:-good location close to underground-free parking-nice and modern rooms-friendly and helpful staffCONS-no window blinds, if you are used to sleep in the dark this hotel is not the best choice- only wired internet connection in the room (wifi in the lounge)
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location near metro station. Wide rooms with good bathroom (shower). Free parking. Good enough breakfast. Room 209 - Wi-Fi OK. Quite hotel with friendly people from reception. Suitable for business travelers.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Plus: - Location.Hotel is very close to metro- B line- and is better to buy the metro tickets for one journey from the reception it will cost you 27 CZK. This type of ticket you can use them also for tram and buses as well. - Free parking space - Clean hotel - Friendly staff,with one exception.The last day of our staying when we had to pay ,the blond lady from the reception had no manners.She was very irritated and very unprofessional and for this type of person I have a suggestion: Please don't work in the hospitality industry ,were you have to work with PEOPLE, just go and work in a factory or stay home.Minus: - breakfast should be more varied - wi-fi does not work in rooms (in 202 and 203)
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel has a good location (close to a metro stop and night bus).Separate (guarded) parking spot, clean rooms, friendly staff, hotel bar with affordable prices and a decent breakfast. Also the boxspring bed was very nice.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the Herrmes hotel for 4 nights and had a great stay! The staff was more than friendly, the room was very clean and the breakfast was good. Since parking is free of charge and the hotel is literally around the corner from the metro station, it is a great place to stay during a visit of Prague! We would definitly recommend Herrmes!
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the hotel from October to December 2014 with breaks. Very good location, close to Metro Station, safe parking lot behind the fence, modern and clean rooms, good service and continental breakfast. Very helpful receptionists. I can only recommend while in Prague.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay. Staff very kindle and helpfull, breakfast very good, room confortable and clean. Good location. Metro station is only at 2 minutes walk away. Reception give us you any information and request.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was a good deal! It has a closed park place 24h observed by video cameras. Nothing really to complain for the price. Notice that in the room internet is only by cable. Breakfast was eveyday identical, but more than enough for a good start into a new day. I recommend this place!
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very close to the metro station ( 2 min walk ) , good accommodation , neat rooms , clean bathroom , tasty breakfast included , friendly service , i guess that herrmes is one of the best hotels in affordable price , what else do You need - I will be back 4 sure !!! :)
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very convenient location, very friendly staff, we stayed there for 3 nights, excellent breakfast, very secure car parking, free wifi, close to the metro station, quite rooms, air conditioned, we will defiantly will come back
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights.Its very modern, and fresh with a great reception team.The room itself was nice clean with everything I needed for the trip.I went to prague on a leisure holiday and this hotel was great because it wasnt in the centre but it wasnt far from the metro stop. It took me 1 minute to walk to the metro stop and trains were every 5-7 minutes. It takes around 15-20 minutes to get to the old town.Breakfast was great, Alot of choice and alot of seating area.If I return to prague I will return to this hotel. I paid £50 per night for 2 people inc breakfast
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here in early May for two nights, with my clients- We had booked three double rooms.The positives - the place is very new with a modern decor. The rooms are clean. There is plenty of secure parking for guests. The breakfast is very basic, but hearty.Unlike some other reviewers, we had very cooperative staff - they helped us with maps, made a few calls for us (to inquire about parking situation in the city) and so on. But again, service depends on who is across the counter, and maybe we were lucky to have very helpful staff.The downside - Location! This place is quite far from the city. We explored the option of taking public transport, but quickly gave up and drove instead and parked in a city garage. if there are senior citizens or children in the group, I would not recommend this place. The other drawback because of the location is that there are no restaurants in the vicinity and the hotel does not have one either. So make sure you have your dinner outside before heading back to the hotel, or be ready to drive a few kilometers (again toward the city) for dinner.Also, approaching the hotel from the city side, our GPS always got confused in the last half a kilometer (maybe because some of the new roads are not mapped). Approaching it from Plzen side (where we came in from), there was no problem. Something to keep in mind.So, on the whole a nice place to stay if you have a car and if you are okay driving into Prague each day and parking somewhere close to city centre.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was given a plastic key card which didn't work and had to be recharged several times. On the last day the card snapped in half. I was not allowed into my room until I paid 70 CZK to replace the card. It's an example of poor customer service and ridiculous policy. You get one towel daily, the thinnest I have ever seen.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel very close to the underground station.It's not in the city centre but is reachable in 10 minutesI Suggest for all people, which want an comfortable , clean and nice room for reasonable price.The Staff is very helpful. We get a right information for the night club, with voucher for free drink.Inside the hotel is safety parking place on request.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Plenty written about the excellent value of this place elsewhere.This is a great hotel for business in Prague, good connections to the centre and yet perfect for the airport, easy access by car and secure parking. It is also in an area popular with expats for similar reasons.For the tourist I would recommend it as well. A cheap ticket gets you quickly from the airport (bus 100 to ZLIČÍN then 6 stops on metro) and its quick by Metro into town or for those in the know down to Smíchov for local life.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I went on a business trip to Prague and had no idea where to stay. I checked Trip Advisor and after looking at a number of properties, I selected Hotel Herrmes. When the cab brought me from the airport to the hotel, I started thinking, "What in the heck have I done." We seemed to be in an industrial area and we definitely weren't in the town center. Once I was dropped off, the hotel looked new and almost out of place for the neighborhood. The staff was very pleasant. One of the first things I noticed as I checked was an award from Trip Advisor for one of the best budget hotels in Prague. It definitely was. The room and bed were comfortable and the complementary breakfast was excellent. Great value! Yes, it was a distance from the city center but there is a metro (subway) station literally 300 yards from the hotel. Four to five stops and you are in Prague center. I would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the hotel for 2 nights. Staff is very friendly and helpfull, we got all needed information about the city. It's guite far away from the centrum BUT! there is really near a metro, so about 10 minutes and you're visiting the centrum. Breakfest very good, lots of food to choose. Hotel very clean and calm. Just one minus... you can't eat there a supper, so better to eat something outside.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is not in Prague center but very convenient to get there from the Metro station which is a short walk away. We parked our car in the free secure parking area and didn't use it till the day we left.....the all day Metro pass was well worth the price. The complimentary breakfast was quite good and the room was well furnished. Although the hotel had free wifi in the lobby, the rooms had a wired cable which didn't fit into our Mac so that was a bit inconvenient. Overall a very pleasant stay and would definitely stay here again !
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 1 night. Very nice, clean, staff very friendly and helpful. Secured parking, some places covered. Quiet location, close to metro (2 min). Beds are little bit soft, but ok. Breakfast tasty. Will stay here again.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed one night in this hotel during a business trip. My trip took longer and I needed to stay one more night - unfortunately the hotel was already fully booked otherwise I would go back there. The hotel is new, very clean, all people I met at the reception were friendly and helpful. Did not use the secure parking at rear as there were parking places on the street also secured by a camera. Room was of decent size, bathroom great, however the beds were extremely soft. In the room there is only wired interned, wi-fi should be available in the lobby (did not use it). However the speed of the wired interned was quite slow. Good breakfast. Although I did not use it the hotel is literally next to a metro station (3 min. walk max) so it is convenient. On the other hand it faces either a busy street (especially in the morning) or the abandoned industrial building with a railway track that is still operating. I was waken twice at night by a really loud shunting train.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I wanted to take a 3 day trip to Prague, traveling by car. We picked this hotel because of the secure and covered parking. The metro stop was only a 2 minute walk from the front door of the hotel. We bought metro tickets at the hotel and after a short 10 metro ride we were in the heart of Prague. The hotel was very clean, quiet and comfortable. The beds were very soft, but it didn't bother me. Breakfast, from 7 to 10, was well stocked and tasty. I would definitely stay at Hotel Herrmes again.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel looks like its brand new, very modern and stylish. The free and secured car park is perfect. It even has a roof. Staff is very nice. The mark for you the best spots to visit on a city map and sell you the subway tickets. The quick ride with the subway is really the best option to explore the city. It's literally 1 minute walk from the hotel and very nice and clean. Breakfast is also quite decent and very large selection for the price. The only thing to consider is that you occasionally hear the airplanes in the morning and evening which can be quite loud for a minute there. Didn't bother me. Also worth noting is that the rooms only have wired internet. It's free and the cable is provided, but if you want to surf via tablet or mobile phone you have to come to the lobby to use the free wifi there. There are plenty of comfy couches and a TV so many guests hang out here to check their mails. All in all a top hotel. Next time I'm in Prague I'll stay here again.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for five nights in July. It is a great smaller hotel away from the hustle and bustle of the city center. Rooms are comfy and not overly decorated. The staff is helpful and always available. The train stop is only about five minutes away. The breakfast is from 7 to 10 am and has good options. Only con is no peep hole on the door but that's a small thing. Ask for a room on the 2 or 3 floor and away from the street.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have already left this hotel after 3 nights stay, the hotel location is perfect only 1 min far from metro and there is no bothering sound from streets as hotel is located in a quiet place. AC is working properly and hotel service is excellent.Briefly; Hotel Herrmes is a complete choice for staying in prague.
hotelName:
11    Herrmes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here twice with a company and never regretted. It's a quiet and comfortable hotel near the center with all necessary facilities: what I liked most is a small kitchen in the suite, very handy if you're not travelling alone and saves money. Breakfasts were fine and the room was made up every day. A good choice even for a picky one!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it's a good hotel. i'll recommend it, it's not that far away from the city centre and there is a very beautiful park near that i've visisted and it's very pretty and quiet. the food is not the best but it's ok.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic customer service at this hotel,the management were extremely helpful throughout our stay, if your looking for a standard hotel then this is the place to stay, very cheap and not far from the centre of everything.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this hotel is great as it is off the beaten path yet still close to everything. The rooms are clean and spacious, and have a kitchenette built in for a longer stay. For what you pay, it is a good value. Breakfast is generous and convenient. The only issue I had was payment, as I had prepaid online for my stay and the person at the service desk could not locate the proof of payment. This unfortunately delayed my plans for the day and I ended up missing part of a tour I had booked, spending extra money to book a taxi and make phone calls so I could reach my group. I do not mention this to complain as we eventually got it sorted (I persisted and proof of payment was indeed found), but rather as a reminder to be vigilant and make sure you have all your ducks in a row before you go and to double check all plans the day before so your schedule is not interrupted.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quiet hotel for the location, convenient to walk to “must see” parts of Prague. Excellent breakfast. Full time staff is friendly and attentive. Small room air conditioners would be a great improvement. WILL COME BACK AGAIN.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The breakfast could have been better. The location was the best, right next to the city. The room was bing enough, with comfortable furnitures. But in the end Everything was great and we enjoyed our stay.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the Mala Strana last week, it was only for one night but I found the hotel to be brilliant value for money. Located in a nice part of town just south of Charles Bridge (10 min walk) it’s off the main road and very quiet. Lovely staff who were very friendly at check in and very helpful again at check out. Breakfast is ample and exactly what I’d expect for this price range. Lots of choice and I found it all to be of a good standard. The room was very clean and had everything you could need. Location wise it’s a short walk to all the popular destinations in Prague but allows you to just be out of the centre of it all if you want a quieter location. I look forward to coming back in the future. Thank you.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just booked this hotel for a one night stay, it's VERY basic, but clean. The mattress was very thin so it was hard to get to sleep plus we were in a room facing the street so there was noise from the road. The bathroom is fine but the shower head went crazy and sprayed water everywhere and I mean everywhere! There was no English language channels on the TV, that we could find.Breakfast was very basic and not very appealing.. Even though it was cheap you can, for a couple of euro extra, get better options in Prague..
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small three star hotel. Meet this level. One lift that is really slow. The breakfast buffet is small and the food is the same every morning. No fresh fruit. The stomach gets full. Staff friendly. No TV channel list found. There is a safe in the room for a deposit. Location excellent, tram stop a few meters away. Despite the shortcomings, I could stay overnight again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in late May 2019. Staff was friendly, decent sized breakfast. The size of the room was fantastic for what we paid. The only thing was the walls were filthy! There was a big black mark at the head of the spare bed on the wall. There were cracks in the bathtub and also the bathtub is shaped weird and a little too high off the ground to be safe. Walking distance to everything was optimal. I think i would stay here again if they updated a little.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel. Great service. Clean rooms. Friendly staff. Walkable distance to major tourist sites. Great breakfast. Was lucky that I chose this hotel. Will stay in this hotel again if I visit Prague again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was perfect for our few days in Prague! They were very accommodating and welcoming. The rooms were a great size and clean. Ours even had a little kitchenette which was a pleasant surprise. The breakfast was very decent...several interesting hot choices and also some cold stuff and some breads/cakes, coffees, teas and juices with some slight variety from day to day. But the pictures of the breakfast online are a tad misleading...we were a little disappointed to find it wasn’t quite as extensive as we expected. But was still good! I gave 4 out of 5 for that reason and because there’s no shelf or anything in the shower to put any soaps or toiletries! Otherwise a great stay! And the area is nice and quiet, away from all the tourists but very close to the tram stops and even a couple of markets.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable accommodations, friendly and helpful staff, the hotel is within walking distance from everything of interest in Prague. Parking was not a problem either. Breakfast all fresh and good variety
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed about a week to see Prague and this was perfect. We walked everywhere and this place was so convenient to sites, restaurants, trams, commercial areas. And our room was very quiet. A small apartment where we could have cooked. Adequate breakfast. Fabulous Wi-Fi. Friendly and reliably helpful staff.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Delicious breakfast（with soup, egg, salad, bread, pudding, all drinks). Nice location (near by tram-2 min and brige) Clean and big room with bad, kitchen, dining table, and sofa. Nice front desk service.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the location close to old town and close to public transportation. Room was nice, clean and quiet. Breakfast was tasty and well balanced. Had some trouble with hairdryer (overheated after 2 min). Otherwise I had a great time and the great service.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Handy for the Funicular and Petrin Hill. Excellent newly opened craft beer bar in the next street, All sights within reasonable walking distance.Hotel provided an adequate breakfast. Room was clean and bed was comfortable. Shower was powerful.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Mala Strana is the only place I want to stay in Prague. I've stayed here many times over the last 15 years, sometimes once, but often twice a year. The location is perfect, central, but in a quiet, peaceful road - it's close to all of the main sights Prague has to offer, which are easily walkable from the hotel. Located on the Historic Mala Strana side of the river. If you need public transport, there's a tram stop at the end of the road which will give you access to Prague's excellent public transport system.The rooms are a good size, very comfortable and most importantly, they're spotlessly clean. The beds are very comfortable, which combined with the quiet location means I never have trouble getting a good night's sleep. The building is quite old, and retains many of it's interesting, original features. In recent years, it has been sympathetically refurbished to provide modern facilities - but it hasn't lost any of it's charm. The décor is tasteful and suits the building. There's a lift to all floors.One of the most important features of any hotel stay is the breakfast, and breakfasts here won't disappoint. There is a huge variety of hot and cold foods to suit all tastes from the buffet, whether you want continental or something hot. Too many choices to list here, all I need to say is that a Hotel Mala Strana breakfast really sets you up for the day. I often skip lunch!I can't fault Hotel Mala Strana and have been very happy during my visits here over the years. Everyone who works here, whether management, restaurant staff, receptionists or housekeeping really puts a lot of effort into making everyone's stay an enjoyable and pleasurable one. It is credit to them that the hotel is so good - and also means that I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in Prague. Already stayed here this year, and it won't be long before I'm making a reservation for my next visit. Can't wait!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can recommend this hotel.It's value for the money.I didn't try the breakfast, but all in all they helped me out with all I needed.I travelled alone with my dog, so it was a different experience .But this will suits for the small families but also if you looking for a quiet place nearby Centrum.Travel alone or you look for a romantic holiday, it will be in safe hands of all the staff inside Mala Strana.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 days Feb 14-16 with my cousins and the hotel did not disappoint. Eva, the front office staff was very helpful and friendly. She helped us plan our tour and booked our tour tickets. The buffet breakfast is ok. The location is strategic, very near the Church of the Our Lady of Victorious and Infant Jesus of Prague. Also around 20 mins walk to the Old Town.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Walking distance from the castle and the centre of town; safe attractive neighborhood with lots of restaurants and stores.Rooms were large and clean; modern bathroom; kitchenette and sitting area.Breakfast buffet was solid but uninspiring; breakfast room was depressing and music was loud and irritating.Elevator, California room, stone stairs, wrought iron balustrade, wooden doors to balcony on every floor [for smokers].Receptionists friendly and helpful. WiFi.Cons: Bare floors and thin walls made the room noisy if you had inconsiderate neighbors [ we did].Only local channels on TV and no newspapers.Charming hotel due to age but also few upgrades so is tired and somewhat depressing.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was great pleasure to stay at hotel Mala Strana. Excellent location, friendly stuff, cosy apartments and delicious breafast all this factors made our trip memorable. Hope to return to this hotel soon!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly people. Rooms are quiet, and nice. Breakfast was good, but I didn’t liked the breakfast-room, it was in the basement. From the Hotel you can go every where. Around 30 min walk to the train station, and the other attractions. Around the corner there is also a very good restaurant.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic location in the quiet district of Mala Strana in Prague and is within a short walking distance of the old and new town. Rooms are spacious, clean and have everything you require for a short stay in the city. Breakfast offers a wide range of options (Both hot and cold) and staff are all very friendly and helpful if you require anything.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in a central position. Trams and buses are easily accessible and people who enjoy walking can see all the main sights comfortably by foot.The staff was incredibly warm and friendly.The room was a bit outdated and so probably seemed slightly unclean. It was perfectly acceptable for the price and location, however. The pros far outweighed the cons.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved everything about this hotel . It is in a perfect location to visit anywhere in Prague . 5 mns walk from the metro Uzejd if you do not want to walk . Feel very safe ,has mini markets nearby and a Tesco . The studio is spacious enough with its own sitting area, kitchenette (very handy) and TV and sofa . The bathroom and wardrobe are in a separated area from the room which means you do not hear other guests at all . It is not a mainstream modern hotel and it has a retro feel to it that is lovely but do not expect the latest furnishing . It is very clean and everyone from the receptionists to the ladies serving breakfast to the housekeeping ladies were extra helpful. Fantastic and varied breakfast . Used the public transport (bus+metro+tram ) for the transfer Airport /Hotel . It sounds like a real hassle but everything is connected and we hopped from one transport to the next very quickly . We bought a 90mns transport ticket at the airport and it costs 32CZ ( around 1.50£)
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Short trip to meet with family. Rooms nice and big with all you would need in a great location with good transport links and with walking distance of all the main sites. Breakfast was good and the buffet refilled on a regular basis.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really it's very good service, the people are very polite and friendly, the breakfast is lot and very tasty, and it's near to the tranvia station and the center city, I recommend it totally, we were very happy and confortable
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spend there only one night with friends but the hotel was great located for sightseeing, only a couple of walking minutes to the Old Town and Charles Bridge. The room was a bit small for three people, but still cosy, furnished in vintage style.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a room with small kitchen and seating area. A great place to sit and have a cup of tea after a long day of walking. The staff was great and very helpful. Breakfast was the standard continental break, but with scrambled eggs and hard boiled eggs. There were plenty of items to choose from. Loved our room. Location is perfect. They recommend Meduzzy Restaurant on the corner and the food was great. Can’t go wrong here
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After using the card to open your room door, there is nothing modern or functional inside. The hair dryer only works for about twenty seconds at a time, The room layout is clumsy, with the bathroom door opening into the path of everything. There is no air conditioning, and no screens on the windows, so good luck in the spring. Heating is by radiator, so there wont be much control of it in winter. The website didn’t mention the fridge, and although it is very small, it is useful. I didn’t understand the kettle and plates, as there is no microwave or other way to heat food. The bathroom fan sounds like its a jet engine reving to take off. The squeak in the door is fodder for a horror movie. The stairs are in desperate need of cleaning. Breakfast isn’t until 7:30, The room safe uses a medieval warded key, for which there is a 500 kc deposit. The safe is too small for a laptop, but does fit a tablet.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The hotel overall was very clean and had msny charming original features. It was a 10 min walk to the funicular, 15 min to Prague Castle, 10 min walk to Charles Bridge and 15 min walk to Old Town. We walked everywhere and didn't need to use trams. There are numerous restaurants near to the hotel, our favourite was The Olympia just as you come off the bridge, a buzzing atmosphere and good food. The breakfast at the hotel was very good with plenty of choice, I particularly enjpyed the frenc toast. This is a reasonably priced hotel near to all the sights in Prague. I would highly recommend it.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There was a small kitchenette provided though I didn't use it. Also a small fridge provided. The room was large with plenty of space. Good central location on tram route. Good breakfast with various choices.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly and professional Staff , good Breakfast , clean big Rooms and an excellent Location.I certainly when in Prague I would stay there again and certainly will recommend it to Friends and Family. It was a very good stay
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located at a walking distance from most of the historical sights and very close to Ujezd tram stop, for those who do not want to walk. The funicular train stop to Petrin Hill is also located at Ujezd, (on the hill opposite the stop).The staff was friendly and very helpful. City Tour packages as well tickets to Hop on Hop off buses can be procured from the front desk. Breakfast was superb, with a varied choice of items.Our one bedroom apartment was spacious, and we had a cosy dining area with a little kitchenette equipped with electric hotplate, mini fridge, sink and electric kettle. Crockery and cutlery were also provided so we could eat in the room but no pans or utensils to warm food on the hotplate. We found the beds to be very comfortable and rooms were cleaned daily. The room however gets hot, especially since it was peak summer and the table fans provided were not sufficient for cooling. While I understand they cannot install ACs due to UNESCO regulations, providing ceiling fans, larger pedestal fans or room coolers would have been more helpful, especially in summer. Toilets were clean and hot and cold water was perfect. Plenty of towels were provided and changed regularly, but no other toiletries except for liquid soap. Despite the minor inconveniences, I would highly recommend the hotel for and would love to visit again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are so glad we were in Mala Strana while our trip to Europe. When the hotel staff learned we are pure vegetarians, they took the efforts to specially prepare fresh morning veg breakfast (without eggs) for all three days of our stay. A BIG THANK YOU to you guys for serving us exceptionally. Also the receptionist Kimo was very helpful in providing us with the information of the city whereabouts. We feel lucky to have stayed at your hotel. Keep up the good work!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Service is excellent special mention to Ismeal whom assisted me with all my questions, on public transport and tours and in addition allowed me a 2 hour early check which means alot for tired travellers. Good location, can walk to old town or catch tram number 9 very easy to get around in Prague, cafes and restaurants close by at reasonable prices. Hotel is comfortable clean and neat rooms stayed in studio.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is in a central location but 10 minutes to historical center... 2 minutes to tram station... old building and not renovated... very helpful and friendly staff... check in and check out was easy and fast... rooms were clean and quiet... with a kitchenette... NOT air-conditioned and only with a fan... NO shampoo or conditioner or slippers... breakfast was limited but delicious and well organized...
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: PROS:-20 min walk from tourist attractions-Safe location-Clean bathrooms-Breakfast available-Helpful staffCONS:-Extremely old apartment building converted to a hotel needing many updates-Old basic furniture - furnished like a dorm in a poor college / or an old "Motel 6". Bed was hard as a rock.-No AC or Fan-No amenities like pool, gym or sauna
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here with family. Overall our stay was superb. Front desk person was very cooperative and helpful. We opted for Single room studio apartments. Rooms are large and clean with all modern options. There was a small kitchen which was most convenient. Breakfast has so many choices and the staff were always in a greeting mood with sweet smile. People will feel the warmth.Only our corridor was dark due to light failure which took 2-3 days for them to repair, I expect this delay was not intentional and not regular The nearest tram stop is just around 180-meter walk which will take you to all major attractions within 10-15 min. People can walk also if they have the time and energy. Number of food shops and supermarkets are nearby to fulfill the regular needs.The hotel place is centrally located yet just bit away from the hassles and bustles of city. There was a park nearby which is indeed a very pleasant time to sit and relax by end of the day. Just opposite to the hotel there is tram ticket vending machine. We won’t mind coming back here again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Mala Strana isn't the most modern hotel but it's comfortable, very reasonable, and the staff are really friendly and helpful. Plenty on offer from the breakfast buffet and the area has plenty of cheap but great places to eat and drink. A very short walk from the centre but far enough out to be away from the tourist buzz if wanted.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: staff were friendly. Rooms were clean and warn enough. Rooms were quite large. Breakfast was not rich but okay. A little further from the centre. Easy to reach from the airport. Close to tram. I Recommend the hotel.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location and great hotel. It's at a walking distance from the old city centre and the castle so we basically didn't need to use public transportation. The room was big, we had an entrance hall and a sofa and clean. They were cleaning it every day and changing the towels when needed. The bathroom was fine. They have a hair dryer that was working well (normally the ones at hotels have very little power) and the water pressure of the shower was excellent! The breakfast was tasty and it had a variety and the staff was always smiling and helpful. They also sell public transportation tickets without overcharging so I suggest to buy it from there since they don't sell them on the buses. I recommend it.On the bad side we asked for a double bed and we were given a room with two single ones which had wheels so even if they were put together by the staff during night they were drawn apart creating space between the beds. Also the pillows were extremely soft and it could use a renovation.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we stayed 4 nights between Christmas and new year, i arrived at the hotel about 11am and was able to check in then which was great as the normal time should be 2pm.the hotel was nice and clean,there was a small area in the reception to wait on the taxi pick up and there was also a lounge area to sit, the rooms were of a good size, there was twin beds and also a couch there was a small table to sit at if you wanted a snack in the room, there was also a kitchen that had sliding doors so you can hide the kitchen out of site. the maids were in every day to clean,the wifi was really good in all areas, it was fast enough to stream videos. the location wasn't too bad only a few minutes to the funicular railway to take you to the petrin tower, the Charles bridge was about a 10-15 minute walk away, if you went out the hotel and turned right you river is only a few minutes walk away, there are a lot of restaurants and supermarkets near the hotel.it is a good base if you dont mind a bit of walking to get to the main tourist sites
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for the fifth time with 4 friends. The location is great just a couple of tram stops from the centre or a 10 minute walk over the river. Rooms are comfortable and well equipped, if a little tired. Wi-Fi is excellent in the rooms. The breakfasts are tasty, plentiful and have a large choice of warm and cold items. The 2 best things are the value for money and the friendliness of the staff (this time the kitchen staff were particularly friendly and helpful). The blip - on our third morning the 6 of us were going back to our rooms in the lift when it broke down. An engineer was called and we were rescued within 30 minutes. This I can totally accept, accidents can happen. What was not acceptable was the reaction of the management/staff at that particular time. It took over 5 minutes of ringing the alarm for anyone to try to speak to us. The only question was how many people were in the lift, there were 6 of us and the response was that there should only be 4 of us max. Before, during and after the incident the plaque in the lift states maximum 6 persons! When freed there was no member of staff around to apologies or the check everyone was OK. It was like the incident never happened, it was never mentioned over our last 2 days.This one incident does not detract from the quality and value of the hotel and we will definitely stay here again when next in Prague.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel located in Malastrana. Big room for 4 people with large bathroom. Clean and warm. Good continental breakfast with cakes, bread, eggs, cheese, and much more...Staff polite and kind. My best reward to EVA.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the hotel! We stayed here in February 2016, actually, but as I didn't leave any review then, I'll do so now. Great rooms, fully renovated. Older building, but is completely renovated, which only adds to the city's charm! So close to the historic city centre and Charles' Bridge! Breakfast was always nice! The room was very clean! Great place as a hub for visiting Prague!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely little hotel with kind and caring staff. The room was a good size for 2 and the furnishing was good. There is no air-con and the street noise is just about bearable so the summer months may mean you look elsewhere. Breakfast was good
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel lovely and clean, daily maid service and fresh towels. Spacious room, we had a kitchenette, which was really useful. Bed was super comfortable. Hotel staff helpful and friendly. Hot and cold breakfast buffet was great. Quiet location, but just 10 mins walk to old town etc and trams just around the corner. Close to restaurants and a couple of supermarkets. The only minus was lack of air conditioning, though not a problem when we stayed in May. Free wifi in rooms a bonus.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with a few friends, after visiting he city for a few nights. The hotel is situated a 10 minute walk from Wencelas square and so is ideal to retreat from the hustle and bustle of the city. We had a slight issue with the electricity on arrival, but that was resolved soon enough and 2 bottles of complimentary water greeted me and room mate. Thr hotel is very clean and the beds comfortable. The rooms do have a fridge and small, concealed kitchenette, but there were no glasses, mugs etc. Breakfast was more aligned to a local/European taste, with no bacon and small local sausages, potatoes dishes, scrambled eggs and of course, cold meats and cheese, but there was a fruit juice machine and tea/coffee. Staff were helpful and friendly and in all, for the price we paid (around £120 for 4 nights) you cannot grumble. I would not hesitate in returning to this hotel and if you have a wander, there is a pun a few streets away where beet was 76p a pint! Oh one thing to consider in Prague, if your a first time visitor, the beers are served with a head around 4-6` in height, around a quarter of the glass. Just for info.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was clean but no AC. Hot during the day. At night it was OK for the month of may. Breakfast was really good. And personal was very attentive. Close to the center and to all attractions but far away from airport. Need transport service from and to airport.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a group of 7 friends..we got three rooms in this hotel and every room was clean and big enough. Furniture was little bit old but thats not a problem. Hotel is near by the city centre ...Staff on the reception were really nice. Breakfast was good too nothing to complatin about .)
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I rested at the hotel for the Christmas holidays in 2016. The best impressions about the hotel. The main advantages - a convenient location (less than 30 minutes the main tourist attractions), matching of price and quality. Very good staff in the kitchen, nice breakfast. Good lounge for guests on the ground floor. I recommend this hotel as one of the finest budget options. I thank the hotel staff.From Russia (Orenburg) with love.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my fifth time in Prague and the second in this hotel. Amazing service in rooms, reception. I wish to thank for kitchen staff fot incredible breakfast. Location close to most important places.Only 15-20 minutes by foot to Staromestka Namesti and Vaclavska Namesti. Hotly recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visit Prague 3 or 4 times each year usually staying in the Mala Strana or Andel areas. I have stayed in this hotel several times, most recently in May. I have various hotels but always feel welcomed at the Mala Strana. the location and transport access is excellent. I enjoy Prague and this hotel, and have booked my next stay in February 2017.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was great value for money and delivered on all the important stuff - nice room and bathroom, clean, great help at reception and location perfect for exploring Prague. The only small negative was the breakfast where staff weren't as friendly and were quick to clear us out on the strike of 10am! However overall I would definitely stay here again and recommend - thank you
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The only real fault I could find with this hotel is that the bed, in my opinion, is far too hard to sleep on. However, my travelling companion did not find the beds a problem, so it is a matter of opinion. Apart from that, the hotel is great. The hotel staff speak English, and have a manned 24 reception desk. Towels are provided at this hotel. The room cleaning service is prompt and do a good job. Would recommend the stay at the right price.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed here for four nights during an October half term week. We paid just over £50 per night for a serviced apartment.The staff were really helpful upon checking in and provided leaflets and plenty of information about the area. Remember to ask to borrow some pans for the kitchenette if you're staying in an apartment and plan to cook for yourself. We did for breakfast as there is a shop literally around the corner, so can't comment upon the quality of the buffet.The room was a good size, clean with nice big windows and plenty of seating and storage. The kitchenette was simple but had everything required i.e. fridge, kettle, sink and 2 electric hobs, whilst all plates, cups, glasses and cutlery was provided.In terms of location, whilst it is around a 15-20 minute walk from the Old Town, we found this gave us the opportunity to enjoy areas of Prague we may not have otherwise done so with Petrin Park a minute away, and also meant we had plenty of excuses to cross the Vltava river a few times a day and take in the castle and cathedral from a distance. You honestly won't mind walking anywhere in Prague!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 4 nights in Hotel Mala Strana as tourists. It is not the newest hotel, but its location is excelent, the room was spacious and clean, breakfast (buffet) is complete and excelent and above all: the friendliness and kindness of the lady at the reception and the ladies in the breakfast room was outstanding! They made our stay!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location was convenient. We took public transit from the airport and although you need to take a bus, then metro and then tram, it was really easy to navigate and a lot cheaper than a taxi or setting up transportation through the hotel. The hotel is only about a 10-20 minute walk to all major tourist locations, but it is near a tram stop if you prefer not to walk. Breakfast was decent, just a small variety. The room did have a safe, but we had to pay a deposit to get the key (20 euro or 500 czk I think). The bathroom has an all in one shampoo/conditioner/body wash, so if you prefer individual products bring your own. No air conditioning, but the temperature was okay. Our room was on the first floor behind reception and this was very loud. We could hear people coming and going at all hours. Try to get a room on a higher floor. Room did have a mini kitchen, so if staying more than a few days this is convenient. Shower curtain did not keep water in the tub and no mater what we did, water spilled outside.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel with friendly staff close to everything in the quieter end off the city but still central would stay again..Only thing never suplied tea or coffee had kettle and cups but nothing to put in them
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for three nights in a double room and had family members in another double and a two bedroom accomodation here. We very much enjoyed our stay, breakfast is included in buffet style with a variety of foods and drinks amongst them coffee, tea, milk and juices as well as cakes, breads, salads and eggs and sausages. Free wifi worked fabulously to look up information to get around Prague and such. The doubles are quite charming and fairly recently redecorated. Beds are solid and compfy. The rooms also include a small kitchenette and fridge, which we didn't use in the end. The bathroom hasn't lost its more antique charme yet though also offers a few things to mark. The shower could not be positioned to keep it's place while water was running and holding it in your hands was the final and only option. Cleaniness was good though not perfect, once again our bathroom had a few stains on the shower curtain and remaining hair on the tiles from previous guests or the house maid I assume. Besides that it was spotless! My family's rooms were almost identical, no complaints about their showers or cleaniness though. The two bedroom place on the top floor however had a new and fully redone, modern bathroom. It offered accomodation for 4-5people. The hotel is nicely situated within walking distance from the tram, 25min walking distamce from the main station and about 15-20min to the Charles Bridge and other sights. Smaller restaurants and a pretty good ice cream cafe is close by as well as two convenience stores just around the corner, one of them is open late. We loved it here and will be back for sure. Enjoy Prague!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good value for the price, centrally located but very quiet, hotel needs a bit of new paint and decoration, very friendly personnel, breakfast was more than we needed, good choice of items and friendly service, all important touristic attractions are within walking distance
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upsides- Spacious room with mini-kitchen, fridge and safe - Quiet, clean - Friendly staff - Convenient location - Clean and spacious bathroom with many towels - You can have guests for as long as you want (though you'd be charged extra 25 Euro a day for an extra person to live with you) - 24 hour open receptionDownsides- Check-in strictly after 14:00 - No air-conditioner (I think because of some regulations - the whole building doesn't have them), only a fan - Double bed is not really double - it's just two beds together with two separate mattresses, so you can sleep only on one side of it. You can't lay in the middle cuz you fall down and the mattresses slide aside - Can't order just a coffee on reception, only the whole breakfast for 8 or 9 Euro (don't remember exactly) - City tax is not included in price of the room
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had to cancel our trip a week earlier than the booking date, because of a military coup-de-main in Turkey.Even though the apartment was booked as non-refundable and my credit card was already charged weeks ago, Reservation Manager Ms. Polednova gave us a full refund with no questions asked!I was very surprised when they supported us very kindly in this hard situation.I believe this experience is something noteworthy about the Hotel, and they will be our first choice when we rearrange our trip in September.Thanks!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 nights here this past week. This is definitely a no frills basic hotel in a reasonable location. The breakfast options were good but that's about it. I wouldn't recommend it for a longer stay. Desk staff were variable. The male receptionists were helpful.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel really took me by surprise. Affordable, and still so nice. Beautiful rooms with nice beds. A bit outside center but still there is easy to get downtown with trams! Very nice and helpful staff. They go far to help you.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this small family run chain hotel whilst visiting Prague for our 30th wedding anniversary, nothing was too much for the staff, they were so helpful. We had an apartment, so had a kitchenette with a kettle, fridge & microwave. The room was spacious & comfortable & for those who can't be without wifi, there was free wifi throughout the hotel, including the rooms. There was also satellite TV, though there is so much to see in this beautiful city, we didn't have time to watch it.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived here and were quickly booked into our room,409,which was on the fourth floor.Staff were very friendly however we were both ever so slightly underwhelmed by our room....clean and tidy but extremely basic with no coffee or tea( or a kettle in the room)making facilities.Our inclusive dinner offered a buffet which consisted of pork and mushrooms, potatoes,salad,vegetables and rice. The restaurant was stunning and very clean too. The hotel is close to Andel and a huge tescos/shopping centre as well the metro. Visited 1st may 2016.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has friendly staff members who are also helpful. Not the fanciest hotel in the world, but it has the basic things you need for a good stay. Tram, buss and underground stations are close to the hotel as well, but the hotel has good location so you can get to many popular places in Prague just by walking.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a very pleasant 5 night stay here. Nothing fancy about the hotel, but the had all the comfort I need for a good night sleep. Big room with a little pantry and a dining table, comfortable bed, good light in the bathroom and fast steady free WiFi. Very quiet and a fantastic location, walking distance and tram stop just around the corner.Breakfast not that big, but kept me going until the afternoon cake adventure. Nothing to complain about. Plenty of good restaurants and cafes in nearby. Staff very helpful and especially the "breakfast ladies" that speaks nearly no English, but understands everything. What I understand are they also the housekeeping. They truly keep the rooms clean.My room was next to the lift - but it didn't bother me at all .. never heard the lift. Hopefully, I will be able to visit Prague again this autumn and I will try to stay here again. A great 3-star hotel.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is good, just near the river, and a nice walk to the castle. The rooms are spacious, nothing spectacular, but quite affordable. The breakfast was varied and the staff was nice. There is a tourist tax, but this is normal in many cities.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've traveled with my wife and 1.4 year old daughter. There was nice and comfortable room with small but useful kitchen. The crib was placed by our arrive just in accordance with our request. I really like the hotel's destination. There is a beautiful park just in a few steps from the hotel, Charles bridge and Kampa museum are not far from it. And if you want to get to the city center from the hotel, it wouldn't take more than 15-20 minutes afoot. Fine by me, especially in such a beautiful city. There were included breakfasts, not too much various menu, but very tasty.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is perfect for budget travellers who want to forego a hostel. The room was huge, and the free breakfast was welcome. It is in a great area, surrounded by local bars and restaurants, and walking distance to almost anywhere you want to go. The hotel was easily found using the metro, and is situated not a far walk from the Astronomical Clock where you can find excellent free walking tours. The staff were exceptionally kind and pleasant, particularly helping to book tickets to see classical music. Would highly recommend. Thank you.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We went here for Christmas on a 3 day trip. It is a clean hotel, really central from most of the main attractions. Staff was nice, spoke decent english, rooms wrre a bit old fashioned but comfortable and clean. Breakfast was decent, enoigh food yet not very diverse. The parking is extra 8euros a day, but not such a big deal. All in all, if you get it for a decent price ( we paid 117 euros for 3 nights a double room, breakfast included ), it is a good choice
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had booked a double room with Kitchenette for our 4 nights stay in Prague and couldn't have asked for more. The room was huge with a spacious living room which was perfect for our son to wander around! The tram station is at a 3-4 minutes walking distance which made our life so easy! Plus there are couple of hypermarkets close by too. Some real nice restaurants were at a walking distance as well including the ice cream joint Angelato! The breakfast served was adequately stocked, fresh and very delicious all 4 times. We had a sound sleep every night which was much needed after all that walking during those days. It is located away from the main road so the tram noises don't disturb at all. I am glad we chose this hotel for our stay and recommend this to everybody planning a Prague trip.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You know what to expect when you book a room at an Ibis hotel. It’s the same kind of furniture and facilities in pretty much all of them. I was satisfied with my room, the bed and the wifi speed. If anything the room could be painted as the walls looked tired. Even though the hotel is pretty close to a busy road there was no noise when then window was closed.It’s not located in a very central location but that was not a problem for me as it gave me the chance to explore the area and use a different route into town every day. There’s a shopping centre just 100 metres away (with a huge Tesco in case you miss your UK products) and loads of tram lines as well as the C tube line linking the area.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location - 2 minute walk to nearest tram station Ujezd; 10 minute walk to Lesster town bridge / charles bridge; Lots and lots of restaurants nearby - spoilt for options - China restaurant, NOI, cafe Savoy, Mexican canteen to name a fewReasonable rates, easy booking. They provided room service everyday. The building was quite old. There was a lift, but it had its limitation in no of people. The rooms did not have any view. The wifi was good most of the times.Buffet Breakfast was wonderful - we stayed for 5 days and Menu was chnaging everyday - the spread was good as well for european breakfastRooms were spacious - it was a king size bed with comfortable mattress, separate wardrobe area, spacious toilet with bathtub, separate seating area with sofa and additional bed, separate bed for our son, separate kitchen and dining area - it was nearly perfect. We would have loved a microwave as well, but it was not there.English speaking helpful staff in the reception - made our live lot easier with direction to bus terminus / attractions / tickets / maps.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service was great, the room clean and nice and was fixed everyday. The breakfast had many choices and was a nice start on the day. The location was spot on and it was easy to get to any point of town quickly.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Concur with previous reviewers about the great location and the great staff (really can't say enough about how good the staff is here - they are that good). Prague in August is a very popular tourist location and they seemed to be out in force throughout the day and night.Our room was on the Fourth floor - not high enough to get away from the street noise - and came with a full kitchen. A nice feature that allowed us to bring leftovers back to our room from dinner. With its central location, access to the tram (it stops across the street from the front door), the Residence is an ideal place in the center of Prague.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying here with wife and mother for a 4 night stay in Prague. Super nice staff gave us plenty of info on arrival and stored our bags for us as room wasn't quite ready at 10:30am. They even recommended tours, restaurants and local grocery stores. As there are three of us traveling they gave us a larger room with kitchen (stove, sink, fridge/freezer, cutlery, cups and plates), lounge room (with proper single bed) , bathroom and a seperate bedroom. Breakfast was a buffet including cereal, juices, coffee, tea, eggs, sausages, toast, pastries, fruit salad and more, so very surprised to see negative reviews on breakfast. (It's a three star hotel, so wasn't expecting 5 star food) Comfortable beds, clean rooms, clean bathroom. It's an older hotel so once again was not expecting fancy decor and finishes, especially not for how cheap the accommodation was.As for the location, I chose it specifically as I had travelled to Prague before and wanted to be close enough to walk to all the main attractions, but to also be far enough away from the crowds. This hotel suits those needs perfectly. Room is a bit warm with no aircon, but is beautiful to sleep with windows open. Did not have any bugs or mosquitoes.  This place is perfect for those that want to be close to most major sites and slightly away from the massive crowds to be expected in Prague and also want to pay a reasonable price for a room you won't be spending too much time in anyways!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is very good, not far away from the Charles Bridge, but in nice part of Prague. There is no noicy traffic in the street and it is good place if you want peaceful surounding. There are some good groceries and restaurants close to the hotel. Parking is free and sometimes is hard to find it. Hotel is nice and clean. Our room was larger than we expected. Nice thing is the kitchen in the closet. The light was not good in the room and we had a problem when we wanted to read in the evening. And it was a strange smell in the bathroom. Breakfast was very good but I missed vegetables. Staff was very kind, especially receptionist Eva. Internet was good.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a junior suite with a kitchenette. This was a very spacious set oif rooms with a kitchen in a cupboard. The kitchen was very workable. The bathroom was spacious and newly renovated. There was even a dining table and ample storage throughout. We loved the high ceilings and original banisters and tiling. All historic features were beautifully maintained. Wi fi was very good. The breakfast was exceptional with many choices and regularly refreshed. The location was excellent and easily accessible by tram.This hotel had a feeling of quiet elegance at a very reason price.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, good rooms, good service, good value. Wi-fi works well.No airconditioner, breakfast may be more variety.This hotel gives you discount 10% in Meduzzy restaurant. the restaurant is near the hotel (1 minute walk).Recommend, but not in summer.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is well located on a quiet street just off a main intersection with lots of nearby amenities. The hotel was close enough to where I wanted to be without being in the thick of things. The room is clean spacious and comfortable. I was staying for 9 nights and appreciated the little kitchenette. I noticed on other tripadvisor reviews that I should ask for cooking pots etc and the staff was happy to help. I loved the French chanteuse music each morning in the breakfast room. The breakfast offerings were a good mix of hot, cold, eggs, pastries, savouries etc. I would definitely return here.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in Prague for 4 nights, monday to friday in June 2015. The hotel is in a good location in Prague 5, nice area with the massive Novy shopping centre only a 15 min walk away and the tram stop a 1 min walk away. There are also supermarkets, pubs and restuarants within an 2 min walk of the hotel however there is no noise whatsoever at night. Old Town and Prague 1 is a short 20 min walk away and a taxi into Old Town (where most of the clubs are) only costs 180 Kuronas - dont get a taxi through the hotel as they charge 400 Kuronas which is a rip off. Overall the hotel suite is pretty nice. Very clean and housekeeping is daily. the breakfast is pretty naff - only the basics i.e. toast, basic cereal, terrible coffee etc and after the first day, we didnt bother waking up for breakfast again.Hotel staff are friendly and welcoming and if i visited prague again, i would definetly consider staying at this hotel as its value for money and in an ideal location.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are currently staying at this hotel. My son and I are on a 10 country tour of Europe and we booked everything ourselves. The hotel is kept immaculately clean. The staff helped us book tours and a car rental and did so with a smile. The reading/sitting room is quiet lovely...situated in a small courtyard surrounded by some greenery. I have seen comments about the breakfast being poor and our breakfast experiences have been great. Each morning has had a selection of different meats and hot food along with cold items. We went later in the morning one day and still had a complete selection of food. If you want to use the kitchenette you can rent pots/ pans etc....just ask reception. Some of the hotels on our trip have been extremely small so I appreciate the large living area with this hotel. The location is great....quiet street within walking distance of Charles bridge. It is a bit of a jaunt to Old Towne Square but you are close to the Trams so it is still easily accessible. There are many restaurants and bars in the area. For a 3 star hotel I think they do a great job.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff is so helpful and kind, very good service. The hotel is in a very good place near to everything like the tramp and bus easy to buy tickets in the tabacoshop for one day.So it's very easy to recomend.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just visited Prague for a few days and stayed here for 3 nights (3rd – 6th May). Always do my research on Trip Advisor after filtering available hotels prior to booking, and decided to book this hotel. We had a few surprises when we arrived at our designated room though. We arrived fairly late in the evening and were allocated Room #1. I booked a Junior Suite, and according to the confirmation this comprised of 1 double and 1 single bed. However what we got was 2 single beds squashed together, with 2 single mattresses and 2 single duvet covers. I complained to reception, and after they checked our room they confirmed all the rooms in their hotel were like this. So basically it was not their fault, but the error of the site I booked with (Expedia). We had no choice to accept it really, but I will be taking this up with Expedia. In addition to the bed situation, we were supposed to have a bath in our en-suite, but I wouldn’t have called it a bath. More like a large sit down shower tray thing. Not enough room to stretch out and certainly not possible to lie down. Oh and then there was no plug anyway, so we had to take showers. Not ideal when you’ve pounded the streets of Prague all day. As for the buffet breakfast, this was ok, albeit the water to make your tea wasn’t hot water. The bonus though was there were scrambled eggs on offer, not expected but appreciated. We were glad we didn’t arrange a trip here in June or July though, especially being allocated Room #1. This room was downstairs from reception, which should have been a cooler room really? Oh not so. It was very warm during the night, and this was at the beginning of May. We both had terrible nights, as it was too stuffy. No air-con in the room, although I guess we should have asked for a fan. We have no idea if any other rooms had air-con. The only solace was to open all the windows to let some fresh air in. The downside to this was the communal smoking area outside our room so there was chatting right outside late evening and early morning, and we had to keep the curtains closed to stop any prying eyes. The bed was hard, the room safe was right at the bottom of the wardrobe so you had to get on your hands and knees to access it, there was a kettle in the room, and cups, glasses & cutlery. But no condiments. The hotel offered free wi-fi, but this was so hap-hazard and came in and out on regular occasions. There was a small fridge in the room which helped to keep water cold which was great. The location of the hotel was good for the tram route into the centre of town. And there is a great bar/restaurant just 1 minute walk around the corner called Meduzzy which is open until 11pm. On check out, the staff did not ask if we had enjoyed our stay, it was a good job really! Other travellers have commented that this is a clean and tidy hotel. It was indeed a clean & tidy hotel. It was just the little issues we had that stopped us enjoying staying there.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent three nights in this hotel sited in a good location opposite side of the river to the main attractions of Prague. All within walking distance and not far from the famous Charles Bridge. There were plenty of really good restaurants nearby which were much cheaper than those in the centre. Also close by was the funicular railway which led to a lovely park and viewing point over the river and all of Prague. Spectacular!We booked a suite which could only be loosely described a suite!! It was a bedroom which had two half dividing walls separating the kitchen area from the bed! That said, it was basic but clean and adequate to our needs. There were no toiletries supplied nor were there tea and coffee provided. I am not sure why they had a kitchen area as there was a cooking hob but no pans! It would have been better if they had left it just as a large room!! The staff were courteous and helpful but the breakfast room was two floors down from the ground floor and was dingy and canteen like. The breakfast was 'different' to say the least. Nice fresh bread and a small choice of cooked meats and cheeses. Also some kind of 'omelette', small hot dog type sausages and scrambled egg. However, if anything ran out there was no chance of replacement!! If you waited until late to breakfast there was very little left!The best that could be said of this hotel was that it was clean, free wifi and the location good
hotelName:
12    Hotel Mala Strana
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We absolutely recommend staying here. This Guesthouse is in a beautiful, residential neighbourhood. It is very quiet and peaceful and it's nice to come home to after a busy day. Although it was in a residential neighbourhood, it was very easy to get to the city centre and to all the sights. It was a 15 minute tram ride or a 10 minute subway ride.
