And it was only a 5-10 minute minute walk to the tram or subway. There was a grocery store and some really nice restaurants nearby which made things convenient if we wanted to stay in the neighbour hood for a bit. There is also the beautiful 'Visheryad Palace' which you can walk to from the Guesthouse. The Guesthouse was neat and clean and our room was cleaned every day by a cleaning lady. Every morning there was an amazing breakfast ready for us including bread, cereal, fresh cold cuts, cheese, jam, yoghurt, fruit and danish. The hosts, Jan, Jitka, Jiri and Jana were very helpful and kind and made us feel welcome. They were more than willing to help. We saw Jan most of the time during our stay. He picked us up from the airport and helped carry our luggage to our room. Every morning he gave us tips on how to get to sights, what to see and where to eat (and what to avoid!!!!). Jan was very enthusiastic and passionate and gave us excellent recommendations. There was even a transit ticket available for us that we could use for our stay there. Our flight left later in the day and we were able to leave our luggage with them as well. It was a wonderful stay! We would definitely stay here again if we went back to Prague.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first visit to Prague and I can’t say enough good things about the Lida guest house. Jan and Jitka are amazing hosts and truly made our stay in Prague special. Jan picked us up at the airport and that was truly a godsend for two jet lagged Canadians. He is a wealth of information about Prague and his unfailing knowledge and courtesy made us feel ever so welcome. He assisted us with everything from booking tours, to directions, to restaurant recommendations. The guest house is located in a quiet residential neighbourhood and it is very convenient to the metro and the trams to the old city. The rooms are clean and spacious and the breakfast is excellent. If you are looking for a place to stay in Prague that will make your stay truly exceptional then I would highly recommend the Lida guest house.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Every time I visit Prague I stay at the guest house. It is perfectly situated for easy travel to the city center but far enough away for the noise. Jan and Jiri are amazing hosts and the guesthouse is cozy. The rooms are perfect for any sized group and the guesthouse breakfast is the best!!! I cannot day enough good things about this guest house.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just spent 3 nights at the Lida Guest House and could not have been more pleased. The help with tourist advice and directions was excellent. While the breakfast is usually served starting at 8am, since I had tours planned and needed to leave by 8am, they had the breakfast ready at 7:30. My last morning I had to be at the airport early and they had the breakfast ready at 6:30. Totally accommodating. I can’t wait to return!!
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is best described as a very comfortable and unpretentious little hotel and for that a perfect stay. It's a little outside the center of town but that is a great positive after a long day in the crowded touristic areas. The neighborhood is quiet and leafy (although it is a bit of a schlep to the tram and the metro -- there's a small hill -- it's very doable and still very convenient, and the proprietors are very ready to help with directions, passes and so forth. Better yet, there are a few terrific restaurants in the neighborhood if you want to relax away from the crowds. The proprietors, two brothers and their wives, are extremely friendly and helpful. For example, when our flight was delayed, even though it was very late, Jan was nevertheless right there to transport us from the airport and offered to drive us via the "scenic route," which was longer but allowed us to see a little of the city on the way. They are obviously (and rightly) proud of their city and enjoy sharing it with guests. While there are few "frills," the facilities, rooms, hot water, bathrooms, towels, sheets, etc. are ample and spotlessly clean and functional. Breakfast, too, was simple but ample and very tasty. There is also a convenient snack shelf for very inexpensive "pour it yourself" wine, beer and snacks at the end of the day. Altogether a delightful stay and a most reasonable price.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My 80 year old mom has been staying here every year for a least a decade. I now understand why she loves it so much. Not only do they go out of their way to help you in any way they can, they are pleasant, attentive and really care about the quality of your stay. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The breakfast was perfect and sustained us until supper. They will arrange transportation (even if that means a 5:00am ride so they have to sleep at the inn), sell tram tickets, exchange money, and anything else that you may need. Thank you for taking such good care of my mom all these years and for making this family vacation awesome!
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Family owned guest house in a quite quarter of Prague, but near to the center. The staff is always ready to help - day or night. Clean, light rooms of different size - fit for evebody. Clean, large, nice equiped bathroom. Business corner and WiFi available. Absolutely positive ratio benefits/costs ("value in money"). Nothing is a problem! Delicious breakfast, own food can be stored in refrigerators. Fully recommend, by heart.Olga Balkova
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I made my reservation on booking.com some time ago (New Years Eve 2016). However. It disapeared and i couldn't find it again to make proper recommendation. It bothered me for some time so i need to say more about this place. First of all Jiri - owner of this place is very much humble and open minded person. He is also a walking knowledge repository about Prague and Czech republic. He will tell you everything and recommend great places to see during your short or long stay in Prague. Place itself is very well maintained. Rooms are comfy and clean. Breakfasts are just super tasty. You can take whatever you want from the fridge, make a note and pay on your check-out. Super cool sign of trust to the guests. Place is located in a quiet neighbourhood in short distance to a metro station. It is very easy to get to the old town from there in a very short time. Generally we've had only great memories about this place. I fully recommend it to everybody !
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely guest house for a stay in Prague. Only a 10 minute walk down to the river or a 5 minute walk to the metro. It is nice to be out of the busy part of the City for recharging your batteries at night.Host Jan very helpful and welcoming. A delicious breakfast starts your day
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our small group of five stayed three days at the Lida Guest House after touring ten days with our church choir group. Jan and his wife were perfect hosts. Their B&B is beautiful. It is not the most luxurious or the most up-to-date, but it is delightful and a taste of a Prague community. The breakfasts were delicious. Jan was very helpful to suggest places for us to visit in Prague and purchased tickets for events as well as got us to the airport for our return flight to the states. Lida Guest House is named after Jan's mother, and he treats his B&B and his guests in a way that would make his mother proud. We may never return to Prague, but if we do, we know we will stay with Jan and Jetke.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I came here just for one night and Jan,the owner,was absolutely lovely accepting my late check out for the next day and leavingme complete flexibility on timings for breakfast and the shuttle to the airport. The house is in really good conditions and in a very quiet and pretty neighborhood so you won't be awaken by cars roaring or people screaming.Room big enough and with all the must have,towels + shower gel (little bottle but enough for one day),tv and electric fan in case it gets really hot.30 minutes from the airport and reasonably close to the city center.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited Prague recently and me and my partner had travelled separately due to other commitments. Jan had arranged to pick my wife from the airport at late hours. Made her feel welcome and comfortable.Clean room with clean toilets.Very helpful hosts. Their positive energy and enthusiasm will come through. Jan is a geologist who has a passion in what he does and will give you advice on how to travel as well as where to go. He also arranges the tickets for any of the travel and events that you would wish to go. Simple but good breakfast.Would certainly recommend this place and any minor flaw that the picky would come up will be compensated by the warmth from the couple who run this place.Go for it.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One could not ask for more gracious hosts than Jan and Jitka!Jan picked us up at the airport (yes, for a tiny extra charge!) HOWEVER he gave us a quick overview and history of the City on the way to Lida Guest House. Once we were there, Jan took out a map and introduced us to the tram stops and Metro stops. Lida is a little ways from the City Center and is easily accessible via Tram or Metro. Yes, you may walk a bit to get to Lida but so what as we appreciated the exercise!This is WONDERFUL place to stay with gracious hosts.Thank you Jan and Jitka.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice clean rooms and friendly staff. Great breakfast. Helped us with all our needs to have a great trip in Prague from the transport to the airport to getting around Prague. Fresh towels were given every day.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights and it was wonderful. The proprietors make go to great lengths to ensure that the spirit of Prague remains while you recover from sight-seeing, eating or other activities. Single rooms available or you can group up a 3-person room. The beds are supremely comfortable with large pillows and soft, warm comforters. The Lida trades the convenience of being close to the city for the quiet serenity that refreshes the soul. It is within a short walk of a subway stop, making downtown just an 8 minute ride. Breakfast each morning is a delightful array of bread, cheese, prosciutto alongside breakfast cereals. I'd highly recommend this place to any who wish to exhaust their bodies in the city and have it completely recharged by morning (or afternoon if you are a midnight wanderer). Simply put, I will stay here again the next time I am in Prague.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 2 nights just before Christmas. Husband and I had same huge front double as several years ago. . Now TV with English station!. Warm and clean with very friendly and helpful hosts . Very good breakfast. Excellent budget place to eat within walking distance .Safe street parking -take the tram -it's an adventure! Hope to return again! Thanks!
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lida guest house is really a home faraway from home at the beautiful city of Pragueit is our second stay at lida and we were not disappointed the owner jiri and his wife were so helpful and lovely helping with the transport to and from the guest house good breakfast the rooms are big and comfortable free internet and a computer corner i would recommend it to my friends and family
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lida Guest House is located in a residential neighbourhood away from the busy and crowded Prague Old Town. You need to catch a tram for the short ride to major sites like Charles Bridge and the Old Town, and make connection to take a different tram to visit the Prague Palace on the hill, no problem at all. Our room was spacious, breakfast was adequate, and the husband and wife owners very helpful. They rented us a monthly tram pass to do all the daily sightseeing in Prague. If you want to be a traveller and stay away from all the tourists in crowded Old Town, Lida Guest House is the place.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just returned from a 4-night stay in Prague. Having chosen Lida BB based on the various reviews turned out to be an excellent idea. We wanted to rate this as 4.5 but this is not possible. Our room did not yet have a shower but this will be subject for a later renovation we have understood.The hosts could not have been more friendlier and responded to every question we had. For a reasonable charge they also offer an airport pick-up and/or drop-off service. The breakfast offered was a good start of the day.The villa is a bit outside of the city center but the excellent public transportation services will bring you to the city center within half an hour including the short walk downhill to the tram stop or uphill to the metro station. A bus stop is also close to the guest house.The hosts also recommended a few restaurants in the neighbourhood and we were not disappointed. In fact, the area is much cheaper than the city center and you get very much value for your money.We would recommend Lida BB to anyone who is looking for a charming stay in Prague. The smile and the highly appreciated service are included for free.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Lida Guest house for 3 nights this month. Everything about the stay suited us well. One of the innkeepers, Jan, picked us up at the airport for a small extra fee, which was very convenient. He was a wealth of knowledge about Prague during our stay! He helped us book bus tickets for another part of our trip, offered us Prague transportation passes at a discounted rate and shared with us helpful tips on local restaurants. I also loved this location. Prague can feel very busy and crowded in Sept. and it was so relaxing to come back to this inn in a very local neighborhood that was 15 min or so by tram from Old Town. It was a 5 min walk to the tram stop so it was easy to get into town. There is also a metro station that is a 10 min. walk. Our room was spacious and we had a delicious breakfast every morning. The rate was very budget friendly. I would absolutely stay here again the next time I am in Prague!
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this B&B for 4 nights. The owners are wonderful people and they will make you feel at home. Jiri and his lovely wife are a wealth of information. They sell local travel tickets and show tickets. We had a very early morning flight out of Prague and we were lucky Jiri offered the service to drive us to the airport. His wife even packed us a nice breakfast to take with us. Don't hesitate to stay at this place.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a fantastic experience to stay in this HostelEverything is 1st class for sureFood excellent and hostess and host exceptionalHighly recommend itPrices very fair Location is great too Transportation close and inexpensive Loretta foleyVictoria Canada
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a two-night visit in Prague and to be fair, staying in Lida Guest House made it certainly degree ir two more enjoyable.The exchange of emails after reservation was fluent and natural and the follow-up right before our trip was pleasant. We took the pick-up service from the airport offered by the guest house and it proved to be worth every penny as the trip was easy, but also Jan, one of the business owners, picked us up and gave us a small trip showing us places right from the start wraped with a lot of knowledge about Prague.We got our room straight ob the arrival followed by a package of information about moving around and points of interest worth visiting from Jan. They have a selection of public transportation tickets on sale at the guest house and promise to do reservations for teather and concert tickets and to restaurants, a service we did not end up using. It is easy to ask advice concerning moving and for example suggestions for good restaurants and information is actively offered. They all seem very enthusiastic about heloing their guests to enjoy Prague and esoecially Jans knowledge of the city seemed astonishingly vast.The room, three bed room we had at least, was nice and peaceful. The breakfast was basic but suprisingly wide-ranging. Only downside might be the distance as the guest house is certainly a bit off from the main sights but I personally did not mind as the trams and the metro were only a short walk away. This is something to concider in any case, especially if one has an intention staying long in the city center, although information on the night buses and trams was available from the guest house.All in all, I am very happy I chose to stay at Lida and certainly will concider coming again should (or when, more likely) I visit Prague again.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's beyond me that a place like this can get less than a 5 star rating. The guest house is close to a metro where you have access to 90% of Prague within 25 mins. The breakfast is small and 'homey' and the hosts help you settle in with all the necessary information to make your trip as easy as possible. Would recommend it to anyone and looking forward to my next trip to Lida Guest House.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is run by Jan and Jiri brothers. Both are super helpful and it was mostly Jan who took care of me. Jan was everything to me in Prague- a money exchanger, terrific guide who woud recommend a dish from the menu at a local restaurant, who would recommend good wine to buy, etc. They are travellers themselves (they have even traveled to the Himalayas!) so they know what travelers expect and need. Every time I came back to lida guest house, I felt like I came back home. Everybody gets VIP treatment here. Highly recommended!!
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best place to stay at Praha.The staff is super kind. Because of staff(Jan), the city seems like better place. He gave every information for trip and took care of us. The room is clean and cosy. Trams go frequently, so you can move easily to the main town. Best, best, and best. Breakfast was also wonderful.중심지에서 거리가 조금 먼 것 같아 걱정했는데 오산이었어요. 트램이 워낙 자주 다녀서 편해요. 구글맵스 활용하시면 되구요.가족들끼리 운영하는데, 스태프들이 모두 매우매우매우 친절해요. 숙소도 쾌적했구요. 조식 맛있어요. 전반적으로 강력 추천해요.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just spent one night at Lida but I know that when I return to Prague, I will definitely aim to stay again.I confirm what other reviews have said about the hosts. Jan was extremely helpful in answering my questions and locating all of the places I wanted to visit (some of which were pretty obscure!). The room was absolutely spotless and a good size (I took the small double/large single...not the smallest but the next one up). Very comfortable bed and the neighborhood very quiet, so I had a GREAT night's sleep.The bathroom was very modern and had a great shower. Hairdryer provided and some toiletries. The breakfast was quite abundant, plenty of good hot coffee, plus a range of breads, yogurt, cereal, fruit, meats and cheeses, and some juice. Setting nice, plenty of light and comfortably arranged. You could sit and not talk to anyone if you wanted, or you could chat with other guests.There is a small reading room that I didn't use, but I looked and saw there were some books available to read (a bunch in English); there is a computer available there for the rare person who doesn't have their own device!The location for me was good. If you want to be right in the middle of the noise and crowds of, say, the Old Town Square, then this isn't there. But it was literally a five minute walk from the metro and maybe 5-6 minutes down to the river where the trams passed (frequently). The river is a good spot for a morning (or any time of day) run if you like to keep up on your workouts while traveling.I was sorry not to stay longer; I was literally there less than 24 hours, but I will definitely return there next time.Great service for an unbeatable price!
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Your hosts at Lida guest house are masters of their trade. They'll make sure that you arrive safe in Prague, are served with hospitality, and will help with tips and tricks about Prague. Lida is well located, close to tram and metro. The house is in a neighborhood, which itself is worth exploring. We spent 4 nights, literally, because we left in morning and returned just for sleep. The house is cozy. Instantly we felt like staying at friends house.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I spent three nights in Prague on our first visit and stayed at this fabulous guest house. Our room was clean, comfortable and spacious and was just what we needed after the long flight from Melbourne. The breakfasts provided here are exceptional. It is in a great location, a quiet neighbourhood with nearby attractions and restaurants but just a ten minute tram ride into Prague centre. However, it was the hospitality of hosts Jan & Jitka which ensured that our stay here would be truly memorable. Jan collected us from the airport on arrival and delivered us all the way to our train platform on departure. Their advice on how to get around and places to visit ensured a truly enjoyable visit to Prague for us. Jan is a great conversationist, proud of his country and so interesting to listen to. One of the suggestions we followed was a visit to a traditional Czech dinner and show which was wonderfully entertaining. Sincere thanks Jan & Jitka.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Jan (Yan) and Jitka (Yitka) and their family co-team take turns managing the place every couple weeks. They are as gracious and hospitable as one could ask for in this magical setting. And they run a great little power breakfast (continental-style) with endless coffee to start a full day of sightseeing off right. Ask them questions. They do a great job answering!Love staying here whenever I'm able!And it's nothing like a Hampton Inn. You're in Bohemia now!!! Soak it in with quiet style and charm.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: so clean and friendly place in quiet part of city, but close to the center. Enjoy beautiful wiew an old gardens around. Room No. 9 has glass wall between bedroom and shower ;))) Great and ritch breakfast :) just perfect plyce to stay! We find our second home in Prague :)))))
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff is very friendly and helpful. They made everything so easy for us, even explained all the must go places in Prague as soon as we arrived. All of this combined with a beautiful city makes this place a must go
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first visit to Prague and this guesthouse made a great first impression. The couple, Jan and Jitka, were very helpful in providing information about the city that wasn't tourist-oriented. As a result, I had no problem venturing around the city, in spite of the language barrier. The amenities were well-maintained and had the basics; however, you're not doing yourself any favors staying indoors and watching TV. The guest house is located in a residential district away from the bustle of the downtown scene. Should I have the opportunity to visit Prague again, I would not hesitate to give Jan and Jitka a call.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family stayed at Lida Guest House for 3 nights. It was a very pleasant stay. Lida is well located, within 10 minutes of the tram stop from where the 3 or 17 tram takes you anywhere in central Prague. Jan and his wife made us most welcome from the moment we arrived. Our car was safely stored in a locked garage and our room was very clean and comfortable. Jan was also very helpful giving us recommendations for sights and sites around the city. Breakfast was very hearty with a nice selection of hot and cold foods in a bright, airy room. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Other reviews have written of the amenities, location, etc. We agree with every one of them that this is an excellent place to stay. What makes it the best are the hosts! My wife has knee problems. We stayed on the third floor and each morning Jan would bring a pot of coffee and pastries before breakfast opened to our room so that my wife would not have to go up and down those stairs. Jan met us at the train station and after 5 days took us to the airport. After dropping us off at the airport, I realized that I had left our passports hanging in a vest in the wardrobe. In a panic, I called Jitka and she told me that Jan did not have a cell phone but she would leave a message for him as she had a doctor's appointment and would be gone before he arrived back at the Lida. A few minutes later she called back and said Jan was on his way back to the airport. He had to have drive crazily back to the airport to give us our passports. We boarded the airplane with less than minutes left in the boarding process. Later, in talking with Jitka, we learned that she was very late in going to her doctor's appointment because she waited for Jan to return in order to send him back to the airport. In so many ways, the saved us. Wonderful people and wonderful hosts.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent four days here arriving by motorcycle. Jiri accommodated us with a garage rental for our stay. The room was sunny and bright and very clean. A nice breakfast is provided and a a thorough briefing given on transportation options (close and efficient trains) and local eateries. They even did a load of laundry for us. These are exceptional hosts and we enjoyed the time here very much.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 5 nights at Lida Guest House and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The location was quiet but we could walk or take the Metro to any place we wanted to go. The owners were so friendly and informative and made us feel welcome and comfortable. I would highly recommend Lida Guest House to any travellers!
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were at the Lida House for a little more than a week and found our stay there MAGNIFICENT.Our hosts Jan, Jiri AND their wives were simply SUPERB.We found them to be VERY helpful, accommodating and friendly, all 4 of them.The location of the guest house is only 10-15 minutes to the old town part of Prague ,when one takes the streetcar, a service which comes very frequently and is only a 5-10 minute walk from the B&B. The subway is close as well and serves as an alternative. We liked the streetcar as one sees more of the city that way.Daily breakfast is simply a delight, which is augmented by the meeting of other guests from around the world.The owners are also very helpful in telling you about "must see attractions", depending on how much time you have in the city.The room we occupied was very quiet and comfortable.What else can we say about this place and its owners? Well a lot, but we'll leave it at this.Suffice to say the other items we left out were equally EXCELLENT.Bravo Jan, Jitka, Jiri and Jana. Well done!
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Jan, Jiri, and their wives are fantastic! They sit with you and explain things to see, how to get around, and go out of their way to help you in any way! Will absolutely stay with them next time we go to Prague! Highly recommended! Close to tram stop to get you all around town too.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Lida for the third time and it was just as good as previous trips. To start out, this was a last minute trip. Jan and Jiri accommodated my last minute request for a room. We stayed in the attic apartment which can accommodate six people (maybe more?) and I don't think is available through booking.com. As per their service standard, I was greeted on arrival, assisted to the room and offered coffee/tea to discuss Prague. Jan and Jiri are very knowledgeable on events in the town and how to get the most out of your trip. They have public transportation tickets available and can explain how to use it.If there is a negative aspect to the stay, the area near Lida is a little run-down. It is really typical for the area, but can look a little intimidating if you aren't expecting it. Again, this is my third stay and each time I have been out late at night and have never had even the slightest uneasy feeling about my surroundings.A couple of quick tidbits- free wifi; they serve breakfast; it is a ten minute walk to three different train/tram stops; more reading material than you can read on the city; secure parking available on request (small fee); if you're up for a long walk, it is walking distance to the city center (done it a few times with kids, about 40 minutes). I think this was my last trip to Prague. If there is a fourth, I will stay at Lida again!
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stumbled upon this small B&B while looking for an accommodation close to Zluty Lazne and it was a lucky find. This small family run hotel offered us very good accommodation for a very reasonable price. Owners are very nice people always willing to help. We've got a good sleep and a hearty breakfast.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first visit to Prague, and the city was everything we had heard it was. Beautiful with a really great energy. The buildings have interesting detail and the city just seeps with history. My husband, 15 year old daughter, 3 year old and I stayed at the Lida Guest house in the family suite- which was more than enough room for us. There was a queen size bed in the large room and two bedrooms that both slept two people. One had a double bed, the other had two single beds. There was also a little loft space that would be perfect for two little kids, probably aged 5-10 or so. It was like a secret hideout! My 3 year old liked going up there to check it out. There was a kitchen and bathroom. We felt right at home! It was absolutely perfect to come home to at night after a day exploring Prague. The breakfast was fantastic, the coffee wonderful, the hosts were so very nice and helpful with recommendations. Jiri referred us to an authentic Czech eatery and we absolutely loved it. Pinta, it was called. We had such a great stay in such a gorgeous city. And a huge thank you to our hosts at Lida guest house! We hope to see you again!
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I spent 3 days and 2 nights at Lida and thought it was the best accommodation of our 3 week trip through Europe. Great location on a quite street. Jiri was fantastic. He took time to explain where to go and what it see. He had metro transportation tickets available for us to buy.My wife is celiac and needs gluten free food. We mentioned this to Jiri and he had a gluten free loaf of bread for my wife at breakfast time.The door handle on the bathroom door broke off. I shown this to Jiri and he had it fixed when we came back in the evening.Lida has a PC available for use in its own separate room. Our bedroom had a fantastic view overlooking Prague. The bed was comfortable and the room adequate. Everything was clean.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were collected from the airport and then Jiri spent 30 minutes explaining transport an Prague's attractions. He supplied concert tickets and bus and metro passes. Good breakfast, clean and comfortable beds. Short walk up slight hill to underground, slightly further and steeper down to buses. Old Town is walkable for the energetic. Note, around 25 steps from street to lowest rooms, so not for disabled.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a month-long vacation in Europe and Lida Guest House was our first stop (4/27 to 5/2/15). I exchanged emails with Jitka and Jan prior to our arrival and my request for given an unit with views was quickly granted. Very pleasant communications!On our way to Prague on 4/27, we missed our connecting flight from Frankfurt to Prague due to the fault of Lufthansa. Instead of arriving in Prague at 6:25pm, we arrived at Lida around 11:30pm. Yiri (brother of Jan) had to change his plan and he was there waiting for us (As I understand, they are not living onsite and Yiri & wife (Jana) and Jan & Jitka take turn to manage the property on a two-weeks rotational basis).Our 5-nights stay at Lida was very pleasant and enjoyable. It was located in a nice and quiet residential neighborhood and less than 10 minutes walk from the metro station (genial uphills) and tram station (downhill). Our unit was nice and clean with a very big picture window facing the backyard and a door which opens to the backyard. Using the very efficient public transportation systems, you can get to any tourist sites very easily. Yiri recommended two local restaurants to us and we tried both. The foods at the two restaurants were delicious and inexpensive! The breakfast at Lida was nice and we had very enjoyable conversations with other guests. Yiri speaks excellent English and he gave us clear instructions on how to use the public transportation systems. We also had a laundry done onsite at a very reasonable price.After arriving at our 2nd stop in Vienna, I realized that I left one of my clothing in the closet by accident. After notifying Yiri, he and Jana were kind enough to make a special trip to the post office and mail my clothing to me at my 4th stop in Athens. They only got their costs reimbursed about two weeks afterwards.Overall, we enjoyed our stay at Lida very much and we appreciated very much the willingness of Yiri/Jana to go out their way to make their guests' stay a very pleasant one. Should we have the chance to visit Prague in the future, Lida will be our number one choice!
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we booked our room, Jan could not have been more helpful,from giving us directions and instructions on public transport from airport, to when we arrived, making us coffee and giving us all the infomation regarding what to see & how to use the excellent & very cheap public transport. Room & breakfast was excellent, I cannot praise Jan & his family high enough for the service they provide,If we ever go back to Prague I would not consider booking anywhere else.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the beginning of making the reservation to the end of our stay at Lida Guest House the service went above and beyond. We were greeted upon our arrival by Jiri who was friendly and eager to make us feel welcome. We stayed in the Family Suite which was fantastic and plenty of room for our party of three. The rest of our stay was with Jan and his wife Jifka who were just as friendly and helpful. The area where the Guest House is quiet and lovely. I would have to say that in the many places our family has stayed the warmth of the owners of Lida stand out. The breakfast was wonderful and the consideration on details such as where to eat and transportation information was outstanding. Prague is a beautiful city and when we hopefully return, without hesitation we would stay at Lida Guest House.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just quit looking for places to stay, and book your room before it fills up!!I can not say enough good things about this place...Jiri was so friendly, and very attentive and helpful! He recommended some great restaurants in the area, and we were pleased with every suggestion he had! He went out of his way (WAAAAYYYY above and beyond) to help with many things!The rooms were very cozy, clean, and a few have their own bathroom! You CAN"T beat the price! It is in a great location, and the breakfast (traditional European) is filling and fresh. Wifi is available at the house. BEST OF ALL....they are a B&B who accepts children! This is uncommon!If we ever return to Prague, we will definitely be staying here again!
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All things the other reviewers sais is true : rooms, breakfast. But I like to stress the kindness of the people who run this B&B. They know the city and help you with everything. We'll definitely go back next time we visit Prague.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can't say enough about the wonderful experience my family (of five) and I had while staying at Lida Guest House. Jan and Jitka were fabulous hosts who went out of their way to provide us with an orientation to the city, see that we were comfortable, and assure that we had everything we needed to get into the center of Prague. From the moment we walked in, we felt genuinely welcomed. Our accommodations on the top floor consisted of two bedrooms (three if you count the living area that has a bed), kitchen, bathroom, and a loft. It was our own spacious apartment. The architecture of the roof made the bathroom ceiling a little low, but we didn't mind--it just made the space more quaint. We loved it.Breakfast was tasty and plentiful. Jan and Jitka were constantly making sure that everything was filled and that we had what we needed. One morning, Jan played a CD of music at breakfast that he knew we would be hearing at the symphony concert that same evening. Very thoughtful. We patronized (twice) a local restaurant that Jan recommended. The food was delicious and the prices were right.The house is about a 10-minute walk from the nearest tram stop, so it is convenient to public transportation. The trams came along regularly and whisked us into the center of Prague in less than 15 minutes. If you want to stay out of the tourist center in a place where you can have a better sense of Czech life and culture, Lida Guest House is a must.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My dad and I stayed here for two nights in March 2015 at the beginning of our Central Europe trip. Our stay was outstanding. As other reviewers have noted, the owners of Lida are what distinguish this B&B. We had the pleasure of meeting Jiri and Jana. We took advantage of the late evening airport pickup, since we were arriving in Prague after 18 hours of travel from Los Angeles. However, public transportation is excellent in Prague, and had we landed at an earlier hour and not spent so many hours prior in a plane, it would have been easy to navigate. Lida is about 8 minutes' walk from a Metro stop and about the same amount of distance from the tram stop. Once you get on the tram or Metro, it is just a few minutes until you're in the center of things. Lida is close enough to the city's highlights but far enough away to feel like you are hanging with the locals, which you are. We had a great dinner in a restaurant recommended by Jiri (just down the hill from Lida, across from the nearest tram stop), and it was nice to enjoy Czech food with locals (and without the ridiculously inflated tourist prices!). Based on Jiri's recommendation, we finished our day of hard-core touring with a visit to Vysehrad Castle, which is about 10 minutes' walk from Lida. What a gem! The views at sunset were unbelievable. And there were lots of neighborhood folks hanging out, exercising, and simply enjoying the fact that they have an old castle in their neighborhood. The rooms are clean and the breakfast quite diverse and delicious--enough to fill you up for sightseeing and make you want to eat a late lunch. Thank you, Jiri and Jana, for making my first trip to Prague so pleasant! I hope to visit again in the near future.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From outside it looks a normal house like many others around it, in a residential area of Prague. The owner, Mrs. Jitka, speaks very good English (better than me) and was really friendly and concerned with my well-being. We talked for 45 minutes about the places to visit in Prague and her sugestions was really good. She knows the city very well and explained me exactly which trains I should take to go to the old city. The house is near the subway, then it is quite easy to go anywhare. The suite is quite big, very comfortable and has a relly good bath to relax after one whole day walking. It has also good restaurants near the house.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for three nights on our trip to Prague. This was at the end of a 16 day trip and a few other B&B's. This one ranked right at the top of our list for several reasons, and as is usually the case, it was the people that ran the place. They were all so nice and accommodating, eager and willing to answer all our questions and to provide insider help on where to go and how to get there. It is located in a nice, quiet residential area that has several nice restaurants within a very short walk and it is only a 10-15 minute walk to the tram to get you to the tourist parts of town. The room was nice and large with a big enough bathroom and was very clean, as well. Breakfast was great and plentiful, too. There is a small fridge in the breakfast room stocked with drinks, beer and other stuff that works on the honor system. Some good Czesk beer for about a dollar!  I would highly recommend you stay here for your trip to Prague.
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The reviews convinced us to stay at this absolute gem of a B&B. We certainly weren't disappointed. The instructions from Jitka on how to get here were perfect and then we were greeted by Jan who gave us a comprehensive rundown on what to do and see in a prague and how to get there. The room was huge and bathroom luxurious. It was lovely to escape the crowds of the city at night to come 'home'. Thankyou for a wonderful stay in your glorious city!
hotelName:
13    Lida Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Can’t fault the location of the hotel, perfect for exploring. Rooms not quite as shown in images! Compact but clean, lovely shower . Breakfast adequate. Please note - to enjoy yr time in Prague, leave yr heels at home totally impractical due to the cobbled streets.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed a lovely 3 nights in this hotel. Great location in the old town 1 minute walk to Charles Bridge and close to other important sites to visit of Prague. Friendly staff, smooth checkin and lovely room and bathroom. Down stairs restaurant within the hotel building complex very nice, great buffet breakfast with great egg station. Would definitely stay here again if returning to Prague.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a terrible restaurant experience for a party of four: first the dishes did not come on time, not simultaneously. The staff were unfriendly and we had great surprises when the bill came: we ordered a burger (which came cold) and we had to pay extra for ketchup and for mayonnaise, without being told in advance. So tourists, be warned of this tourist trap !!!!
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Malvaze was a pleasant experience. we travel around the world so it's nice to find a place that exceeds expectations. The Room was well appointed with hot water electric kettle , coffee to get you started . the bathroom had a heated floor along with a wonderful push button on/off shower. The bed was comfortable with soft bed lines and down comforters. The aircondioner worked well and was extremely quite. Breakfast was more than ample with omelet station, all types of breads and fresh croissants, cold meats and cheeses as well as fruits, sausage, bacon, fresh grilled vegetables and fresh yogurt.The location is excellent only one block from the charles bridge and 5 min walk to the town square. You can even walk to the castle in abiut 15 mins giving you the opportunity to see other sights along the way. The staff was atentive, kind natured, spoke english well , and professional. The restaurants food was very good to excellent. They had live entertainment so you realy did not have to go any place if you were tired from walking around all day.A great place to stay at a reasonable price.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice little hotel situated very near the Charles Bridge on Karlova next to St Clements Cathedral. You have to walk through (and back through) the restaurant to check in which is a little awkward with luggage unless you come in the back entrance. However we had a warm welcome and one of the guys helped with the luggage which was important as there is no lift - I guess like all the older buildings in the city. Rooms are clean. Beds are comfortable. We overlooked Karlova which is a busy street and were amazed we could not hear any sound due to excellent double glazing. Wi-fi was good too. Breakfast was expensive so we had this elsewhere. The rooms were let down slightly by the decor and some issues like lights not working and even one bedside light having exposed electrical cables which would have been dangerous with little children. (See picture). One bedroom was also missing a smoke alarm.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have mixed emotions about the hotel. I want to say the staff was friendly and so very helpful. The rooms are large and they had nightly music which was nice. My issue was that the photos must be quite old as many things seem to be falling apart. I had a 2 bedroom and the bathroom was nice. My king bed table was missing lampshades on both sides and 1 fixture has no bulbs. Both rooms has wheels missing from the desk chairs. There is no elevator which is not bad but the stairs are quite bad in places and actually slant down. Breakfast was nice and the location is great for nightlife, sights and restaurants. This hotel was fine but not as advertised. Overall it is great for the price but kind of a let down from what was shown as to what you get.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved my stay here. We booked a standard double room and it was absolutely huge. Our room was on the first floor at the front of the hotel and it was surprisingly quiet despite being situated on a very busy pedestrianised street. Hotel is a 2 minute walk from the Charles Bridge and there are plenty of restaurants, quaint touristy shops and bars to choose from right on your doorstep. You really are in the heart of town here.The relaxing restaurant/bar transforms each morning into a breakfast hall. The breakfast is fantastic with a wide range of foods. A chef cooks fresh omelettes and pancakes on request. We even had free champagne one morning (it was a saturday). We aren't sure if this is a regular thing on a Saturday but it was free to all guests in 'help yourself' style and really good quality!
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing location right in the middle of Prague by the bridge. The room was bright and the shower was super. Breakfast had lots of options and even a chef to cook omelettes. Would definitely recommend to stay here.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms we had were fantastic. It's a little hard to find reception so just ask in the restaurant. If you can afford the royal suite it is massive and four people can easily share it. The two bedroom could sleep a couple plus three more in beds upstairs. Super close location. Quiet enough-just bring earplugs if you are sensitive. Very friendly and welcoming staff.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and i spent last night and the night before at this hotel. very comfortable bed in nice clean room and very tasty breakfast. My brother in law and his wife stayed at the hotel on sunday night and their room overlooked Karlova Street. He said they were woken a number of times by noisy people. We were on the other side and it was quiet. This hotel is literally three mins walk from the Charles Bridge. We took public transport to get there which was dead easy and only about £1.40 each!. We got lost in Karlova Street as the entrance is not obvious when you are trying to make sure your suitcase wheels don't get stuck in the cobbles and you are avoiding the crowds. As you turn into the street from the Charles Bridge it is about 8 shops down on the right and you need to look up above shops where there is a clear sign. That tajes you in to the restaurant and you walk through that into reception. The easier way we found was tbrough the entrance in Anenska Street. A perfect city for a city break
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely old hotel with lots of character...great bathroom and a very comfy bed...super location near Charles bridge..and so close to other popular areas too.. very friendly staff and a resident parrot who was quite a character!. Breakfast served in the restaurant adjacent to the hotel which is also open to non residents. Overall we enjoyed our stay at U Malvaze
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend & I arrived at the hotel really impressed on how lovely it looked. We arrived 5 hours before we could check in but the staff allowed us to check in early. We were told to take a seat as they spoke to one another in their own language. We were sat waiting for around 10 minutes. We were then met by another member of staff to tell us the hotel had been over booked & we were being moved to The Black Star which was around 3 minute walk away down the street, which we were fine about. Our only ‘moan’ is that we were told that this room was better than the room which we would of got in our original hotel. After looking at other photographs of the room we originally booked, we aren’t too sure we got the better deal. The room was ok, large bathroom, double bed & a room with a single bed, kettle, small kitchen table, fridge & wardrobe. However, there was no natural lighting in the room which made the room feel very dark. We were still able to go back to Residence U Malvaze for breakfast as it was only a short walk down the road.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cozy hotel. Clean and spacious room. (We were 4 friends sharing a executive family room). Helpful staff and Oscar the parrot gave the hotel a soul. Breakfast was good - loved the egg and omelet station. Perfect location with just a two minute walk from the Charles bridge.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was absolutely perfect (103), clean, wifi superlative, bathroom big, OCCITANE equipped!!! From the window you can see the main tower of Charles Bridge.Breakfast? Unique, big choices, omelettes prepared in front of you with ingredients that you choice, panquecas, fantastic cheese, ham, Champagne Brut also!....beans, mushroom, scrambled eggs, bacon....croissants, cake, yogurt, fresh fruit, what else?And on the evening, a perfect restaurant with Czech food and other delicious food.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 3 nights, check in took 30 minutes because just have 1 staff on desk, so we had to wait our turn. We had the Deluxe room on 2nd floor (no lift) which wouldn't suit anyone with walking difficulties. Room was spacious and clean. Our room faced the back street which there was no noise which we had good night's sleep. We were worried after reading some reviews about the noise from the front of the building. Beds are king in deluxe and ample space for the two of us. Big TV with mostly German channels, but has CNN, BBC. No kettle, but has a coffee machine with free coffee that you can top-up in reception.Breakfast is served 7-10am with a variety to suit all.There is a parrot that is let out of the cage around 9am that fly's up the stairwell and will swalk for a couple of hours, this is your wake up call to tell you to get breakfast . Charles Bridge is a minute away, as is all cafés and bar's.I booked a taxi from the airport through the hotel which charged €30, I took Uber back to the airport for €20.I would stay again, as it was a pleasant stay.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'll start with the positives. The location is excellent, as are the people who work there. Tje room is clean and comfortable. Breakfast is good with lots of variety. The restaurant is also good, as is the Wi-Fi. The negatives are that there is no air conditioning, and no elevator. Also, with the windows open in the room it is very noisy. The stairs between the first and second floor are non-symetrical and very noisy. There is a very heavy door between the lobby level and the first floor which slams constantly and makes all the room doors rattle day and night. All in all, I recommend this hotel but be aware of the downside.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were 4 guests visiting Prague. We booked 2 rooms at the hotel for 5 nights. The hotel is very close to Karl's Bridge. We were extremely pleased with the location, with the large rooms with big windows, with the pampering L'Occitane bath products, with the generous breakfast and the friendly staff, especially the manager Alex, who was very helpful and very patient and made our stay very enjoyable. We definitely recommend this hotel and we look forward to staying there again in the future.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very pathetic bedrooms. They gave us room on the 3rd floor there s no elavator absolutely so hot rigt now and no fan or air conditioner in the room. It was not even written om their website that there s no AC. The hotel itself is too inside and there s no hotel board outside the hotel. It took us about an hour to find the hotel itself. I would never recommend this to anyone.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Number 1 plus point for this hotel is its location - 30 seconds to Charles Bridge. However, its location means that it is also slap bang in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Prague’s nightlife. Our room had no fan or a/c and even with the windows closed, the noise from the street was quite loud. There is no lift and the stairs are uneven. The hotel itself has a quirky design which may or may not appeal. Our room was a decent size. Breakfast was ok and the staff were helpful. All in all, stay was ok, but could have been better...
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very central for a tourist trip to the old city of Prague. Found the hotel to be clean the staff friendly and the Restuarant offered good reasonably priced food. The breakfast was very good. Our room was very comfortable and quite spacious. The noise level at night was party people passing under the window and was quite noisy but we did sleep with the window open. Our room was on the first floor and opened onto the street at the back of the hotel. There is easy access on the opposite side from the walkway that comes off the Charles bridge which is 2 minutes walk away. Would definitely go back.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was nice and clean, walking distance to the restaurants, bars, etc. The breakfast was okay, there could have been more selection of meat and fruit. The staff are nice and very helpful (Alex). There is NO smoke alarm in the room or in the corridor. NO escape plan in the room or in the corridor. NO sign of a emergency exit. NO fire alarm bell in the corridor or room. This draws down the safety and standards of my part! The hotel has a parrot, the parrot woke me up Saturday and Sunday at 09:00 with its scream. Not comfortable! No elevator :/
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location was very good, but room being on the 2nd floor, it was very noisy. People were talking on the corridor, slamming doors, knocking doors, yelling. We woke up several times at every night. There was also live music every night at the restaurant downstairs, so if you're planning to go to sleep early, pack earplugs.One thing that was a bit weird, was that the cleaner lady tried to come to our room first time after 8am every morning. I mean if you like to sleep late, it is not very nice feeling when door opens and somebody peeps her head in. And even when the room was already cleaned fot the day, they did the same peeping in in the afternoon. Don't know why, I never asked.Breakfast was very good and staff was very nice.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. The location is just perfect, two minutes from Charles Bridge, and the room is clean. But, we booked a triple room which was on the second floor. It was really really noisy. I woke up in the middle of the night several times because there were people climbing the stairs. The walls were like paper thin. What is more, for the 4 nights that we stayed, not even once were out sheets changed! When you pay €230 a night, I expect the sheets to be changed. Overall the hotel is good but not worth the money .
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just enjoyed a fabulous 3 night stay in the beautiful city of Prague. This hotel is in a excellent location, just a few minutes walk from Charles Bridge. There are bars and restaurants nearby, not to mention the hotels own. We arrived at approx 9.30pm and check in was quick and efficient. The room was located on the 1st floor and was a good size. The bathroom was modern and the shower was very hot. The design of the shower was a bit of a problem as it flooded the bathroom, but this was not a great issue. Rooms were cleaned every day and fresh towels provided. We stayed bed and breakfast. The breakfast was buffet style, and there was lots of choice, from fresh fruit, pastries, cold meats and cheeses amd omelettes to order. Check out was easy amd bags were stored until we were being collected. All staff we encountered were very friendly. If visiting Prague again, we would definitely return to U Malvaze.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Situated in the heart of the old town, close to all of the must visit places and surrounded by authentic Czech bars and restaurants. We stayed in room 112, high standard of fittings in room and bathroom, very clean, comfortable bed afforded two very good nights sleep. The room was warm but windows opened fully to allow temperature regulation especially through the night. Staff were very friendly and helpful, our room was ready on arrival some 2 hours before due check in time.Breakfast was amazing nothing too much trouble for staff. Will definitely recommend and hopefully return as so much to see and do in Prague.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this hotel is steps from Charles Bridge. This is a great centre point to navigate around the city as you are right in the middle of everything. Although the hotel is situated on a hustle and bustle type street, we never found noise to be an issue. The layout of the hotel is super unique as you have to walk through their beautiful restaurateur and open an iron gate which leads you to a winding staircase to the rooms. If stairs are not your friend then be sure to request a lower level room as not only is there a lot of stairs but the unevenness of them makes it quite exhausting to walk up. It really added to the charm of the hotel though and we loved it. The rooms are exceptionally clean and well kept as well. No complaints by far for this place and for the price it is amazing. Steps from one of the largest clubs in Europe making it a safe spot to go and overall surrounded by amazing restaurants, bars, galleries, shops, and more.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Residence U Malvaze for three nights in December 2017. We checked in on a Sunday and checked out on Wednesday.The Old Town is beautiful, and it snowed a little the first night we were in Prague.Residence U Malvaze is literally 100 metres walk on the Charles Bridge. You can walk on the bridge before breakfast and avoid the crowds.Breakfast at Restaurant U Malvaze is very good, and was included in our package. We loved the freshly made omelettes.Two negative points to make:Our room was the family suite, which had two bedrooms and a bathroom, but no storage space for luggage. It was a small space for a family with two teenagers.The noise from the street was also a negative. We stayed during the lead-up to Christmas, but I could imagine it would be a year-round problem. There are several clubs nearby - we didn't hear noise from the clubs, but patrons leaving definitely weren't sympathetic to people trying to sleep.Photos attached show the view of Charles Bridge in the snow, taken from our room, the parrot which greets new guests in reception, and the fantastic Czech goulash and beer served by Restaurant U Malvaze, which is on premises by a separate business from the hotel.The airport pickup in Mercedes van was worth noting, and we would recommend the train station transfer too, which we used on check out day.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived around 11am on Tuesday, however were unable to check-in until 3pm which we were already made aware off. The staff took our bags into holding and we went off exploring. The location of the hotel is excellent - minutes from the Charles bridge and surrounded by restaurants and shops. On returning to the hotel to check in, the main reception area is lovely and also have a resident parrot - which can be vocal at times, I personally loved It! Our room was on the top floor.. 71 steps to be precise!! The room itself was spacious and beautifully decorated. It was clean and was cleaned daily throughout our stay. We had a large corner bath and a walk in shower - the only problem was the drainage and several times the shower overflowed. The receptionist couldn't be more helpful and attended and rectified the issue. Overall we both enjoyed our stay and would recommend to stay here. An enjoyable and comfortable stay. Thank you.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow amazing hotel in such a perfect location! Absolutely central to everything there is to see and do in Prague!! Such a grand hotel like many buildings in Prague with amazing features and decorations.staff so attentive and friendly and any slight problem was fixed straight away. Room plenty big enough and the bed so so comfy!! Shower excellent too! Breakfast was such variety to suit all nationalities and tastes! The man serving fresh pancakes, eggs, omelettes etc was fab and they tasted brill. The restaurant was a lovely relaxed atmosphere at any time of day! We often came back at the end of a busy day for a couple of drinks and was brill and good jazz music playing live too. Cannot fault the location and hotel at all really. The only negative was lack of complimentary coffee/tea facilities in the room. Really let it down for a 4 star hotel. Can’t beat a coffee or tea first thing in the morning! The was coffee maker but additional cost! Apart from that would recommend fully! Good group of men running the hotel
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found this place with a friends Recomendation. It is situated really well just by Charles Bridge, close to all the activities restaurants an bars. The hotel was easy to find an checking in took just 5 mins the room was of a good size an reasonably clean, great bathroom with walking shower. However at night it was noisy. Went to the loo in the evening dint put the light on as I knew were every thing was an I touched the toilet bowl it was very sticky an dirty on the outside it left a funny impression on me. Decor is classic an staff very attentive.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived late on Friday night and were pleasantly surprised to see a 24 hour receptionist who was extremely helpful and quick. Our room was on the first floor so it wasn't too much of a stretch to climb the stairs (no lift). I booked the triple deluxe room, it wasn't what I imagined it to be (spacious) but it was enough for x2 people. It became apparent that the hotel pet (the parrot) would be quite noisy in the mornings, so much so it woke me up. That is my only criticism. I can't fault the hotel. The restaurant and staff were super friendly and very attentive to our needs. The hotel is smack bang in the middle of everything and a two minute walk to the St Charles bridge. Great stay for my partners birthday so thank you.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Awesome breakfast and friendly staff. Beautiful rooms and restaurant got "soul" with diffrent styled tables. In breakfast there was sparkling wine, fresh omelettes and pancakes. It was on top 3 from all hotels we have been.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1) easy booking with Booking.com or Trip Advisor2) smack down in central Prague of Karlova street (pedestrian walkway)3) friendly staff, and some upper end suutes are pretty fancy4) great free breakfastNote: entrance at rearEnjoy !!
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved my stay here. Perfect location next to Charles Bridge, very good breakfast. The room was amazing, very stylish, modern and clean. There's no elevator so make sure that you bring your boyfriend to help you to carry your luggage upstairs
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Be aware that the Residence is actually three properties, but the reception and breakfast are at the Aneska location. This means that you have a 5-10 minute walk to breakfast, or if you want to store your luggage after checkout.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked the 2 bedroom family suite for our family weekend trip to Prague, which was the perfect choice for us.The rooms were nice and clean and well appointed with a TV in each room, a coffee maker and complimentary water. Large bathroom with nice amenities.We loved the generous and delicious breakfast buffet every morning and enjoyed the welcome cocktail.The location was another plus and allowed us to be very flexible in our daily planning.We kept the windows closed at night and were not disturbed by any street noise. Since each room was equipped with a fan we were able to stay cool at night.Excellent value for money and a lot of charm... I would come back here in a heartbeat.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My fiance and I had an excellent breakfast (2 mornings) in this lovely and old restaurant 2 weeks ago! Lots of sweet and salt food, ice cream and wine are also available! Omelettes are express made! The team are very gentle and quick! The location is a very old building, they have arranged the old courtyard which is covered in case of rain, with lots of plants and sun light- The costs are low, the bread is delicious! The building is also a little hotel, they also have some independent rooms in a building in the old Jewish district JOvanov, where we stayed, very calm and modern furnitures!
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located in the very heart of Prague, walking a few minutes you have the charles bridge , the river trips , the restaurants, the Hard Rock Cafe the views and everything .I have to mention that they have a really customer service& brand oriented manager , his name is Alex and I'm sure he cares About the guest's experience , he tries and knows how to solve situations.The rooms are very nice , the breakfast is delicious , they offer a lot of options , including sushi and prosecco .I highly recommend this hotel even though we had to deal with a particular waiter who was very aggressive with my wife asking for his tip .
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This little gem is located in the old town and within walking distance to almost all the must see attractions like Charles Bridge, Prague Palace, etc. in Prague. The hotel staff are most friendly and helpful. We were 'welcomed' by the hottest summer (according to the locals). The kind staff offered to change our booking to a room with AC although we've booked one without. The room was spacious for even 3 of us. It's an old (very old) building converted into a hotel. Our room was facing the Main Street, hence, if you are light sleeper, you should request for the room with the opposite facing to avoid the noise. There was no elevator, The breakfast buffet was good, they even serve bubble drinks for breakfast. ; )Will certainly come back again!
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is all about the little things when staying in hotels. From the way people welcome you on arrival. To the cleanliness of the rooms, to little snack trays in the reception, to the local hotel parrott. Yes U malvaze has all these and more. I should probably mention that it is 100m from Karlsbridge and on the main walking street.We really enjoyed our stay! Thank you!
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Alex at the front desk is one of the hardest working, most concerned for your interests people I have met. The rooms are spacious, the breakfast is fantastic, you are steps away from Charles Bridge. Two musicians play guitar and violin while you sip Pilsner Urquell (I can't confirm, but it tastes better here) at the restaurant at night. Good rates.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Break with 5 friends for 50th celebrations.Great location next to Charles Bridge.Airport transfer available.Excellent buffet breakfast.Adjoining restaurant.Clean rooms with facility for 3 sharingLuggage storage on arrival before check in.Airconditioning.Endearing but noisy parrot...Oscar who was quiet at bedtime.Reception and administration lacking in respect of communication and effectiveness.Different price for taxi home not communicated.. was significantly more expensiveTried to charge taxi to hotel twice..no records of monies received.Just minor things but significant when additional cost involved.Best asset is its location.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is clearly unbeatable.Very kind staff and very nice friend Oscar the parrot.Summer garden for a good and complete breakfast.Only problem it does not have lift.The restaurant at night is also good.Private airport transfer at 25€ standard price in Prague.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Did not stay at the hotel but had my fantastic breakfast there each time during my 3 days stay in Prague. Great hospitality, kind and nice service. Great location, in old city 2 min walking to Charles Bridge.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Right in the middle of Stare Mesto, the old town, on Karlova (Charles) street only a few meters from Charles Bridge and a few hundred meters from Old town square. Quick and friendly check-in. We stayed on the third floor and the climbing was a bit challenging. There was no elevator and the wooden stairs with varying heights needs your attention. There is a restaurant as well with live music on weekends. The breakfast, which includes in the room price was tasty and excellent with lot of choices, omelettes to your liking. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a family suite with two bedrooms. A spacious bathroom with bathrobes.If you have windows facing the Karlova street you can count on some noise from the street even at night time. Prague in May is full of tourists, and the room prices a rather high and you better prepare for a lot of queuing when visiting the plentiful sights of Prague. For easy traveling in the city be sure to buy a one day or three day ticket, which is valid in buses, trams and metro.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose U Malvaze, although a bit more expensive and less showy than similar hotels, due to the location near the famous Charles Bridge. We cannot imagine we were so lucky. You can reach the hotel from the airport by bus 119 that will leave you at its last stop at the metro. You must take Line city direction and drop out at Malostranska. You will reach the hotel walking for 5 minutes. This is the cheaper solution but you can also ask the hotel for a taxi that will pick up you at the fixed price of 25 Euros for up to 4 persons. Then location is the best you can desire. You do not need to buy any ticket for bus or metro nor to catch any taxi. You can easy reach every place of interest just walking. Also the castle is at 20-30 minutes walking distance.When we arrived there was a little delay in preparing one of the two rooms we have booked....they offered free bevarages for all of us (we were 4 people). All the personnel is very friendly and ready for your requests. You have to meet the owner, a very nice guy, who can help you to plan your stay at his best. The hotel has a very good and typical restaurant with regional food. You will get your breakfast in a winter garden; its roof can be opened in sunny days.The rooms are larger than usual, clean and confortable. It is very near to a five stars hotel.Well, in conclusion it was the perfect choice.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great hotel , my wife and I have just had four fantastic days in Prague on the start of a mini tour ( Prague , Vienna, Bratislava and Budapest) .The Hotel is at the back of the restaurant if you enter from what is essentially the main walkway from the Charles Bridge to the Old town Square where the Astronomical Clock is . This is such a great base for seeing all the main sights . The room was a very good standard with a super walk in shower , very modern. The room has a mini bar and also a coffee machine no kettle when we asked for one it arrived with two large cups and was no bother at all .very friendly staff .We had the breakfast option and found it filled us enough not to need lunch . As the restaurant is there we ate there in the evening . The Manager Aleksandar was excellent helping us to book our onward travel , recommended the coach to Vienna. At €15 each I was a little sceptical but wow what a service very much like a good airline free drinks and an entertainment screen in the headrest .The Hotel has a great charm with lots of great antique furniture around . It also has a Parrot whoLives in the reception . Would recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to see the sights and sounds of Prague.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best location in Prague. One minute walking to Charles Bridge and five minutes to Old Town Hall.Wonderful staff, very friendly and helpful.The room was big, modern and very clean with all the facilities.Very good and fresh breakfast.Thank you Alex (hotel manager). Everything was great.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this hotel was perfect - I could not fault that. We was so close to the Charles Bridge and only a short walk into the centre with all the lovely restaurants and bars. Breakfast in the morning was lovely, as well as the restaurant that's below were we had a great traditional Czech dinner. Our double room was quiet and comfortable, the beds extremely comfy and the shower was great too. The hotel was amazing apart from one morning we headed down for breakfast and as we returned to our room there was three strange men in there. It was quite a shock and to be honest quite scary as we had no pre warnings from the hotel. The men had come into our room to change the sink in the bathroom but having no communication from management to warn us wasn't great as our money and passports were laying on the bed. It's a shame as it did put us off staying again if we ever come back...Overall, amazing location and a great hotel. I just wish we didn't have that hiccup otherwise it would of been an absolutely perfect holiday.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent u Malvaze 3 great days and no matter how hard I would try, there is nothing to complain about. Room was just great and well equipped, breakfast tasty and service kind and helpful. Everything was clean. No words needed if it comes to localization - what can you say about Residence located 100 meters from Charles Bridge? During next trip to Prague we will definitely consider u Malvaze again!
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was very good indeed; large, well appointed with an air of luxury. The staff were all very welcoming and put themselves out to be helpful.
