The buffet breakfast was also very good, as was the service from the bar in the evening. The hotel is just at the end of the Charles Bridge and is very central to all tourist destinations in Prague. It is in a busy position, so if you are looking for tranquility this might not be for you. Given that we were there to see the sights, so it was great for us. Double glazing meant we were disturbed at night. I would recommend to friends.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with my boyfriend from the 28th of January until the 1st of February. I could not fault this hotel at all. On arrival our check in was very relaxing and our bags where brought up to our room as there is no lift. The hotel provided breakfast which was very nice. A wide variety to choose from. It was my boyfriends birthday whilst we where there and I asked the hotel to organise a cake. They done so, free of charge. I would highly recommended this hotel as it's location is perfect, rooms are spacious and the staff are very friendly.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Residence U Malvaze is very close to Charles Bridge and old city town. Easy to walk and see whole city. Plus, room is very cozy and clean. The staff is very polite. Definetly, recommend to stay as U visit Prague
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Whilst visiting Prague went into U Malvaze for food was absolutely lovely. Staff were very friendly. Couldn't fault anything. Will be visiting again and looking at the rooms we will be looking at staying at the hotel too.
hotelName:
14    Residence U Malvaze
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Traveling a lot rarely have I come across a hotel with such a friendly welcome and care. It's the first impression that strikes you and experienced throughout our short stay,will be back for sure Thank you Paula thank you Thomas. You really went out of your way to make us feel comfortable . Furthermore the hotel is very well located , charming , clean and spacious rooms . Will recommend it to my friends and family . Keep it up bravo
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After two days travel to get to Prague by air from New Zealand the staff at Hotel Residence Agnes looked after our every need. As first time visitors to Prague at the end of May we felt well looked after by fabulous hosts. H& N Gerbic
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were excellent from the moment we arrived. They are the friendliest and most accommodating staff that I have ever experienced and made a huge difference to our visit. The hotel is well positioned within a short walk to the main square. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All of the positive reviews here are true - this small hotel is clean, beautiful, comfortable; air conditioning was very much appreciated during the recent heat wave. The breakfast buffet is phenomenal w/the usual plus homemade sweets. But what really sets this hotel apart is the service and warm welcome you feel the moment you set foot in the door. I have stayed in six other hotels in the past five months in Rome, Vienna, Budapest and Cesky-Krumlov, and the staff at this hotel surpassed all of the others in regards to friendly hospitality. Warmth and friendliness extended to my sister and her husband, who stayed around the corner at a different hotel (foolish!). Airport pick-up appreciated, also! To the staff - thank you!!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Agnes hotel for three nights.The staff is amazing. You feel pampered and welcomed all the time. They greet you with a great smile and offer all kinds of drinks from water to wine/ beer whenever you come in. It was very appreciated especially after spending few hours in a hot city.They helped us with our five hours tour arrangment.My brother's family joined us for a tour and they were welcomed for complimentary breakfast.We had a great time.We were offered a free shuttle to all points of interest.Our rooms were very clean, comfortable and nicely decorated.We would definitely recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot tell you what a difference it makes to come to a new city and experience this level of wonderful customer service. One feels right at home, safe, and happy! And not only is the service amazing - kind, helpful, intuitive but the hotel is lovely, perfectly situated, and has a delicious buffet breakfast. There is a reason it is rated number one on TripAdvisor most of the time. My dream trip with my daughter ended up with me sick and sending my husband in my place and the hotel Agnes made their visit absolutely perfect. I highly highly recommend this hotel. Thank you Hotel Agnes!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just returned from 4 nights at Hotel Residence Agnes and cannot rave enough about our stay. The entire staff is wonderful and their attentiveness to your needs is exceptional. The hotel is perfectly situated in the city, within easy walking distance to the major sights.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Residence Agnes for four nights in mid-June 2019. The hotel exceeded our expectations, which were already high after reading positive reviews here and elsewhere.Location: The Agnes, with its inviting pink facade, is located on a small side street in the old section of Prague. Because there was very little vehicular traffic, it was peaceful, and there was no noise from other guest rooms. Old Town Square and the Jewish Quarter were approximately ten minutes away by foot, and several excellent restaurants were well within walking distance.Room: Our room was toward the rear of the third floor, easily accessible by elevator or stairs. It was excellent, with a comfortable bed, ample storage, strong A/C, and a modern bathroom. Storage around the sink was a bit limited, but that was only a minor concern.Common areas: The central lobby housed comfortable tables and chairs that provided overflow seating during breakfast or a place to rest on our way in. We did this many times, stopping to chat with staff and other guests while enjoying complimentary drinks and snacks.Breakfast: This was a highlight, with a broad selection of cheeses, cereals, fresh and cut fruit, cakes, eggs, and bread, among other food offerings. Although the meal was served buffet-style, staff brought juice, coffee, tea, and other items to our table.Service: I concur with others who've claimed that this was the best they've experienced anywhere. We were greeted immediately upon arrival and seated in the lobby, given drinks, asked what we would like to do in Prague, and offered suggestions for sights and tours with no pressure. Staff were genuinely interested in serving our needs throughout our stay, on one occasion delivering a pitcher of cold water to our room at no charge. Their restaurant recommendations were uniformly excellent, an all our questions were answered cheerfully. On our day of departure, we were even driven to the Prague train station — the driver refused our tip.We loved Prague, and will certainly return to the Agnes when we come back.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What makes this hotel one of the best we’ve ever stayed in is the exceptional service from everyone we encountered during our stay. We were there 3 nights in early June. From the pickup at the airport to the drop off at the train station, we couldn’t have asked for anything better. Restaurant recommendations/reservations, transportation around town, bottles of water when heading out, friendly faces and more. We overslept the last day and didn’t have time for breakfast. They wanted to pack us something to take with us. Location is great as well. Would highly recommend Hotel Residence Agnes to anyone going to Prague.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As many others have stated, I booked this hotel after the reviews from TripAdvisor. They have the best customer service of any hotel I have ever booked. There are not enough good things to say about the staff and the excellent service. They helped us with our excursions, getting around in the city, recommending which ATMs to use; and recommendations for restaurants. We visited Karlstejn castle, Prague Castle, Kutna Hora and took the Jazz Boat for dinner one night. They arranged transportation for us to get to every excursion. One day, due to the very excessive heat, they even suggested that we call the hotel to arrange for a pick up from the drop point of our excursion. Should we have the opportunity to visit Prague again, we will be staying at Hotel Residence Agnes. This is a small hotel which allows them to provide excellent service.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We picked this boutique hotel after reviewing TA and stayed for 3 nights for my family. It was the right choice and the hotel although small and does not have any spa or recreation centre or swimming pool, you will feel you live in your own home with super friendly, warm and helpful staff. They picked you up from airport and made wonderful recommendations on tourist spots and restaurants. The friendly driver will send you to the Prague Castle and restaurants. When we decided to go to see the Church of Bones in Kutna Hora for day trip, the driver sent us to the main train station and helped us to buy train tickets and picked us up when we returned, all FOC. The hotel is located within short walking distance to the Old Town Square, Astronomical Clock and Charles Bridge. Our rooms are clean, nice and cosy with free drinks and snacks in the fridge. Breakfast variety is good and wifi is excellent too. You will be offered free drinks and snacks each time you return to hotel. The most wonderful thing is that they do free laundry for you on daily basis. On checking out, they asked us to pack any food from breakfast stretch and sent us to car rental to pick up our car. I think you can't find a better hotel with such superb service and friendly staff than this in Prague!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the absolute pleasure of staying at this lovely hotel. From the moment we arrived we were greeted by the most wonderful staff who went out of their way to make our experience exceptional. They gave wonderful suggestions for tour and restaurants and booked everything for us. We have stayed at many wonderful places but the service here was beyond compare. The room was large, clean and very comfortable. The breakfast was the best we have ever seen. The hosts made our first visit to this lovely city one we will never forget. We will definitely be back.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Hotel Residence Agnes for two nights. It was a perfect way to begin our trip to Europe. Everyone on the staff is amazingly friendly. Upon arriving, we were immediately offered beer and wine, and each time we returned to the hotel from our walks around Prague the greeting was equally enthusiastic and warm. The breakfast buffet was extensive and included spinach and mushroom quiche, a wide selection of fruits, bacon and ham, and assorted breads. The hotel is located in the Jewish Quarter of Prague, within walking distance of the Old Town Square. We found this location to be ideal, because it is close enough to the touristy areas, yet tucked away on a side street so that the atmosphere was quiet. The hotel has a driver who will take guests to the various attractions.If you want a comfortable, hassle-free stay, this is the place for you!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in Prague for a week the first of June. I booked the Hotel Residence Agnes based on the good reviews. From our arrival at the front door, we were welcomed and made comfortable. We got several great suggestions for our stay and enjoyed everything. We were given a large, clean room with modern bath, huge bed and little street noise. The hosts were so warm and friendly, funny and with excellent English. The included breakfast is one of the best I've had anywhere. They went out of their way to assist us navigate this wonderful city where they are centrally located.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Residences Agnes was our home away from home. The staff was the most welcoming, accommodating and helpful we have ever encountered. Upon arrival, we were offered a refreshment in the courtyard lobby and a concierge sat with us to provide an introduction to the city. Throughout our stay the staff was happy to offer recommendations, make restaurant reservations, purchase tour/concert/train tickets, arrange for a hotel driver to take or pick us up from a destination within the city, and so much more. Thank you Hotel Residences Agnes for a wonderful stay!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After reading the reviews for this hotel, we decided to book for 4 nights to celebrate my birthday. Before we left I emailed the hotel for restaurant recommendations and they were very helpful and informative. The room we booked gave us a free transfer from the airport which was fantastic and removed the stress of getting into the city. On arrival we were given a glass of wine and the receptionist was very helpful in recommending places to see and things to do during our stay. The room was very modern and comfortable and had a fridge with free drinks and snacks which was a nice touch. The breakfast was excellent with lots of fresh fruit and pastries as well as hot food. The hotel has a free shuttle service which takes you anywhere in the city as long as you book the day before. After a long day exploring the city, as soon as you walk into reception you are offered a free drink. The hotel is right in the centre and close to all the city highlights. The biggest plus about this hotel are the staff, everyone is super helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. They all go above and beyond to ensure their guests are well looked. If you visit Prague stay here it’s fantastic
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed two nights at this hotel and the staff went out of their way to make you feel welcome. The room was immaculate and very comfortable. There are no tea or coffee making facilities in the room but that didn’t matter one bit as the staff provide complementary drinks down in the lobby any time of day. I would recommend printing out a map if you’re walking from the train station. There are lots of winding streets but it’s a brilliant location once you’re there. Definitely worthy of its great reviews!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just been fortunate to stay in this amazing hotel for 5 nights. Nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast spread in the morning was amazing with everything you could possibly want. They even went to a local bakery to get me fresh gluten free bread. We were greeted on arrival by Paula who i cannot speak highly enough. She organised a walking tour for us with a guide and there was only 4 of us on the tour. So much better than the tour we saw with a guide here almost 50 people. All drinks are complimentary and we met a lot of amazing people whilst having local wines. The amazing attitude of the staff rubbed off on all the guests and I can honestly say we would be very hard pressed to find another hotel like it. Please visit Prague is a beautiful city and the Agnes hotel enhanced our visit
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very nice hotel in a great location. It is just outside the Old Town but a 5/10 minute walk to the Old Town Square. As it is slightly out of the Old Town it is in a nice quiet area. We asked for a quiet room and could hear no noise either from outside or from the other rooms. The staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome and nothing is too much trouble for them. If you wanted, they would get you tickets, book restaurants and even run you where you wanted to go! We booked the shuttle to and from the airport and it was excellent. There are some lovely touches such as complimentary tea, coffee, water, beer and wine 24/7. We like to be able to make tea and coffee in our room and, although it is not standard, they happily provided a kettle, cups etc for us to use. The breakfast is extensive and excellent, hot food, cereals,sweet good etc - even cherries picked from the managers(owner?) garden! The only reason for 4 rather than 5 stars is that, although the rooms are clean and comfortable (we had a deluxe double) I expected a bit more luxury for the price. Similarly, the bathroom was clean and spacious but quite basic. All in all though, a very nice hotel and we would stay there again if we returned to Prague.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Probably the friendliest place we've ever been. The staff make you feel extremely welcome and willing to help anytime. The location is great and if you add the complementary breakfast it make the Agnes one of the best places to stay in Prague.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic hotel in residential area within walking distance to all the sights in Prague. The hotel staff were superb and without a doubt makes this place special . Hated to leave at the end of our trip.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for five nights and had an amazing time. The staff is consistently over-to-top helpful and friendly. Room was clean and well appointed. The breakfast was terrific and well stocked with delicious food. We would 100% stay here again during our next trip to Prague.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can't say enough about this hotel. The location is fabulous, central to walk everywhere in Prague. The rooms are spacious by European standards and the bathrooms are modern. The staff are what really make it outstanding though. They go above and beyond to make you feel welcome. Throughout the day, everytime you walk in the door you are offered a drink or a snack--even though it's billed as a bed and breakfast. The breaksfast is simply amazing, all made in-house and the quality and variety rivals much bigger hotels. If I'm fortunate enough to get back to Prague, I know where I'll be staying!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we were picked up at the airport everything was wonderful. The free transfer is included if you stay three nights or more and we also had a lift up to the castle one day and to the station on the day we left. The location is excellent, a short walk to the main square but in a quiet and attractive area. You are offered coffee or wine etc. every time the staff see you which you can drink in the stylish atrium/foyer/reception area. Our room was spacious and well equipped, breakfast is beautiful and housekeeping immaculate. The standout feature is the staff, so genuine and friendly and helpful without being overpowering or cloying in any way.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I write infrequent reviews but the service and friendliness of Hotel Agnes deserves a shout out. From the moment you arrive, you are made to feel like their most important visitors with a staff member offering you a beer or glass of wine at no charge, while inquiring if you need help with tours, tickets or reservations. We had pre-arranged our tours but the staff was very helpful in recommending restaurants and bars and even securing reservations for us, where necessary. The hotel is well-located within easy walking distance of the old town square and the Charles Bridge and is quiet and well-maintained. Rooms are on the small side but are pristine. Breakfast, included in the room charge, has everything you could want from fresh fruit and yogurt to scrambled eggs, cheeses, pastries and sausages. I cannot overstate how fabulous the staff is! Hotel Agnes is a textbook example of how a great hotel should be run.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Every thing at this Hotel is great !!!The price worth every euro that you pay.It starts and ends at the staff, that is ready to do everything for the guestTHE MANAGMENT IS PERFECTSMALLTHE OWNERS ARE SOO PROFESSIONAL AND HONEST
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The greeting received is so welcoming. Staff cannot do enough for their guests to ensure they get the very best out of their visit to Prague. They recommend restaurants, their driver will take you to venues, help with trams and taxis if late in the evening. We felt we were staying with a family who looked after our every need. Thank you Hotel Residence Agnes especially Paula and Frank, your attention to detail was hugely appreciated and you went over board to make our stay so special. Anyone looking for a place to stay in Prague, this is an absolute gem and we highly recommend it to you all.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful, customer oriented business. Service excellent from the moment we walked in. Paula greeted us and set us up with dining, tour and shopping options, woke up to a wonderful breakfast with more than one could want including German pastries, also comfortable, well appointed room. They take every step to be sure visitors are welcome. We will return here if we come again and highly recommend.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can’t say enough positive things about this extraordinary hotel in Prague. Very well run by Frank and excellent service from Paula, Clara, Martin and Lucas (and others). Perfect attention to detail, transport to sites and restaurants and beer and wine welcome. I would not stay anywhere else in Prague.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I switched to this hotel at short notice after reading all the glowing reviews and I am so glad we did. We were greeted by Frank and Paula on arrival and they made us feel so welcome. We were offered a glass of wine and beer and Paula gave us a really helpful talk about Prague and showed us where to visit.The whole team at the hotel go above and beyond what is expected and really want your stay to be a great experience. The breakfast buffet each day was outstanding and our room on the fourth floor was beautifully decorated and comfortable.Residence Agnes definately earns it's 5* reviews. If only all hotels offered this level of service! You really must stay here to appreciate this wonderful hotel and the amazing city of Prague.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed there on May 2019 because of many great reviews on Tripadvisor and all of them have true. Excellent helpfull staff, great location, wine at lobby free whole stay. Manager is really great guy as well. Have to come back again as soon as possible. Thank you!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you Frank, Natalie and Clara for welcoming us to your amazing residence! From the moment we were picked up at the airport until the moment we were delivered to Budapest, everyone treated us like family. The welcoming glass of wine and "Agnes" heart gingerbread cookie, instantly made us feel at home. Your breakfast buffet was the best, with fresh home made pastries, fruits and coffee. Having someone available at all times to take us to dinner or deliver us to wherever we wanted to go was above and beyond what anyone would expect. Thank you for making our visit to Prague incredible!!!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was definitely the best hotel stay I've ever had. The sincere, warm hospitality shines through every aspect of the Hotel Residence Agnes. Each and every time we entered the hotel, we got a friendly greeting and were offered something to eat and drink in the beautiful atrium lounge. The breakfast array was stunning. Our pretty 2nd floor room looked out on a quiet street. We had opted for the larger, 'triple' room, which had a comfy king size bed plus a couch that could fold out. While we don't spend a lot of time in the room while traveling, it is nice to have a good place to sit when we do. Room and bath were spotless, as is the rest of the hotel. The location is perfect. Central to everything, yet quiet as can be. The provided excellent advice and recommendations, and arranged tours and concerts that we were interested in. We look forward to returning to Prague, and we will most definitely plan to stay again at Hotel Residence Agnes.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Genuinely probably the best hotel we have ever stayed at, service on another level!!We can't thank the staff at Agnes enough for making our four day stay with them truly special. All of the staff were so friendly and helpful going above and beyond to make our stay in Prague unforgettable.We had such high expectations of Agnes based on the numerous glowing reviews on TA that I was actually a little concerned that it wasn't going to live up to it's reputation but I shouldn't have worried because in actual fact we were blown away by how great it was.On our last day we had a ridiculously early flight back home and the owner arranged a complimentary transfer at 4 in the morning back to the airport so that we wouldn't have to mess around trying to find a taxi....just one small example of how awesome he and the team at Agnes are.If you are thinking about visiting Prague you really have to stay at this amazing hotel.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As two couples we spent a week exploring Prague and the broader area. The hotel made our trip exceptional every day from the moment they picked us up at the airport. They recommended a variety of restaurants, made and confirmed the reservations, and transported us if we desired. They arranged a car and driver for a day trip and devised the itinerary to visit castles and a medieval village.The breakfast buffet was abundant and delicious, with some of the baked goods available all day. Whenever we returned they greeted us warmly, wanted to know about our day, and offered us beverages (including beer and wine) to relax and unwind. The rooms had high ceilings and tall windows and were spacious for Europe. The bathroom was updated and spotless, although not much storage space for toiletries. The bed was made up as a king and was comfortable. I would have preferred a king duvet but we had two twin duvets (I did not ask for a king duvet). The hotel is 6 minute walk from Old Town Square yet it was so quiet!All of the staff and the owner were fabulous with special praise to Klara, Paula, Stephan and Franck. We felt like they were family by the time we had to depart.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: HiHad a great stay in January. Left 14 january. Could not pick up dry cleaning as shop closed. Hotel posted to me. Thought lost. Must have been on a slow boat. Arrived 30th April. Thanks plava Never should have doubted you when I contacted end of February.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I have traveled fairly extensively .One always hopes for a good experience when you enter an accommodation.From the moment you enter Hotel Residence Agnes, you are treated to an unbelievable experience. The receptionist, greets you, asks if you would like a wine,beer,or something else, and then sits with you and reviews what you want to do in Prague. She then arranges your tours, concert tickets, and dinner reservations. I cannot say enough about the staff and owner.They go above and beyond! The breakfast buffet was astounding ! During breakfast, staff comes around to,offer you even more delicacies! Twice the owner walked us to different sites in the neighborhood- he even escorted us to astore where we purchased beautiful Bohemian glass!Prague is a beautiful city, made even more satisfying by our experience in this wonderful hotel and their incredible service team- thank you Paula, and Frank, and all of you!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is by far the best hotel I ve ever stayed and I am comparing it to Grand Tourism +5 stars hotels- all inclusive; this super cute and small but very unique hotel has an exquisite service; their staff are extremely kind. They could have an Agnes Hotel in every city of the world and I would actually stay at! Included breakfast is wide in options, delicious in every bite!! Tastes like homemade food, ( Compared to Coffee & just bread) that mostly all hotels give you) This is a must. This is the best hotel in Prague. I will come back for sure.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This lovely small hotel has it all. Great location, service that can’t be beat from the wait staff, transportation, desk/ concierge etc. We had 4 rooms for 4 well travelled couples.the king size beds are very comfortable w air conditioning if needed. We wished we could have stayed longer.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just had a fantastic stay at this lovely hotel, which is in a great location. The staff are faultless. They are friendly, polite and super efficient. Nothing is too much trouble for them. We have stayed in many hotels over the world but have never received such wonderful service, including from some expensive luxury hotels. The staff are unobtrusive but always ready to assist with free shuttle service, advice regarding things to see and good restaurants.We were greeted warmly from the moment we arrived and offered complimentary beer and wine every time we entered the lobby. This was very welcome, particularly after a long day sightseeing in the beautiful city of Prague. The hotel is situated perfectly, close to everything but in a quiet spot.The rooms, although not having the very latest technology, have everything you need for a comfortable stay. They are modern rooms so don't expect character and tradition. The beds are huge.Breakfast is fantastic, loads of options and attentive service in a pleasant room.If you want a reasonably priced hotel that is clean and comfortable, with superb service, in a quiet but central location, this is the hotel for you. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is amazing. If you ever go to Prague, then I suggest staying here. Small independent run hotel and with every attention to detail and fantastic service..... and I’m a right fussy git Really can not fault the place
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location, a lovely hotel with staff who are so really very kind and friendly, they make your staff perfect from start to finish. The complimentary hotel driver will take you to restaurants, do pick ups from the airport etc and the breakfast buffet is fabulous with a massive choice. NOTHING is too much trouble for the team, they really want you to enjoy your stay. They will recommend places to visit, book restaurants for you and take care of every little detail. Then its complimentary soft and alcholic drinks in the foyer after your days out so you can chat with other guests making your stay so much more intimate than a larger hotel. Its so right to give them a 5 star the entire team from front of house to the chefs and cleaners make this such a very special place and a great experience. Thank you from Mr & Mrs Liverpool!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Like the other reviews we could not believe ghe amazing service and attention to detail provided by the hotel staff. One of the best features was the free transport around the city. Thank you everyone.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 4 nights here during first visit to Prague.Perfect location for walking to Old Town Square and famous bridge, but with little supermarket and local bars and restaurants on doorstep.From booking to check out we were treated with such kindness and friendliness, receiving a free airport transfer and free taxi drop offs to places of interest,which we could not reach by walking.Lovely room and large bathroom, all spotlessly clean with everything you need. Delicious buffet breakfast with every sort of hot and cold food you could wish for.Complimentary tea/ coffee in the foyer on return everyday - and always a lovely welcome from staff.Have stayed in many hotels, but never had this degree of genuine hospitality. Would definitely return.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are like me who likes to research and read a lot of reviews before deciding where to stay, please do yourself a favor. Stop wasting your time researching for places to stay when visiting Prague. Book your accommodation at Residence Agnes. You will not be disappointed. Great location. Well appointed rooms. The service ?? Awesome !!!!! We have stayed at five star hotels before but have never felt the personal touch you feel when you stay here. All the review regarding the service at this hotel are true 100% All the staff is extremely courteous and go out of their way to make your stay memorable and stress free. We were a family of four and stayed in the family room which was spacious. The breakfast buffet was lavish. Special thanks to Frank, the owner, for making our stay in Prague memorable.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The wonderful experience started with reservations and the help with pickup at airport, Ideas and suggestions of what to see, made dinner and show reservations. The breakfasts were over the top with homemade pastries, fruit eggs, cheeses and meets. WOW! The friendliness of the staff was a wow as well. The room was perfect in everyway. I will definitely stay here next visit.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we were picked up from the airport to the moment we left we felt welcomed and taken care of. Nothing was too much trouble. We loved our stay so much that we have booked to return at the end of the year. The location is perfect. The breakfast was delicious but really it is the people that make it a special place to stay. Paula was utterly charming, she was especially kind to our children. We were collected from the airport and taken back (complimentary of booking directly with the hotel). We also enjoyed complimentary lifts to Prague Castle and the Ice Bar one evening. Paula also booked us concert tickets which made everything easy. One of my favourite elements was that you can enjoy a glass of wine or a beer in the lobby area (again this is included). Prague is a truly magical destination and this is a magical place to stay.Thank you for having us.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The folks at Hotel Residence Agnes give a warm welcome to their guests, helping in every way possible. In 50 years of traveling, never have I discovered such a high level of hospitality - not just upon arrival, but throughout our entire stay. Other travelers we met there agreed - the level of service and hospitality provided was truly exceptional and unlike anything we had previously experienced.Frank, the owner/manager, and EVERY employee at Hotel Residence Agnes, are truly focused on customer service and satisfaction. We arrived hours before the stated check-in time given an early flight from Budapest. Frank showed us to the dining room and invited us to partake in the buffet breakfast. One of his associates, Klara, brought us a map and discussed our plans and interests, as well as made some suggestions. They kept our luggage and Frank personally drove us to the National Museum, all before we even checked in or got in the room! (The Hotel was fully booked). They even washed a bag of laundry for us.On the day we checked out, we had a very early flight at the airport- Frank arranged for a car service to take us (complimentary). His night staff even prepared a bag breakfast for each of us, as we departed before the breakfast buffet was open. To summarize, Hotel Residence Agnes truly provides much more than a room - they provide hospitality extraordinaire!The rooms we had were large, clean and well kept. The hotel is located in the old town - just a short walk to the Astronomical Clock. We found the location very convenient to the main sites. There are lots of restaurants nearby. About a 5 minute walk away is Mikulka’s Pizzeria - good pizza at a reasonable price. One night got a carry-out pizza and ate at one of the many tables in the hotel lobby, with complimentary beverages provided by the gracious hosts at Hotel Residence Agnes.They provided some other transportation as well during our stay - to the Jazz Boat one night; to a shop to buy a cheap suitcase one day.At the reception desk, they have a community “tip jar” which is shared among all staff. This was very convenient to leave the collective tip for all of them at check out. Superior service and superior hospitality warrants a generous tip!Thanks to everyone at Hotel Residence Agnes!You are the best.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this lovely small hotel for a weekend trip to Prague. I chose the hotel based upon the amazing reviews of the service. Therefore it is only fair that I leave a review as well.Please stay here.... the staff are so lovely and helpful, they really do go the extra mile.We arrived quite late on the Friday evening and were met by a lovely receptionist who offered us a drink and sat with us and talked us through the city map and marked out a suggested route for exploring the city the following day. She also made a reservation for dinner at a traditional fine dining restaurant for us. The hotel owner gave us free funicular tickets and even dropped us off there in the morning. We had a room on the 4th floor which was nice and spacious. So, the decor is a little plain and there aren’t the usual 5 star additions of a coffee machine etc, but the rooms are clean, spacious, and perfectly adequate for sleeping. Remember, this is a listed building so they cant make many changes. After all, on a city break how much time do you spend in your room anyway?Breakfast was amazing, so many things to choose from, and the staff are so friendly. There is no bar or restaurant that caters for dinner in the hotel but everything at breakfast was freshly baked ( bread, cakes, pastries etc) and lots of hot food plus cereals and fruit.We can’t recommend this little hotel enough. Amazing service and super friendly and helpful staff. They even drop you off at the airport.Thank you Hotel Agnes
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have had the most perfect stay here at Residence Agnes. We’ve traveled in many places, no other hotel can compare to the service provided by Frank and his entire staff! The rooms are large, beautiful, clean, quiet...but it is the attention to detail and impeccable service extended to every guest that truly makes this hotel stand tall above any other hotel we have ever visited. The complimentary beverages and snacks offered each time you walk into the lobby, the fabulous breakfast buffet, assistance in every detail of your visit, everything was wonderful and perfect. The only downside is that we have to leave and can’t imagine any other hotel stays could ever measure up! We must check out today to continue our trip and we are a little sad to leave, feeling like we are saying goodbye to friends. Thank you to all our friends at Residence Agnes! We will visit Prague again just to come see you!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can honestly say this was the best City I’ve ever visited.The hotel,the people and so much to do.We stayed at the Hotel Renaissance Agnes just a couple of minutes from the main square the staff were sooooo nice and helpful they could.nt do more for us if they tried,they waited on us hand and foot.Drinks,food a driver if we wanted to go anywhere nothing was a problem.The hotel itself is so well done out room are beautiful and big.The Road is cobbled and this features into the hotel reception and sitting area,lovely.As for Prague itself there,s so much to do.1.A walk to the Charles bridge is a must,the views from the bridge over the river to the castle on the hill are gorgeous (night time too)..2.the funicular railway up to Petrin and it’s tower and gardens.3.Vycherod with its fortress walls and church then walk down to the river and walk back .Too many to put in so just go it’s beautiful..
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: "Helpful" does not come close to describing our experience with this great hotel. From the moment we showed up, bedraggled and sleep-deprived, Pawla and her colleague went to extraordinary lengths to make us feel welcome. Immediately on our arrival, they gave us coffee and pastries. Every morning, we availed ourselves to a free breakfast, which included excellent fresh baked pastries, coffee, fresh juice, omelettes, fresh fruit, etc. Car service to various destinations is free (they also picked us up at the airport). But best of all, they gave the best advice on where to go, where to eat, and what to see. Truly they made this trip memorable. The hotel itself is quite small (about twenty rooms), and on a quiet street just five minutes walk from the Old Town and the Jewish Quarter. Exactly where you want to be, in other words. The rooms are nice, but not luxurious. All told, strongly, strongly recommended.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are very friendly and can't do enough for you. Great relaxing area in the atrium to meet and chat with other guests and exchange stories and restaurant recommendations. Breakfast was delicious and hotel is very handy for restaurant, bars and sightseeing. Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the pre-arrival information, friendly welcome, helpful navigation advice around Prague, central location in the Old Town area, comfortable room, there really is nothing to fault about this lovely hotel! Bottle water was freely available, Clara at reception was so helpful and even offered a driver to drop us off for an excursion which was unexpected but much appreciated. Breakfast was comprehensive with hot & cold food with their own baked goods. I only wished we had more time to stay longer here to enjoy their hospitality!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Residence Agnes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, you don't need to use any kind of transport to see every tourist destinations in the old part of the city. Apartment was clean and lovely. When I will go back to Prague sometime I will definitely choose City Nest Apartments again. I really recommend this place.
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Think it’s the best place to stay in Prague if you’re looking for an apartment for 4-5 days or even more. Just near to the Quadrio shopping center and 10 minutes from the Old town square and other attractions and facilities. Strongly suggested mostly for the staff, always polite and helpful. I’m probably going to come back there.
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a family of 3 adults. We were in Room 32. Very new, clean and spacious. Generous cutleries in nice kitchenette with mini fridge. Only thing lacking is shelving in shower closet to place bath amenities. 24 hour reception is great and definitely makes guests feel more secure.Area is good and very near supermarkets (DM, Tesco and Billa), good restaurants (Cafe Lourve, Creme de la creme, Polpo etc) and fast food (KFC and McDonalds). Hotel is 15 mins walk to old town square and 5 mins walk to Narodni Trida tram stop where you can take Tram 22 or 23 direct to Prague Castle. Plenty of options for coffee and pastry breakfast.Hotel also arranged English speaking driver to pick us from train station and send us to airport at affordable rates. Will definitely recommend to friends and family!
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently opened serviced apartments. Good location within walking distance of city centre and main train station, about 15 minutes each way. Good Dutch Pub directly across the road. Tesco and other food retailers within 100 metres. Plenty of restaurants around which are mostly inexpensive, good value. The apartments are well furnished, with large quality bed / mattress and pillows. The kitchen area is reasonably well equipped, with coffee and tea provided.The bathroom is clean and fitted with top quality German fittings, sink, shower and toilet. There is a 24 hour reception with nice coffee machine. The receptionists are friendly,polite and helpful. Strongly recommended.
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed at City Nest during our 4 day visit to Prague. The location is central and very easily walkable to all the major attractions. (25 Min Walk Prague Castle, 10 Min to Astronomical Clock, 15 Min Charles Bridge) There is also a Tesco located near buy so you can pick up groceries to store in the small kitchenette. The room was clean and the price was reasonable…but saying that comes with some caveats. First, the rooms (at least he one we stayed in) do not AT ALL look like the pictures on the website. While the space itself is large, it is dated looking. Do not stay here if you are looking for the cute apartment vibe the pictures indicate, as it isn’t accurate, for all of the rooms.  One other comment that bares saying but didn’t impact our experience there was that on the lower levels it is very loud. There is a bar directly across from the entrance, which our windows opened on to, so it was loud late into the evening. Also the doors are extremely heavy and slam loudly. We had read this in advance in other reviews so were not put off.
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very impressed at the room very spacious and light with a fully self contained kitchen. The instructions received from them to get there from the airport were perfect. Beautifully renovated building right in the perfect spot, near the metro, trams, shopping and an easy walk to the major attractionsVery helpful staff with a good knowledge of the area and not afraid to communicate with you. Well done City Nest
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We got a nice room with a king size double bed. The location is perfect and the apartment was quiet. Bathroom and shower of newer standard and cleaning every day. The only thing that was under standard was the the bed, as the mattress was hard and uncomfortable.
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We definitely recommend this hotel. It’s close to metro and you can also walk to the old town and all of the tourist attractions. The hotel is clean, the room is big and modern and has everything you need. The staff is friendly. We will definitely come back if we have time in Prague.
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I made a reservation and I paid for it online. As I checked my bank account I saw the hotel charged me 5% extra. As I arrived in the hotel I asked the girl at the reception why am I overcharged. She was quite nervous and explained that the reason is the exchange rate. I explained I was charged in eur, not czk, but this didn't help, the lady became more nervous and impatient. Anyways, I did't want to argue, I expected to have a nice view from my room in CityNest. The room was on the first floor overlooking the inner courtyard. The room itself wasn't bad. Overall bad experience.
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for two nights and I have to say it was great value for money. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. The hotel room was also very clean, spacious and modern. It had a nice small kitchen area. The room was also much larger than we expected (we booked a Deluxe room). Location is also very good; walking distance to Wenceslas Square and a few tram stops to the Old Town.Found it hard to locate the hotel (arrived late at night). Google Maps recommended Lazarska as the tram stop but found later that Narodni Trida was a closer stop. No obvious sign at the address as well. The Dutch pub across the road was a more effective marker.Overall a very good place and would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are in the airport on our way home from a fantastic stay in City Nest, Prague. We cannot recommend this apartment enough, not only for it’s fantastic central location but also for its cleanliness and helpful and friendly staff. We had a very pleasant check-in and they even gave us a list of recommended places nearby for breakfast - IF Cafe was amazing! The room itself was lovely, with a modern bathroom with a good shower. The kitchenette was useful for making coffee and for storing drinks in the fridge. They also arranged our transfer back to the airport with no issues and at a reasonable cost. All in all the stay was very good value for money and we would definitely return.
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there for 2 nights in April 2019, it is very nice and comfortable. The room is equipped with all needed stuffs for arranging your own breakfast/lunch/dinner and everythong is properly clean. Bed ia big enough and comfortable. Even if it is close to the cuty centre, it is in a quiet street so there is no noise at night. City centre is easily reachable in 10 min walking but you are 2 min walk from the metro B and a big tram stop. Tabac shops on the other side of the metro station sells tickets too. There is no breakfast service, but you can do your own in the room or reach the closest Starbucks in 2 minutes walk. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place. The hotel is in the city centre next to the big mall and restaurants. The room was very clean. Fast Internet, friendly staff, good decoration and worth every single penny. Highly recommend it!!!
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent place to stay in the center of Prague. Comfortable rooms with the nice kitchen corner and great bathroom. Fast internet, big smart TV and soft comfortable bad. Walking distance to all Prague attractions. Recommended to everyone. :) D&N
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is perfect, everithing was within walking distance. Everyone was really welcoming and friendly. The room was comfy and nice. If you want a nice place for a good price in a perfect location, this is your place!
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location was perfect,everything was within walking distance. The staff was very welcoming and friendly. The room was very comfortable. Shopping mall within two minutes. Value for money. Keep up the good wotk
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Chose to stay at City Nest mainly for the location (5 min walk from Old Town Square) and for the affordable price. Noticed on arrival that is quite a new concept, because the building wasn’t heavily signaled. It’s a refurbished building, but all the utilities were brand new and working wonderfully. Amazing thing that reception is open 24/7, although I was not expecting an early checkout at 10 am (normally seen at midday). The staff are super friendly and welcoming, as I was travelling alone, they offered their company in case I would feel lonely. The studio apartment that I stayed (superior studio) was quite big, the bed, probably a queen size, super comfortable. Had a small kitchenette, from which I only used the fridge for yogurt, was clean and had the essentials. The bathroom was decent size, including the shower and everything worked perfectly.Overall I highly recommend the place for location, price, comfort, tidiness and friendly staff. If I return to Prague, will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights with my partner. The receptionists (and all the staff, really) of City Nest are so accommodating and helpful! They made checking in real quick and easy, they helped us get a cab to the airport, and gave us tips around the city. The room was beyond our expectations. It had a king-size bed, a big TV (with Netflix!), a nice WC, a kitchenette (fridge, hob, microwave, kettle, and all cutleries/pans/plates/bowls), a cute dining table, and wardrobe. The room was also very clean and of a decent size (not stuffy, high ceilings, good lighting, etc).The location is literally in the centre of everything. My partner and I did not take public transport the entire time as everything was less than 30 mins away (the Astronomical clock is 5 mins away and the Prague Castle is 25). There is also a shopping centre with a Tesco nearby so everything we needed were just yards away.I really recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Within walking distance to everything. The bed is comfortable. There is room cleaning and comes equipped with a full kitchen. You just can't beat that. The best overall package I've had in Europe. I loved it.
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was amazing the service was great and they helped us a lot around the city...the room is close to the old city and subway ! Would recommend 10/10 It’s cheap and comfortable and the rooms are beautiful
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is perfect, plenty of good food within 0-10 minutes walk, short walk from main tourist attractions. The room is clean (daily maid service) and spacious. It had good amendities including a kitchen, coffee, tea, salt and pepper, and shampoo and body wash
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To begin with,I had doubt about the room because of low prices.When I came to the city nest,I realized that the room is very clean and provides many things that I didn’t expect for instance Netflix option and a huge smart tv.To be honest,was a nice experience!!
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I enjoyed our stay at this hotel! The flat was really new and everything was in good condition. There’s a small kitchen area for people to prepare food if needed and very good insulation and heating (which was great as it was the coldest week when we visited!). There was renovation work going on at the venue next door that got quite loud during our first night there but the hotel was very nice about it and refunded the first night and gave us a bottle of sparkling wine to make up for it which was a nice surprise and we were really grateful for that :) All the staff spoke perfect English so we checked in and out with no problems at all. The location of the hotel was also really convenient — only a two minute walk away from the subway and tram stations, and within walking distance to most of the tourist attractions such as the astrological clock and the Charles bridge. Thank you citynest for making our stay so memorable!! Will definitely be staying here again the next time we visit.
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really loved the 2 days stay in this beautiful stay. It was just at the right location of the city, everything was at walking distance from Charle's Bridge to Old Town.Host was extremely helpful and kind. Room was clean and comfortable with right kind of stuff required. We were initially facing one small issue of net not connecting to TV but to our surprize, they upgraded our room to a Suite which was again big and beautiful. Our stay in this place actually made our 2 days visit to Prague very special.Thanks to the owner, host and staff. We will definitely recommend our friends to stay here.
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Awesome place. The treatment was perfect and also was its location, you could walk anywhere and it was well connected by tram, bus and metro. The daily cleaning was good and the the heating too. I would definitely recommend it to everyone who wants to come to Prague
hotelName:
16    City Nest
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the perfect spot to stay for us. It is located closely to a variety of very lovely locations. Slept really well due to comfortable bed and quiet street/surrounding. Great design - love the details!
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff could not have been more helpful and efficient. It is so quiet but near everything and the streets around the hotel are beautiful. The rooms are spacious with great facilities and high specification. I cannot recommend Mooo by the Castle enough.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent four nights at MOOo by the Castle at the end of June. Our family of four, including two teenagers, stayed in a one bedroom apartment. The apartment was beautiful, immaculate, and very spacious The location is great, as it is away from the crowds, yet close enough to walk to everything. The staff was exceptional in every interaction we had with them and arranged for transfers for us upon arrival at the train station and departure from the apartments to the airport at a very reasonable rate. We were in Prague during some VERY hot days (100 degrees fahrenheit), and our second floor apartment was not air conditioned. We opened all of the windows and were given two Dyson fans, which did help cool down the apartment somewhat.If we ever find ourselves in Prague again during our travels, we would definitely stay at MOOo by the Castle.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We wanted to be near but not in the center of town and this location was perfect. Our room was very spacious and clean. We had a separate bedroom, and living room. Good restaurants are very close as well as the castle. The management is very friendly and very helpful. A nice courtyard to relax in the afternoon with a local beer or drink. Security is also very tight. Note: if staying in the summer on very warm days, it might be better to stay upstairs where the rooms might be cooler than in the first floor since the rooms don’t have air conditioning. Enjoy
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mooo by the Castle is a wonderful place to stay while in Prague. Beautifully decorated with all the mod cons, the apartment felt like a luxurious version of home. I would definitely recommend it and plan to stay there again when I return to Prague. 10/10 from me
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first visit to Prague and we weren’t sure if we wanted to stay downtown or near the castle, and we really think that Mooo by the castle is the best location! We were close to the castle and shops and restaurants, but on a quiet little side street which was perfect. An easy walk to the Charles Bridge and then you are right at the Old Square! Location was exactly what we wanted! The building and courtyard are lovely...we returned home one afternoon to find a local show with singing and dancing being performed by local children and adults. Charming! The individual apartments are beautifully and tastefully decorated. The furniture was comfortable and modern. The kitchen had everything we needed. The beds were comfortable and it was all very clean. The bathroom was beautiful too, great shower! It was VERY hot in Prague during our visit so we were grateful to have air conditioning in our two units. If that is important to you, I suggest you request it when you book. Not all of the apts have it. I imagine there would be a nice breeze, though, as there are lots of large windows that you can open in your apt. I really can’t think of anything we would have changed! And if/when we return to Prague, we would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family stayed in a two-bedroom, two-full bath apartment and it was AWESOME. The location is close proximity to the castle is it also within walking distance of the Charles Bridge and to the shops and restaurants across the bridge. The staff is very helpful from making tour reservations, dinner recommendations an ensuring our family had all we needed during our stay. Everything in the apartment was working. looked to be new, and spotless and the cow-themed special touches were an extra whimsical bonus. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment is very nice near the embassies, they are very complete and luxuriously furnished.You lack nothing in its entirety. Super friendly staff who are happy to help you on your way and come up with nice addresses. Also very nice the cafe downstairs to have a drink, just a pity that you can not eat there.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: MOOo was recommended to us by friends and we couldn't be happier! Location was central to everything. Max could not have been more accommodating with recommendations for restaurants, arranging tours, etc. We will definitely be recommending MOOo to everyone.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful apartment hotel, I was delighted with my stay. Grey staff, wonderful location, quiet and Peaceful. Rarely add such a good experience from a hotel. Well maintain, clean and nicely decorated. A must if you stay in Prague.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was recommended and this hotel did not disappoint it’s just wonderful. Staff are really courteous and it feels very safe. Great little bar downstairs! Come stay here very centrally located in amongst the cobblestones
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is designed wonderfully, we loved the fact the the kids had their living area and so did we. Two bedrooms, two Tv's. Worked great for us We also enjoyed the very clean and modern decor. The champagne that awaited us was a nice gift too. The environment is very peaceful, very quiet.. a nice sanctuary away from the busy streets of the city. The hotel also locks down at night .. so we felt very safe. The staff is very helpful * Kind and the transportation vehicle was large enough to take us to and from destinations in comfort as we had a big group & lots of luggage. Highly recommend this gem in the center of Prague.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has an excellent location. The staff is very nice and facilitated all kinds of help to make our trip more enjoyable.The apartment is very spacious, comfortable and clean. Highly recommended for families.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for four days/three nights at the beginning of May, in a one-bedroom apartment. The apartment itself was great, with a spacious bedroom, and a living room with a decent kitchen set-up and dining table. Front desk staff were great in answering any questions we had. MOOo is located on a small side street (actually, more like a small side walkway) off Nerudova. It's a fairly steep set of stairs and sidewalk down, or alternately, you can come up to the hotel if you start below it at Bretislavova (we found that a little easier). We came in from the Prague airport via the 119 bus and then the subway. The closest stop for the subway is Malostranska, which left us with a walk of about 15 minutes. Alternately you can take the aboveground tram, which leaves you off at Malostranske square, and then it's just 5 minutes and a couple blocks uphill to the hotel.Pro tip: there's a Starbucks in the square right where the tram stop is. I know that travel is supposed to be about broadening your perspective and experiencing the local culture and all, but we had a couple of mornings where we just wanted to get coffee and get out into the city, so that worked out well for us. MOOo is a 5-10 minute walk to the Castle complex, depending on how fast you motor uphill. It's also all of about 10 minutes from the Charles Bridge. The Wallenstein Gardens are also nearby, on the walk between the hotel and the metro stop. One of the days we walked past, the doors were open and we decided to check it out, and it was a lovely space to explore. Petrin Park is also nearby, and while you are up at the castle, you can check out Novy Svet. One thing you should know about this place is that the stairs leading up are a bit of a challenge. They are pitched more steeply than what would be considered standard in the US, and they slant a little downward. Max, who was the person who greeted us and set us up when we arrived, told us that the building is something like 500 years old and is a UNESCO protected site, and that they are limited in what they can renovate, so the stairs are what they are. We were able to get up and down without mishap, but someone with mobility issues might find this a bit problematic. That said, we would stay here again without question. Overall, we had an excellent experience here.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our second time staying here and it just keeps getting better. The two bedroom apartment included all the high end amenities needed to make our stay perfect. One bedroom looked out to the courtyard and the other looked out into the street. The housekeepers (Nadia and Masha) keep our accommodations immaculate. They were very attentive and quickly brought us extra sheets upon request. Cloe and everyone at the reception desk were extremely knowledgeable about the area. She even went way out of her way to help us find our driver when He was lost! Max, our main contact person at "The Castle" went way above and beyond to make our stay perfect, even providing us with a bottle of Prosecco. Thanks to everyone at Mooo by the Castle for making this trip memorable!
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: MOOo is a fantastic old-world hotel on a side street just down the road from the castle and a short walk from the Charles Bridge. It's a wonderful place to stay. My wife and I stayed for a week in a 2 king bed, 2 & 1/2 bath apt. on the second floor with another couple we were traveling with. Access was via an amazing wooden spiral staircase dating back to 1546. The apt. was a home away from home with an amazing staff. Max, the hotel manager, was the perfect host. He anticipated and took care of our every need during our stay. The staff (Alyssa, May, Chloe, and Martyna) were very personable, friendly, and helpful as well. Prague is a beautiful city and MOOo makes it that much better. We're looking forward to visiting again. Thank MOOo!
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was an amazing one bedroom and we could not have asked for a nice experience. The room was amazing value and was so close to the Castle. It was about a 6 minute walk to a main transport hub and it was easy to get around from there. The service and hospitality was some of the best we've seen and we would stay here again in a heartbeat. Everything was just easy, comfortable and relaxing when we stayed there. I was like your own apartment and we really would recommend it to anyone.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We traveled as a family of four with another family to visit Prague for the first time. We didn’t quite know what to expect but were more than pleased with our accommodations. To start, the staff were always warm, welcoming, and eager to help. For example, we quickly realized that we had forgotten to bring electrical outlet converters and they were more than happy to lend us a couple when asked. The apartment was spacious, clean and modern, but still retained a cozy rustic feel. The kitchenette was well stocked with cups, utensils, an espresso machine, electric teapot, cooking ware, microwave, and even a dishwasher. Both the main bed and pull out beds were very comfortable and the latter was a surprise as this is usually not the case. My favorite feature was the extra touch of the heated floors in the bathroom. We absolutely loved our stay there and only wish there were more Mooo properties that we could stay at in the future. This is a rare find and I would highly recommend this apartment for a stay in Prague. It was also very close to the Prague Castle which was an added plus. Thank you, Mooo by the Castle for the wonderful memories. I think our experience was best summarized by my daughter who said that she never wanted to leave!
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the courtyard around an old Alchemists' house, this apartment hotel is everything one can wish for in Prague. Mystery, romance, ancience all wrapped in an extraordinary creative decor and ultimate comfort inside the apartment. Max the house manager was brilliant in helping us navigate the trip prior to arrival and while we were there. The local wine and cognac bars are a must to explore. I will miss walking up the old and irregular stairs made in 1456. It was a spectacular stay, the feel of Mooo was just right and will stay with me! Thanks to the staff for enabling this trip.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you MOOo by the Castle for an amazing 4 night stay in Prague. We loved every aspect of the apartment and slept very well each night. We really appreciated the friendly service we received throughout our stay, all the staff couldn't do enough for us. The apartment is very well located and is within walking distance to all the main tourist attractions. We hope we can come back and stay again in the future. Thanks again. Jonathan & Emma.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great rooms, lovely part of town a great place to stay, would recommend to anyone. The staff looked after us well and sorted ourt transfers and things to do and they couldnt do enough for us.We would definatley visit again
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Traveling as a family with small children, we usually stay in apartments instead of hotels. This was one of the best vacation apartments we have ever stayed in. Everything was just perfect. The building itself is beautifully restored. The children particularly liked climbing up the fairy tale tower and greeting Cookie the Cow every time we crossed the main gate. The apartments are spacious, clean, well-maintained, quiet, tastefully decorated, and nice and warm in the winter. The location is also great, right in the middle of Mala Strana and a short walk or tram ride from the Old Town. In addition to the sights and picturesque lanes, we enjoyed Mala Strana's quieter nightlife. Dinners at very nearby Santini Garden, U Magistra Kelly and Kuchyn were all excellent. The alchemy-themed bar on the ground floor was also fun and worth checking out.But what really makes Mooo stand out is the staff. Everybody we came across was incredibly nice and helpful, from the moment we booked until the airport transfer for our return flight. Finally, we would highly recommend the walking tour arranged by Mooo. The guide was friendly, knowledgeable and great with children. We will definitely be back!
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I have just enjoyed a 3 night stay at MOOo by the Castle. From the initial booking the staff could not have been more helpful. We opted to book directly through their website which offered a free pickup/drop off to the airport during our stay – this was an amazing touch and made out transfers extremely easy. We received a warm welcome upon arrival and the very helpful girl on reception also provided some recommendations for dinner – St Martins was one of our favourites – the food is AMAZING and well worth a visit during your stay. The apartments themselves were FANTASTIC ! High end appliances, beautifully decorated and very much a home from home. I cannot recommend these apartments enough. We were so impressed by the apartments and staff that we’re currently looking at booking up again for another trip this year. Thank you to all the staff for our amazing stay in Prague. :-)
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This apartment is extremely beautiful. Delicately designed, we love everything about this place, interesting interior and exterior. We stayed in a room with painted ceiling. The staff is the best part, Max the manager and Chloe at the reception are awesome. Nadia who cleaned the apartment did a fantastic job, the room is spotless! We couldn’t find anything bad about this place besides well...once you enter the room you don’t want to go out ever, it is THAT cozy!Thank you Mooo team!
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place exceeded all expectations. The team there has done a great job of incorporating the charm and culture of the building with modern conveniences. The apartments are beautiful and the staff is attentitive and truly care about the happiness of the guests. Each apartment is surprisingly large. We had a group who rented the 2 bedroom and the 1 bedroom, and they were both really big with plenty of space to socialize and sit. The hotel location is an easy walk to most everything you want to see in the city, though be prepared to walk uphill when returning to the hotel. You can find multiple restaurants and bars within a couple blocks, but it is a very quiet area. Inside the hotel is tower you can walk up (about 4 stories) and look out over the city. There is a bar downstairs that cannot be missed. It incorporates the Alchemist history associated with the building. Don't let the quirky name fool you. This is a top notch, well appointed place and I highly recommend it to anyone traveling to that magical city.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter booked this trip as a birthday gift for my 50th birthday, I love cows hence booking the apartment with the quirky name. We had a great welcome - a full sized cow in the courtyard! Not real I’m might add. The staff during the booking process were so helpful and wrote such friendly emails. They organised our transfer to and from the airport. The driver was a lovely chatty person. Pre bookez a wonderful French restaurant for a great Steak for us as we would not have been able to get on otherwise, The 2 bed apartment was amazing, modern luxury. We were just up from the American embassy below the castle. Plenty of walking involved but not a problem. I 100% recommend the apartment. Even a bottle of Prosecco was waiting us in a bucket of ice as we entered the apartment.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment is located 5 minutes walk from the Castle. Although it is located in a very popular area the rooms are very quiet since they have double windows. The apartment was equipped with everything we need and the kids loved the big Flatscreens with Netflix. We came by car and they have a good parking at about 400meters away. Will definitely come again
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned home after spending two nights in two bedroom apartment and have to endorse all reviews before this place is amazing.The staff are so helpful, we had booked at last minute for New Year and Martyna managed to organise us a restaurant to see the New Year in and gave as several recommendations for places to stay, she made sure we had a fantastic time.We loved Praha and look forward to returning and definitely want to stay at Mooo again.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights at MOOo. It was a perfectly furnished apartment in the heart of new town on the hill, right by the American embassy. The apartment was big, with nice bedding and nice bathrooms. WiFi service was very fast. Plenty of restaurants, bars and shops nearby and a short walk to the castle. There were a few cafes nearby for breakfast. The hotel sent a van to pick us up from the airport. Parking would be difficult. The neighborhood was quiet. The staff was helpful. If you have any physical limitations i would recommend checking ahead of time to ensure a room on the first floor. We had to go up two flights of steep stairs. Thankfully, the staff helped carry our suitcases.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Moo located in great area of Prague...Absolutely gorgeous apartments for our trip to Prague..beautiful building..gorgeous cosy furnishings..really friendly helpful staff..great value..what more can you ask for......
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
