review_body: What a fantastic 3 nights we had at the MOO"o apartments.Centrally located and very high spec amenities.Thanks for the complimentary prosecco,however as you will have gathered we dont drink.will return.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here after reading all the other excellent reviews. There really is a reason why they have so many 5/5 reviews! First of all, the location is excellent, you’re in the centre of everything you’d want to be (and if you book on their website you get airport transfer included). There are loads of places to go for food and drink within 5 minutes walk as well. The room itself was excellent, comfortable bed, big tv, Bose sound system, Nespresso machine. It was spotlessly clean and came with a nice bottle of Prosecco on arrival as well. They also had a cot and high chair waiting for us (we travelled with an 11 month old). Finally the service from the staff was exceptional. There was nothing they couldn’t do. As we were leaving, we had half an hour wait for our taxi and an American member of staff made us feel very welcome getting us coffee, chatting to us etc. There is not one thing I could think of that needs improving in this place, it really is that good!
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a brilliant short break in Prague, staying at Mooo by the castle. Had read the excellent reviews and it didn't disappoint. We had 2 of the 1 bedroom apartments, each side of the courtyard. They were both lovely - very large, modern and well equipped. A great place to come back and chill after a full day sightseeing in this beautiful city. Thoroughly recommend and we'll definitely come back.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we were a group of 12, when i booked the rooms i read the reviews, looked at the pictures and thought to may self "it's to good to be true". but in fact it is even better! the pictures? well in reality the place is even more charming, the rooms are big, beautifully designed and supper comfortable. the location is perfect. Special thanks goes to the wonderful Max - what a great welcome, what a great person, i haven't got the words to thank him enough! So Prague is amazing and by staying at "MOOo by the castle" you'll up-great your visit from great to excellent. i'm trying to express my gratitude to Max and the staff at MOOo's and i can't find the words - so a thank you will do.if you want to treat your self to a great hotel & experience - book a room at MOOo by the castel!!!!
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What an amazing, unique, BEAUTIFUL place to stay. My only regret is that they were so booked that we could only stay 3 nights. The service was fantastic, the apartments were INCREDIBLE as was the rest of the hotel...courtyard and bar were perfect. I would recommend this to anyone headed to Prague. Location of Mooo by the Castle is just around the corner from the tourist area/castle. Incredibly walkable.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an amazing time during our stay at MOOo by the Castle. The room was large and had almost everything that we could ask for. The beds were very comfortable. At first I was unsure about the 1 blanket per person set up but my husband and I ended up loving it. No more having your blankets stolen from you in the middle of the night. The neighborhood was safe and very quiet at night. It was a welcome escape from the hordes of people in Old Town. The only suggestion that I have is maybe adding a full length mirror in the bedroom. The few minor hiccups we had...no towel replacements for the first 3 days of our trip and an issue with the hot water... were resolved promptly and with a smile.A word of caution... the hotel is partway up a small but steep hill and our room (#14) was on the 3rd floor with no elevator. While this was not a problem for us, it may be a problem for some. If you have trouble with stairs, maybe ask for a room on a lower floor.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I, we really had a Wonderfull stay at the Mooo by the Castle. The flat was amazing, top end quality and with a design and comfortable that made us feel at home. Highly recommended for short and long stays.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful stay at MOOo by the Castle Apartments! Before our stay I communicated with the hotel directly, and they were so helpful and informative. We stayed in a Two Bedroom Apartment Monday until Friday, and we enjoyed a spacious, clean and luxurious apartment where they had though of everything. The kitchenette was super and had all the necessary amenities that 4 (or more) people would need, the living room was spacious as well as the two bedrooms that were absolutely perfect, beautiful decorated and very spacious. Just outside the door to the aparment you can enjoy the view of the court yard, and it was very relaxing sitting there, enjoying a cup of coffee and the view of the yard.The location of the hotel is super, about 5-10 minutes walking to the Charles Bridge (Karlův most), and therefore a super starting point for experiencing Prague.All of the staff were so helpful, nice and service minded. We have stayed at a lot of hotels, but we all experienced a lot more service than you will at other hotels. Because we had a late flight we asked to keep the room a bit longer than 12 o'clock, and that was not a problem - and they would not charge us anything extra for it either. Absolutely a super staff!We have stayed in Prague earlier, but we were much so satisified with this hotel - and cannot reccomend it enough!
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay at Moo by the Castle. The location is perfect, in the old part of Prague, but away from the busy roads in the Old Town. We had an amazing room with lots of details and charm, and met very kind and helpfull staff throught the stay. Highly reccommended.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: MOOo is fantastic. Large suite, beautifully designed. Every detail is perfect. Wonderful kitchen, large bedroom, beautiful bath, comfy bed...everything. staff was very friendly and helpful. Stair is awesome if you are agile. Very unique setting. We could not believe how affordable this marvelous place was. Also in a great location. Close to everything but quiet in the evening. The tram will get you within 4-5 blocks.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Yes, part of the reason why I choose MOOo by the Castle was the cow theme. But aside from that the apartment, building and courtyard were simply beautiful. I stayed in Apartment 1, which was ground floor facing the street. This wasn't much of a problem as the street was quiet at night. The only potential problem was leaving windows open while you were out (this apartment did not have air-con). The furniture was of a high quality and I loved the various cow-related furnishings. The kitchen comes with lots of utensils and the mini fridge is a decent size. This apartment did not come with a separate bath, but the shower had a rain shower head.Staff were awesome, very friendly and fulfilled everything I needed. The location is up a slope, so that may be a concern for those with mobility issues. If not, I found it great. Within walking distance to the Castle and Charles Bridge and also a tram station. There's also a small supermarket just up the slope, that closes at 23:00, and some restaurants nearby, including Santini Garden just across the street.MOOo and Prague itself exceeded my expectations and I would love to come back.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the very first second of meeting Cookie the Cow, to the sad time of saying goodbye we could not find one fault with staying here. The staff were more than friendly, welcoming and helpful. Anything and everything from getting extra pods for the nespresso machine to printing our boarding passes they did with the upmost professionalism. The apartment itself was nothing short of five stars: nespresso coffe machine for those mornings after the night before; Bose Bluetooth speakers and Netflix for afternoon siestas; and most importantly the cleanliness from the daily maid service made it a comfortable place to relax. The location itself was nothing more than ideal, short walk from places to eat and drink but far enough you’re not kept up at night with the loud hustle and bustle. Prague is a beautiful city, which everyone should have the joy of experiencing, and where better to base yourself than half way up the hill to the beautiful views by the castle.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great location near the awesome Prague Castle. Just a few minutes walking distance to the Charles Bridge and many other great sights in Prague. Our family of 4 was visiting Prague for the first time and couldn't be happier with the Mooo Apartments. The apartment is very nice and very comfortable. Some apartments have AC so make sure to request that if you are used to having AC and are visiting during a warm season. The staff is excellent and were so welcoming. We loved it!
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: These apartments are great! The apartments is placed near some embassies, so if going by car, you will be stopped by the police and they will inspect your vehicle. But it feels more natural than it sounds and really give a secure feeling.You can park just outside the apartments, but only briefly while unloading and checking in. The hotel can arrange parking, but we choose mrparkit and got to park somewhat cheaper and inside.Then jumped on a tramp to the area near the apartment. Worked great.We had an apartment on the top floor. It had aircondition which was nice as it was warm. The apartment had a kitchen with most of what we needed. Could use a toaster though.A nice bathroom with a giant rainfall shower.A living room with a big sofabed and a large TV.Then a bedroom with a TV and a safe.Everything is very clean and the decoration of the apartment is great. You can sit outside the apartments as the is café table and chairs. You have a nice view over the yard from here and even a peek at the castle.The staff is very friendly and speaks great English as some of staff are even from the states.From the apartments, you can walk to the castle and the old town via the bridge.There are lots of places to eat in the area.In the yard of the apartments they serve great beers.This is the type of apartment you want to return to, so I highly recommend MOOo.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I almost don't want to write this review, because I want to keep it for myself. Bit as someone whose gone to Prague a few times, I can say this place is hands down my favorite. I didn't even know it was a famous alchemists house when I booked it, but the history of the place is phenomenal. Awesome themed bar downstairs, and little museum up top. And the location can't be beat for the price. If nothing changes, I'll only ever stay here when I visit.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel staff is very friendly and the rooms are spacious and very comfortable. Our family of four stayed in the two-bedroom/two-bathroom apartment (with kitchenette). The hotel is very close to the castle and about a fifteen minute walk to the Charles Bridge. We appreciated that the hotel was down a quiet street, but still close to stores and restaurants.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We lived in Mooo for 2 days. You can get there by metro Malostranska and take tram 1 stop to Malostranske namesti. The reception is friendly and the room is beautiful, impressive. Hope we can get back to Mooo if we have another journey to Prague in the future.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What got us to reserve this hotel is it’s magical location: a old alchemist lab. But what really impressed us was their services. Max, their manager is an absolute gem. Warm and genuine while super helpful. My mom was having trouble climbing the stairs so he immediately moved us to a lower floor and moved all of our luggage for us. And the decorations were top of the line and every details was well thought out.Highly recommended
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: especially staffs are very friendly and all kinds of stuffs are clean and useful.the place is very quite and easy to approach bus stop and Prague castle is quite near so it's very good to walking in early morning
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We absolutely loved this place!!! The old style building, stairs going in circles. For those traveling with small kids it can be hard to carry strolers up but it is definitely worth it! Everything is new and in cow design which was really interesting. The kitchen was fully equipped, and the apartments had short distance to several small stores. It is not that far from the town as it seems. Prague is an old architecture town and walking is what you want to do! The staff was great and very polite and chatty. The Moo has alchemy museum on the very top floor where the apartments er, and one in the yard where the employee that worked there was wearing an old alchemist costume. It was a great place to stay! We loved it here, and we want to come back again!!!
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is amazing. Traveled with our kids 4 and 7. The hotel looks better than the photos. The stairs to our room are from the mid 1500’s so it’s extremely old mixed beautifully with modern. Comfy and clean. Everything feels brand new. Tucked away in a quiet and quant area near amazing restaurants and all of the embassies. Just a two minute walk to the bridge. Staff is very warm and friendly. Only downfall is no air conditioning. We have fans but it’s still a bit warm at night. I’d still give five stars and totally recommend if you are traveling with a party greater than 2.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If I could I'd add another half star because everything was just superb: the decor, comfort of beds, furniture, design plan, quiet location near Prague Castle, and especially cleanliness. Max and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, responding to requests for taxi's, coffee pods and dinner reservations. In early June it was very warm and there was no air-conditioning. The fans while helpful, did not do enough until we decided to leave the door to the apartment open and some windows, to establish some airflow I would have been more comfortable sleeping under a sheet or a thinner comforter during our stay. Still, all things considered, we had a wonderful stay at MOOo!
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location was great. It was just 300m from Prague Castle and walking distance from Charles bridge. Great eating and shopping places next to the hotel. Staff was extremely helpful. Very good amenities in the room. TV's , fridge was well stocked.
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay at MOO was nothing short of a dream. It was beautiful, clean and the receptionist Farhanny was such a great help. My friends and I travelled a long way to get here and her smile and warmth really made our journey worthwhile.MOO was certainly a “home away from home”. I highly recommend this place to anyone who wish to visit Prague. :)
hotelName:
17    MOOo by the Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Don't let the Adjoining Mosaic House Hostel confused you to think that MOOo Downtown (owned by the owners of the Mosaic House) is anything less than an apartment hotel.. To begin, both facilities have first class personnel at their respective front desk, and both will go to great length to assist with visitors' needs.Our MOOo Downtown apartment was ta true delight, clean rooms, modernized bathroom, and well equipped kitchen. Its convenient location is definitely an advantage.I will definitely go back to this hotel on my next trip to Prague.One comment: there are some stairs to negotiate before you'll get to the elevator. The delightful receptionist was kind enough to alert me to this fact at the time I made the reservation, for which I am still grateful. Despite the stairs (my wife had a broken right fibula) we did not regret staying at this hotel.One last thing: breakfast was fabulous!
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We wished we could have stayed here for a few more nights. We stayed in only the 1 bedroom apartment (2 adults and 2 young kids) but space-wise, it was sufficient. We love the personality the place had – eclectic spirit to it yet modern.We arrived late night because our travel documents were stolen on the train and we informed the apartment folks ahead of time about late arrival. They were so thoughtful and even left a bottle of prosecco to cheer us up (even though we did not get round to drinking it in the end).You can get your breakfasts a few steps away at their sister hotel and I would definitely recommend you do that. Well balanced breakfast that is not stingy.Andrew (kudos for the good communication over email) or someone else is often at the desk on the 1st level during regular working hours but outside those hours, you can always get the information or assistance you need from the sister hotel across the road – so best of both worlds.Don’t even need to ask me whether I would be staying there again!
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: MOOo Downtown is conveniently located and situated in a quiet street, away from the bar crowds. Property is newly renovated, very clean and has comfortable beds! Wifi speeds were great (essential for those travelling with kids). I definitely recommend a stay here.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a very nice trip to Prag, The Appartment was very nice and in the City of the old town. The man at the reception was very nice. We would to be come back. The rooms were very clean and wonderful
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a fantastic 2 night stay here recently. A very warm and helpful welcome, very clean, quirky and well thought out accommodation and A great breakfast next door. Location was perfect for seeing the main sites with a 5 and 8 year old. Their only complaint was that there were no English language cartoon channels on the TV.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really pretty Apartement with Great Service! I‘ve been there once before and both times it was great!The only negative thing to say is that they don‘t have an oven in the Penthouse, they only had a microwave there. But who needs an oven, when you can sit on a rooftop with a beautiful view?We will sure Comeback!
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A superb apartment. Spacious, spotlessly clean, good facilities (fridge, cooker, cooking utensils, cutlery), good walk-in shower, very comfy large bed, and a great location, just a few minutes walk from the centre of Prague.Will definitely stay here again on next trip to Prague.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great, central location. The building is elegant and renovated to the highest standards with top of the line kitchen equipment and bathroom fittings. The beds are SOOOO comfortable. We had four nights here and really loved everything about the apartment.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am a regular visitor of MOOo and stay with pleasure in MOOo apartments. All rooms are nice, comfortable and always clean with lovely view on Prague. Staff is 24/7 professionally available and even know me by name.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fabulous and spacious apartment in a beautiful old building in a great location in Prague. The bedroom was large with a big comfortable bed. Staff were fabulous. A big thankyou to Andrew in concierge who went out of his way to accommodate us.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We book in Mooo Apartments because of the location, and it was perfect for my family. It is close to the historic centre (10 minutes walk) but very paceful place to sleep. The recepcionist were very friendly and gave me very practical information about public transport and the city places to visit. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved my stay at the apartment in MOOo Downtown! Very clean, nice, exceptional bedding and bath! Excellent kitchen, bedroom and living room incredibly comfortable! Location very, very charming and staff very attentive! I will definitely return to Prague.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay, thanks! Close to all tourists attractions, really nice building with well-designed apartments! All really clean and convinient. Smiling staff and good contact. Smart TV connected to the Internet so we could watch some movies in the evening
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very clean and comfortable. The apartment is perfectly located for a city trip. Sweet balcony with an amazing view of the city! We stayed two nights in April, i think in summer it gets a bit hotter and louder but the apartment has an air condition.Tip: try restaurant La Loca just over the street at mosaic Hotel. Delicious freshly made food :)
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great in every aspect. Can warmly recommend MOOo Apartments. Stayed for 5 days with wife and 3 kids. Felt like it could have been home. Provides their own transfer service which is great when going to the Zoo or the airport for example.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice apartment, will stay at Mooo again if I am in prague.Very nice building, everything is there which makes the stay special. Very luxurious apartment, each bedroom has its own bathroom. Everybody is very friendly. Will recommend this apartment.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing stay in a perfect location . We got upgraded to the penthouse on arrival , which was simply an eye candy :) Big thanks to Andrew who was super helpful and very friendly and made our trip to beautiful Prague smoother. We’ll definitely be back !
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: best appartment ever,,, great host erik! I loved itgreat location also coffee and tea around the corner everywhere also breakfastand the possibillity of having breakfast at the appartment (hotel) Top !!
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for the 5th time and every stay was pleasant. We would never stay anywhere else in Prag. The appartment is beautiful and clean. The personal is very friendly and helpful. Best place to stay in Prag.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first time staying at an apartment style hotel and we loved it. A kitchenette was a big plus and daily cleaning was perfectly done. The manager (I think his name was Max) was just AWESOME and everything was perfect during our stay. STAY HERE :)
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were wery pleased with MOOo Downtown the little time one wanted to be inside in the beautiful town. My husband said he slept better than at home. Kitchen was full equiped - but we eat outside - stereo offered 80's music, bath was relaxing. Only about 1 km to the old market place, nice surroundings all in all.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel center of Prague. Park your car and walk to all the sites. Enjoy local culture in safety. Dining all around day and evening. The hotel features an comfortable living space with sizable comfortable rooms
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a long weekend. We were greeted by Andrew, who assisted us with checkin and gave us all the scoop. The room was amazing, we were upgraded to the penthouse. From the room we had the perfect view of the Castle. You are only minutes from downtown, and the astronomical clock. Don’t pass up this enjoyable space to take in Prague.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great time here, the apartments were clean, cosy, metro station and the old town centre is a ca. 10 minutes walk. The only tricky part was the check-in: it wasn't at the apartments, but at 'Mosaic House', next to the building, which we didn't know (the hotel could have mentioned it in an email beforehand), but apart from this small "slip-up" everything went smoothly :)
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I liked to stay in the MOOo. It is a very nice and fancey place in the middle of Prag. As I had some small reques it was not a problem to have the proper answer. All teh employees are very friendly and I will stay definitly again there.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment was beautifully modernised, clean, and well equipped. Attention to detail right down to fresh coffee pods daily for the machine, and the bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in, with luxurious duck down pillows and duvet. Well done Mooo for getting it right!
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location was great. Room was in great condition and feels artsy. So far best value for money experience of mine! Building itself and high ceilings made me feel that I am staying in a real Prague house.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall I enjoyed my stay, for the first time it was not so easy to find the entrance when you drive a car (I made couple of circles around), car parking was kind of challenge, but finally I dropped my car in the public garage nearby (a bit expensive)
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A delightful find for my first time in Prague I would come back here again and would definitely recommend.A great location, not far to all the attractions. A lovely complimentary bottle of fizz made our stay even more memorable Thank you Teresa an co.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment was beautiful, in a lovely building. really nice kitchen and living room. The lamp with notes on of previous people who have stayed there was a really nice touch too. Would definitely stay there again. Walking distance to Old Town Square and Charles Bridge too. Simple to get to from the airport through the receptionists instruction on the phone, very helpful.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We went with our baby and all necassary equipment supplied by staff. Apart was fully designed for modern and all new furnitures and hausehold appliance. Much silence and no sound from neighbors. We like too much and thank to all smiling faces.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment was clean, modern and really nice. About 10-15 minutes away from the city centre and located in a really nice area. About a 30 minute drive from the airport. 5-10 minutes away is a shopping centre where you can purchase groceries at Tesco or shop and go out for dinner.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect room with nice location.It was almost like expensive hotels but the price is better.Very luxurious room.I would prefer using this apartment hotel next time coming back to prague.nice room service.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rented 1 bedroom apartment for family of 2 adults and 2 kids.Apartment itself as was good and spacious enough.breakfast at Mosaic home was very good for the price I would say that cleanliness could be improved. Bed sheets were not super clean as well as floor was not vaccumed several days.location is excellent 10-20 minutes on foot to most of city attractions.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay here! The price was ideal considering we are students. The apartment was clean, modern, chic and in a great location. For us, everything was in walking distance. The staff were very friendly and provided a bottle of prosecco on our arrival which we've never received before! This apartment actually felt like home. Will definately be staying here again!
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We looked hard long and hard to find a place to have a family reunion. Our needs were in fact a bit specific, as we were two adult couples and two children. We specifically looked for a place with as many bathrooms, showers, WCs as possible. we have actually booked a different apartment, but had a very hard time getting answers to our questions from them. Eventually we came across Moos, rang it up and were answered by a very friendly receptionist. All our questions have been answered and we decided to go for Moo!! The apartment has more or less met our expectations. In fact bathroom wer fewer than we expected, but in all other respects it was great. A hint to ownere is to equipe the bath tub with some sort of a screen. Otherwise if you take a shower water splashes all over the bathroom. In all other respects the place is wonderful!
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were 2 adults and 2 kids 11 & 15. The room was very clean and had everything necessary. Good breakfast in the next door hotel. Very helpful staff and the location is a 15 min walk from the old city square.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: my friend and I had a few days in Prague just before Christmas and Downtown MOOo Apartments were perfect !!! Warm and cosy ! (the duvets were so lovely !) super clean - great location and Andrew at reception was great at confirming our reservation and was always around if we needed any help ! HIGHLY RECOMMEND !!!
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good Apartment located in the City Centre. Everything was fine. Unfortunately, I have rip of my jacket due to a protruding sheet metal part in the hallway.The danger spot should be repaired, but this did not happen until we left. After my trip I wrote an e-Mail but i didn‘t get an resposne. That‘s poor customer service and for me an expensive trip.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was in Praha for a dance festival. The service was perfect.I have nothing to claim.Clean, Beautiful and perfect check-in. And i really appreciate the present at the arrival.For sure, I come back soon.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing stay and lovely staff its was a great stay we loved the apartment design and quality thank you for hosting us, it will be our NO1 apartment in PragueThe apartment was big and comfortable thanks again
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The "MOOo Downtown" is great! Warm welcome, clean, cool design and a central location in the city. Only some small things found, but these are some minor points on the review.We will recommend it to everyone planning a trip to Prague.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dear hotel management,I would like to raise your attention on the POOR service of tour reservation to Cesky Krumlov on 19 Nov 2018. On 19 Nov 2018, Tereza helped us booked a tour to Cesky Krumlov on 25 Nov 2018. On 20 Nov 2018, we paid CZK 940 to Ondřej [--] (A tall guy with brown hair). On 25 Nov 2018, around 8:20 am, we asked Ondřej [--] where we should wait for the tour bus, and please help us call someone to confirm this question, he said "you should have asked when you booked the tour." and left us to wait in the cold weather. I went over to Mosaic House and asked for help from a woman with dark and curly hair to shoulder, but she did not do anything and asked me to wait outside. I called the number +420 606 600 123 to Premiant City Tour many times but no one answered the phone. At 8:50 am, I asked the woman with dark hair to call PremiantTour for me, and they said we did not book the tour, although we paid booking fee CZK 940. Finally, she helped us book the tour, charged us CZK 1358 for final bill and confirmed no more payment would be charged to us. She asked us to wait inside Mosaic House but did not mention how much time we should wait. How come there was no one inform us about this bad news in advance and why there was no proper handover between hotel staffs, and we had to bear this kind of horrible service and wait outside for nothing???At 9:20 am, Ondřej [--] informed us the tour guide arrived and we finally joined the tour. On 26 Nov 2018, when we checked out, Mr. [--] asked us to pay CZK 1464. HOW COME there is more payment to be made!!!!!! I refused to pay but he said he would charge me even if I left Prague because he has my credit card detail. In the end, I paid 940+1358+1464=3762. May I know what's wrong with the whole service? I was happy that the Moon apartment was nice and comfortable but I was EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED at the tour reservation service and how staff treated us as we are nothing.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Over the past several decades I have regularly travelled for business and pleasure and have stayed in hundreds of lodgings. I avoid glitzy hotels because they are rarely worth the price. We frequently select stylish hotels that are not your usual box with a bed. The MOOo Downtown is such a rare gem, a hotel with style, humor, class and personalized customer service. Eric is the manager and superstar concierge.My wife and I are very partial to Jugendstil architecture and furnishings. The MOOo Downtown has been renovated and modernized, but the original Jugendstil features (such as door handles, door glass and ceilings are still there. Otherwise, expect a modern, thoughtful floor plan and all the amenities you expect in a new extended stay hotel. The MOOo Downtown is conveniently located within walking distance of the entire Old City. Although Prague has one of the best public transport systems, we chose to walk to most places. (If you are 75 or older and an EU resident, the city transportation system is free. If you are 60+, the cost is quite reasonable.)There are many good restaurants within a 5 minute walk of the MOOo Downtown and our host took care of all the reservations. The service and food quality in Prague have made quantum leaps forward in the last 25 years. Especially good is the French bakery nextdoor and the new Italian restaurant next to the Boat-hotel, on the river, 4 blocks away.The MOOo Downtown is one of the most pleasant hotel stays I have ever had. On our next trip to Prague, we will try its sister, the MOOo on the Castle Hill.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice and clean appartment. Excellent housekeeping made our stay very comfy.Good Location. We walked approx. 10 minutes to the charles Bridge.Would definitely recommend or book an appartment with friends again!
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If I come back to Prague again, I'll do it here again.I was here last year.I can't see the carol bridge, It's close and clean and good in front of the tram.The price is low and the room is spacious and nice.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely stay in this wonderful appartment. A nice warm welcome a super clean appartment with a complimentary card and prosecco! Great!! We have been in a two room appartment 2 adults and 2 children. Breakfast is close to the hotel. We enjoyed our stay - and for sure it was not the last time we have visited Prague and we will choose next time MOOo also:)
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For almost two years I been using Mosaic hotel and apartments. For me Mooo is the best place to stay in Prague. Rooms are nice, big and well decorated. Staff is very friendly and professional. All facilities like public transport, shops, restaurants are on walking distance.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment is very new and modern, the beds very comfortable and everything was very clean. It is well located, with metro and tram stops and supermarkets very close to the apartment. The person in charge of the reception was very friendly, the treatment exquisite.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a great experience at Mooo Downtown. The location is very convenient for all parts of central Prague and the apartment itself was spacious, well-kept and comfortable. A special mention to the very helpful and kind young man on reception who took care of a problem with my safe, looked after my luggage and was friendly and welcoming at all times. I will stay here if I visit Prague again.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We absolutely loved our visit. My girlfriend was made up with the cow theme of the room. Big bed, lovely furniture and it was big and spacey. Housekeeping were also great and really looked after is during our stay. I absolutely recommend staying here, a gem in Prague.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This apartment should be the best apartment I'd ever stayed, no matter the hardware or software(staff) is the best I'd ever saw. this apartment should belongs to the MOSAID hotel just next to the street in 1 min.location is great, I only need to walk within 20 min to reach center of Praha.highly recommend.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This has been one of my favorite places to stay so far in my travels around Europe. The location, amenities and value was excellent. Easy access to everything in the old town area and tram line. Nice restaurants and coffee shops nearby. The Mosaic House across the street has excellent food and beers, plus a lively karaoke crowd. I highly recommend this for all travelers.
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stylish, warm, spacious, cool accommodation in a very smart part of Prague.The breakfast was served in the neighboring Mosaic House (20m walk), had plenty of quality options (inc Vegan!!), great with a atmosphere!
hotelName:
18    MOOo Downtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in a studio type of room complete with a well equipped kitchen area with full cupboard. The place is very clean. Sufficient stocking of amenities for my 5-nights stay. Location: 2 min walk to the subway stn Andel. And one min walk to a bus terminal for taking regional coaches to e.g. Cesky Krumlov. Very convenient. The neighborhood is peaceful with several local eateries that charge reasonable prices vs those in Old Town or touristy areas. Breakfast was very good too, as the owner would even cook up cheese n ham toast sandwiches for you, in addition to the numerous items already on the breakfast table. Slight audible traffic noise through the windows during weekday morning hours. Overall, extremely fun and worthwhile stay.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I cannot begin to praise Kristina, the owner, enough. She transformed a two-week stay in her hotel into a graduate-level course in Czech history, geography, and sociology. But of much more importance, her infectious sense of humor kept us from drifting into the well-known traveler's despondency (short-lived as it may be). If we had an unfortunate incident in exploring Prague (getting lost, for instance), she helped us see the bright side. She is the Energizer Bunny, racing about to care for her guests in whatever way they need. My wife requested a fan, and after we returned from a walk it was in our room. The fact that Kristina speaks a number of languages doesn't hurt either. The accommodations are very comfortable. We took advantage of the offer to upgrade to a suite, and we had ample room to ourselves. (Sometimes in a long trip a couple needs a brief respite from each other -- nice to have two rooms!)If we return to Prague, and we may, it will be only if we can stay at Aparthotel City 5. We're spoiled. Wouldn't stay anywhere else.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family stayed for 6 nights, and really appreciated the homey atmosphere. We were travelling with 3 generations, and wanted to have a suite of rooms so the adults could socialize after the little one was put to bed. The hotel was convenient to puplic transit, restaurants and shops, and they offered an informal breakfast buffet every morning. Our granddaughter loved the basement play room, and the resident dachshund, Nero. Kristina, the manager (or she may be the owner?), was friendly, and provided great information that helped us feel comfortable exploring the city.This hotel is across the street from a brewery, and occasionally the smell of mash would waft on the air, which we actually enjoyed, though some might consider it a negative.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I went on a business trip for 11 days in Prague. I got an entire studio with built-in kitchen, private toilet and shower room, a full-size fridge with a microwave. It was super clean, spacious with lovely decoration. The hosts, hotel owners are super kind and very responsive during the entire trip, either just for inquiries over the phone, booking process, any support along the stay or extra touristic guidances. I highly recommend this to anyone who wants to visit Prague, either for the first time or a comeback trip. For business trip, it's absolutely ideal since the location (Andel) is right in the middle of the city center and the office areas (SAP for example). The metro station is exactly 3 minutes walk from the hotel. Super easy and accessible to any other transportation like tram or buses (to the airport).
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have lost count of how many times I have stayed here but I would not stay anywhere else in Prague but even if this is your first time in Prague, be sure to booked here for the warm and welcoming stay Kristina provides. A mine of local information, she will help make your stay, in this fantastic, beautiful and proud city, a memorable one. In these times of expensive hold luggage charges, a free laundry service is provided. Just a short walk down the street brings you on to the Vltava river (lovely local market on Saturday mornings til 2pm) and a very short walk up gives you a choice of tram, metro, bus or train. After a long day out, you can enjoy a variety of restaurants and pubs in the area. I’ve only been home for an hour and already I WANT TO GO BACK!!!!!
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Aparthotel City 5 is where our heart is in Prague. We’ve been staying here once or twice a year for the past 7 years. We first found the hotel on TripAdvisor. Impressed with all the 5 Star reviews we decided to book. Now, we wouldn’t think of staying anywhere else. The hotel is located a few blocks from the Anděl metro station and 2 blocks from the Vltava River. Turn left at the river to walk to the Charles Bridge and Old Town Square. Turn right at the river to walk to Vyšehrad. Public transportation is awesome in Prague, but walking, for those who can, is the best. Don’t forget to look up. The hotel is Pink! It is very clean with single rooms or little apartments with kitchenettes (tea provided). The beds are very comfortable, and the thick walls and double (or triple?) pane windows keep the rooms quiet. There is instant hot water for showers, and bathrooms are of decent proportion.The very best part of the Aparthotel City 5 is the hotel owner, Kristina. She wins in all categories of hospitality. Kristina welcomes you from the first email conversation to the personal greeting and orientation you receive upon arrival. Breakfast in the hotel cafe extends the welcome with warm toasties (ham and cheese panini), assorted breads, cheese, fruit, cereal, coffee, tea and Kristina, making sure everyone gets seated and served. We’ve had many interesting conversations with people from around the world in that cafe. Book before she fills up!
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights, and felt at home. Kristina, who manages the place, gave us a warm welcome when we arrived, freezing and tired from a night flight, offered us warm drinks and sat with us patiently giving her brief review of all the highlights in Prague, marking them on the map for us. The hotel has a perfect location for public transportation, which compensates the fact it's not right in the center, yet it is located in a an area which is not too noisy. The apartment was very clean and had small kitchen with all the essentials. The hotel has a reception from 08:00-20:00 which is advantageous. In short, this hotel was the perfect choice for us.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Kristina was very responsive and made sure we didn't have any worries when we arrived to Prague. She graciously sent many directions and information about how to get to the Aparthotel, with common rates and what to expect and even some tips and what-not to dos that come out to be very helpful. Once we arrived we were treated like family. We were given tea and toastys and I wasn't feeling well and Kristina just moved with such grace, offering me honey and a nice nap right away. She went over a beautiful map of Prague and helped us plan out our 4 days in town. She gave us lots of materials to learn more and how to explore this magical city. It really does give you energy and power. I felt it everywhere we went. I just loved staying here so much, the room was large! We had complimentary tea every morning on our rooms, because we have a kitchen! We loved having the lounge downstairs, we had breakfast there every morning. Kristina was so generous to offer a welcome breakfast and even do our laundry. We could not be more thankful. Kristina has a place in our hearts forever!! I sincerely suggest any one staying here, you will not be sorry!
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Kristina was the best host ever! This was my first time to Prague and I worried a bit about location but the public transportation is excellent. This hotel is just three minutes from the buses, subway and tram. Public transportation from the airport takes about forty minutes and cost about a dollar. A 3 day pass is only about $13.00. It's a beautiful walk to the old part of town from this hotel, it takes less than an hour. The rooms have everything, microwave, refrigerator, hair dryer, fan and a modern bathroom. Breakfast each morning was included and plentiful complimented by Kristina's excellent coffee. Kristina was available everyday with tips of what's going on around town. Prague is a very vibrant city and the area around the Aparthotel City 5 is not exception, a large indoor mall, grocery stores and plenty or bars and restaurants that are excellent and a better value than eating in touristy parts of the city.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been coming to the Aparthotel for many years. The welcome from this place is warm and friendly. Kristina who runs the place makes you feel really at home and she goes the extra mile to make sure your visit is a pleasure. The rooms are bright and spacious and very clean and comfortable. The location is near Andel tube which makes it a short journey to get to anywhere in Prague. The river is nearby and it's a nice walk into town if you prefer to do that. Nearby are local markets and nice restaurants which are reasonably priced. I recommend the Czech restaurants nearby. The brewey is also nearby and worth a visit. Just five minutes away is a shopping centre with everything you could possibly want.This place is a good choice.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay in Kristina’s hotel was great. She is the soul of the place and make you feel at home. The hotel is just a few meters away from the train station which is very convenient and easy to use. We are very happy to have chosen Prague as our destination and blessed to have Kristina as our host.Thanks KristinaVirginia y Omar
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dear AllThis hotel is very good. Its near Andel metro station and also near to river. Charles bridge or vyshaed are at walking distance ( 30 minutes). Hostess is extremely good and help you with Prague tramps / maps etc. Breakfast was given free to me as i was solo female traveller :) . Breakfast was fresh and good. Many options around for lunch and dinner. Room : Big and spacy rooms. Neat and clean. Pictures are rightly mentioned in trip advisor. I will highly recommend this to everyone.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have just returned from a 6-night stay at Aparthotel City 5 and I would give it 10 stars if I could. The apartment itself was great - very clean and it had everything that we needed. The balcony was an unexpected extra!The breakfasts were lovely too, in a really comfortable environment - quiet, but cheerful and exceptionally welcoming.However, the best words that I have must be reserved for Kristina who runs the Aparthotel with such care and enthusiasm. Kristina loves her city and I really think that she is committed to ensuring that everyone that stays at Aparthotel City 5 has the best experience of Prague possible. She is so knowledgeable about the city and advises you about specific areas that may interest you, in addition to the popular tourist sites.Kristina is one in a million - I think everyone should visit Prague, and everyone should go and stay at Aparthotel City 5 :-). I can't wait to return!
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all I'd like to mention extremely friendly and helpful staff of the hotel. The rooms are clean and full of light. The building is new and has very cozy interior. Just in 5 min you can rich a metro station, a tram stop, or a supermarket. Breakfast is very delicious. It was a pleasure to stay in the hotel.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First – Let me say that EVERYTHING prior TA reviews have said about Kristina is true. She is the most welcoming, friendly, and helpful Concierge I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. Her suggestions and help made our well-planned trip to Prague even better.Reaching the correct stop on the metro is super easy from the main train station – Florenc. Take the yellow line towards Zlicin, and exit at the to the Andel station. Once in the station take the exit towards the BUS sign. Walk through the bus area until you reach the corner. Cross the street directly ahead and turn left immediately. [i..e. away from the restaurant with the big green beer sign]. At the first intersection turn right. – this is Vltavska St. The hotel, painted a rosy pink, is about half way down this street. If you keep going, you will walk right to the river. Press the intercom button for admittance.Kristina upgraded our apartment, so it was very roomy. The kitchen was well equipped. We had a full size fridge, microwave, cook top and hot pot. There was a comfy couch in the living area and a good chair in the bedroom. It was squeaky clean. There were lots of extra towels. Kristina has a lot of good travel info downstairs as well as a book exchange. The wifi signal was strong our entire trip. We found the apartment nice and quiet.One advantage of staying out here were the restaurants. Kristina recommended 2 that we enjoyed very much –the Na Veranda’ch [ the one with the big green beer sign, which was the brewery restaurant] and the Andel Plzensky in the opposite direction on Nadrazni. I had one of the best duck dinners ever there. If you are a beer drinker there are a lot of local brews on tap to try. We liked all the ones we tried. We also tried and liked very much a local place a bit further down Vltavska St on the other side of the street from the hotel. They had a bar upstairs and the restaurant downstairs. I think it was called the Katerina, or something similar. All the fun beers we had tried were here as well – just less expensive. The food was very good. There is also a Tesco supermarket nearby off of Nadrazni just past where all the trams are. At the corner where you first turn there is a fun little pastry and ice cream shop that is worth a stop.To leave for the airport, go back to Andel station and take the yellow line to the end of the line at Zlicin. Exit the station and turn right. The bus pick up for Bus 100 to the airport is only a few yards away and well-marked. Buy a 90 minute metro ticket which will get you on this bus as a transfer - no need to buy a separate ticket. From exiting the hotel to entering Terminal 1 took us an hour. Do plan on extra time [at least 1 hour] as the check-in process at the Prague Airport is VERY slow.I would not consider staying anywhere else on any subsequent trips to Prague.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the perfect place in Prague for our family. We had 2 adjoining rooms that were very clean, spacious, and comfortable. As others have noted, the woman who runs the hotel, Kristina, is amazing! - very warm and welcoming and informative. She really made our visit to Prague better by advising us and making us feel at home. This hotel is probably a 5 minute walk farther from the main attractions than other places, but for the superior service and reasonable price, it is definitely a great place to stay.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I stayed for five nights in April. We were warmly welcomed by the most brilliant and helpful hostess, Kristina. The hotel is located 15 minutes of walking to the city centre, and is surrounded by charming restaurants and bars with traditional food and mainly local Czechs. There's a huge shopping mall just around the corner with everything you'll need. The rooms are clean and the beds comfortable. I won't consider any other hotels when I'm going back to Prague. Great hotel at a great price. Thank you, Kristina. And yes, Kristina, we experienced Prague during daytime as well :)Sondre and Kjetil, Norway
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The woman who runs this guest house is the best host EVER! You will feel like you are family. Very friendly. Close to underground. Easy to get to airport from here. Very clean. Very quiet. Best guesthouse experience.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights. As we were travelling in a budget this was the most affordable place we could find still at £60pn but in Prague that seemed cheap now and for what we got it was excellent. So glad we stretched our budget and found this place.Location - yep it’s a little out of the old (25-30 min walk) and new town (15-20 min walk) but Prague is lovely to walk around so sad don’t bother us. Also loads better f restaurants and bars nearby much cheaper than in those tourist areas including being right next to staropramen and their sister restaurant mmmmmm. Less than 5 min walk to metro and major bus interchange and tram lines. Tesco 5-10 min walk away. Room - it’s an apartment and very clean, spacious and great facilitiesBreakfast - we had once as saving money but it was great at €4 a head and there was tonnes. We mainly had food in the apartmentStaff - the best part of this place is Kristina, she is super helpful, great tips, and just always friendly. Would definitely recommend. Worth it
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights and was excellent value for money. Christine the owner goes above and beyond to ensure not only your accommodation is great but more your experience of Prague. The location is central and easy to find with only a short walk to public transport. I have plans to visit Prague again in the near future and will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First let me say that Kristina's personal welcome introducing you to her city is exceptional. A good breakfast is served in the welcoming entrance lounge and the apartment rooms are very clean. However, as the 5th most popular hotel in Prague based on travellers reviews, I have to say that overall it did not live up to my expectations and I will echo comments made by another traveller in 2008. It might be that reviews I have read made me expect more, but the rooms whilst perfectly functional lack charm with their tiled floors and basically lino surfaces. In addition, the curtains did not quite cover the windows so street lights shone in. And although it is a short walk from the river and there are good local restaurants round the corner, it was further away from most tourist sites than I had expected. It is all perfectly fine for the price but sadly apart from Kristina herself, the place just did not quite live up to my expectations based on reviews I had read.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 旅行に出かけるのを決めてから、あまり時間も無く予約したのも急だったのですが、予約後直ぐにKristina からメールが届きました。一人旅で22時頃の到着で、フライト疲れもあってくたびれ気味でしたが、暖かく迎えてもらえてホッとしました。部屋は一人旅には充分で、スーツケースを広げても余裕です。キッチンもあり、お茶のティーパックが置いてあるのも嬉しかったです。Kristina は毎朝声を掛けてくれて、自分の家にいるように居心地良かったです。チェスキークルムロフへ行くのにStudent Agency のバスを利用しましたが、バス停まで徒歩3分の場所なので便利です。次回もまたこちらに戻ってきたいです。Dear Kristina,Thank you for everything. You have been so helpful. I was glad that you talked to me every morning.I was able to spend a lovely time in Prague and came to like Czech.I am going to visit Prague and your apartment again!Naoko
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful time at Aparthotel City 5 in Prague. It was our first time staying on this side of the river and hadn’t much explored the Smichov neighborhood. Our expectations were exceeded! The hotel is located just a couple blocks from a major transportation hub with Metro, trams, and buses (city and regional). If you want to take a day trip to Cesky Krumlov, can’t recommend this location enough as you’re just 5 min away. Or you can walk in the other direction just a couple blocks to the Vltava River. The rooms are mini apartments with a kitchenette including everything you might want to make a meal. The laundry service is super convenient. We didn’t have breakfast but the spread looked awesome. Last but most importantly, Kristina the owner was friendly and kind and unbelievably helpful. She gave us lots of recommendations for things to do in Prague and the neighborhood and overall was just a super lovely person to have as a host. Oh and the price. She could charge a lot more! But I’m glad she doesn’t. This is our new go-to when staying in Prague!
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ApartHotel City 5 ,Service apartments is just great ,loved my stay here . Kristina was really sweet and helpful in guiding us where all to visit since it was our first visit to prague . Next visit to Prague ,stay is definetly gonna be Aparthotel City 5.Kristina thanks again & God bless
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I found this little hotel on Trip Advisor and chose it because of all the good comments. The good comments were all true! The owner met us at the door and was genuinely sincere and warm in her greeting. This was especially welcome after a long series of air connections. She recommended the traditional restaurant 2 doors down which was superb and a must do! Breakfast the next morning and everyday was a real bounty of various types of European breakfast traditions. Room was spotless. bed was nice & firm as I prefer. Shower was European so you have to watch where you are spraying or you get a wet floor! A totally pleasant experience. the owner will also stop what she is doing to get out her city map and give you 'the straight scoop' on where , what and when! I look forward to my next visit!
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The place is located near the Anděl metro station, which has also plenty of tram stops, a shopping mall, supermarket, restaurants, pubs, etc. You can get to the old town square in a 20 minutes walk, which is great!The place was very clean and warm (we stayed during winter). We didn't notice much noise from outside despite having a massive window facing the street.There was nothing that particularly stood out about the room (which is good thing), but it was all about the host, Kristina, she is great!After a 27 hr trip (got stuck in airport, missed a bus, etc), she was super welcoming and helpful, she even gave us complimentary breakfast upon arrival (superb cheese toasties :D ). She also gave us a lot of recommendations, including places to visit and how to get there with a free map. Kristina definitely makes you feel more like in a B&B type of thing. She is the best.Overall great experience and would definitely recommend and stay again!
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an amazing time in Prague, and all made possible by our wonderful hostess Kristina at the Apartcity hotel. Kristina was a bundle of energy, first welcoming us in with a lovely late afternoon cappuccino, then giving us lots of ideas as to where to eat, drink and visit while in Prague. Breakfast was fantastic, and served by the energy lady, Kristina, including lovely cold cuts, fresh fruits, cheeses, cereal and coffees. Hotel itself was very nice, was a luxury to have a suite with a separate kitchen/lounge/dining area that gave us room to spread out (after a couple of weeks in hotels). The location is great - shopping centre down the street with plenty of restaurant options. It is an up an coming area, two of the Czech breweries have restaurants/breweries within a couple of blocks walking distance (Czech Republic has fantastic beers!!!). We also got all the directions we needed from Kristina. It was a wonderful stay, thanks Kristina!!! Sean & Deb from Sydney Australia
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay at aparthotel. It is about 25-30 minutes walking to the main part of town but even more quickly accessible by public transportation (both metro and streetcar). We had read great things about Kristina and she definitely lived up to expectations. She was so welcoming and offered us coffee when we arrived (free of charge) and helped us get oriented around the city with a free map and some personal recommendations. She even did a load of laundry for me for free. Overall great experience (especially for the price) and would definitely recommend and stay again!
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Believe the reviews!! Kristina is an absolutely amazing host. We got in around 5PM, and she immediately welcomed us with coffee and tea and all smiles. She sat down with us and personally went over a whole map of Prague, explaining how to get places, and all the highlights we shouldn’t miss. It came in very handy! She even managed to save a favorite sweater of mine I’d spilled goulash all over, and thought it was done for :) :) can’t say enough about her.The apartment was so comfortable, and had everything we needed and more. It literally is a full apartment!! Best value and most space we’ve seen in anywhere in Europe. The location is just outside of old town, a quick 20 min walk along the very scenic river, maybe 25 if you’re a slow walker. But honestly we loved the walk. There is also a tram just around the corner if you’re not up for the short hike. First impression of the location can be daunting (a lot of graffiti etc), but don’t worry it’s completely safe!!!! We walked home after dark every night and never once felt uncomfortable or had a problem. Prague is a very safe city. All in all loved our stay here, and will definitely be back. Promise you won’t regret booking here!
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Kristina would have to be the most friendly hotel host/owner i have ever met, from greeting me when i arrived, spending a good 30-60 mins explaining all the best things to do in Prague which helped me have an amazing time without a doubt. With fresh good spread for breakfast (toasted sandwich fav) everymorning and Kristina even washed my clothes. If you after a nice relaxed hotel with a super friendly host you cannot go past this hotel. Thank you Kristina with your help i think now Prague is in my top 5 favourite city in the world.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best value for money. Clean. Only problem the slow very slow internet. Good location. Happy owner. Near to metro station IP Pavlova. Near to a small food market. Near to bus station. Full of electric devices (hairdryer, washer etc)
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the place where you'll feel like coming home after the long flight.We impressed with the hospitality of the owner, Kristina. She welcomed us with the free buffet breakfast, explained everything about the city, and upgraded our room for free.This hotel was clean and well-maintained, room was spacious, and she provided free laundry service.The location was not exactly in the centre of city, but it was located just next to the Andel Station, a big intercity station, so getting around was not a problem at all. And it also near to the big mall, Novy Smichov, with the 24hrs supermarket on the 1st floor.I will recommended this hotel to anyone who visit Prague, and will definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I fly standby. While sitting in the gate at JFK and knowing I would be on the flight I got busy trying to find a place to stay. I came across the listing for Aparthotel City 5 and couldn't believe what I was seeing. How can it be possible to have so many excellent reviews? And how could this "Kristina" possibly be so good? The countdown to boarding was getting close. For me a leap of faith as I usually try to research every angle. I booked for 4 nights and got on the plane! That was the beginning of my good fortune on a wonderful trip to a city I'd never been to.  I'm not going to try to come up with something new and clever to say about Kristina.I've been in customer service and now the hotel business all my life. She is the most professional, knowledgeable,and welcoming person I've ever come across. With a wonderful sense of adventure and humor!  She knows how to read people and suggest ideas they may not consider. She also opened the door when I arrived and sat me down to a cup of coffee and pulled out a fresh map of the city. And her pen! And twenty minutes later I was out the door!  All in all, I must've seen one hundred sights in Prague and the day trips Kristina suggested to different cities. (Later that day I checked my emails and found one that Kristina had sent immediately after I made my reservation. In that email she outlined how to get to her hotel and an offer to have a driver pick me up. I found it easy to take the city bus from the airport to a stop that I would be seeing a lot of in the future!) To bring a close to a long review I'll leave you with this. I had originally made a four day reservation. I ended up staying eleven! I mentioned to Kristina that I made my decision based on the reviews. She seemed to be aware but not impressed. I hope to be back someday. I know where to stay now.And you will enjoy the toasties along with the entire breakfast layout.I enjoyed not having someone from the staff in my room during my stay. I'll let you know if I need anything.Most enjoyable was the two separate loads of laundry done at no cost or hassle!And meeting the others each morning at breakfast. Some very interesting and enjoyable people from all over the world.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Seriously amazing, felt like home on day 1, great location: just walking distance from all major Prague areas, awesome breakfast: awesome selection and best toasted and the most superb and welcoming host Christina.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Two couples arrived and checked in on 18/10/17 and were greeted by Kristina who treated us like we were part of the family - sat us down for a coffee/tea etc and then went through the map of Prague to tell su about all the sights and how to enjoy Prague. From that moment on we felt so special - what a lovely lady and what a fabulous welcome. If you are looking for a friendly place to stay and don't demand the fancy hotels with prices to match - then this is the spot to go. Lovely place, very clean and friendly, lovely flowers everywhere and all the advice and guidance to make your trip to Prague really special - we all loved it, thank you Kristina for treating us so well and for having a good laugh as well.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location - you can walk everywhere by foot, or use public transportation located few minutes walk from the hotel. Amazing place - clean and cozy. And the host... Oh, the host. You will find nowhere someone so warmly welcoming. Kristina welcomes every guest personally, gives you full information about Prague's sightseeing (she actually planned our stay in Prague during that meeting, so we were able to see the most of it in only 4 days), and is very helpful in any situation. Kristina, thank you for everything - you made our trip perfect!
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I arrived at Aparthotel City 5 afterhours as a fatigued stranger, but left four days later as the manger’s best friend. This is the experience that any reasonable tourist will have after meeting Kristina. She stayed late to welcome me and to begin my orientation to Prague. Kristina’s love for her city is infectious. The apartment, away from the chaos of old town, was a good location. When the 20-minute walk to the city center became a bit much, I took the nearby tram after Kristina’s simple introduction to local transportation. My apartment was large and clean. It had plenty of positives but someone looking for ‘fancy’ might be less happy. The most impressive elements of my stay were: Kristina, her bountiful and inexpensive breakfast, and the fact that everyone (three delightful couples) I met at breakfast had stayed at AC5 multiple times. It will certainly be my Prague home again if I have the good fortunate to return.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have hurt my ankle during the trip and needed crutches to walk. Befor we checked in, I emailed to Kristina to ask for a lower floor room. And we were late than we should be, I called her and her warm voice told me not to worry, she will be there for us. When we got there, she opened the door and gave us very passionate welcome. We felt like we were home. She cared about my foot and thought of many details to help me release my pain and inconvenience. She gave us the most useful information to see prague, so Prauge is my favorite during this trip. I also like her breakfast and beautiful small garden. When I am back, I definitily will stay in this hotel again.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a perfect place to stay. The location is great - access to the metro, trams and shopping center. The studio we stayed in was clean and comfortable with everything we needed. Kristina is a wonderful host - full of energy and spunk. She is there to assist and guide your experience in Prague. The breakfast is great with a variety of foods to eat - pastries, yogurt, fruit, cheese, meat, etc. She also makes a delicous ham and cheese toast. You will feel so welcomed and happy staying there. Another plus is that it is close to the Saturday market. A must see in Prague. You can take a tram/boat to the market - which is so fun.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I forgot my home when I was staying there. Kristina is really awesome.. no words.. she s very helpful.. she made me feel home. I was totally comfortable. she will do wtever u want. she made break fast ready especially for me at 7:30am. their Break fast time is at 8:30am. So, its a big help for me. she is a good guide if u want any suggestion to roam around prague, u can ask her. prague is a great historical city and aparthotel is a beautiful place to stay in prague. Am waiting for my next trip. In my next trip also I will stay in aparthotel only. <3 :)
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Of my current trip's accommodation, this place is the best. Best in cleanliness (spotless clean, likely one of cleanest in Europe and similar to the cleanest of Japanese standard), convenience (has all the basic amenities you need), location and most importantly the host Kristina. Location:Location is very convenient. 2min walk from Andrel station and 5min walk to the shopping complex with convenience stores. Location is not right smack in the middle of city but I'd prefer here as it is less noisy, less crowded yet within a manageable and walking distance to the city (est 20min) with nice view along the river. If you'd like to opt for metro/ tram, it has direct tram to Kampa, Mala Strana area (tram #2 I think), from which you can also walk to Prague castle.There is also direct tram to Letna park to view sunset (alight at "sparta" stop).There are many eateries near Andrel station, but I want to highlight a very affordable and nice Cezch restaurant which is 2min walk from the hotel (ask the host for directions)Cleanliness:Spotless clean - from toilet, kitchen, bed - perfectHost:Kristina is a very attentive and sincere host. She does her best to accommodate and answer any inquiries you might have, and serves very good breakfast too! There are many hotels with good services, but I think her sincerity and going the extra mile to service from the heart makes all the difference - it doesnt feel like a temporary place to sleep, it feels like home away from home. Will choose here anytime if I were to visit again.Stayed for 3 nights in September 2017
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Large apartment with bedroom and living room with tv. the rooms are clean with fridge, microwave, safe and coffee available.Only one English speaking channel but we did not come from USA to watch tv. Metro 5-7 minutes away, we purchased 3 day pass for two for $30 usd. and was flagged 3 times in Metro so be sure to have your tickets or pass when using metro. Christina went far and beyond her duties to assist her and we wish to thank her for her for making our trip more enjoyable. Recommend visiting the Terezin Concentration Museum and the St. Cyril and Methodius Church, plenty of World War History in both places.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's been a while since I wrote a review. I was compelled to shift away from my inertia because of my experience at Aparthotel and with Kristina. If I could convince Trip Advisor to skip straight from their 2018 award (Aparthotel is awarded this every year) and go straight to living sainthood, Kristina would be duly rewarded. My mother who also wrote a review, broke her foot at the end of our very first wonderful day (of a two week trip!). Simple freak fall on the cobblestones (helpful hint, wear sturdy shoes and be mindful! Nobody stares at their phones like they do in North America. Walking is the equivalent of driving stick - can't multitask!). Dusk made orienting ourselves difficult (we were almost back at Aparthotel, so well located in Prague) and I was loathe to roam as I hadn't yet found a SIM card. I got a hold of Kristina and she arrived like a superhero and arranged a taxi to take us to the hospital. She conveyed in Czech what was going on and made sure we were taken care of (wheelchair, triage, etc.). Suffice to say a heel break meant *zero* foot-floor contact. Side note - make sure you have comprehensive medical insurance (we did, thankfully) and avoid the public hospitals. Language is an issue and instead of a cast, we got crutches calibrated for a 5'9" person (my mother, in her 70s, 5'4"), no lesson on how to use them and a free bonus lecture on the evils of capitalistic private health care. I'm Canadian and adore my socialized medicine, so tend to agree with this but in the case of Prague - you must opt for private. Kristina early the next day arranged to get a mini scooter that folded up so we could take taxis (not so easy to find!). She helped us adapt to this new reality always with her cheerful and practical optimism. She was determined to save our trip. She suggested accessible places to visit. When my mother developed an infection, she got us antibiotics and refused money. When we left our crutches at a restaurant one night (thankfully not too far) she hopped in her car to retrieve.
