Every self-perceived inconvenience thrown at her met with humour and kindness.Every time she heard us descend to leave for an outing or returning from an adventure, she would be there ready to help us in and out, or taking the scooter to recharge for the night. Ready, always ready - her gorgeous face and Cyndy Lauper hair became our patron saint. I'll leave it to others to describe the charm of the accommodation - homey, whimsical and lovely. Flooded with flowers, plants and an overall positive energy that contributes to a sense of community. The feeling contagious. Everyone chatting in her delightful kitchen. Nero her adorable Dachshund tootling for scraps... The spacious digs, everything one needs to live comfortably, even long-term... The fact you're in a residential hood living like a local, not 5 minutes from transit and a fully stocked mall with everything you need...That Kristina sits with you upon your arrival, no matter the time, with a smile and a refreshment and literally maps out everything you need to know. Arranges taxis to and from airport, rides, outings...We thought we had some special relationship with Kristina but then we witnessed so many hugs, so many gushing goodbyes... and of course this is why I selected her in the first place. 1,000+++ 5 * reviews. In this case, it's ok not to be "special", we are more than happy to share the love. Thank You dear Kristina for EVERYTHING <3
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had the misfortune of breaking my foot the very first day in Prague. Fortunately, I was staying at Aparthotel and Kristina was my host. She met with us at the site of the accident, arranged for my transport to hospital, secured my mobility devices and became my advocate during my stay. How does one describe this place and these hosts? They become family and care profoundly for their guests. Nothing is overlooked. All details, great and inconsequential are addressed in a loving, caring manner. Aparthotel will always be my home in PragueThank you, KristinaYou were my AngelDahlia Zaide RusinekToronto, Ontario,Canada
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are excellent location is about twenty minute walk from the town centre,kristina is an extremely nice and welcoming person, and ia very enthusiastic about pleasing her guests. Cant fault the hotel.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here on recommendation from my daughter and didn't regret it. We were here for 4 nights and then returned for a night after travels to Český Krumlov.From the outset Kristina was a wonderful host, providing us with helpful, useful advice and tips about the city. The hotel is clean, cheery and comfortable. It is close to all services either walking or public transport. Right near Andel underground and bus station. This was the best place we stayed in during our whole trip. Thoroughly recommended. I will definitely return.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very clean and comfortable. Kristina goes above and beyond to make sure you have a great trip. When we arrived she took the time to give us a cup of coffee and show us a map of the city. Excellent customer service! Highly recommend staying here.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Aparthotel 5 over a period of 3 1/2 days, and had an extremely positive experience. My room was clean and well-maintained, and the breakfast buffet represented exceptional value for money for only 4 euro. The proximity to many restaurants and Metro/tram stops is also welcome, and the local river is easily reached within a few minutes of walking.The host, Kristina, did everything possible to ensure that I enjoyed my stay and was always willing to advise on which attractions to visit. I have never experienced such hospitality elsewhere, in spite of being fairly well-travelled. I thus recommend the Aparthotel 5 without hesitation.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice 2 rooms plus bath, including kitchenette, was perfect for our family with 2 teens. Safe location has lots of restaurants nearby, is a block from Metro and tram stops, but also pleasant evening walk to and from downtown. We felt perfectly safe having our teens go out separately and find their way home. Breakfast is comfortable, filling and relaxed. Kristina also went out of her way to help me with my Czech geneology search including translating and making a phone call. We'll be back!
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived after leaving another hotel because I had wrongfully booked it for less nights than I was staying. It must have been about 10 am when I was informed I had to leave and had to rush to pack everything while finding another hotel for that night. In a stroke of divine luck I found the hotel in question.I was expecting close to nothing, instead I was greeted by who is probably The Friendliest Woman in Prague. It was well over 11:30 and all guests had already had breakfast, but when I told her I hadn't had anything she proceeded to cook breakfast herself, just for me. While I was eating, she went out of her way to prepare my room (which I had booked just 45 minutes ago). The room was actually -as the name suggests- a nice, spacious and comfortable apartment. I got much more than I needed and expected.While the location is not right in the city's center, it is only a 20-minute walking distance from the castle and main square. In addition, the owner gave me close to 5 billion alternatives to the popular hotspots which were just as interesting and were not plagued with tourists. Just ask and you will learn about an old cemetery or a romantic themed walking itinerary.I am extremely thankful for feeling so well welcomed and treated.Btw, I'm sorry if this comes across as a very subjective personal experience, but said personal experience is all I can provide, and it was also excellent!Enjoy Prague :)
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family of 6 stayed 3 nights in the apartment. Very clean,spacious room in a convenient location close to tram and subway. There is a small kitchen in the room too. Highly recommended especially for family.
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner & I stayed 5 nights here and would definitely stay again. The host Kristina is wonderful, she invites you straight into the bar for a welcome drink and chats to you all about the city, where to go, how to get there, what to see etc. (to the extent of highlighting it out on a map for us to take) and was more than happy to help in any way through our stay. The location is excellent, the room/ apartment was very comfortable, immaculately clean & had a nice breakfast available each morning. Never had better hospitality anywhere!
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Kristina is absolutely amazing. She made us feel at home straight away and really looked after us. The rooms are extremely spacious, contain a microwave, fridge and stove and the hotel can be conveniently located if you arrive by the train as it's only a few minutes walk from Andel Metro station. Kristina gave us a map and informed us of all the best places to go in Prague and numerous tips.You also have to try the breakfast as Kristina makes the best ham and cheese toastie in Prague!!!Kristina thanks for making our stay in Prague great. We look forward to returning when we visit your beautiful country again! Kathy and Joe
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved visiting Prague; made even better by Christina our host at Aparthotel! Confortable rooms; adequate breakfast accompanied by 'instructions ' of what to see and why! Also central to all tourist attractions; and awesome Saturday morning markets. Absolutely loved it
hotelName:
19    Aparthotel City 5
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location, cleanliness and value for money. We usually do not spend a lot of time at the hotel, but rather out walking in the streets. Comfy bed and nice bathroom. Breakfast was included. Garage parking available for 20EUR/night.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Prague as a city break for five days/four nights. The hotel was fine as a base for our stay. In my opinion it is not a holiday hotel, four nights there is enough.There was nothing at all wrong with the hotel, we had the B&B package which was ideal. The breakfast opinions were fantastic, the kitchen catered for all tastes including continental and English breakfasts and the food they served was excellent.Our room was as we expected, clean, tidy and comfortable. The room was cleaned everyday which was a plus for us. The room had a TV, on which there was Netflix so when we were back in the room we could put the telly on and watch something interesting. The hotel is about a five minute walk from Wenceslas square where everything was going on.All in all a nice hotel with nothing that anyone could complain about if they were there for a short break in a beautiful city.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is about a 15-20 minute walk to the centre of Prague. It’s down a small road so you wouldn’t know it was there. When you walk in the lobby is spacious and the receptionists on hand and helpful. We had 3 rooms for our group of 9 split over two floors (not a problem) the rooms were spacious and had all the necessary amenities you could want from a hotel room for a weekend break. It was clean and tidy and overall a great hotel/location. There was some refurb going on so there was a strong smell of paint but otherwise didn’t know there was any work taking place. Breakfast was lovely - good choice of food. Downside the toaster takes forever even on the highest setting so if you’re after a quick bite of toast reconsider the options - which are plentiful.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I couldn’t sing praises or write a vitriolic review because it was all just fine. I don’t wish to sound negative in any way because there were no negatives.I was treated to a trip to Prague for my birthday and this hotel was ideal really. Number one thing is that it was Great value. Clean, spacious and ideally located within walking distance of everywhere. The hotel is not central but we didnt use a bus/tram/metro once. Within 5/10 mins walk there are some really nice restaurants and bars leading to Namesti Miru where an early xmas market had opened up.We were booked a suite, but a standard room would have been fine. Room was clean and well equipped for what little time we spent in it. Prague has so much to offer, your hotel needs are limited. The hotel breakfast was great and appreciated the fact it served till 10:30. We are not early birds.I would recommend this hotel for those, like us, who dont spend much time indoors. Staff are friendly and I appreciate that housekeepers took the time to fold my PJ’s. If visiting Prague again, I would book here again.P.S. check out Bad Jeff’s Barbeque 10/15 mins walk
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed one night here in October. The apartment was really huge but a bit old fashioned and there was a fitted carpet. However the bed was excellent and we also appreciated the separate bathroom and toilet. If you want a good hotel situated close to everything but however silent, this is a good choice with a reasonable price.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A clean and tidy hotel, a bit dark and aged in places but on the whole not a bad place to be. The hotel resides on a quiet street which is close to a tram stop. The fifth floor apartment suite is perfect for larger groups. The breakfast is nothing special but should easily satisfy. Our stay was very reasonably priced. Our only concern was some of the staff, certainly not all. But the select few made it feel rather un welcoming at times. Miserable and somewhat un helpful with absolutely no attempt to hide the rolling eyes when asked a question. This appears to be a recurring theme within Prague towards tourists.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was clean and basic - nothing fancy. The front desk personnel was somewhat helpful, although their information was not as clear as it could have been. The location is ok, but I wish there had been a better selection of nearby restaurants. The best thing about our stay here was their very generous and tasty breakfast which is included in the price of the room. There were many selections, both savory and sweet, and everything was very fresh and well presented.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Short walk to metro/tram stop and Wenceslas Square. Lots of good, cheap bars and restaurants nearby which provide a welcome respite from the crowds in the main tourist areas. We stayed four nights and the reception staff were very polite throughout. We also found the buffet breakfast excellent. Would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel republic is a nice place to stayThe reception was very kind and niceWe booked a room for 4 of us and it was very large with two room for separated place to sleep !!! ExcellentIt's is very clean place !Breakfast was ok, included in the price with several choices, it could be a little bit betterWe will come back with pleasure
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an awful experience on this hotel. We didn't get the beds that we ordered (4 adults) as one of them was a child's bed (70cm).We got a terrible treatment on the reception as the Lady was laugthing saying that we cannot make a complaint just because she didn't want. All time kidding to us and without helping us to her more info of why we got this kind of bed... So, no respect to us in hotel as customers so won't recommend it to anyone...
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have to echo a recent review which commented on the negative attitude at the reception desk on arrival. The same happened to my wife and I when we recently spent 3 days at the hotel. This improved as time went on, but first impressions always count. There are countless alternatives in Prague.That said our room was good and very clean. Looks like a recent reburshishment had taken place, so bathroom and shower cubicle were excellent. Lighting in the room was on the low side and could be improved.Breakfast had something for everyone and was very good. Location was okay, but a bit of a hike to the Old Town Square and the surrounding area if walking is a bit of a problem.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A nice place to stay in a convenient location. My room was rather small but I survived. In case you would have a problem with small space than I suggest you ask for another one. I would definatelly ask for a room which does not have a view to a wall. It was clean and equipped. Breakfast was good, offered variety of food options and regularly refilled. Wi-fi is free and of good strenght.Staff is helpful and polite.P.S. They should really reduce excessive use of scented cleaning detergents. The wholle place smells intensivelly after it. I had to keep my window open constantly so that I avoid headache.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. Friendly staff. Breakfast is sumptuous. Room for two is a bit small but the beds very comfortable and basic amenities good. Close to Wenceslas square and in easy walking distance are Old town square, Charles Bridge, Quadrio Mall, Dancing House. Towards the end of my 5-day stay was not too keen to walk, no problem, the tram lines and metro were 5-7 minutes away. As mentioned in the other reviews on this forum the elevator is slow and my 1st floor room window look out was the wall of an adjacent building with an open terrace in between (on the 1st day found this a bit depressing but then you do not have time to stay put in the room). This hotel has no restaurant so you cannot order any room service for dinner etc.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very close to city center. Delicious breakfast for European culture. Autopark is advantage but expensive as all around Prag city. Clean rooms and bathrooms. Very good at cost benefit analysis. If I will go to Prag again I will stay there again
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel should be in first republic style, but seems to be a bit dark and smelly. But all equipment seems to be clean and fine. Breakfasts a bit monotonous and seems a bit poor of warm food. During winter there has been really cold at the room and I had flu. But receptionist has been always nice.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights on arrival was greeted straight away and offered coffee our room was on the small side but everything you needed down to house coats breakfast was ok could always find something to eat ..
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed my stay here. Very nice hotel with friendly stuff. Rooms are quite small, but cozy. Bed was comfortable. Breakfast was quite simple, but fulfilling. The location is not far away from Vrozlaw Square.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good location within easy-moderate walking distance to the new town square, old town square and even the Charles Bridge. Excellent value for money. Love these quaint Hotels. This one had plenty of soul, with its corridors that made you feel you were somehow in some old chateaux, and the rooms with quite a modern contrast; although small were comfortable and well designed. Nice arty touch with the theme of photo-paintings running through the common areas and rooms. Staff made all the difference. Lovely, warm, friendly attentive. Cosy little lobby lounge, although offering a limited array of coffees and snacks made to feel very homely by attentive staff. Felt very much at home during a week-long stay.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed our stay at the 1.republic. Were able to check in early and the receptionist offered us coffee when we arrived. Booked a suite which was worth the extra money. Room was roomy and clean with a good shower. Bed was also comfy. Only problem I had was the hairdryer kept turning off after 20 seconds then wouldn't turn on for another 5 minutes. breakfast was fairly good! Good location for what we wanted. Would return if in Prague again. Overall really good value for money.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Despite smaller room and little waitng for the car, the stay was great!Especially- good location / price - clean rooms with minibar fridge- rich breakfast, ready also for glutein/dairy free people- strong wifi DL 8MB/s- kind personell (free map on reception, free champaign to room as birthday present etc)
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I know, I know it's Prague not Paris. However this hotel was a star find in our opinion. Close to Wenceslas Square (less than 5 minutes walk) and close to the river (about 10 minute stroll) and sandwiched between the main thoroughfares of Zitna and Jecna. So it's conveniently placed and the shuttle, a mini bus with two other couples took a little over thirty minutes to reach the hotel from the airport.Our welcome was warm and whilst completing out registration cards the receptionist provided coffee and cake for us. Perhaps we looked like we needed it after a very early start to catch the flight. We had one of the smaller rooms in the hotel, however it was well appointed, spotlessly clean and very comforatble.Breakfast was a wide choice of continental and hot food with plenty of fruit and cereals available. Juice, coffee and choice of teas.The double bed had two single duvets, which threw us a bit and the only English language TV channels were BBC World News and if I recall correctly CNN, but that wasn't a big deal.What else is there to say, friendly staff, good accommodation, excellent location and the food was plentiful and delicious.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister and I stayed here for a few nights in May (2017). The price is great, as is the location (I thought the area seemed pretty safe, as we walked back from the main tourist areas in the evenings and night). We enjoyed the breakfast and wifi as well. Rooms were a little on the smaller side but still enough room for the two of us, and the bathroom was pretty big. Overall, a really great value!
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located at old town and very nearby old town square. It’s 5 min walk to the nearest metro station I.P Pavlova. We stayed here for 3 night (15th-18th). The staff is very prompt response via email before we depart to Prague. We had asked for taxi arrangement for our arrival and birthday cake arrangement as it was my husband 40th birthday on 15th. The taxi fare is 650kč, about 40 min from airport to old town. Although our taxi has minor crashed by another careless driver in front of the hotel but this didn’t spoil our holiday mood.When we arrived at the hotel, we were welcomed with hot tea/coffee and homemade cake. The receptionist Alisa is very friendly and helpful. She gave us a very good suggestion for sightseeing Prague city with 2 young kids and save our money. We took a hop on hop off orange mini bus for a day trip for exploring the city on day 2. During the winter time, the museums and 1 hour river cruise are close early. The hotel has prepared a Rosé wine for my husband birthday and the housekeeper is very friendly and thoughtful, she left some candy and a little bear keychain for my children after cleaning our room. This little thing really made my children happy. Thank you to them. The breakfast buffet you cannot miss out! Variety food to choose , nice coffee and tea, each day the hot food they served were different. It was a great experience for us. Our first visit Prague , first experience with hotel 1 Republic. We will be back !!
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would highly recommend this hotel. This was our second time staying at this hotel we were there two years ago for our staff party from Ireland and we stayed here again for this years staff party. It’s so clean warm and the staff are extremely friendly. Great location. Great breakfast. I look forward to returning thank you so very much for a wonderful stay once again.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very impressed with this hotel. Gorgeous coffee on arrival. Location perfect for some sight-seeing (not too far to walk in cold Jan!). Staff went above & beyond to ensure my fiance had a special birthday. Made our first experience of Prague wonderful & we would return to this hotel in a heartbeat.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the " radium" apartment on the top floor. It has three bedrooms, 2 bathrooms. Very nice and recommended for families. The location is also good, a short walk away from Vaclavske square. There is also a luggage room in case needed. For short, recommended.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was great! We arrived late in the day and didn't have a place to stay (7 people). They were very helpful in working it out to stay. Their rooms are very clean and air conditioned! The breakfast was a great spread with lots of options. You're a short walk from the main square and not far from all the other main sights!
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mid priced but close to wensalas square and national museum.Breakfast was buffet style. I am a really fussy eater so not a lot of things for me.I filled up egg, fried or scrambled on toast.Coffee is nice despite being from a machine.Facilities are sparse but that did not bother us as this was our base to go out.Reception is friendly and helpful and English I spoken.Rooms are clean and basic.Showers only.Our room on the second floor was quiet.Air con in the rooms as it can get hot in prague.Tea, coffe, mini bar, hair dryer and dressing gowns.I would stay here again.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Republic Hotel was everything we hoped it would be - welcoming, clean and centrally located - this was the perfect base for exploring Prague. The hotel staff were very helpful and eager to assist with booking tours and taxis. Overall, would recommend this to fellow travellers and would stay here again!
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a couple of nights and found it to be a excellent base to get to all the sites Prague has to offerService was good, and hotel was very clean. We stayed in room 210, which yes did have 2 single beds pushed together but after walking all the sites just needed somewhere to collapse on a soft bed which these were. Bathroom had a shower unit and plenty of hot water, and we heard no noise which had been mentioned previously Breakfast is typically continental but good If looking for a base then would recommend this hotel
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here during a 3 day visit to Prague. It's just 10mins walk from train station and about 10mins to the main shopping street and near by historic old town. As other reviews have said it's a bit of the beaten track and doesn't look like much from outside but rooms are spotlessly clean and comfortable. Staff are very friendly and helpful and good breakfast, WiFi etc. Everything you need for short city break and better value than some of the hotels in 'old town'! Would highly recommend local Italian 'trattoria' around the corner! Lovely food and just few mins from hotel.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is in a good location, a 10 min walk from Wenceslas Square. Hotel is very clean and well presented. Our room was quiet and well equipped with all we needed..towels, dressing gowns and toiletries.Also, there is a mini bar which was not expensive. Tea and coffee facilities in the room, as well as TV and hairdrier. Breakfast was included in our rate...plenty of choice of hot and cold items, all good. Staff are very pleasant and helpful and can arrange airport transfers for you for a fixed price.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in a "luxury suite" for 5 nights with my wife and two teenagers. The old town is a 20-30 minutes walk away, but the trams are very easy to use, just get the 24h tickets from near by metro station. The room was a bit dark and during weekend the party people can be heard if your room is facing the street. Wifi worked well (important especially for our teenagers), and breakfast was very ok. Minibar prices were reasonable, and the two rooms in our suite were quite big.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I went there with my girlfriend for a weekend in Prague and we stayed for 2 nights. We were very pleased with the facilities, the breakfast, the stuff and the room in general. I would recommend it considering its price and the proximity to the city center.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good hotel. The room was clean and warm, not very spacious but we didn’t really need that much space anyway. The bathroom was also clean, it had a hairdryer and wee toiletries. The big plus was breakfast that was included in the room price. We went down to the restaurant around 9 or 10 but there was still plenty of food to choose from. The location is pretty decent but it’s not the heart of the old town. It takes around 15-20 mins to walk to the main square and the clock. Main train station is also around 20 mins away (walking). Overall, I think it’s great value for money. I would stay there again without doubt.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was in a business trip, and the hotel attacted me because of good discount in addition to suitable location and very good responces. So, the only one con: there is no restaurant in the hotel. Besides, this is not a real problem in Praha in evening. You can find some food nearby till 23.Everything else was exceptionally good. Professional, friendly personnel is everywhere (reception, buffet, cleaning, etc.). Very clean. Everything works. Rooms are equiped with everything you need. Mine was unexpectedly small, but warm, quiet, clean and inexpensive. Good bed. Really high speed wireless internet. Beer, juce ans cola from a fridge are not crazy expensive. Breakfasts were above my expectations!The hotel is located 15 mins by walk from a railway station and 10 min by walk from a metro station. There are number of pubs and chinese mini food/goods stores around.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is recommended if you want to reach all the nice and interesting places by your own feet-walking. In 5-10 min you are in the middle of historic center and if you want to visit original Svejk restaurant " U kalicha" it is pretty close. The staff is very nice and very helpfull whatever your needs. Breakfeast is excellent ,rooms are quiet and beds are comfortable. I have staied in this hotell twice and will return.Recommended
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this hotel is welcoming , every thing you need , cant fault our stay ,room was perfect , clean , comfortable , breakfast was by far more than was expected xxx we didnt need any toiletries , all provided , quite area , staff where helpful , very welcoming , nothing was to much trouble , extremely happy with our stay , first time visit , will definatly visit again in the future , happy to come back to this hotel , highly recommend xx
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Reception staff were friendly and welcoming from the word go (contrary to what some other reviewers have said).We had a problem with a noisy room and they were more than happy to change us to a new room. Location is good - close to trams, metro and within walking distance of the old town. Breakfast is plentiful and a good variety each day. We'd definitely stay again.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel that is conveniently located and comes with parking. Friendly staff and comfortable room. Parking facility as referred to picture attached. Remember to ask for parking when u book hotelBreakfast is decent with good variety of choices.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1. I and my partner checked in around 6 pm and we were met by a woman from the front desk and a guy whom I think was security/bellman. 2. We were not greeted nor helped with our bags even if they saw us struggling to come in with our luggage . The 2 just looked at us and we had to tell her we were checking in.3. Front desk woman was curt and cold and not very welcoming. I felt that she wanted us out of her way . Even with giving directions she just gave us a map that was pre- marked on hotel's location. Definitely not very helpful coming from someone who should be the "face" of the hotel .4. Room we were given was nice and quiet. 5. Our room was regularly cleaned and we appreciate such gesture. 6. Front desk team missed a wake up call we requested by 15 minutes 7. Martin, who works at the breakfast area was very nice and friendly and always took time to ask how we were or how our breakfast was. 8. Another Front desk team who works in the afternoon is not sure of what the hotel offers. The hotel had a posting at the computer area about shuttles but she didn't know what it was and she had to refer it to a man who himself didn't know what it was . It seemed like it was the first time they heard about it . my partner had to figure it out. You shouldn't be advertising services if you yourself do not know how it works. 9. Also, front desk woman in the afternoon didn't know how to process checkout via payment via credit card and cash. She asked us to come to the desk in the morning instead. 10. Hotel is centrally located .
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights Loved the location Breakfast is good (serviced until 10:30)The room is small, bathroom is good size Not really a romantic place , but good to people who want to explore the city We paid about 59 € for the firsts night and the second time 71€
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in hotel 1. Republic visiting from Australia with my partner in September. Great location, close enough to the city center yet still quiet. Room was spacious and very clean. The staff was attentive and very helpful. Would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is ok, don't expect too much, but is totally fine for what you pay.We hade a suite and the room was really big and clean.The breakfast is not the best I've ever had in a hotel, but is nothing I would complaint about.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Hotel is very well located - in a very quiet street for a relaxed night sleep specially if you are with family . Its just 5 min walk to the New Town Square and may be 12 min walk to the Old town square . Bus , tram and Underground is just 200 metres away . We took a Deluxe Apartment which was air conditioned and very spacious . Hotel staff was highly helpful in booking train tickets or bus tickets .
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here as the location is within walking distance from city and the rooms are very good, upgraded to a suite which was massive and very cheap. Would highly recommend as a base when visiting this city
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good position, close to the main objectives, you can have a short walk to find all of them! good breakfast, clean hotel! an advantage is the parking in the garage- in the center of Prague - a little bit expensive, 20 euro/day, but it's ok ! Overall, a good location for a city break!
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is clean and comfortable with air conditioning. It is a little far from the center and walk 25 min from main terminal. But you can take underground (C?) to I.P. Pavlova stop (only two stops from main terminal) and walk 5 min to the hotel. Also, it is closed to trams #22 stop (10 min walk) then it will take you to most of attraction area. They have great breakfast and nice kitchen staffs. Only one of the front reception was rude and we had to wait 10 min when she was on the phone.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a weekend in June 16. Would have rated it a 4 star but between them and booking.com... they goofed up on our reservation... and to top it off, we had to pay premium rates due to last minute booking.Pros=========* Budget hotel, but would recommend you book in advance. They generally charge 2x rates over the weekend.* Most of the places are walking distance from here.* Breakfast spread is quite nice, however they don't have lunch or dinner option.Cons=========* Between booking.com and them, they goofed up our reservation. We had our kid with us but they did not have that info, so we could not get an extra bed.* Everything is self-service, they don't have much staff. Assuming you are not paying 2x rates, you should be ok with that.* They are not a kid friendly hotel. If you have kids, then they seem to charge quite a bit extra... compared to other hotels. Be sure to read the policy.All-in-all, don't expect much from the place and be sure to validate your booking by calling them.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although room looks clean and cozy, it was the worst stay in my life.Ventilation system of the bathroom is broken, and never stops making big head-aching sounds. Even though bathroom is two doors away from the bedroom, closing doors does not help this problem at all.Staff said there is no other room they can replace me, but I believe this room should not be served to any guests from first.In the end I took away a key-card while I am in the room, so that all electricity including ventilation system stops. It was my last night in Prague and without lights, without shower, cannot do packing up due to darkness. I don't even know if I should pay for this hotel. I hope that this problem will be fixed soon and next customer won't suffer like I did.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent three nights in this hotel. Upon arrival we were stressed because of working too hard but when we left the hotel we were relaxed and cheerful. The room was very big and comfortable. The beds were excellent. You can sleep well and relax. We did not hear any noise from the street. we loved the old fashioned atmosphere of the hotel. The staff was helpful and kind. The cleaning service worked only on week ends. We had to use extra litter bins. You must walk only 200 meters to the nearest metro station.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pretty clean hotel, small but friendly officers. Bathroom Shower works perfect. Sometimes, internet goes slow, but it's ok. About 15-20minutes walk/ tram to the Main Street of old city. Thanks for the coffee you served for free while I was waiting a taxi in the lobby.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In terms of value-for-money for bed and breakfast the hotel could not be faulted. Very clean, staff friendly and helpful; breakfast had fine range of options. Smooth wifi. Nothing to complain about at all.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a friend's 50th birthday for three nights Tuesday to Friday. Lovely hotel, great position, clean rooms, friendly staff. Breakfast included - mostly continental but sausage and eggs each morning too. Taxi from the airport cost about £16. Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
20    1.Republic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice property in a quiet location. Helpful personnel and very convenient on request (!!!) shuttle from hotel to a nearest metro or tram station. Rooms, however, would need some attention – there are certain maintenance issues – at least the one stayed in.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from this hotel and would highly recommend it It was very relaxing after busy days in Prague .We were visiting our daughter on a university exchange programme and it was walking distance to her accommodation.Breakfast was nice ,room large and as previously stated a fantastic pick up service to and from metro however using bus 201 and 112 will also take you near to the hotel.Used the hotel pool sauna jacuzzi most days and had it to ourselves very clean and nice.The hotel wifi did not work too well but not a real issue for us personally.Looking forward to a Spring visit as some nice outdoor space to sit in bar /gardens and a crazy golf course plus bowling.Very helpful kind staff and a great ambiance.We didn't travel with young children but a fantastic little playground loads of equipment for them Thanks a great stay
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 2 nights during first visit to Prague. Hotel is in a quiet residential area and has private parking which means you don’t have to be confused by fighting with trams etc. Hotel offers a free shuttle service on request including pick ups until 11pm...they will organise tickets for anything you want to see and offer plenty of advice. Really friendly place with comfortable rooms..has a pool and sauna but we didn’t use it. Great stay
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here to complete our honeymoon in Prague and it was just splendid. Everything was amazing, the room, the pool, the free shuffle bus service which also picks you up from town(ish)!!! We even got a packed breakfast because we told the staff we have to leave around 4am to catch our flight! I was beyond impressed!
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good clean and friendly hotel just out of the city. Great value and made convenient by the addition of a courtesy bus to the tram stop or train station for onward transfer Ito town. A simple call to the hotel when you return and the mini bus collects you within a few minutes.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this hotel is out of the city centre making it quiet and good to relax, there is also good access to the city, the staff was very kind and great, food was god and roooms clean, thhe spa is a bit too small.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very spacious comfortable room, very clean, very helpful staff, good facilities, excellent breakfast, parking. The hotel is situated away from the centre up a hill, but they offer a free minibus service whenever required down to the nearest tram stop from where it's only a few stops to the centre. They took us down to the stop very promptly when requested, and were there to pick us up just a few minutes after we called.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were most pleased by this hotel! We had a family room which was basically a small apartment. Two very large separate rooms with a bathroom. Just amazing when you have two doors separating you and your children for a good night sleep and still have a comfortable, homey feeling. Their shuttle service is also great. It takes you to the zoo and back, or a nearby metro station if you want to visit Prague and you can leave your car there safe. The driver of the shuttle was super friendly and with the biggest smile. We also played a game of their adventure mini golf which was also very amusing. The restaurant was also pleasing with a lovely terrace and little playground. Basically , a very lovely hotel and I would recommend it to anyone who wants to visit Prague and still enjoy a little peace and quiet.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed at this hotel three times over the past couple of months and have thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The first time we were a bit dubious as the hotel is outside of the city but the friendliness of the staff made up for this and the fact that the mini bus was willing to take you to the nearest Metro or tram stop and pick you up again. The ride into the centre of Prague was relaxing and entering the city from a different direction makes you realise the splendour of the place.The rooms are clean, comfortable and well air conditioned. The beds are also comfortable and extra pillows are available upon request.The breakfast in the adjoining restaurant is good but not an excessive choice and again you are given a smiling welcome. The lunch time menu changes everyday and is very good value for money.The evening menu is limited and needs to be updated on a more regular basis as is becomes monotonous if your are staying more than a few days.The laundry service is same day and the bags are iron and non iron. No clothes were returned that had been washed at too high a temperature and prices reasonable.We would recommend the garden BBQ held through Thurs. to Sunday. Great food in an enjoyable garden setting.The hotel is not too far from the Zoo, well worth a visit, and the Botanical gardens and again the mini bus will take you to both sites.The wifi is a bit slow although it has been upgraded but just be patient. There is also limited English Channels on the TV but not a major disaster.Thanks Konrad and your staff for making our stay so enjoyable. Recommending to friends who are considering visiting Prague.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel for a few weeks whilst on business, it was a very enjoyable stay, all the staff are very friendly and helpful, the hotel is very clean, the food in the restaurant is also good, the gardens are beautiful, it is a quiet hotel, this also has the advantage of be able to use a mini bus to take you to the metro, zoo, botanical gardens etc.We needed an item posting to England which they did for us, in our opinion the management went above and beyond in looking after us.This hotel also has a pool which is open at varying times in the day, a ten pin bowling alley and crazy golf.Highly recommend for a quieter holiday hotel.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a lovely stay. The staff were very helpful and friendly and always on hand. The rooms were lovely and spacious and clean and the breakfast was nice. The hotel isn't located in walking distance from the city centre but the hotel provides an excellent free transfer service which drops you to the nearest tram/bus stop (and zoo) and will collect you aswell between 8am and 11pm everyday. They also sell tram tickets at the reception for approx €1.80 return. The hotel also has leisure centre with pool, Jacuzzi, sauna & steam room aswell as a lovely crazy golf course out the back with lovely flowers and is well kept.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was the best hotel i've stayed at on my vacation so far. The staff was really friendly and incredibly helpful. They offered a shuttle service to the nearest tram and metro free of charge and that simplified things a lot. They also had a phone number and would come pick you up after. The room was phenomenal for the price, and the location was perfect. Not to close to the city, not too far away. The sauna and hot tub were nice, and the pool was clean and refreshing. The bottom line is the staff were willing to help you do whatever it took to make you happy. I was sick and they offered to drive me to the pharmacy to get some meds. This place was well priced, in a great location, and had a great staff.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location near to city center of Prague. Hotel provided shuttle service to and from metro station, Prague Zoo and also to Jazzboat Cruise and train station. Services also included ability to purchase metro and Jazzboat tickets at hotel. Room was spacious and very clean. Konrad and his staff was great. Excellent and friendly service also at restaurant.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a family of 5 and throughly enjoyed our time in Prague. Prague is very charming and it captured all of our hearts.Castle Residence was perfect for us. We were greeted with a smile and warm welcome. The residence itself is quirky but good.It's situated in a quiet residential area.Our family room was spacious and clean.Breakfast each morning was good.We used the indoor pool at the end of each day. There is a small bowling alley within which we also played at night.Outside is a little park where the kids can play and run around. An outdoor seating area also where you can have a bit to eat or a drink whilst watching the kids play.Every morning the owners shuttled us for free to the underground station. We were also picked up on return. This was so helpful and convenient for all of us.The tube ride into the centre of Prague was not that long. Maybe 10/15 mins ?We spent most days in the city exploring and enjoying the beauty.We highly recommend the Segway tours. A great fun way to see the city and hear about the history.No complaints. Really enjoyed our stay here.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel for four nights. It is off the center in the middle of a neighborhood. It is convenient for families which come by car - there is on-site parking, and the hotel provides a ride to the nearest tram station. Nice facilities.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very difficult to find-in the middle of a mixture of high rise apartments, commercial buildings and private homes. Not an easy review to write so I will set it out as follows.1) First room we were allocated was dark and dingy- lots of wood felt like a coffin with a large a/c unit hanging from the ceiling. Meant to be a double room but, was 2 single beds side by side with a large gap down the centre.2) 2nd room was nice, quite large with balcony and terrace which was very acceptable. Still 2 beds side by side apparently Hotel has only 1 room with a double bed so web site is confusing. Hotel in general appeared to be run by Gentlemen and so it lacked a "womans" finesse eg no room or shelf for toiletries in the bathroom. Very useful that it had a mini fridge and kettle for tea making although it had no English breakfast tea -just green or earl grey. Room had 1 bottle of water which I would expect in a single room so for a double 2 bottles of water expected.3) We arrive down for breakfast 10 mins before the cut off time. It was very dis jointed had to ask for cups/ glasses/ cutlery etc. Very limited on what was on offer but, perhaps that how it is in general in Prague.4) The leisure area is very basic and un -inviting in its décor and ambiance. It appears to be totally geared up for kids as every morning when one would normally like to swim it was full of parents and kids!!!! No where on the web site did I see that children appeared to have priority on the use of the pool with swimming lessons taking place!!! 5) As mentioned earlier the Owner and most of the staff are very friendly and could not do enough to help. The restaurant staff not so good and could do with guest relation training. The shuttle bus is a fantastic service to offer and I think without it guests would find the Hotel far too difficult and out of the way for sight-seeing and visiting the centre of Prague.6) Very disappointed on our return from sight seeing that we could not get a nightcap as a resident the bar closed at 11 pm. To me this is always a perfect end to a days sightseeing and enjoyment. Never ever stayed in a hotel which did not offer a bar service to residents and certainly not what I would have expected to find in Prague generally, as drinking seems to be encouraged and in some establishments it was cheaper than having a soft drink.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We choose that hotel because it lays a little to the north of Praha, closer to the Airport - we didn't want to go into Praha for just one night. However on our way to the hotel we were not always sure if we were on the correct road - if road is not too much. However when we arrived, we found a good parking (for free!) and a well maintained building. After our uncomplicated reception, we were brought to our rooms ... the way there was split. In some parts it was very nice, beautifully decorated with inlays in the floor and in the next you stood in a empty, cold aisle with stains and marks on the walls. The room was spacious the bed was good and the bathroom wonderful - however the layout and design of the room at more than a hint of minimalistic design. Still, there was a mini-bar and a desk with free WLAN.After a very quiet night we got a delicious breakfast which was wonderfully laid out (at the cheese platter I even I second thoughts about taking one of the slices because they were so well arranged).The juice was good but the coffee / tea was average from a very simple automate...I can see why some people would give it an excellent but actually for my taste there were just a hint too many stains and the surround, yeah, I wouldn't take a walk around the hotel unless I stayed in the nice gardens. The complementary shuttle to downtown Praha is very kind and we were tempted for a short moment but then decided otherwise and go to the Restaurant in the Hotel.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were passing through Prague on our way to Budapest and needed a place to stay. Since we weren't really visiting Prague city center, we thought this would be a good choice since it is a bit out of town.We really enjoyed this hotel. We had our dog with us and needed a bigger room so we took the 2br family room. It was clean, nice, and spacious....and the price was right.The staff were friendly and helpful and offered to take us to the city center. We had dinner and breakfast in the hotel restaurant and it was solid.All in all, we would call this a solid choice.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spend a lovely weekend in the castle residence.Our huge family room was wonderfull! The breakfast was good and rich! The offered transfer to the metro station was easy to organize and allways available. The staff at the reception very friendly and helpfull.A nice hotel in Praha!
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 9 weeks and 1 day. The manager, Konrad, was excellent and responded immediately to all requests. The hotel is in a quieter part, just outside Prague. The area is known as the 'garden' area and this is lovely if one wants to go into and out of the centre (very easy… trams 12 and 24 go into and out of each half of the city). The hotel offers lifts to and from the nearby tram stop and also to local areas of interest like DOX, local restaurants, or the National Gallery. (free). The rooms are well equipped and the service standards excellent. There are a few amenities, like a small swimming pool, jacuzzi and sauna, but Prague is probably too lovely to spend too much time indoors. The hotel has a restaurant (outside catering) which is good. I found all the staff helpful, friendly, professional and caring. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone who does not want to be smack bang in a tourist area but who would like to see more of Prague itself. I did use the 'garden area'. It was nice to be able to sit outside in the sun. I shall definitely be going back…. x
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 3 nights over summer. Location is cooler away from centre of city. Lovely old house, has been around as restaurant for a long time in past, now sensitively restored. Parking convenient, and pleasant gardens for eating outside. Food is very good, breakfast good choice and excellent value. Rooms were very comfortable, nice bathrooms, clean and good size. Pool and sauna added bonus after sightseeing etc. The shuttle to tram is great, a truly personal service. Staff very friendly and helpful. Tram 15 mins to centre, cheap, frequent, shuttle back immediate if rung ahead.Strongly recommended, as the cost for this is much less than it would be in most cities, never mind capital cities. Preferable to staying in centre unless partying is the core purpose of trip.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was in the hotel at October 10, 2013 for five days. Restaurant is some miracle place. You come there and might not find anyone at work time for half an hour. You order something and they don't remember.At the breakfast I was alone eating 10 minutes after finish and was forced to immediately leave, because in 50 minutes they need to "open restaurant for people". I asked several times if I can finish my food and was told, no, you must leave now, breakfast time finished - we need to clean. What?!It was like I have personally insulted her by not finishing breakfast on time. For hundredths of hotels I've been before - this is the first time I've got such intentionally rude service.Aside from this - no king size beds, hard mattress, no slippers, safe box not working, design of rooms is strange, tv on the side of bed, open electric plug at the head on the bed, carton walls so you hear everyone movements and talks.Aside from the fact that it's extremely far away from the center despite how it looks. And I have a rented car...It's my number 7 hotel in Prague - big drop in quality. How they got high rating here???Good point - place looks nice outside and reception was friendly on arrival.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this out of city hotel for the "25 acres garden" to give us peace and quiet from the city. All we found was a rather odd 'adventure golf' and NO GARDENS! The hotel is very nice, staff were helpful and friendly, but the hotel is quite a distance from the old (and new) town. The hotel did provide a free shuttle to the tram or bus stop, which was helpful, but it still took 45 mins to get from the centre of town to the hotel. The hotel is in a residential area so there is nothing to walk round or do once at the hotel - although they do have a nice swimming pool. You can also hear traffic noise all of the time as the hotel is within 100 metres of two major roadways. Not the peaceful retreat we were looking for :(
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is the perfect place to relax after a day in Prague. The setting is park like. The staff are all friendly. Restaurant is fine. They even have a bowling alley. The only drawback is that there is nothing within walking distance. They offer free transport to the tram or bus, but then it's 30 minutes into Prague. Walking into Prague was not really an option and there are no other restaurants or markets nearby.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you arrive Prague by car and don't want to park the car in central Prague this hotel is probably the best choice. A wonderfully renovated wine yard in the northern parts of Prague. Rooms are large and of good quality. Breakfast is great and staff is really helpful. The pool and jacuzzi in the basement is nice relaxing after a day in Prague. There is even a small bowling hall behind the restarant. Even if we come without car next time we will choose this hotel.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The info tells you this hotel is outside the city, for that you get absolute peace & quiet after your busy day in the city. But don't let this worry you as the free shuttle is efficient and quick for transfer to Tram or Metro for the short ride into town, the costs of public transport is cheap and the hotel will sell you the tickets. The staff speak English well and nothing is too much trouble for them, they were polite & attentive at all times. Special thanks to Jan for his advice.The breakfast was good and plenty of choice, buffet style food & hot drinks so you could have as little or as much as you wanted. Long availability of breakfast was also good so early or late starters. The building and rooms are immaculate, spacious and the cleanliness of the highest standards. Not a critism, but a suggestion for the future - for us we would have liked to have been able to get snacks or light meals at the hotel rather than just the full restaurant menu. Swimming pool & Jacuzzi are a lovely addition to aid relaxation after a busy day sight-seeing Would definitely go there again and would strongly recommend to anyone
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great location for quiet stays in Prague, excellent service at the reception as well as room service, only the catering in terms of service really is poor - the food was fine, but the staff serving us on all three days of our stay was not properly trained.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Where to start...difficult question as don`t want to make it look like an advert for this hotel...Well whatever! We were having our wedding reception at this hotel in April this year. We arrived quite late on our arrival day (11pm) even that guy from the reception came to tune our TV as was in Russian language and none of us understood single word. Great! Our guests came over next couple of days. We have had quite few children so playroom and bowling were very handy to keep them engaged. Except one night out we were having our dinners in hotel. Ohhhh soooo yummy! Everything we have had there was delicious! Breakfast gives you a nice choice too.On the wedding day best man has found he has white shoelaces in black shoes!!! `No worries` said bartender and gave him his own. Fab! I have to say all members of staff were very friendly and willing to do anything to make you happy which we think was one of the reasons why our wedding was so great!Overall...rooms are very nice and clean. Whatever you need just call reception and they will bring it to you with smile on face no matter what time. Food...loved it a lot! Location...nice and quiet place with free transport to Zoo, bus or tram station. Service...fantastic!Thanks for making our stay so special throughout whole week we were there.Kat & Neil
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was our base for trips into Prague over a long weekend. The service was excellent with lots of advice by the English speaking reception.The Castle Residence is quite a way from the city centre but the hotel runs a free shuttle to the nearest tram and metro stops which never failed us during our 4 daily visits to the city. Our family enjoyed playing ten pin bowling and mini golf although it is worth noting that this is at extra charge. All the facilities are in impeccable order and the overall effect makes for a good holiday. Prices at the bar are reasonable for the good Czech lager available on draught. The hotel is in a quiet location and the garden is pleasant for sitting at the end of the day.Our double room was very big, quiet and comfortable during the hot and cold weather in late April.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely quiet location, reception staff and Konrad provide service like it should be. They have a great knowledge of the city and are more than happy to make sure you know exactly where you are going. Tram tickets are available (and cheap) at the desk. Buy tram tickets for your return as well. Better still - if you know you will be there for a few days, buy a 3/4 day pass.Dont forget to stamp tickets in Machines. The staff will then use their minibus to take you the two minute drive to Trojska tram stop. Call the hotel on your way back and they will pick you up as well!!. the Tram stops very close to the Charles Bridge. The pool, Jacuzzi, and sauna were great We had the pool to ourselves most of the time very nice to come back to and chill out after a long day. The restaurant is a nice place to eat with a limited but good menu but there are lots of places in the Town as well.Breakfast is an extremely good buffet, with bacon, scrambled egg,Sausages, and toast. and many cheeses, meats, fruit and breads. The bar is well stocked and the tarrif is not the usual Hotel rip-off prices.The room.Tea and coffee making things are included and a mini fridge.There is a safe, TV,The beds are firm but Comfortable the Quilts and pillow covers are as soft as silk(my wife said)very nice.We Drove there from our home in Berlin you can park your car at the front of the Hotel. It cost us €95 per night for 2 Adults and one 13yr old Child. Could not find any fault with our stay,all the staff were very pleasant and obliging, we would certainly recommend The Castle Residence.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First impressions are always the best and this place didn't disappoint. The rooms are huge and very well presented. They are clean and fairly modern. Don't dump your bags and jump on the beds though. Something will break....and it won't be the bed!That said, we got a great nights sleep and felt very comforatable in what would better be described as a maisonette instead of a room. Tea and coffee making things are included and a mini fridge. There are no cooking things in the rooms.The reception staff provide service like it should be. They have a great knowledge of the city and are more than happy to make sure you know exactly where you are going. Tram tickets are available (and cheap) at the desk which you can put on the bill. Tip - buy tram tickets for your return as well. Not all stops have ticket machines. Better still - if you know you will be there for a few days, buy a 3/4 day pass. The staff will then use their minivan to take you the two minute drive to Trojska tram stop. Call the hotel on your way back and they will pick you up as well!!The pool and sauna were great for our kids (8 and 6) as Prague is not exactly abundant with kids things. We had the pool to ourselves most of the time. It's very warm and looks good with the underwater lighting.The restaurant is a nice place to eat with a limited but good menu. Even then, the chef will prepare anything (within reason) tha isn't on the menu.Breakfast is an extremely good buffet, with bacon, scrambled egg and toast for the Brits taste and many cheeses, meats, fruit and breads for the continental dwellers.The bar is well stocked and the tarrif is not the usual Hotel rip-off prices. Probably less than a UK pub (although I haven't lived in UK for 6 years).An extra welcome activity is the bars' en-suite 10 pin bowling alley (2 lanes). Again, these were always available and very reasonably priced.I think there is also minigolf at the back, but this was closed in the cold days of February.If I could think of something bad about this place, I would tell you, but I can't.......hang on.......nope! Not a thing.OK, the views are not inspiring and it's not bang in the centre, but for the service, quality and value, you would find it hard to beat the Castle Residence Hotel.We paid 500€ for 4 nights which included the breakfast. The pool is free to use. We had two evening meals with beer, wine soft drinks. Countless games of bowling and lots of tram tickets.Total bill was 611€..I'll throw some pictures on here later - watch this space.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I took our 13year old grandson for a half term holiday break. The Castle residence were offering a package at that time which included tickets to the zoo, bicycle hire, ten pin bowling session and soft drinks from the fridge. Excellent value for money.The hotel was impressive, a lovely quiet location. Our bedrooms were intercommunicating, large and neatly furnished. The rural location meant we were some distance from the centre of the city but the hotel provided a very efficient taxi service which took us to either the metro station or tram and from either we could reach the city centre, the metro being the quickest 10mins, the city stop meant a good walk to Charles bridge, the tram being overland took a little longer but stopped close to Charles Bridge. A quick phone call to the hotel on return for taxi service. Breakfast in the hotel taken in a very light and pleasant dining room with a delightful outlook was excellent. We had a very enjoyable dinner one evening,good choice on the menu and the prices were fair. This is a hotel we would like to stay in again in the summertime as the garden patio surrounded by well cared for borders would be a very nice place to relax and enjoy peace and quiet after a lively day in the beautiful city of Prague. We could not find any fault with our stay,all the staff were very pleasant and obliging, we would certainly recommend The Castle Residence. Many thanks to them all for a most memorable and enjoyable experience
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We saw some nice reviews for this hotel and we realy wanted to stay in this hotel during our visit to Prague. We wanted to stay for four nights but they did not have any avalible room for all nights of our stay. Their staff have made considerable efforts and on the end they have found a solution. Hura for them and a great news for us.Hotel is not in the center of Prague, but don't worry, they have a solution for everything. First they have a great, safe and free parking. Their shuttle bus will take you to the tram and you will be in center of Prague in 15 min.. Totally cool service. When you come back, they will pick you up at the tram station and take you back to hotel. Rooms are nice and clean, staff is ultra helpful and friendly. They also have a nice restaurant where they serve good breakfast. We also had dinner once and it was excellent to. Sauna and pool is great after a long walk in Prague, so use it. :)The price was realy good because you have a great service, parking, sauna & pool, breakfast and shuttle transfers in the price. Totally cool hotel. The only bad thing was the WIFI...It worked, but was slow and the signal in our room was not so good. Nevertheless, we had a great time in this hotel.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a previous reviewer said, it was a little odd getting to the hotel on a few different side streets, but it is in a great location if you don't want to be in the center of the city with all the noise and parking hassles. The hotel will literally take care of your every need. We had a 3 day holiday where they booked a massage for my husband and I on short notice, always were available to take us to the tram (and had the tickets there for the tram). The restaurant had a great breakfast in the morning with lots of variety for hot and cold options as well as pastries/fruit and the lunch/evening entrees were delicious as well. The room we had was pretty large and had a balcony with the bed being the usual or Europeans in that it was a double bed- two single beds together, though the comforters/pillows were super comfortable. It isn't absolute luxury like your staying at a Hilton, but very personable, clean, and a place to relax- but still see the heart of Prague. Also if you get a chance- check out the Folklore Dance, super fun and by far the best night that we had while staying in Prague.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were very friendly and helpful. Lots of facilities to make use of. They drop off and pick up to the Tram stop and I wanted to go somewhere else and they said they would do that for me too. Very nice breakfast with lots of options. Clean rooms with heaps of space and air con which was a blessing when it was +30degrees outside. Wifi worked everywhere in the hotel as well. Out of the city but tram only takes 15 minutes and you are right in the city centre.Really enjoyed my stay :)
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently spent a week at the hotel and had a great time. I found the hotel very nice and a spectacular deal. The staff were always very accommodating and extremely helpful, whether with their courtesy pick-ups/drop-offs at the local tram stop or metro stop, having mass transit tickets available for when you head out, finding a restaurant we didn't have the address for, or providing other random answers. We had a double room, which was quite large by most European rooms I'd ever stayed in, however maintaining the standard pressed together double bed arrangement. Each bed still had it's own blanket too. This could be a benefit if the person sharing your bed tends to use more than their half of a bedspread. There were no extra pillows/blankets in the room but I'm sure the staff would accommodate if you asked. I would say the general decoration of the hotel is clean, feeling of higher end Ikea.Mini-fridge was stocked with beverages and a couple snacks with prices prominently indicated. They appeared to be sticker price and not raised to excessive levels.We ate dinner twice at the hotel, and had coffee/drinks on two other afternoons. Each meal was very good and equally well priced. My first was a really memorable confit of rabbit, with a parsnip mash. Never having rabbit this way before I was really, really, pleased with the sheer succulence of the meat, as well as the intense flavor of it, reminding me of what I wished a Thanksgiving turkey actually tasted like. When I ordered it the waitress informed me that was a common Czech dish-which I confirmed later throughout the week after seeing it or a version of it, on many other menus. To note, the hotel is not at all in or near the city center. It isn't even a quick walk from the pretty excellent mass transit available in Prague. It is in a purely residential area on the periphery of Prague. They are about 5 minutes or less from a tram stop which will have you in Old Town in less than 15 minutes. Getting back at the end of the night was always more complicated, we were usually looking for the #17 tram, and occasionally misread the schedule, having to transfer at a stop or backtrack. The front desk is occupied 24hrs a day and was able to resolve any doubts though-even picking us up a little after their 2300 cut-off time. There is parking for the hotel if you rent a car at some point, like I did. They also have free WiFi-though I didn't use it not having a computer on my trip.The hotel appears very child friendly and over the course of our week we noticed most occupants were families.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The quietness of the outer circle of Prague combined with an excellent shuttleservice to nearest tram- and metrostation or zoo. Clean swimmingpool and we had a large familyroom for two adults en two kids, large tv and three windows with a view over the garden. With sauna, small whirlpool with music!, bowling, children playroom, good food and friendly service. Very good for families with kids.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In our travels, it is seldom that you stumble on a hotel that: 1) customer service and hospitality are truly first and genuine 2) You feel at home even when the home and the home is both chic and classy 3) You are presented excellent value for money. Castle Residence is without a doubt an excellent hotel, one that I can't just say enough good things about. The staff is sincere, professional and go out of their way to insure you are treated with five star hospitality when you are paying substantially less. This is one of those hotels that you will be reading about in Conde Nast or some other well heeled travel magazine that will be touting it as a must to stay at. While you won't find door men and superfluous staff, what you get in return is a visit to a hotel where the rooms are nicely appointed, common areas that make you feel like you are visiting a part of the past, a restaurant that is good value for money and sense that you are in your house and not a hotel. This is definitely not some cookie cutter hotel or high brow bed-n-breakfast where customer service comes second. While you are in Prague (East Side by the Zoo) you are close enough to everything because of the shuttle that Hotel provides to a near by Tram Stop. If you want to try something different, try this hotel, you won't be sorry.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gorgeous hotel with extremely friendly and helpful staff. Really made us feel we were living in luxury for a few days. We happened to go in off season, which meant we pretty much had the whole place to ourselves, including the pool and sauna area, which was very relaxing. The room was fantastic, spacious, clean and very classy. Only downside is the location, which is out of the city centre. However the hotel staff had no problem in transferring us to any local stations. Its only because we had a couple of late nights that it made it a bit more difficult to get back, but this was our choice. Definitely recommend this place for a romantic city break. Prague is awesome too.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We Stayed in this hotel back in the summmer of July. I have stayed in many hotels before but never one that is so friendly attentative to detail friendly staff beyond anything i would of imagined.The restaurant is fine dining at sensibl prices, a meal for 2 didnt set us back any more than £20 and that included drinks. the bar prices were also sensible meaning you cuold enjoy a relaxing meal and after meal drink in the bar without the fear of a hefty Bill at the end of your stay.The facilities are well equipped, and although it is out of town getting to town is not an issue with regualr tram links and a complimentary shuttle service provided by the hotel to tram stops. The tickets are sold in reception for the tram and the ride is approximately 10 mins into town. Parking is free on site so it is a great find if you are travelling by car. One of the best Hotels i have ever stayed in! i hope they keep it up.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed in Castle Residence Praha in Prague. This hotel opened in April 2011 and everything is brand new. Our room was huge and could easily fit two normal hotel rooms. The room offers comfortable beds, a nice sitting area, large flatscreen TV, tea-making facilities and a spacious bathroom. The people running the hotel do their utmost to make you feel comfortable (and they succeed). Breakfast is good and the restaurant offers a small menu but with tasty and well made dishes. The outside terrace in the garden was very nice.The hotel is situated in a residencial area just outside the city centre of Prague. Trams 14 and 17 take you to the city centre in approx. 15 min. We didn't mind the fact of just being outside the city centre; unless you are in the very heart of the city (and are willing to pay the price) you will always have to travel within the city as well.
