We found that the transportation to and from the city (the hotel offers free shuttle rides to and from the tram stop (or bus stop) was as easy as being in the city itself. We would certainly choose this hotel again when travelling to Prague.
hotelName:
21    Castle Residence Praha
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I adored our stay at MH Suites Palace. We arrived in Prague early in the morning, and were able to store our bags in the office before check in as we explored the city. Check in went smoothly, the snacks in the room were much appreciated, and the room itself was comfortable and well decorated. It was one of the most comfortable places we stayed on our trip. The only downside was the distance from the airport when we had an early morning flight- we ended up needing an Uber, as public transport from this location to the airport is not convenient in the early hours.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room size is spacious enough for a family of four. The staff are very nice and helpful and can speak english well. The only MINOR criticisms were sofa bed was not done , beddings were not ready and the bins were not emptied. However, we enjoyed our four night stay in the hotel.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: - Pubic hair on the bed, very dirty floor that caused us to drag more dirt into bed from under our feet. Found the slippers - saved! Had the «do not disturb» on the door, it was disregarded. Not very nice to have to pass two huge(as high as a grown person), one each side of the door, with dirty laundry, every time we went in and out of our building(nr 2). The echoing effect from the stairwell and the courtyard was close to amazing.... + Good location. Felt safe. No street noises.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in apt 411 the room itself was huge - no complaints at all! overlooking the courtyard area in the second building.The room itself had all the amenities you would want - hairdryer, fridge, plenty of wardrobe space, ironing board and safety deposit box. Tea and coffee was re-stocked daily as well.The location is good just off Wenceslas Square, and about a 10-15 minute walk to the old town. We did have a power cut on one of the days and were without power for a short period, but this was quickly resolved.On our final day checkout was 11 but we weren't due to be picked up until 2pm the hotel kindly allowed us to store our luggage there until we were collected.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really good hotel not far from the heart probably 5 minutes walk but just far enough away if you do want to have peace and quiet.The rooms were well equipped with air con thankfully as on entry the room was very hot. All facilities nice bathroom and very spacious bed couldn't finished for much more. Only critique i could say was the ironing board was a table too one which are just very fiddly to use when trying to iron a decent shirt
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a double room for two nights at MH Suits Palace (H7 Palace).We arrived at the reception earlier than the checkin hour and we were able to deposit our luggage there until the checkin.A couple of hours later we came back to checkin. When we arrived at hour room, the door was open and uncleaned. (At that point we were really disappointed)The cleaning lady called the receptionist to tell her the problem and we left the room. 1-2 minutes later, a staff member came, apologized and told us that we’ll receive a larger room, which in fact was a huge apartment. The apartment was very clean and comfortable.We really loved this place because it was clean, comfortable, located in the vicinity of the city center (15 min walk) and the staff was very friendly and reacted quickly when our booked room wasn’t ready.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great hotel! It was clean and modern. Our room was very spacious and bright with high ceilings and a decent sized bathroom- exactly like the pictures. There was couch and TV in our room and the bed was very comfortable! There was a bag of crisps, olives and breadsticks in our room which was a nice touch. Reception staff were friendly and helpful allowing us to leave our suitcases after checking out. The location is ok...it’s quiet of a night and around a 15 minute walk to the centre.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms and breakfast are 1st class and the location is a 10 minute walk to the main square and Christmas markets. Couldn't fault anything about hotel or the city. Everything is on the doorstep and the sites are beautiful
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location ok, but in the night is it far away from quiet. At least if you have a room like us facing the street, Family Premier Suite, that is spacious and nice but would need 2 bathrooms to be a real family suite and my God, the pillows, hard like a rock. Few tv channels too. Breakfast nothing to complain about, like I read that others had issues with. Enough but in the basement so a bit claustrofobic, like the penthouse we had that only had windows in the ceiling and no view. Have stayed at good 5 star hotels in Prague before for the same or less amount we payed here, around 250 €/night. Ok we could be 3 adults not sharing bed as one of us slept on the sofa and the other two in sep doublebeds. Prague is not for me so will probably never go back after the times I’ve been there now, and would I do would I choose a 5 * hotel more in the center and with more service and facilities.The manager was a very nice man and did his best to take care of the big group that we were a part of.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in H7 Palace for four nights recently. My husband was having eye surgery at Praga Medica and the clinic was just around the corner from hotel so very convenient. Our room was large and quiet, spotlessly clean with big comfy bed and sofa. Breakfasts were continental, delicious with plenty of choice. Only fruit teas provided in room so bring your own tea bags and longlife milk if you like your morning cuppa, as we do! There was, a fridge in our room. The hotel is within easy walking distance of Wenceslas Sq and Old Town and there are plenty of eateries in the area. The "pub" across the road from the hotel serves good basic food and tasty Prague beer on tap. The only problem we had was that we were not able to leave our suitcases at the hotel for the day when we checked out (we had a late flight back to Heathrow so had some hours to kill before our taxi was due). The hotel will look after your cases for a couple of hours max but do not have proper storage facilities for looking after luggage in these circumstances. The manager told us we could leave our cases at nearest railway station for a small charge but in the end we found a local youth hostel through Bagbnb.com that looked after our cases for 5 euros for the day. Bit unsecured so local station prob safer but it was fine for us.H7 Palace gave us a convenient and comfortable stay in Prague.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed four night in two rooms. Reception wasn't immediately when you entered, but upstairs in an office, but I was warmly welcomed and we had our room keys quickly. Unfortunately, one room was still being serviced, but it really didn't matter as we stored our luggage in the other room and went to lunch on Wenceslas Square- just a short walk away. The Old Town is also only about a 15 minute pleasant stroll from the hotel.To get to our rooms (which were in the other wing), we had to climb half a flight of stairs as our floor wasn't fully serviced by the lift which was a little bit difficult with heavy luggage. Our rooms were basically furnished and clean but had everything we needed for a pleasant stay. The best thing about the rooms were the lovely, large marble bathrooms. There is a courtyard between the reception wing and our wing, which was a lovely place to sit and relax.The hotel is modern and stylish and features marble floors in the public areas and has a nice sense of space. We had breakfast one morning in the dining room and it was of a good standard and reasonably priced. We had the pleasure to speak to the new General Manager and he was more than happy to have a chat.We enjoyed our stay and would happily recommend H7 Palace.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: H7 Palace is close to everything. It is in a gracious old building with large, airy rooms. We slept 3 very comfortably in our room. The bathrooms are modern. The breakfast is amazing. Staff very friendly. H7 was a tremendous value.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had done a thorough search for accommodation in Prague as many accommodation prices were cheaper than what I was used to in Western Europe.I can certainly say that this was the right choice!The hotel is on a quiet street just 1km from central station and it is quite easy to walk there. The hotel is also about 1km or a 10 minute walk from one of the main streets (Vaclavske Namesti) that eventually leads into the old town if you follow it straight down. The hotel felt new, it was bright with high ceilings, and modern. I loved how, what I assume was a previous older building, was minimalistically merged into a fresh, modern hotel. It was also very spacious and very clean. The hotel personnel has done an outstanding job in terms of cleaning. It was also very quiet! The hotel room was spacious. We stayed here with 3 adults and were never in each other’s way or stepping on top of luggage. The bathroom was perfect: new, lots of towels and a great shower. The beds were comfortable (with crisp white sheets!) and big. There were 3 windows in the room bringing lots of light even with the room facing the court yard. We didn’t have breakfast included but decided to have it in the hotel anyways. A good variety of bread with choices of meat, cheese, yogurt, pancakes, cereal, boiled eggs, fruit. It’s a simple breakfast but certainly sufficient to get your day started. It is buffet style so you can easily load up on the fresh carbs. The hotel staff was very friendly!! I was pleasantly surprised as I had left my expectation for customer service at the airport. But arriving at H7 and checking in was a breeze and we were welcomed and treated with the utmost friendliness and respect. [In regards to the general customer service, anyone visiting from Western Europe or North America will need to lower their expectation. People there interact differently with the customer, eye contact and smiling varies in every country. You may perceive it as rude, but just perceive it as different and don’t take it personally.]To get to the hotel we took the Airport Express bus from the airport to the main train station. This was cheap and easy. At the airport, you can buy bus tickets in terminal one at the tourist information desk (not at the kiosk for other local busses, metro or tram). At the train station you can buy the AE bus ticket at the domestic bus/train counter.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the hotel was really good. Interior of the rooms and the hotel had the feel of a four star hotel and we were really comfortable staying there. It is conveniently located near I.P Palova Metro Station which meant we could get around Prague easily.However, we were slightly let down as we came back to our room to find the door left ajar by housekeeping. This was a serious security breach which we reflected to reception.We were thankful that we did not leave any valuables in the room, otherwise, the consequences could have been disastrous.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Newly renovated hotel, modern, and very spacious. We stayed in a suite with a loft. We wished they have included more chairs/seating with such big space. Bathroom is clean, shower pressure is great. The size of the bathroom is decent but counter space was limited. I wish they would remove the bidet and put more counter space and hanging rods instead. There was one garbage can in the entire suite, and no Kleenex was provided. We were on the top floor so instead of windows, we had skylights, which was wonderful. The buffet breakfast was excellent. Front desk staff was very helpful. Close to metro and tram stops.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very comfortable bed. Beautiful shower. Close to trams and train stop. Walking distance to the old square (20 mins). Room was Quiet, even when we left the window open tok let the fresh air in overnight, couldn't hear trams or people at all. Dark curtains if you like to have a sleep in. I would definitely recommend it.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was clean and large (loft). Our AC was not efficient enough to cool down our room. Management said it would be addressed and it never was. The pub across the street was quite loud so between the noise and the heat it was hard to sleep. We were charge for breakfast that we did not have and had to argue with the manager to have the charges removed.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although not easy to find due to the very discreet signage outside, this hotel is an excellent place to stay if you want a peaceful place to stay close to the city centre.The staff were welcoming and helpful throughout. The room was beautifully decorated, with an en-suite bathroom with shower, comfortable bed, TV, tea facilities, and a safe.This hotel was very good value for money, and I would recommend staying here.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the place from the moment we arrived. Lovely lady on reception who was really helpful and accommodating. Our room was lovely, warm and clean. Nice and big and tastefully decorated. In terms of location, it’s a walk to all the tourist attractions but we didn’t mind that and got up our daily steps!! H7 is close to the shops and some lovely restaurants...Googlemaps was our best friend!Breakfast had the potential to be great but by the time we got down for breakfast (usually 9ish) a lot of it was dried out or cold. That would be my only ‘room for improvement’ point. On the whole, we had a wonderful stay at H7 for my 40th birthday! Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: H7 is a small New hotel located 10 minutes walk from Vaclav's square. Comfortable, clean, modern, quiet. Excellent breakfast. Over all i want to highlight the friendly staff, specially Francesca and the people serving breakfast.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a surprisingly cheap 3 night stay at the end of February as a couple. Firstly, there was good communication from the hotel before arrival, one email offered a prebooked taxi from the airport which we decided to use. A taxi was waiting for us at a cost of €25 or equivalent Czech price. Upon arrival at H7 we were buzzed into a vast clean and white hallway. Check in was quick with multilingual friendly reception staff who were happy to talk through a city map for you to get your city bearings. The room was ready early a perk of booking with Secret Escapes. The aparthotel is very airy with high ceilings parquet floors and is clean and quiet. The room we chose was a classic room - we chose this room as we didn't intend to spend much time in it so didn't need a suite. That said, the room was large with a sofa a large comfortable bed plus a beautiful big modern bathroom with a rainforest shower. There was also air conditioning which we didn't need. In addition, the room was quiet as was the street. We were very pleased with our room choice. Breakfast was included in our rate, it was served in a bright clean basement with arched ceilings. There was plenty of continental food on offer such as hams, pastries, cereals yoghurts etc. The hotels location was in a nondescript side street about 10 minutes easy walk from Wensleslas square. Upon checkout H7 had a secure luggage room for your cases. We also booked another taxi. To sum up, a great modern boutique aparthotel in a fabulous city as a great price.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel with new interior and very friendly staff. The hotel is located centrally but not noisy at all. Public transport as well as the city centre are only a quick walk away. A small shop for drinks etc. is in the same street as well.The rooms are spaceous and well equipped. Of course, in an old buidling, you sometimes hear other guests when speaking loud in the hallways but I've never been bothered.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was lovely, location was okay (not central) but the receptionist/desk lady was quite lazy and not very helpful. It was more like staying in private dorms rather than a hotel as the receptionist finished at 8 and there wasn’t anyone else available.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful hotel and great staff, the lady at the reception was very kind and helpful. It is situated in a very central location. Also, the bed is amazingly comfortable.We loved staying there, thank you!
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 7 nights at the H7 Palace. Reception is open form 8 am to 8 pm so if you're checking-in late send and email to the hotel so they can arrange for your room ahead of time. The H7 Palace is composed of 2 buildings, the main one through the main entrance and the second one through the courtyard.The rooms are a good size and updated. Although the toilet paper is like sand paper. You have a convenience store just next to the hotel so you can get some there. The safe in the room is a bit complicated to operate it so ask the reception desk for some help (not like the typical one you usually find).Breakfast is good with a good variety. They don't put enough cold cuts on the plates and they are very slow to fill them back but in general the service is good. If you ask them, they can make you scrambled eggs from the kitchen.The hotel is very well located in the new town and is close to 2 metro stations. The area is safe and you even have 2 small bars on the other side of the street of the hotel.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff speak good English and we're very helpful. We had an attic room. Although there was no view as you could not look out the windows the room was light, airy, large and clean. The bed was comfortable and they even had a bidet. If you require an iron you have to request one as they are not automatically in the room. The room was very quiet. It is a little out of the way but still in the old town, so wear good walking shoes. The tram is on the next street over. We felt safe but I would not like to walk alone at night.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Prague beginning of June this year for a few nights and we booked the H7 palace, as it was quite cheap I was a bit dubious of what we was getting, We arrived early morning and was greeted by the receptionist who was very helpful, the staff around the hotel was excellent, my girlfriend lost her expensive sunglasses and the waiter found us the next day to return them, The rooms are bright and refreshing, very clean with lovely bathrooms, the room was only cleaned the once whilst we was there but wasn't a problem as we spent most of the time exploring Prague, Overall the hotel was amazing and I could not fault it, would 100% return
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The entire building is nicely redone and the rooms plus entrance etc all look nice, new and good. Downsides for me: they have kept (or redone) the beautiful old doors to the rooms, but these, unfortunately are not sound proof and also otherwise you can hear people in the rooms next door more than in a hotel. That can be quite disturbing when they come home after you and talk (even at a normal level).Breakfast: no bad, not great, but very friendly waiter and breakfast service. Service otherwise is limited, there is one person only there at the reception (leaving at 8 p.m. - if you check in after that, you get a code, worked fine for me).Real downside in my view is the location: it is still central, but not super central and while the street itself is quiet, the area is not. If you walk back from the center at night you come accross a red-light zone with the corresponding men around...
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: H7 Palace hotel was pretty nice and clean and it was located in a good area. It was a bit away from the hectic city only about 1,5km walk to the Prague old town. The hotel was modern and clean and quiet even though one of the busiest roads was near. The customer service was really friendly and helpful :) The room was nice and clean but it was a bit hot in the room even though we had our air condition on all the time the lowest you can get it. Also the breakfast wasn't worth for 7€ it was quite poor - with that price we would have get a big brunch in some other cafe or so... But after all the visit in H7 Palace was good I would recommend it if you are looking for a bit more quiet hotel and area. Just go and have breakfast somewhere else or buy breakfast to your room.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The H7 hotel is a "wonderful" hotel for a stay in Prague. The hotel is situated in a very quite Halkove street yet its 10 minutes walk from the old town center.The classic rooms are wonderful, with decent space for 2 people and they are decorated with very nice furniture.The hotel breakfast was fine.Note: the hotel was design to provide comfort stay without phones in the rooms so you will not hear people shouting behind the walls which makes it very quite.I highly recommend this hotel !!!!
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely new apartment hotel close to Prague tourist attractions. Tucked away in a small alley, is a decent place to stay. The staff are very helpful.The hotel itself is very new and crisp.Fairly a large size rooms, with limited house keeping service. The property has no restaurant or gym or in house parking . However they have a tie up with nearby parking which u need to book prior to arrival as they have limited spots. If u want a big and neat room and no frills attached , this is it.Also a small convience store outside the hotel if u need anything. Lot of food options around tooo.Over all .
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here in May 2017 and really liked it. Minimalist hotel but very clean and stylish. Staff very helpful and happy to recommend places to visit and arrange taxis etc. Bed very comfortable indeed and bathroom very nicely finished. Would happily stay here again due to close proximity to metro stop and not far to walk to main parts of town. If I was being very picky I would also like an extra chair in our room (there was only one), some milk (for English tea!) and maybe some slippers due to wooden floor. But otherwise, a very pleasurable stay. Many thanks.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have double room and was huge same like bathroom ! Room was really clean and everything was modern. I absolutely love my bed, memory form matters. Usually I have a problem with sleeping on new places but here I haven't got any. But negative side of this hotel is no breakfast
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed a couple of days in Prague and looked at several hotels before deciding to stay at H7. At first curious whether the place was a bit far out we found that it was really nice to stay bit out of the crowded, touristy area. It's very easy to travel by public transport or walk in 10 / 15 minutes to the center. We had a very good experience at H7. Very clean, very neat, and the staff was friendly. When we had a little issue with our booking they were super convenient. 5/5 stars we'll be back.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall we found the H7 to be poor value, given by the nearly complete lack of service- which was unexpected. The front desk is staffed by a single person, who is frequently absent, only until 8pm. There are no phones in the rooms, so the only way to contact this single staff person is to go to the desk and hope they are there. We were here for 3 nights, and housekeeping did not service our room once. We inquired after the first day and were told they only come every second day, but in our case that didn't happen either. We did ask for and get additional towels, but of course didn't think to ask, and therefore didn't get refills on the in room water and instant coffee. Because there is no restaurant or room service (yet) that meant we couldn't even manage a coffee in room. We stayed in the family suite, which worked well for sleeping arrangements - but wasn't really a space you could hang out in. The lack of service and attention to detail extended to the small courtyard, which had enormous potential, and most nights has several guests outside enjoying it, however all forced to sit on the wicker seats without cushions, which were there on day one, but never reappeared.So, minor details, maybe, but for what you pay, I'm certain you can do better in Prague- we paid hotel rates for what was essentially and under equipped apartment.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I found this hotel through the website voyage prive. This hotel was part of our package deal. We read the reviews and it looked great. We were blown away by the cleanliness and the amazing bed and shower in the room. The front desk was more than accommodating. The location is not bad at all- about a twenty minute walk to old town. Overall, we would highly recommend this accommodation for your trip to prague. It really made our holiday that much more enjoyable !!
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is just great! Location is excellent, rooms are actually apartments but still very elegant and functional. There but staff is super helpful when I needed something from them. Definitely worth staying at if you are planning a visit to Prague.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: - Central location near subway, little still quiet, recently renovated hotel with very nice and comfortable brand new Italian touch rooms with a great bed and shower. - Staff is very friendly and helpful- They don't have a 24 hour reception, bar or breakfast available.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Brand new hotel in a central area of Prague. The historic part of the city is just 10 min walk away and the area in which the hotel is situated is nice, safe and really quiet. So you can avoid the hassle of the tourist crowds while having all the attractions at hand. The room we had was really big, all furnished with Italian design pieces. Moreover the staff was friendly and at our kind disposal for every need. Suggested, also for longer stays!
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Central location near subway, but still quiet, recently renovated hotel with very nice and comfortable brand new rooms with a great bed and shower. Staff was very friendly and helpful, despite of my late check-in. Minor detail, no 24h reception, bar or breakfast available. Probably not needed for private get-aways, but for business travelers it might be inconvenient. It's described when making a reservation though, so no surprise or issue.
hotelName:
22    MH Suites Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at hotel for 4 nights and it was very nice and comfortable,A room 27 was warm, clean and perfectly suitable for me, so i had a pleasant stay there.You have my recommendation. Employees at the reception desk are very kind.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you speak English don’t stay here.The rooms are dull and lifeless.The food is the same lunch and dinner for weeks.Breakfast is monotonous and not great. It’s fine.There is a lunch menu which is not available in English.There are very few places nearby for food so you are forced to eat here.The cleaners do not come until late afternoon.I was not made to feel welcome.There are extra charges for water and things like mayonnaise!Just stay somewhere else.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having never been to the Czech Republic we had no idea what to expect. This was our first and only stop in the country, unfortunately, but we loved it. The hotel is clean, well equipped, the staff is helpful and can speak good English (for we who cannot speak Czech) and the rooms are spacious and modern. With the bus service at the front door and trains only a few minutes walk away, and free parking in the grounds there is much less reason to stay closer into central Prague. The restaurant in the hotel is very good and the breakfast provided as part of the quite modest room charge is absolutely brilliant! As with everywhere we’ve been in Europe so far the coffee is the weak spot, but it is drinkable. Someone here as a fetishising with water wheels, but that is really a nice quirk. In the evenings the shell in the courtyard restaurant runs, and there are schematics and drawings of Walter wheels all through the other side of the restaurant where we had breakfast each morning. Great place to stay.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. The room was nice and clean as we expected. Though we got 2 seperate beds instead of 1 large, which wasn't quite comfortable as well we didn't have hand and foot towels for the first night. When we were going to city centre, we took a tram and spent approx. 30 minutes in our way. Breakfast was ok.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small hotel in Old Mill near a small river - modern rooms, public transport right in front of the hotel, great atmosphere and nice breakfast buffet - and all that for a real good value for money. Clear recommendation!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the place is verry nice and warm.the room are perfect for a vacantion.the hotel is verry good location.ther is in a proximity of the forest were you can make a hike or you make a ride whit the bicycle.the hotel is very quite.i recomanded thei hotel.breakfast is verry good...you can find a good food and the personal is nice and warm.the room is verry clean.there is a parking for the car.if you want to go in Prague and if you want to stay in a good place i recomanded this hotel
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I went to Selský dvůr with my friends. To celebrate the gala dinner, we ate and drank perfectly. Food, coffee, dessert excellent, service nice and pleasant. Environment very nice. Great gastronomic experience. I'm looking forward to coming again next time!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was quite good, besides is far from the city center, without many possibilities of public transportation, we opted for use UBER, the price to the City Center is around €10. The rooms are perfect, modern and spacious, the bathroom amazing, very modern. The breakfast was good. Just the receptionist an asian descent boy, he was arrogant and not friendly, all the time using his mobile and talking by phone, you as client have to wait for him. I recommend this hotel if you are traveling by car, if not try to find something close to the city.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My usual hotel was fully booked so by a chance I picked this one. Easy to get there from motorway. Free and closed parking. Very clean rooms. Interesting dark design but I liked that. Comfortable beds. Breakfast perfect. Reastaurant for dinner had nice selection, good quality and friendly service. I left one of my trousers there and they sent after me w/o hesitation and on their own cost. Really good service and for sure I will return. Thanks fof all!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: excellent hotel, professional staff, the rooms are big and comfortableit is quiet you have a nice view into the garden and the restaurent is excellentprices are totally fair compared to other hotels
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very nicely situated in a rural area and still near to a shopping mall, the office where I was teaching etc. My room was comforable and very clean, just like the bathroom. Everything (lights, water, toilet, TV etc.) worked fine, which you can't say about every hotel. The staff is very friendly and the relevant people (restaurant, reception, bar) speak very good English. Lots of value for money.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in the outskirts of Prague, charming and peaceful. The rooms look very nice, hotel interior and restaurant has a rustic feel stylized as the old mill. There's a nice courtyard where the parties can be hosted or where guest may rest in the afternoon. The food in the restaurant is really good, giving an good selection of Czech cuisine. Staff is extremely helpful and competent, always greeting us with a smile or polite queries. Trip to the old town takes about 20-30 minutes - the bus leaves right in front of the hotel and then you will need to switch to subway. There's parking behind the hotel and a nice park nearby. We've spent there very pleasant 2 nights (3 days) together with friends and family. I would definitely recommend this place for hosting a wedding or family reunions, the manager is very helpful and resourceful.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recenze v češtině níže.***Accommodations - the DeLuxe rooms are beautiful, spacey, clean and bright. The beds are very comfortable and the equipment of the room is practical. Rooms are quiet and you don't hear other guests behind the wall.Hotel interior and restaurant - the interiors (and exteriors) are nicely decorated in rustic style. The small courtyard with the mill-wheel is a very pleasant centerpiece to the building. The food in the restaurant is AWESOME (although not cheap), the breakfast is every day the same, but the selection of foods is wide so even on longer stay one does not get bored.Service - the staff in both hotel and restaurant is extremely pleasant and helpful, competent and professional. They were always eager to help us. They are communicating well in English, Czech, and German, they were even walking the extra mile to greet us in Polish.Location - the hotel is placed in a quiet part of Prague - its location may be a drawback to some since it is not near the center, but the public transport connection is very good, a bus stop is right in front of the hotel with just a few stops to get to the subway (it takes 20-30 minutes to the center depending on the time and day of week). In the vicinity, there are e.g.: a big forest park with a water dam (in summer there is a natural beach), a farm with a petting zoo, or a shopping center.We were looking for a place for our wedding that would allow us to have everything in one place - accomodation for guests from afar, place for the ceremony, lunch and afternoon/evening festivities. We have found all this in Hotel Selský Dvůr and our wedding has turned out amazing.The staff is very experienced in wedding organization and the hotel itself is a great place for such event in any weather, thanks to its interior and exterior seating possibilities.The kitchen prepared an awesome lunch and dinner buffet for a party of 30 and the restaurant staff was always kind and flexible.Special thanks go to Mr. Dvorský, who helped us arrange the whole event and was always incredibly helpful and patient with our never-ending questions and requests. Thank You!***Ubytování - pokoje DeLuxe jsou krásné, prostorné, čisté a světlé. Lůžka jsou velmi pohodlná a zařízení pokoje je praktické. Pokoje jsou tiché, další hosty za zdí neuslyšíte.Interiér hotelu a restaurace - interiéry (a exteriéry) jsou pěkně zdobené v rustikálním stylu. Malý dvůr s mlýnkem je velmi příjemným středem budovy. Jídlo v restauraci je ÚŽASNÉ (ačkoli není levné), snídaně je každý den podobná, ale výběr jídel je široký, takže i při delším pobytu se člověk neznudí.Služby - personál v hotelu i restauraci je mimořádně příjemný a ochotný, kompetentní a profesionální. Byli nám vždy ochotni pomoci. Komunikují dobře v angličtině, češtině i němčině.Poloha - hotel se nachází v klidné části Prahy - jeho umístění může být pro některé nevýhodou, protože je dál od centra, ale dopravní spojení je velmi dobré a autobusová zastávka se nachází přímo před hotelem - k metru je to jen pár zastávek (v závislosti na čase a dni v týdny trvá cesta do centra 20-30 minut). V okolí se nachází např. velký lesopark s vodní přehradou (v létě koupaliště), farma pro děti nebo obchodní centrum.Hledali jsme místo pro svatbu, které by nám umožnilo mít všechno na jednom místě - ubytování pro hosty z dálky, místo pro obřad, oběd a odpolední / večerní slavnosti. To vše jsme našli v hotelu Selský Dvůr a naše svatba se ukázala úžasně.Personál je velmi zkušený v organizaci svateb a samotný hotel je pro takovou akci skvělý, díky vnitřním a venkovním prostorám nabízí variantu pro každé počasí.Restaurace nám připravila výborný oběd a večeři formou rautu pro společnost 30ti lidí, a personál byl vždy milý a profesionální.Zvláštní poděkování patří panu Dvorskému, který nám pomohl celou akci uspořádat a byl vždy neuvěřitelně vstřícný a trpělivý k našim nekončícím otázkám a požadavkům. Děkujeme!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Calm and charming hotel with really attentive staff and an excellent restaurant. Try the fish dishes or the local specialties, they are excellent! The room was clean and well-furnished. Well worth a visit - I will certainly be going back when next in Prague.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel, the food was absolutely fabulous and the choice at breakfast covered everything. Staff were friendly and helpful, the hotel and rooms were immaculate . Our stay was relaxed and comfortable. Would highly recommend if you are looking for something away from the hustle and bustle, yet you were only half an hr away from the old town by bus which stopped right outside the hotel gates
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed one night at this hotel - it was a birtday present for me. When we arrived to the hotel room, there was a card to wish me happy birthday from the hotel management and a little bottle of champane. It was so nice from them! Otherwise the surroundings is nice and calm and the food is delicious. The only little disadvantage is that the location of the hotel is little far from the center, however, the public transport is perfect. I definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel, friendly staff,very nice rooms,excellent food ,good public transport point to the city center, a lot of parking spaces, very nice park near to hotel,good breakfast, excellent beer, good wine
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very nice hotel with clean and comfortable rooms and a good breakfast when I come to Prague is always going back to Selsky court.Even the bed was very comfortable and that is important but it is to wake up in peaceful surroundings
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent food, river and horses in the backyard, bus in front of hotel, easy access to Metro and shopping and close to old city. Best value for your money. Nice Staff and very helpful. Compared to much more expensive 5 stars hotels in town this was by far better.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A bit outside of the Centre but with the tram line 22 quickly in the Prague Centre. Nice restaurant with Beergarden with good quality food reasonably priced. Nice and clean rooms nothing romantic but comfortable. Friendly service.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Basically it was fine, but some little details didn't match with my expectation, like: there were ants in the bathroom, the towels were torn (room number 14). Otherwise it was good, the breakfast is really delicious.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my second stay in this hotel and this time I've tried the wellness center. It was very pleasant! It's quiet, relaxing, sauna is clean so you can have a very nice moment! Rooms are still clean and comfortable. And hotel crew is at your service and always with a smile. So I strongly recommend this hotel and I'll come back for sure.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We went to Prague for an extended weekend trip. This lovely hotel is a little outside the center, but well worth it. It takes about 30 minutes to get to the city center. The whole hotel is very clean and lovingly maintained. Our room was very beautiful. There is a restaurant where we always saw some guests, but we only went there for the breakfast buffet. The selection is great, there were different cereals, salads, fruit, cold cuts, pastries, and a variety of teas. The service at the front desk was very friendly, forthcoming and helpful whenever we had questions. We appreciated the soap and body lotion offered in the hotel room, which were organic.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are quiet, large and comfortable!! Bathroom are very clean. The hotel proposes a lot of services (airport/city transfer, wellness center, good restaurant etc...). The price is very interesting compared to the proposed quality of the rooms. The situation is far to the city center. So it's a good hotel for business trips.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 3 nights in the hotel. I would describe as a classic 3 star hotel, or a 4 star guest house. The staff on reception were lovely, but the waiting staff in restaurant and bar were off-hand and nondescript. The room was clean but small - not much space around the bed. Bathroom was modern and clean. I'm not big, but the shower cubicle was tiny. Breakfast was OK, but a bit samey, with a distinct feeling of anything not used today, is covered and brought out again tomorrow.Wifi worked and was free, so this is a distinct advantage!As a place to sleep, the hotel is fine. Clean and quiet. It is quite far out of town to be used as a base for central Prague.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed several days, visiting family. This time I had a larger room, but the water heater was noisy. Breakfast is ok, it's the same selection everyday, so it gets old after a few days. The staffis friendly and the restaurant is good.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We intend to suggest you hotel to our friends.Room clean and nice to be. Professional Personal Staff(Reception, Restaurant with taste food and cleaning service)The hotel is place that can reach easily with many transport options to tourist center of Prague(bus, metro and train).Around the hotel magnify park with more options to walk and eat.We very enjoy for all
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although in Prague and only 30 minutes to city centre with public transport this place is amazingly quiet and you feel like spending weekeng at your Granda's place in country.Rooms are big enough, clean and with nice modern bathroom.Nice courtyard where you can enjoy breakfast, coffee or bear...I will gladly come back...
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The place was peacefull. The people in the hotel was really nice and they smiled all the time.This hotel was wonderfull for sleep and relax. Thank you guys for all! We will come back again next year.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's a nice hotel located about thirty minutes from downtown if you use public transportation, which you can because they are excellent. The rooms are nice, big, looks new. The breakfast is not the best but decent. The place is quite, it has a parking lot and the bus station is right outside.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a hotel/restaurant a ways away from downtown Prague. It's an excellent bet if you have a rental car and don't mind a short drive.We stayed one night in this hotel to bridge the gap between our travel plans and the start of a work-related trip.We arrived late and were greeted by very friendly staff who advised us to quickly grab dinner in the restaurant, since the kitchen was about to close. The waiter suggested two excellent dishes and we were served promptly. The meal was great -- it was among the best Czech meals we had on our trip.By the time we were done with dinner, the kind receptionist had checked us into our room. The rooms have been recently re-done, with granite countertops, fancy showers. Everything was impeccably clean. The only down-side is that the wi-fi didn't work in our room.The free breakfast in the morning was the best free breakfast I've had in any hotel, anywhere. There was organic loose-leaf tea, coffee, pastries, scrambled eggs, bacon, fruit -- everything you could want. All of it was delicious. This place is a little bit off the beaten track, but in tourist season, in Prague, I think that's a good thing. If you have a car, it's easy to drive from here to downtown, and it's worth making the trek.I wish we'd stayed here for the entire duration of our trip!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good hotel a little far from old town but best with car, free parking , very nice stuff and good environment i liked to stay in the garden - look on the turbine with water and dring a good beer, big rooms and very clean i will suggest to friend and myself will come visit sgain
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice and clean roomPrivate parking Staff at the reception very nice and helpfull especially the night receptionist - we arrived late, after midnight, but she welcomed us smiling. We had lunch in the restaurant and it was quite good (except for the wine) Very good quality of bed.On the minus side:There was some mold on the bathroom ceiling The staff in the restaurant not smiling, which is not a problem, but they behaved like they just wished they were somewhere else I made the reservation on booking and it showed a huge discount, something like from 300 euro per night to 80. So I had very high expectations, but this is just a nice normal hotel, far away from city center, not worth more than 80 euro a night. They say they have some special mattresses and pillows, maybe that's why the price before the discount was so high... :) They blocked some money on my account when I made the reservation. At check-out they asked for the full amount, I asked about the blocked amount, they said it will be unblocked. It took them 2 weeks to unblock that amount - this is unacceptable.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has very good and clean rooms wiht a refridgerator. Is has a pleasant atmosphere. Breakfast is very good.For the restaurant one can sit outside in a garden, Very nice.The hotel is a bit far from the centre.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in this hotel from 5th June to 9th June, 2016. The hotel has a historical look but at the same time it offers all the modern facilities. The interior decoration at the entrance, reception and restaurant are really beautiful and unique. The food quality is good and the staffs are really helpful. They co-ordinate to provide all types of information needed and other requirements. It has central AC and good wifi connectivity with very good cleanliness. In the roof you have window with shutter through which you can enjoy the view of the stars in the night sky or you can close the shutter to make the room dark. At the backside of the hotel it has an open space where you can enjoy lazy steps within beautiful greenery.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the hotel for 4 night for business. I enjoyed the nice ambiance, the stuff are so friendly and the hotel rooms are comfortable and clean (as it should be).I haven't tried the food at the restaurant (I heard it is good), but I enjoyed having a drink there in the nice outdoor area.I recommend this hotel especially if you want to be in a calm neighborhood but stay close to the city.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent rooms which were clean, tidy and modern with good bathrooms and free WiFi. Wide selection of food for breakfast. Unable to review restaurant as we did not eat here during the stay but very pleasant restaurant and bar area within closed private courtyard. I would recommend this hotel and would be happy to stay again.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a good hotel but Only some of the receptionists didn't spoke english Or didn't understand it so there were some miss communications. But otherwise a very good hotel. Nice Place with a nice welness
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very good. Rooms are new and large. excellent bathrooms. the service is different. all staff are polite and very well prepared. the restaurant is highly regarded and serves delicious typical food. Minuses: too far from the city center. We need to take a bus and then the metro. There is an easily accessible hotel. Moreover, every day, the maids start to clean the rooms around 7 a.m. and make a lot of noise without worrying about the sleep of guests.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived around midnight. It cist about 20 Euros by taxi from airport. Room was very nice and clean. Mini bar. Comfortable bed and good shower. Blackout blonds were amazing! Staff were always very helpful. Breakfast was great! This is not exactly central but once you get your head around it its easy to get to the center by bus and underground (20 mins) A great place to stay!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing polite friendly smiling helpful staff who made me feel like a royalty. The breakfast is out of this world. Never seen anything like it and doubt I ever will. To try all home made food on offer I would need at least 3 days....so great my mom wouldn't make it better....just stunned....an absolute must!! Hotel rooms cosy, clean, nice furniture and some of the rooms are enormous....tried the massage as well and it completely sorted out my back problems I arrived with....I think I just want to live here full stop :-)
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When my mom asked me about "Selsky Dvur", i replied: "Three nuts for Cinderella". "What?" - mom could not get me. I explained. "Three nuts for Cinderella" is wonderful Czech fairy tale. As "Selsky Dvur".The atmosphere is very nice. Looks like you are in the middle of country side. Stuff is very professional and work as one team. If you asked one person about something, be sure it would be done, even though the person you asked is not on shift. People all the time smiling at you, greeting you, and you feel that they are glad that you are here. Rooms are very comfortable, with everything you need for good rest. Matrasses and pillows are better than all expectations. Breakfast is excellent, with great veriety of food and drinks. Restaurant is great, everything is tasty and portions are of right size. Transfer from or to airport is great.In "Selsky Dvur" we experienced real Czech hospitality and spent 10 days in wonderful Czech fairy tale.Thank you!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is just amazing. Food was delicious as well as great service provided. Prices are equal to the quality of food. Nice poace for celebrations or family lunch. There is also a hotel if you need to accomodate somebody. Never have been? You have to definitely chceck it out!!!! Till end of November goose menu!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I recently stayed at the Selsky Dvur (pronounced as in “moor”) and it is challenging to best express how much we enjoyed our visit – from 21 to 25 September. This cosy, relatively small (30 bedroomed) hotel is perfect for anyone looking for a relaxing and tranquil experience, we never heard any noise and, apart from when we were dining, we felt we were the only guests. Our delightful ground floor room was simply amazing as was the view to the rear looking out onto a stream with ducks and an inviting park land just beyond. Like other recent reviewers, we also found the beds so comfortable and incredibly soothing; we normally rise early but found ourselves rushing to appear for breakfast shortly before the 10 a.m. deadline. The reception area is staffed 24/7 and special mention has to be made to the 3 extremely efficient and friendly young ladies behind the desk whom we got to know – Andrea, Jana and Gabriel - who were always smiling and eager to give assistance.  We had evening dinner on two occasions at the hotel during our stay and strongly commend the menu and the very high quality of cooking by an award winning chef; we thought the selection of food extensive and inexpensive (resident guests are given a 15% discount); the table service was excellent.The wellness centre is relatively small and quite intimate but ideal as it can only be used privately by individual guest couples/families; it is kept spotlessly clean and hygienic. Bookings are normally required at least 1 hour beforehand to allow the sauna and heated relaxation benches to warm up. There is a special type of foot bath which I didn’t use as it was not familiar. One evening I enjoyed an hour long candle lit relaxation massage from a petite and very pleasant masseuse called Renata, highly recommendable - especially after a day walking the cobbled streets of Old Town ! Although Hotel Selsky Dvur is located away from the popular tourist areas, I strongly believe the benefits of a quiet and safe neighbourhood far outweigh the small inconvenience of having to avail of a bus and metro journey. On a couple of days we twice commuted back and forth into the city, once in the morning and again in the early evening, not a problem. Travelling around beautiful Prague is child’s play, so simple – from the hotel it takes about 7 minutes on a 177 bus then 14 minutes on the (Green) A Line Metro to the area (Stare Mesto) of the Charles Bridge. Cheap 24 hour and 72 hour tickets can be bought at the reception desk and must be stamped on the first journey only, thereafter they allow total unlimited hop on, hop off freedom on buses, trams and metro, forget them but keep safely in pocket/wallet.We would certainly choose to return to the Selsky Dvur.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pet Peeves: Internet connection times out ever so often forcing one to re-enter a password, Smelly ground floor wing due to boiler problems so we were relocated at request, We were allotted 2 single beds which separated in the middle at night; each bed had a narrow single bedcover so we couldn't cuddle under the sheets as a married couple, After an outing, we came back to find our blanket dumped on the floor at a corner of the room by cleaning staff without any explanation - which was a bit strange, Hotel dinner menu was boring after a few days so we ventured out, Very small and uninspiring spa facilities, paid for a deep back massage to relieve aches and pains but the attendant could only offer superficial finger and neck massages claiming that she had no muscles for anything rigorous, No gym or pool at this hotel as far as I'm aware, Found a housefly crawling over breakfast buffet ham and pepperoni spread. Ewww, 40 to 60 minute public transport commute to city centre (includes time waiting for Bus 177 especially at night) - advertising gave the impression that hotel was only 20 minutes away from the city centre. So very misleading, Good Points: Modern decor of room, quiet and reserved feel to the premises, Enjoyed the attic windows and the natural ventilation when relocated from the smelly left wing on the ground floor, Nice and modern bathroom with shower, Helpful staff, Quaint courtyard, Enjoyed the duck and cranberry cabbage dinner and ordered it on both nights, All in all, Prague was a very stunning city and we had an amazing time!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel for our first wedding night. Our room was large with big bed. Mattress is healthy and ideal for sleeping. Bathroom has heated floor. Breakfast is good. Great choice for eating: warm and cold buffet.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are nice, bathrooms are amazing, but when you leave your room it is not as great. Entrance hall has quite a smell, and occasionally smelled of smoke. Breakfast is very nice. Transport in to Prague city centre is quite a hassle and I wouldn't recommend this hotel for a city vacation.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel !!! Very friendly staff, from waitress Camilla to Hotel Director. Food was in optimal quantities, very pleasant taste, and good choice of several different beers. Outdoor seating was very nice. The room was very tastefully furnished, wifi worked without problems.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in April/2015 and loved every minute. We would like to say a big thank you to the hotel staff. Very pleasant and reasonably priced stay with an easy access to city center that is only about 20min away by public transport.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Last year I had the chance to stay in Selsky Dvur for a long term stay of more than half a year. This was really a nice place to stay and I could recommend this to everyone who wants to stay in a friendly environment with very professional service and superb rooms. I never had such a good sleeping comfort and now I'm looking for equal mattresses as I would not like to miss that comfortable sleep at home. So the announcement of sleeping comfort mentioned on the website becomes true.Bus is in front of the hotel and tramway (I think longest line in Prague - directly to the city and also through the city up to Hradcany) is just 5 minutes walk from hotel. Taking the Tram is as good as making a sightseeing tour. On-site parking is available. Good restaurant with outside tables in nicely designed patio.All together it was the best desicion to stay in this hotel.Many Thanks!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel if you have business out of center to avoid trafic and have nice stay. Fantastic big very new rooms. Nice sauna area with possible masages to book. Restaurant not perfect but just ok same as breakfest. Free parking and good internet
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed at this hotel for 4 nights (August) and found it to be a perfect place. The staff is friendly, and the rooms are new and very clean. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom felt like a little spa, with beautifully tiled floors and walls, and a very spacious glass-enclosed shower. Our window looked out onto a small park and the hotel felt very peaceful. The air-conditioning worked like a charm and was very quiet which really helped getting a good night's rest. One of the best parts of our hotel stay was the delicious, truly continental breakfast with bread, crusty buns, cheeses, cold cuts, herring, salads, eggs, bacon, yogurt, cereal, fresh fruit and vegetables, coffee, tea and delicious cakes.To get to downtown Prague, you catch a bus right in front of the hotel, and transfer a few stops later to the subway. A seamless experience. A day pass for the bus and subway is around $5.50 CAN. There is a mall close by (10 minute walk) which has a supermarket. There is a restaurant in the hotel, but we did not try it.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a really cosy hotel with a authentic ambiance, friendly staff and very nice clean modern rooms. Maybe a bit distanced ftom the center of Prague, but has a nearby subway station which goes to and through Prague. Spa is available but we didn't use it so no idea of that.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I want thanks to General Manager, Chef and all stuff for very friendly and complex service during my several visits in this beautiful town and place. I recomended this accomodation to my friends and I can this possibility to advise to all. You'll be satisfied all and soundry.Maria
hotelName:
23    Hotel Selsky Dvur
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the flat was poor, facilities broken,washing machine that was in the plectrum, wasnt in the flat, when we complained, we didnt get a nice treatment. also- our credit card was charged without telling us(we planned to pay with another card and not the one that we gave for the deposit)
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked the apartment because it was based in old town Prague. What a lovely hidden treasure it is. Entrance is through a small door that you would never know was there into a delightful building with little courtyard in the centre. We were in Apartment E on the 2nd floor so there were a quite a few stairs to climb with no lift access (some of the apartments can be reached by the lift) It’s an apartment for 2 people but could sleep three as there is a sofa bed in the living room area. Modern inside and impeccably clean. Has a washing machine, dishwasher, integrated fridge, cooker, microwave, kettle and toaster (coffee maker too!) and all kitchen utensils. It was stocked with kitchen towel, washing up liquid and cloths. The living area had comfy armchair and hugs sofa as well as TV and WiFi router. Bed was a little low to get in and out of (for me personally) but it was comfortable enough (extra pillows available in cupboard too). The bathroom was large, but a little dated, and the shower head wasn’t the greatest, but I’ve seen much worse on my travels. The only down side is that they aren’t serviced and towels aren’t changed (or bins removed) but we just washed them ourselves so not a big issue as we were only here 4 nights. Lovely welcoming staff and you feel secure as the desk is constantly manned. Great location and would definitely recommend! Thanks UKapra for a lovely stay! Will definitely return again!
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is very ideal and central. Apartment is very run down and in bad need of a renovation even though it is clean.  Flooring in master bedroom toilet n bedroom is cracked. Other toilet is leaking. Cupboard in master bedroom has black mould on the wall. Living room lightning is very dark. Bring everything even soap to wash your hands coz its not provided. You need to put a €400 deposit for any damage that might be made. Looking at the state of the apartment, i think i should be given cash rebates for having to stay in the apartment with the damages!!
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice, spacious, quiet, tidy apartment in the middle of Prague old town. We even had a roof terrace, which was nice.We ordered airport transportation to the town at the same time we booked the apartment. The driver was especially nice and told us a lot about the town and the history of the country.The reception was in the other building across the street, so by the arrival we were told to go there, the receptionists in the main building spoke english, but the receptionist (an older man) in the other building didn´t speak english at all and couldn´t even told us on what floor our apartment was.We order a breakfast basket to our room for one morning, although there are nice places near to have a breakfast.The contents of the basket were good, but it was delivered to us so late that we had already had a breakfast at a nearby restaurant at that time.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: These apartments are located within Prague's Old Town, central to all the great things to do. The Apartments are clean with all the amenities expected in a holiday apartment, especially a washing machine/dryer. Modern with the old charm of the character buildings. Would come back and stay again.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were initially a bit worried because of this apartments' central location - it is right in the middle of the Old Town and we thought it would be noisy. That was not the case! The apartment was quiet, with perfectly working AC (important at 34 degrees Celcius) and Wifi (important for our two teenagers). Spacious rooms, large bathroom with separate toilet and functional kitchen made this the perfect spot for our 4-night stay. Sofa bed for the teenagers were OK, futon style mattress in the main bedroom was comfortable enough for us as well. We would definitely choose U Kapra again.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love this apartment for everything! Location at center of old town, next to astronomical clock. Apartment is very spacious, clean and modern. King beds were comfy. We had two families staying together and the layout was perfect. I would definitely stay again!!
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very spacious stylish apartments and have everything u need! Fully stocked with iron hairdryer ect ‘ only down fall was we was on 3 flights of stairs with no view so getting in at night was hard work and if u are elderly it would not be ideal so ask for bottom level ‘ the location is Fantasic right in the hub of the bustling streets , and only short walk from Charles bridge ! Loved it would definitely stay again xx
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first visit to Prague and we decided to find somewhere in Old Town. The U Kapra building is right in the middle of all the Old Town bustle which, after a few days got a little tiresome as it was so crowded. And it is quiet season! Next time, I would stay either on the outskirts near New Town or across the Charles Bridge in Little Quarter. Restaurants nearby are good but expensive compared to other parts of the city. We booked ‘Lovely’ apartment which is 1 bathroom and 2 bedrooms, both of Which are loft-style and reached via their own staircase, one of which is more like a ladder. The two bedrooms are open to the living room and each other so, if you like privacy, chose another apartment. This may seem like a small complaint, but I did give myself a headache by bumping into the roof beams a few times in the night, heading downstairs to the loo! And we found the bedding too hard and pillows way too soft so it was hard to get a solid night’s sleep. We rent a lot of apartments in our travels and only mention it in this review as the poor quality of the bedding is not inline with the high quality of the apartment - I would suggest to management to add a mattress topper to provide a more comfortable sleep and provide better pillows. The apartment itself is very quiet, though, and spacious and we definitely appreciated the washer AND dryer, so rare in european apartments but much appreciated. The kitchen is a good size and has everything you need, including a dishwasher.And, the last thing to be mindful of is the stairs to ‘Lovely’ apartment. 5 flights. Makes baggage transfer a bit tricky. Book something lower down. That’s the trade off with being in a lovely building that is many years old and no lift. The staff were very helpful and the 24hr concierge is a great asset in an apartment building.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the Karlova 48 apartments on a short winter break to Prague, and were very impressed!The apartment was super clean, spacious and in just the right location in the heart of the old town. We were able to go out and visit Prague during the day, and drop back into the apartment later knowing we didn’t have far to walk to grab some dinner.The apartment offers a food delivery service, so you can also ‘stay home’ and eat if you wish.Another plus was the quietness considering the central location.No negatives, many positives. Very highly recommended!
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location of the Ukapra is excellent, we had a 2 level room which was brilliant, really big and well decorated. The bed was super comfy and a huge plus having a balcony. Only one staff member spoke english which made it a little hard when it came to things like checking in. Overall, great place to stay and would 100% stay again and recommend.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Sun-Lit Apartment Loft in Old town. Our first impression was not good as we walked in the apartment and it smelled of smoke and the a/c was not on. 3 of us tried and tried to turn both units on with no luck. IT was HOT. I called the manager (well fellow at front desk called for me- who was amazing btw) and she proceeded to tell me we did not book ac and to show her the email. So i hunted for the email, found it and sent it to her.. When we returned from dinner they tried to tell us the air is working and we just were all too stupid to turn it on,lol... not likely. It was definitely set off. So once the air was on, i could settle down. The apartment was clean, although smelled. It was extremely spacious in a very great area. You walk outside your front door and are in the busy busting streets of Old Town. The bed upstairs was terrific but the pullout downstairs was not so good. I recommend this apartment to a couple ( only if the AC is on) and not more than 2 or kids could sleep on the pullout. This was the second year I have stayed with Prague Apartments. Their communication is very good and I find their pricing reasonable. I would book with them again but perhaps a higher end apartment with modern air conditioning especially in summer.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rented the Old Town Suite again for all of June, plus an apartment 1 floor down to take the overflow of family & friends. Excellent stay as usual, in an unbeatable location. A plus was the new shower, washer & dryer in the second bathroom, & the large Aussie-style shower in the downstairs apartment. The Old Town Suite needs a new dishwasher, but that's a minor quibble. Zorica from Prague-Stay is really helpful. Will be back in 2019.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This apartment is located just 100 mtrs from the old town square. The apartment is very spacious, nicely done up and comfortable. The kitchenette was nice with a lot of pans, cutlery etc. However, you can't drive to this place. You have to park the car about 100 mtrs away and then carry your luggage. While arriving, i got the parking within a couple of minutes as someone was leaving. As i parked and came out of the car, i saw a couple of cars waiting already. So, there could be possibility where you could have to wait for parking. While leaving, it was sunday (parking on sunday is free) and i could easily get parking.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Prague and chose these apartments. We had Flat M at the top of the building. There is a lift to the 3rd floor and 1 flight of stairs to it. It was large with 2 good size bedrooms 1 a mezzanine. 2 bathrooms kitchen with everything you'd need large comfortable lounge. It is just around the corner from the old square and most of the area is accessible by foot other attractions are a little further afield. Be warned the square is busy around the hour mark from 9 when the Astronomical Clock chimes
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was located on the top floor - so not for those who struggle with mobility/lots of stairs! The suite was so worth it though. Exposed beams, nicely decorated, it was everything we needed. I'd stay here again
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There are many positives for these apartments. The location is just off the city Center! They were spacious clean and warm! I booked the apartment and payed the higher rate for the luxury apartment after looking at the gallery online I expected the more attractive looking apartment however the apartment we got was fairly bog standard. I asked our booking agent for a bunch of roses and bottle of prosecco/champagne to be put in the apartment as we would be arriving on our anniversary. Although I was told this would be no problem it never materialised which left me a little disappointed. The wifi in our apartment didn't work, I tried to reset the box but with no success and when I spoke to our agent he said this would be fixed but again it never happened, we managed to connect to another rooms wifi but the signal strength was poor.When we first used the shower (bath with wall mounted shower head) I opened the glass door/shower curtain. The door fell off of its hinges and landed on the floor bruising my ankle on the way down!!! How it did not smash I do not know! I tried to explain this to the lady on reception however she didn't speak a word of English and couldn't understand it either!! So I tried to explain these problems to our booking agent as they were very good at communicating before our arrival and we sent emails back and forth regarding airport transfers etc. However once we had arrived they didn't reply once to my emails expect when they wanted the €25 for our airport transfer which we were told we'd have to pay the driver but the driver said to pay at reception.Our bed was a large double and very comfortable however the pillows were the size of small cushions which was frustrating during the night and the duvet's were two separate singles so me and my partner just as well had slept in separate beds!!When I made the booking with booking.com I was asked to secure the booking with a credit card which is the norm, however the week before we arrived I was charged full price onto my credit card when I wanted to use my debit card on arrival as I always do when using booking.com so this was another inconvenience!A brilliant location they just let themselves down with the service and the few minor issues in the room.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: These apartments can not be recommended highly enough! We stayed in a loft apartment and could not believe the size of it, excellent value. The staff were so helpful, friendly and professional. The appliances were extremely modern, smart TV, chrome cast and all the lighting was controlled remotely. It was extremely clean and comfortable. As for the location it was literally steps away from both Charles Bridge and the astronomical clock. Genuinely have no negative comments, couldn't be better!
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Due to the style of the apartments, I guess each one is different. In my case, I spent two nights ata apartment M. Very nice and spacious, it has a living room with a sofa/bed, a complete bed room, and a mezzanine with a second bedroom. This one is very nice to, but with limited privacy. Value for money is excellent, the only negative point is that the boiler is too small to grant warm water for a shower to 5 guests. Otherwise, highly recommendable!
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great place to stay. It was clean, quiet and comfortable! I found U Kapra on Trip Advisor. The reviews are correct- great value! U Kapra is located in Old Town near Charles Bridge and the Astrological Clock! Great location and close to the metro!
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: U Kapra Apartments are well located in Male Namesti – a small square next to the main square in the old town. We had the so-called Elegant Apartment which was a well-appointed and very spacious one bedroom apartment with large sofas in the lounge area that could have been converted into more bedding. It was on the third floor accessed by a lift from a lobby that always had a security person there. Despite the heavy traffic flow of people in this tourist central area, the apartment was extremely quiet with very effective double glazing.
