On occasions you could hear a few late night exits from some of the bars in the square but it was not problematic. The key plus was that it was in easy walking distance of every attraction as well as restaurants and the all-important tram no 22. It also was reasonably close to the large Tesco supermarket. The kitchen was well equipped with a dishwasher and a washer /dryer. The only two minor issues were that the curtains were not totally light proof (fine in October but perhaps not in July) and the sofas were a bit difficult to sit on comfortably. The company that oversees these apartments, Prague Stay run others and there are quite a few choices in this block and in other areas such as the Rybna 9 apartments.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This apartment is located in the heart of the city. I was very impressed to find this huge apartment at the last minute! We loved it! If I ever go to that city again I'll rent the same place! Everything was so clean! There is a very nice little kitchen, a big living room, there is washer and drier in one of the bathrooms. We were very satisfied in this place. The staff even asked us to shop for groceries before we got there! It is such a great place! I will recommend it! The only problem was the parking! You have to let the hotel staff that you need a parking. Otherwise you have to walk for ten minutes to get to the parking garage.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As it was our first trip to Prague, we did not really know where to stay. I was very happy at how close this apartment was to the old town square (50 yards). The apartment we had was on the ground floor very big, clean and modern. The only thing we were not happy about was the big bedroom had no air conditioning and was very hot when trying to get to sleep. I would recommend staying at this apartment as it's very close to where you want to be
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really loved the decor and location of our apt. Very quiet and it had everything we needed. The manager was very friendly and efficient. She had recommendations for places to shop and was very interested in our travels. She arranged for a place to store our bicycles securely. The apartment was fabulous.... The location right in the centerWe will go there again absolutely
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This apartment was a slice of heaven in the sky !The place is huuuuuge, especially for European standards.Beautifully decorated with all the amenities you could need.Being on the 3rd floor, it had amazing views and you could see the Old Town Square/clock from where we were.It is in a busy area & right near Hard Rock cafe but our sleep was never disturbed.The rooms are well back from the windows & street.Booking & checking in was easy and all staff were lovely.We didnt have any trouble finding the place however, we had been to Prague before.The receptionist & security know very little English, enough to get by, but you should ask your check-in host what you need to know.Highly recommend this place !
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying right in the centre of Prague means to better leave your car in the closest parking garage before checking in. We drove through the entire pedestrial zone and were very lucky not to get fined. However, the agent is very helpful to provide name and directions if asked for it. From there it's a 10 min walk. Otherwise: Everybody there is very kind and give advise according to their capabilities. Yet the receptionist doesn't speak English, they always provide a direct line to the organizers.And the apartment is on the top floor, but the elevator only caters for two floors, so you should not be handicapped.To sum it up: I'll always come back as long as I can. Great stay.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed two days in this breath taking two bedrooms apartment. Very nice and clean space, perfect view through the roofs of old Prague city center. Fully air-conditioned apartment, helpful receptionist and sexy neighbor at the door opposite made our stay even more comfortable then we expected .)) Go there, u will never forget..)
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a really good time at this apartment. Perfect room service and best location right in the city center. Big rooms, all clean. Big screen tvs, fully equipped kitchen and clean bathrooms. Secure place with own reception. Thumbs up!
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We couldn't believe our luck when got to the apartments stunning interior, in its excellent location. We rented the two bedroom apartment, and it was perfect for our two couple party. The bath rooms and kitchen were great spaces, as were the living rooms. And a few minutes walk from old town square meaning it was ideal for sight seeing. Couldn't recommend it enough - we will be back.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at U Kapra with a large group of friends in March 2016. All apartments were amazingly spacious and well appointed. Locations was spot on - a few mins walk (literally) from the square.Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent place to spend your vacation in prague with excellent apartments very clean super location and good service there is always some one setting in the reception who can help with every thing although not all of them are English speakers but they can contact the office for any help highly recommended
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my second stay at U Kapra, this time in a 1 bedroom apartment. It is still one of my all time favourite places to stay. The apartment is huge. Very old world with exposed beams, huge rooms, separate bedroom, kitchen, lounge, bathroom/laundry and entry. It truly is a whole apartment and just oozes charm.Everything has been thought of here, plenty of supplies for the bathroom/laundry and kitchen. All you need is a few groceries and you are all set up.The Christmas Markets are in the centre square and there are plenty of places to buy food and drink. You really are in the centre of everything.Only downside is a few flights of stairs, old building and to be expected but should be mentioned.Would never hesitate to recommend staying here.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having just finished my short break in Prague with my partner I must say we were really happy with the overall experience of the apartment.As I stated in the title, I think we'd struggle to find a place more central to the sites we came to see. What you get for the price tag is reasonable, although there are various small improvements that could make the difference between the 4 bubbles I gave and the 5 I would have awarded them.My first point would be that of the 'serviced' element of their description. As in all the other places I've stayed, I would have hoped for daily housekeeping, if only to change the towels.There are basic levels of initial goods I expect from this type of accommodation; coffee, milk, shampoo... The kind of stuff you need once you've completed your journey there and for the next morning.The living room was clean and comfortable and the entertainment equipment was adequate, if you like Czech television. There is a DVD player, so pack one or two if you want to spend an evening in.The shower is positioned incredibly low and a certain amount of contortion was required to wash myself from the shoulders up. The bath was also quite high, so my not so tall girlfriend struggled to get out, which was quite comical.The bed was comfortable but the pillows left a lot to be desired and seemed to have been omitted from the production line prior to the last stage - putting the stuffing in them.Whilst the rooms were nothing to be sniffed at and have everything depicted in the photos, be aware that the photographer who took the shots is a magician and the lighting and ambience is considerably different in real life.The rooms had great sound proofing from the street outside, although the inner walls were thin and you could hear others in the building. There's a few jobs on the list which the maintenance man has missed, there was a cracked tile on the bath and the bedroom door handle fell off on it's first use.Would return.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After arriving in Prague, we headed straight for the apartment to freshen up and decide what to do for the rest of the afternoon. Google maps took us to karlova street, being where the apartment is. However it took us a couple of trips around the block, 3 phone calls and a visit to the local tourist board to actually find the apartment. Finally we navigated our way back to where google maps had previously taken us, and on the side of a door was a small sign saying 'u kapra apartments'. We were expecting some kind of font on the front of the building, whereas we were greeted by a small sticker proclaiming to be the place we were looking for, which we easily over looked as we aimlessly and repeatedly walked past the door. The woman at the reception was helpful and gave us our keys. The apartment itself was clean and modern with good cooking and entertainment equipment. There was even a filter coffee machine which turned out to be a little pointless, when there is no coffee. There was no tea, milk, sugar or anything to drink either. I've stayed in many serviced apartments before and I expect a 'serviced' apartment to have the basics for making a drink. There was also no shower gel or shampoo for the shower, meaning we had to go out and buy some before being able to freshen up after travelling. The apartment was spacious and practical, and we weren't planning on spending too much time there anyway. The bed itself was comfy and I liked the two separate duvets, meaning there was no arguments between me and my partner. The pillows on the other hand were small and square and had no stuffing. I had to fold another duvet to use as a pillow. My partner who usually sleeps with one, had 3 under his head every night. The bath and shower combination was not very practical. I'm not particularly tall so to try and get out of the shower over the side of the bath proved difficult every time bearing in mind the water makes everything slippy. I will reiterate that I'm not particularly tall, so to have to crouch under the shower head to wash my hair because it is placed too low is unusual. God knows what my 6'1" partner had to do.However, the apartment was in a perfect location, just around the corner from the old square and the astronomical clock and a short walk from Charles bridge. All in all, perfectly acceptable for the money you pay.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We rented to Sunlit apartment, and after struggling a bit to find the door (very small signage), we were pleasantly surprised by the apartment. Two floors, with an upstairs balcony looking over the rooftops of Prague. Since the apartment is an inner courtyard, the noise of Old Town is completely blocked. Full kitchen, living room, sound system, washer, and two bathrooms make this a great place to unwind after some long travel days. The location cannot be beat, just steps away from the main square and clock. The elevator is a nice touch, but be ready at night to find a light switch, as the hallways are kept dark (energy savings?). Would definitely use again on our next (hopefully soon) return to Prague.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is simply perfect. We stayed in a huge two bedroom U Kapra apartment. This is literally the best location in the entire city of Prague for one to stay. The Old Market area is full of restaurants, shops and historical destinations. The apartments are well equipped with lots of space to live. Most importantly, especially in the summer time, the apartment has a great air conditioning. The only negative is that there is no where close to park a personal vehicle. This is easily rectified because there is a public parking lot a few blocks away. But be warned it will be a bit of a hike with your bags. We will stay here again when we visit Prague. This place is just amazing.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are spending 6 days here and it is an absolutely amazing place! Top of line ultramodern kitchen for eating in, comfortable bed rooms, beautiful bathrooms, and absolute quiet after stepping inside with the throngs of people walking up Karlova Street. Would look forward to come back just for the apartment.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a family of four and this was perfect for us. It is right in the heart of Old Town. It has a lift, its own laundry and self contained kitchen, plus a deck (in our apartment). I can recommend it enough. I will definitely be staying here again, when I return!!
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment we had was very spacious and the location was perfect for seeing all the sites in Prague. There was 2 bathrooms one on each floor which was very convenient. It had air conditioning, a clothes washer/dryer, a fully equipped kitchen, an elevator and good wifi. Although the apartment was spacious it could have been more comfortable for the money we were spending. The sofa felt a little damp and when you sat on it the bottom would pull out because it was a sleeper sofa. The dining room chairs where metal and were very uncomfortable. Although the place was generally clean the refrigerator was dirty and the freezer looked like it hadn't been clean in a long time. I had to find some baking powder to put in the fridge to take away the smell. The clothes washer was also a dryer but it didn't dry anything. We air dried our clothes. It was one of the most expensive accommodations that we rented on our vacation and we were expecting a better value for our money.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the first time we tried renting an apartment while on vacation. There was room for us all to spread out in and the common area was great to hang out in. We were in Karlova 48, the furniture is a unique miss of old,new, and eclectic. The agent met us when we got there to do paperwork and answer questions. A grocery store was a five minute walk down the street to pick up breakfast supplies. You have a key for the front door and one for the apartment. A security person mans a front desk inside 24 hours a day. I thought it was supposed to have A/C, but luckily the weather was good and we got great cross ventilation with windows open.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment we stayed was beautiful, spacious, clean and in the heart of the old town.It is very convenient to everything- food, restaurants, attractions, and the apartment is quiet with free wifi. Cafes, coffee shops, minimarket, bank, restaurants etc.. right outside the door ! It is not a hotel but there is 24 hour desk coverage for check in and out. The location is A plus! We would definitely stay again!
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly I want to make one thing clear, the apartment itself is very nice. Perfect location in the centre of old town and as close to everything as you could possibly want. The apartment had all the modern conveniences of a serviced apartment and was very clean on arrival and very spacious. This is where the positives end:Upon arrival we were given keys to a room on level 4. The elevator only goes to level 3 so 4 of us had to carry 4 large suitcases up a tiny narrow staircase to actually reach level 4. My father 65yr old has recently recovered from a double hip replacement so this was a huge issue for him and proved to be a huge issue for 7 days. When we reached room it was completely different room to the pictures and to the style i had booked 1 yr earlier. We were given a dark attic apt with almost no natural light nor any view except other rooftops through porthole sized windows. The reason i booked the EXECUTIVE 2 BEDROOM APARTMENT was because it had large windows that opened out to the main square and so there were no stairs for my father. Also within the apt the 2nd bed was up another flight of internal stairs and was completely open to the rest of the apt offering no privacy at all and was impossible to carry large cases up to the 2nd loft bed due to the tiny stairs. So for 7 days our caes sat in the kitchen area constantly in the way of everyone.I immediately went back down to reception to ask to speak to the agent who was in charge of my booking. The reception lady made a call and the woman I spoke tried to make out that this was the right apt I had booked and that there was nothing she could do. After some time and getting nowhere she said she would speak to the guy in charge of my booking and call back within 30mins. 50mins later no one called so I called back and eventually was able to speak to the correct agent. He offered some apologies and said he would try and move us to a 3 bed apt the following day. He said he would call me back that night or in morning to advise further. 2 days later I still had not received any call from anyone so I wrote 2 not so nice emails to the agent and someone else from his office to complain about the situation. A further day or so later he replied with an apology email about the situation and offered to meet with me at the apt the next day to apologize in person. I responded and said ok this is fine and gave him 2 days in which it would be possible to meet with me. This was the last contact i have had with him and still have not met with him nor heard further from anyone involved with the company. To date the only thing they gave me was a comp airport tranfer which I had to ask for. I work in the hotel industry as a manager of a hotel that is part of a luxury chain so to experience such poor customer service really gave me a bad impression of Prague. I will go as far as saying our week was ruined due to the lack of urgency and compassion showed when there when there was a clear mistake made by the real estate that they acknowledged had been made. If they had deal with this on the day or the day after then my review would be much more positive. In a nut shell if you want the freedom of an apt in a great location the go right ahead. If you want to risk your holiday being ruined by incompetent agents taking care of your bookings then also go ahead.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me, my sister and our friends stayed there on Monday 9.2.2015 for 1 night and we have to say our stay was excellent! Apartment was huge! Beautifully decorated bedroom with a massive wardrobe, bathroom with a bathtub, modern kitchen with a dining table and awesome living room with two sofas, LCD TV etc. The view from our apartment was simply amazing – tower of Astronomical Clock. Check-in was very easy, nothing was too much trouble. We would definitely stay again!
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with 2 friends in the apartment with the terrace. The place is really nice and good facilities. I read previously about the language barrier, which was a minor hassle but no big deal. Location is great!
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just stayed in U Kapra unlit apartment for one week. Well located and equipped exactly what you see on net is product . Recommendation for owners that the reception staff speak English. We arrived and you are transferred by phone to speak to your agent which is all ok( as receptionist doesn't speak English). We were asked to review and sign contract by 11 am the next morning.we had used their advertised shuttle service to arrive and we were asked to enclose 20 euro for the taxi. I also arranged our pickup for our departure . We agreed to enclose the money and contact in sealed envelope . The next morning reception was not at the desk and we had a tour organised. We left the envelope on the desk but away from full view. It had our name on the front. When we returned reception was very anxious fir us to speak to our agent which I did by phone. She asked for the fee for the shuttle indicating she had contract but not money!! As I indicated to her we would have handed over envelope the same if desk manned or not. To the management credit she said it was their fault and was ok. I then confirmed our departure arrangements verbally and by email. We were picked up by taxi driver at designated spot after U Kapra was indicated by driver on the day of departure. However when we got to train station he wanted to be paid. We indicated that we had paid 20 Euro already. He took apartment details and we left for our train. Not sure whether driver was trying to get extra money or incorrect driver however the process could be improved. We would have been happy to pay in our accomodation, safer. Not sure where the 40 Euro went however worked out for us. Otherwise highly recommend.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed christmas week at U Kapra ground floor 2-bedroom apartments. Second time we have stayed here, so thought we should contribute. These apartments are so well located, just minutes from old town square which is a main hub for the city. The team have been so helpful, smoothing arrangements like taxis and food shopping for us. The apartment is very well accommodated, modern warm and clean. Beds are comfortable, bathrooms and kitchen high specification. Hairdryer provided and iron, washing machine, tumble dryer etc. mini supermarket to the left of apartments few doors up. No noise from outside, despite location. Would definitely recommend,
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You would be far stretched to find a better location than these apartments, you step out your door and you are in the heart of the Old Town. We stayed in two different apartment rooms during our stay, one being for just a day because we had a late flight - both were lovely, one being an attic apartment, the other overlooking a small square and Christmas Market. Both rooms were also ready well before the given time of 2pm, which was brilliant. Staff all very friendly, although most staff only speak very basic English. I should also point out that a large Tesco is within walking distance, which we visited every day.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been in Prague for several times, but this was for sure the best stay so far. Location couldn't simply be better. Everything worked very well. Apartment was shiny clean and value, at least not during most hectic tourist season, was just great. Would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Right in the heart of the city centre next to the old square, 10 minute walk from Bus terminal, pubs resturants within 2 minute walk, enjoyed the roomy apartment with all mod cons, reccomend to anyone
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've just returned from a short break, staying in the Sunlit apartment in U Kapra building. Three adults. Great accomodation on two floors. Very clean, smart. Comfy, large double bed upstairs and reasonable sofa bed in large living room. Washing machine and detergent provided, with English instructions. Dishwasher, too, with tabs provided. Large fridge freezer, Small m'wave, etc in spotlessly clean (like the whole appartment) kitchen. Open the main doors to the building and you're on a lovely pedestrian street, only a two minute walk to the astronomical clock and main square. Luggage was held at reception on our last day as we had late pm flight. Visit slevomat website for restaurant, attraction and other deals - it's like groupon / living social. There's a slevomat office off Wenceslas square, too. Great location and very quiet. Windows look out over rooftops, rather than pretty streets etc, but nice rooftops nevertheless! From airport you can get 34koruna (£1) travel ticket to city. Get 119 bus, to Djevicka then metro to Starometska, then 5-10 minutes to U Kapra.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location in the old town square, can arrive majority of scenic spots by walk. Just that I hardly find the entrance of hotel as there is no signboard nor direction stands. And the roads around are not smooth enough for moving my luggages.My stay is a duplex room, well equipped with laundry, kitchen, home studio etc. Put it simply a comfortable home. Clean and everything necessary is ready for you. Highly recommend it to someone who gets tired of typical hotel rooms.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic central location. Excellent apartment with generous communal space.Good facilities.Squeaky bed but otherwise comfortable.Due to it's great location there is some noise at night and early morning but the location makes up for that!I would recommend staying here.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband, ten year old son, and I recently stayed in the Vault Apartment in the U Kapra apartments. Zorica was our agent and she was very quick to respond and was quite helpful, especially when we had some confusion about an airport transfer. The Vault apartment was absolutely stunning! Two great bedrooms, two large bathrooms, and a fantastic living space! The apartments are in a perfect location in the middle of Old Town, close to the Astronomical clock, the Charles Bridge, and great restaurants and shopping. But even better was the fact that as soon as you came into the complex through the external door, all the noise and crowds melted away. The apartment was a perfect oasis of quiet and serenty in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Old Town Prague. The 24 hour attendant was helpful and provided an extra sense of security. The only minor complaint we had was the smaller bedroom had an excellent air conditioner, but the master bedroom only had a fan. The listing clearly says it is only partially air conditioned, so there was no mis-representation, but a second air conditioner would have been great. Otherwise it was a fantastic experience! Thomas was our driver to the airport when we left and he was personable and professional, even going the extra mile of helping us carry our baggage into the airport. We would highly recommend the Vault apartment and plan to stay there again the next time we visit Prague!
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Apartment I which had a wonderful view of the the Male square - you can see the astronomical clock from the windows. The kitchen was well-equipped, the bathrooms were great and the rooms were comfortable and chic. Even though we were on a busy square, it was absolutely quiet. The staff was very helpful and immediately fixed the small issues we had. The central air kept us cool during a terrible heat wave. It is a 3 min walk to the Charles Bridge and major transportation.The staff will provide groceries or deliver breakfast at reasonable prices - but there is a nice farmers market only 2 minutes away and a bakery down the block, so we relied on that. Two small negatives: the double bed is in fact two single mattresses. The staff should put on the $50 connector that covers the crack between the two beds. And the kitchen didn't have salt, pepper, paper towels etc... Also, be advised that the apartment location is in the middle of everything - which is very exciting, but it can feel a bit touristy and frenetic the minute you leave the apartment.
hotelName:
24    Prague Apartments U Kapra
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For the amount of money that we paid, I was NOT impressed! We paid 3x more per night because of the Essence Festival and did not receive the experience I received the 2 other times I came to this hotel. Bed frames were sticking out from bed, cool towels were only available 1 night, elevator was down 1 night, ice was constantly out.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our second stay in this hotel and we were satisfied again. The hotel is clean, staff friendly and courteous. The rooms are spacious and the ones that face the courtyard are very quiet.The breakfast was good with large variety of foods, plentiful seating in various rooms, in summer there is also a patio.We recommended this hotel to couple of friends and they all liked it too.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best hotel I have ever stayed at. The price was amazing. The staff were so friendly. Room was clean and cozy. The pool was breathtaking . I highly recommend this hotel. I will definitely be coming back.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family enjoyed our visit at this hotel. We were centrally located where we could participate in tours, and able to walk to the French Quarter. The hotel was beautiful upon pulling into the drive. The decor upon entering the building was very classic. And the same goes for the room. Although the lighting was a little darker than normal, it fit the style of the hotel. The beds were comfortable and the room was big enough for us.We have no complaints.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would recommend this Hotel if you want the New Orleans experience . This history, the art work and not to mention they serve peanut butter sandwiches and milk starting at 10:00pm . Very clean . I would defiantly go back there.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great time at the beautiful hotel. From the moment you walk in, the massive chandeliers sprinkled throughout the lobby are breathtaking. The entire lobby & bar also had a very fragrant smell. It was pleasant but not overwhelming. We will definitely be staying there again!
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I usually stay in Marriotts when I travel, but the Prague Marriott was unavailable for this trip- so I stayed at this Best Western. It is in a historic building, with stairs to go up and down, but the staff was extremely helpful in getting my bags to my room. I was in room 101- it had a window looking out into the garden, quiet and had a double bed and a single twin. Furniture was antique but the bed was quite comfortable and the room and bathroom were clean and organized. The air conditioner worked very well... thank goodness because it was almost 40C across Europe that week. Breakfast in the morning was excellent with a wide variety of options, and could be taken inside or outside in the garden. The staff was very helpful. Great option for the business traveler and mush better value over the Marriott and a Hilton! Only downside... I could not find a workout room...but a walk up to the Castle and back got my 10,000 steps in and then some.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was an amazing hotel for our yearly vacation! My husband and I really enjoyed our stay here. We always felt welcomed, it was clean, and the PB&J sandwiches at night were such a fun touch! I would HIGHLY recommend.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at Le Pavilion as it was within walking distance of everything we wanted to see in the French Quarter and areas. The hotel is beautifully decorated and made us feel like we were in New Orleans.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: BEAUTIFUL HISTORIC HOTEL, very close to the French Quarter . I hightly recommend this hotel. Not a huge chain hotel, which i happy about. This hotel has a very french charming feel. I willl definitely return to this hotel.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed this hotel for a night after spending 4 nights at Hilton Prague. We actually liked this hotel better, though it is not that fancy but it is cozy and clean. Staff are very friendly, all smile. The location is very good, very close to the old town square which everybody comes to Prague will visit and you can go lots of other places from there. The breakfast was surprisingly good, lots of choices with baked stuff, cold cuts, vegetables, deserts, and coffee and tea. You really can stuff yourself and then just have dinner by the end of the day.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was lovely but breakfast was something to be look at as baked beans looked as if been there for about a year all dried and no sauce. Location was near to everything so good to walk around...
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is good, right in the enternce to the old city. Service was OK. The room was old dated but clean. very basic and I guess that next time we will look for something else. Breakfast is nice compare to Europe.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the best hotels I've ever went to and had an amazing time with my family. Will definitely recommend the awesome people that assisted me throughout my stay there. There were great recommendations and excellent room service all around. Will look forward in visiting again and trying the unique and interesting suites that they have.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent accommodations, staff, service, etc. Best overall experience in a hotel. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. There was always someone close by eager to help if you needed them. Clean, crisp and beautiful accommodations.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gorgeous lobby, lovely staff, beautiful bar, well appointed rooms. The pillows are incredible and the bed was like a cloud. We all wished we could just move in and stay forever! Best location! Away from the stench of Bourbon Street, but totally walkable. Take advantage of the streetcar that runs by the hotel. For $3, it gives you an amazing tour & a full day pass!
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found this hotel to be very good value for the price. Two things that made our stay great were the service (especially Karla at the front desk) and the fantastic complimentary breakfast (best I’ve had at a Best Western). On the fringe of the tourist area (10 minute walk to the main square) but close to the best mall and all transit. Rooms were adequate and comfortable.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. Far away from the noise, but close enough to walk to the action. Friendly staff, beautiful hotel & gorgeous rooms. Second time staying here and we we definitely return. Parking is expensive, but it is everywhere in N.O.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was stunning! We couldn’t have asked for a more beautiful place to stay! Truly beautiful architecture. The staff was very friendly and their was always refreshing cold water with fruit when you came back from a long day of sightseeing! We will be staying again!
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful location in the middle of it all (shops, restaurants). Easy walking distance of everything. Clean hotel, great breakfast, and staff was helpful. I would highly recommend staying here for your trip.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful hotel in a great location. The entire hotel staff was extremely pleasant, polite, and helpful. There were a great number of drinking and dining options near by and the walk to the French Quarter was very short. And on the morning that it was lightly raining we took a cab to the French Market. That cab ride was inexpensive as well.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is near the city center and well located. Also near the train station (you can walk for 10 minutes). Staff are niceWe had the breakfast include, but after the first day, we decided to have breakfast out of the hotel (nothing looked good...even the coffee)The room was spacious and clean. The wifi was ok and had a mini frig in our room. The hotel need a a complete refresh (there are carpet everywhere...and look old)On the day of the departure to the airport, the front desk suggest us a driver (fixed price in cash), the driver did not speach so well in English and was driving much too fast...I do not recommend their driver neither this hotel. For the same price, I am sure there are nicer hotel in Prague
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Remodel of a historic hotel is asthetically pleasing but design trumped usefulness. Bathroom is dangerous. Tile shower has no grab bars. When shampoo or soad hits floor and mixes with water the surface becomes dangerously slippery. Men must contort their leg to hold the toilet seat up when standing. Bathroom fan is useless. Upholstered room desk seat is not adjustable, no wheels and too low. Free room safe is nice. In room fridge nice too. Beds only have sheets and thick comforter. You are either too cold or too hot. Facility is clean and staff is friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my first review ever and I generally never give thought to writing one but in this situation I think it is justified. To make a long story short I ordered room service on three separate occasions, each time having to call multiple times to get someone to answers the phone and it progressively got worse until our final attempt our food never showed up and we were without breakfast for a tour we had that morning. This is such a frustrating issue because the food was great when it did show up but the total disregard for service ruined my experience with what could be such a fine hotel.Just to top it off I called and went down to the front desk asking to speak to a manager about my issues with no response.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything is very good : price, location, service, rooms, breakfast. It was a really nice stay. Beds are comfortable to sleep, room was clean , fast check in. Hotel is very close to everything. Very recommend this place. Anyway the hotel was full, because it has all you need.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great, traditional hotel. Clean, comfortable and friendly, with a decent breakfast. Excellent location, few minutes from Powder Tower and about 10 mins to the Old Square. We used the Beer Spa at the hotel. This was a great, unique experience. Wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again when, hopefully, we return to visit beautiful Prague.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a really nice time. Your hotel service was awesome. The host receptionist, Jessica, was amazingly helpful, professional and informative. She actually navigated me around the city perfectly, great customer service!!!
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautifully renovated building with very reasonable rates. The icing on the cake is the wonderful staff that will have my daughter and I returning when we are a kin the area.Thanks for the PBJ, super fun treat.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In Enjoyed my stay. I received wine for staying and the peanut butter and jelly hour was a nice touch of class to the overall experience. I would definitely stay at the Le Pavillon again. Staff were helpful and friendly as well.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is a gem. Great historic hotel in the CBD within easy walking distance from the quarter, yet not in the heart of the craziness. Perfect for our anniversary trip which happened to coincide with the really excellent and laid back French Quarter Festival. Loved our stay here!
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a gorgeous hotel. From the grand ceilings to the amazing chandeliers throughout the lobby, this hotel yells luxe & old charm. My room was just as lovely. Customer service was great as well. It's in great walking distance from the French Quarters. I love this hotel & will book this hotel again.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband chose this hotel, and I didn’t get a chance to read the reviews until after we had booked. I was concerned about the hot water issue and the size of the room after reading the reviews. Well, my concerns were for naught! This was an absolutely lovely hotel, and I would stay again. It was only a few blocks away from Canal Street and the French Quarter,so we had pleasant walks every day. The housekeeping staff was very good; they did miss my request for another container of shampoo one day, but made up for that the next day. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and pleasant. The PB&J tradition in the lobby was charming and very good. Breakfast at the hotel was just okay, but we were jaded after all of the excellent meals we’d already had. The outside of the hotel is very appealing, surrounded by boring office towers. The lobby is beautiful and elegant. We didn’t think the room was too small at all, or the bathroom. Certainly I’ve stayed in hotels with larger rooms, but we were perfectly satisfied. No problems at all with running out of hot water. I was really, really charmed by this hotel.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this place! Close to the French Quarter, great restaurants, and public transportation. Easy to get to all the top best live music venues. Roof top pool was way cool, and the staff were always cheerful and helpful.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room did not smell the freshest but it was clean. Not fancy for being over $300 per night. Inside and outside of the hotel is very fancy and beautiful. Heard couples arguing outside of room and still a bit of a walk to Bourbon St.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Outstanding old world service and attention to the details. Return to this hotel after a 20 year hiatus. Still hits all the right marks. We had been staying in several of Chain hotels in NOLA. It was great to back to this property
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We mainly booked it for the price, but the location is really great if your looking to hit up a lot of the attractions around NOLA. Walking out the front door you are about a five-minute walk to the French quarter, casino, and other attractions. The hotel itself was in great condition with a very decadent lobby and the rooms were all clean and came with everything needed for a long stay. Unfortunately we didn’t have time to use the rooftop pool but that area also seemed very nice.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rate seemed fare in comparison to other hotels, walking distance to French Quarters. Bed and pillows were not comfy. Allergies seemed to flare up in the room. Maybe they just need to change the air filters. Liked the nightly p and j snack hour.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Can’t ask for a better hotel. The location, ambiance, service, friendliness, late night snack and lobby cleanliness was all terrific. AlBee, the bellman, is a wonderful asset to the hotel. The rooms lite a bit dark, pool cold, and the queen beds aren’t for sharing with kids...a bit small.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is located within walking distance to most tourist attractions. The interior is very modern and inviting. The pool is slightly smaller than it appeared online. The lobby downstairs was very open and beautiful! Very clean throughout the hotel as well.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great time here. We changed from a rather sketchy hotel to this one at 2am and the staff was very accommodating. Informed us of how to book late, helped us to our rooms, informed us of the best place to park, and let us check out late at no charge when we lost out car. Great location and within walking distance of everything down town. Nice safe hotel.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was fantastic. Beautiful and clean. Great location the staff were amazing and friendly. We parked in the lot behind it as it was less than half the price of the valet. We will definitely be back.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this hotel! It’s my second time to stay here and I will return!PBJ and hit chocolate is fun every night at 10pm!Staff is great and we had dinner in the bar two nights. Food and service was wonderful!
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was very friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed our three-bed suite, which was pleasant, quiet, clean and welcoming. The beds were fine, neither too soft nor too hard, with a choice of pillows. I could imagine that a little more space both in the restaurant (full breakfast) and the bar could add to the place, but the food was fine.The location right in downtown Prague is fantastic! You can walk everywhere on foot.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for our friends 50th surprise, birthday, the hotel is in a great location, it’s very clean, the breakfast is ok, the staff are very friendly, it has a beer in the evenings, iit’s very good value for money we recommended a stay.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel great location close to everything especially main train station which is good for airport but staff very helpful beds good and breakfast good has good variety can't complain brilliant stay would definitely stay here again lovely hotel for lovely city ..
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel had a perfect location! If you walk 2 minutes you are at the powder tower and lots of shops and restaurants. Ten minutes to the old town square.Great breakfast!Room was clean and comfortable.A little noisy in the room next to us.Friendly and service minded staff!
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay for our first time in New Orleans. The hotel was beautiful, offered water, coffee, and even late night sandwiches-which we didn't have the chance to have. Would have liked the sandwiches to go a little later after being out on the town. Lucy in the restaurant was so sweet. The hotel was clean and smelled so fresh. Will definitely be back!
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Extraordinary management and hotel, I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone. I arrived Friday in a big group (150) and the checking in was very efficient. The hotel rooms are very detailed and beautiful, it really gives off that beautiful old victorian style. This hotel pays attention to the details and treats every customer like a King and Queen. I would rate this hotel 6 out of 5 stars
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I Would recommend this for anyone wanting an high quality stay in New Orleans. Location is great for night life, but still quiet and safe. They have an old tradition where they put out peanut butter and jelly’s from 10-11 pm. Rooftop pool.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights 20th Feb the room was nice and clean and the bathroom was great with nice big towels.Breakfast was plentiful and fresh with lots of chose and a great coffee machine. The reception staff were really helpful and spoke good English. This hotel is handy for all the sights and not far from the train station & Tram stops .
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights in a really large clean double room with a lovely new bathroom. There was plenty of choice at breakfast and very well serviced by the staff. We didn’t use the spa but the details looked great. The hotel is just by Powder gate and only a few walks to the square. Great value for money, I would highly recommend it.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Few blocks to Canal street, plenty of restaurants near by. Excellent for the price we paid for 5 nights stay. Location is great. Room was pretty big, with a closet. Comfy beds. Will definitely return whenever in New Orleans.
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: PB&J's in the lobby!!! Amazeballs!  Keyless entry, right on! Stand up shower was nice!!! Living room was so cool. Like a mini library! First thing I did was check if the books were real?! They sure are!
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are traveling to New Orleans, definitely book at Le Pavillon. Friendly staff, great rooms and is in walking distance of major attractions, i.e, Bourbon St, Canal St, Riverwalk and Harrah's Casino. Highly recommended
hotelName:
25    Best Western Plus Hotel Meteor Plaza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were obliging and helpful, but the room was tatty and the bed so uncomfortable I would have left if I was booked for more than the 2 nights. Thread bare sheets and the single quilt on double bed was not good
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Couldn't recommend this hotel enough. Excellent location, great value. The room had everything we needed and it was very nice. Staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was very very good also. We were very happy with our stay and it made our trip!
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I highly recommend the Clarion Hotel Pargue City. The hotel staff was highly accommodating in allowing us into our room early only having to wait a few minutes until they finished cleaning it. The room was clean and the air conditioning worked well despite it being almost 36 Celsius outside. Upon check out I had a conference call that was delayed and the hotel granted me a late checkout. From the time of check-in to the time of checkout the staff was extremely helpful. Filling out the comment card for a specific employee was difficult as there would have been a stack of comment cards.I cannot say enough nice things about the hotel and will be back on Monday because of the positive experience.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in the heart of the New Town section of the city near Wenceslas Square. Our room was small but very nicely appointed with a king size bed and modern furnishings. Breakfast provided a wide range of choices from eggs, meats, cheese, fruit pastries and delicious breads. Staff was helpful and friendly. We enjoyed our stay.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Price / quality is as expected from ratings. The location is good, various fast foods at walking distance, local market in the morning. Rooms are clean and the right size. A/C working well and very useful at this period. Would improve shower...and the replacement of shampoo/soap everyday.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Clarion hotel Prague City ( there are three Clarion hotels in Prague so you have to be specific) is very clean and well maintained. We had a superior double which was a good size. Decent bathroom with bath and overhead shower. The hairdryer, unfortunately, is a wall mounted one where you have to keep your hand on the switch which is a bit of a pain. If you want fast drying then I would suggest taking your own.Lighting in the room was very poor but perhaps that was made worse because our standard lamp didn’t work, I’m sure they would have sorted it out had we complained.Nice big bed ( 2 beds pushed together), bedding and towels changed every day. The maid was lovely.Kettle, tea bags and coffee in the room also a mini bar.The hotel doesn’t have a restaurant or a bar which is strange. Actually, that’s not quite correct........ there is a bar in a restaurant but the room is only open for breakfast. There is a room service menu but the food is delivered from a restaurant across the road.Breakfast is nice; bacon, scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, sausages, potatoes, porridge, fruits, cheeses, meat, various bread rolls and sliced bread ( to toast), hams and fruit. Fruit juices etcStaff on reception very nice and helpful as were all the staff at breakfast .Fantastic bakery/cafe, 2 nice restaurants ( Matilda’s was excellent both for the quality of the food and the friendly service) Macdonalds, KFC, salad bar, a mini supermarket and a Costa all within a stones throw of the hotel and plenty more restaurants/bars within the immediate surrounding area.You can walk to all the main sights easily from here or catch one of the trams from the corner of the road.Hotel facilities really warrant a 3 rating but because of the cleanliness, quality of breakfast and the lovely staff I gave it a 4.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights during Easter. Hotel is very clean and staff are friendly and helpful. Room was good size with large ddouble bed, tv, tea and coffee facilities and mini bar. Even an iron and ironing board, should you feel inclined to use them. Good sized bathroom with toiletries included. Breakfast was included and consistent of cereals, bread, pastries, cheeses, meats, fruits and a choice of got food. Tea, coffee and juices available too. Although no bar or evening restaurant, it was only a 10 minute walk to St Wenceslas Square where there is plenty of choice of restaurants. If you prefer fast food McDonald's and KFC are just a few steps away from the hotel!. Definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is quite normal for a business proposal is ok.The check-out was not friendly but check in was very nice.The breakfest is normal.nothing special.The elevator you can use only with the card but more people in the elevator only one can mark the floor hehehe
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is conveniently based in the small square within 10-15 minute walk from the main train station. I stayed on a 4th floor what made my stay even more silent as I haven´t heard no noise from outside.I liked the staircase leading all the way up to the 5th floor which gives the hotel kind of historical accent. The rooms are all modern with TV and a bath tub. The staff was very nice. During breakfast, I also liked a nicely prepared tea glasses with lemon, fresh mint and ginger that you only pour with hot water to make your tea which was delicious.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is great value for money. Very spacious, modern, clean rooms. The bathroom was great, spotless and recently refurbished. The staff is great, arranged in advance to get room decorated for Valentine’sDay. The minibar has really good prices, is actually very affordable. Would stay again when in Prague.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is well looked after and the room spacious, well appointed and the bathroom modern and impeccably clean. Breakfast was very good with lots of choice from fresh fruit, pastries and cooked breakfast. The staff were polite and professional and the hotel is very close to a wide range of choice of public transport (which is exceptionally easy to use).
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister took me for a birthday trip and we stayed here. It's not right in the centre but only a 10 minute walk from Wenceslas 'square' - which gave us a good walk every day, in addition the rest of our sightseeing. The rooms were ready early for us. The concierge was very helpful with directions. Breakfast was really good - something for everyone. The restaurant and reception staff were very helpful and very nice. All in all a fab stay.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is located on a fairly quiet neighborhood. There is a tree covered island in the middle of the street separating 2 one way sts. Altho a bit of traffic outside, inside the rooms were quiet. Hotel in the middle of the block where there are restaurants, small shops and an ice cream shop next door. Across the street another hotel where guests were being dropped off/picked up by tour buses. I much rather prefer the Clarion Hotel, less noise, less traffic through their small lobby. Desk clerks were busy but friendly, accommodating and helpful . Breakfast in the morning had plenty to offer and tasty. 2 of us sharing the room and we were quite comfortable, cozy is the word. Rooms/bathroom, carpet, tiles, walls was clean, spotless and fresh smelling; no distinct odors at all. We were only here one night and used cabs to get around. Two tips, be sure to take a hotel business card showing location of hotel, every cab driver we used were not familiar and 2) make sure you know which Clarion you are staying; there are 3 in Prague.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was such a surprise how comfortable and perfect it was to enjoy all Prague had to offer. The room was very spacious & comfortable, very clean. To start each morning with such an awesome breakfast would set the tone to go out and enjoy the sights. To access the city was just a short walk down the street and made it perfect if you just wanted to stop by and relax in between sightseeing.Also, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful! All and all just an enjoyable stay!
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed four nights at this property. Front desk staff were excellent, most spoke fluent English, all were very helpful. Rooms were clean, quiet, spacious, well appointed. Location is right on a small plaza where a farmers market operated everyday. Subway, tram and grocery stores all closely located.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Free full European breakfast is offered at this hotel. The room size and the 2 beds we have in the room are the typical European sized ones BUT the bathroom is big in that it has a full-sized and deep BATHTUB! The bathroom also has a speaker that’s connected to the tv so you won’t miss out on the news of the day whilst you’re in there. The location is also very convenient. Fast food is right outside the hotel and if you fancy a real restaurant then it’s just a few blocks away. There’s also a farmers market everyday in from if the hotel so you can enjoy some cheap local produce. The tram stop is right around the corner as well.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Would highly recommend for the cost. Really liked the area. The WIFI is really slow and inconsistent though. Great breakfast that we went to every morning. Also, go get a dessert at the adorable cafe next door!
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband booked us into the Clarion Hotel to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary, and it was an amazing experience. Super friendly Staff, clean rooms and a spread for breakfast that is fit for a King. Prague and the Clarion Hotel City definitely deserves a return visit from us.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 3 nights with my friends, we had a triple room. The room was good, beds and mattresses could be renewed as they felt old. The bathroom was good enough, towels were changed when requested.The staff was amazing, very friendly and helped us with the logistics of prague. The breakfast could use an upgrade as there wasn’t enough variety.Overall we spent an amazing time and would definitely come back again.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is modern and small enough that you get to know the friendly, efficient, helpful staff quickly. Breakfast buffet is great with an extremely wide range of offerings. Rooms are a good size and well appointed. Our room was largely insulated from the noise of the city. There are numerous cafes and well priced restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel. The hotel provides very easy access to the tram and metro system and is within comfortable (20 minutes) walking distance of Wenceslass square
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic Hotel & Wonderful CityMy wife and I had a Fantastic 5 day mini break in the City at the end of October early November last year to celebrate my wife's birthday and loved the Hotel & city so much we are going back in early December this year to take in the Christmas markets and have booked to stay in the Clarion again, great staff & management they even put a bottle of bubbly in our room complementary for my wife's birthday, we had a room overlooking the square at front of Hotel which was a great veiw to people watch with your coffee in morning going to ask for same room if possible in December.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for one night during a business trip. The price was ok. The room was very relatively spacy and the personnel helpful. But I was on the lowest floor so everybody could look in to the room from street which was not so nice.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There seems to be nothing to regret about choosing this place to stay in Prague. There is a tram stop just down the street (I. Pavlova); take the no. 22 that will bring you to the Infant Jesus of Prague and the Old Town. A DM grocery just to the right outside the lobby. Kentucky fried chicken and McDonald’s just a few steps away. Wenceslas square for shopping and dining a nice 10-minute walk. At the end of the square when you turn right at the corner you will see an Adidas store within a mall; this has the best currency exchange rate among all that I transacted with. About a block away you will also see the Nike store; here you can have tax refund instead of at the airport; remember though that you need at least a 2,500 Ckc purchase before you can vail of it. The refund will also be Ckc. Back to Clarion hotel, check-in is a breeze, wi-fi is complimentary, and the room comfortable with wall-to-wall carpet, an oversized tub, mini bar, safe, ironing board, eletric kettle and a double twin bed converted to one. TV has 3 English channels (Russia Today, BBC, and an info guide). At least during our stay, they were showing the football world cup games live. There is even a Handy mobile device for roaming calls and map directions should you need one. A desktop computer in the lobby also is helpful. Breakfast fare is basic but the sausages really stand out. The staff are also really helpful, especially with directions; I suggest before you go out, get as much information as you can as it is extremely difficult communicating with the locals in the street as most will shy away with the slightest hint of English. The 200+ euro per night price tag might be a bit steep but with all the pluses, it’s difficult to complain.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I wasn’t fully satisfied and even disappointed. The room was okay, but the blanket is like for kids, pillow is super thin, strange A/C system. Moreover, I was charged for a mini bar when I came back home!! I didn’t use it at all. The hotel personnel didn’t tell me anything during the check out. It appeared they hadn’t checked the room properly before I moved in. Finally, the hotel returned the money they charged after few emails.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good size room ,plenty of space for two people.tea and coffee and kettle provided a couple more tea bags would be nice.Good housekeeping everything clean. Buffet breakfast everything fresh, Assorted breads and pastries,cereal cold meats, cheese and a selection of hot food. Not as central as I thought but not to far from most of the sights. Public transport very good can get around the city easily.Only one suggestion to make staff on reception when checking in could be more welcoming, a smile is a nice way to welcome someone.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed with my husband for 3 days at this hotel on our trip. I really like the location of this hotel. Right across from it there's a small farmers market daily. The tram and the Metro is right around the corner which is really convenient to get into the city centre. And the breakfast was nice. They had a very good restaurant setting and plenty of selection. The service was professional and friendly. The reception was helpful anytime we had questions. It really helps when everyone is speaking English. The reason for one star less is the bedding. They didn't have one double bed so they had push two single beds next to each other. So it still felt like sleeping in two separate beds. My husband is 6'2" and the comforter on each bed was really small. We did ask for a larger one but they told us that it was not available. The bed was soft but the pillows were the worst. They were so soft. Again this is a preference when we do prefer little firmer bed and pillow. The rooms were clean. It had all the amenities needed and included a safe as well. One weird thing was the soap. Although we would open it up and use it in the shower and in the sink they would not replace the daily. Maybe it was just an oversight. Overall we were very happy with our stay and especially the location of the hotel
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel in Prague with easy access to the centre and main attractions either by foot or by use of the metro/tram systems. Breakfast was nice and the rooms very clean and comfortable.The service was staff was great and the price very cheap! I would certainly come back and recommend a stay here.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My Girlfriend and I came over from Belfast for a nice Easter City break. This hotel was just fantastic to stay in. It is right in the heart of Prague with everything all around you at walking distance. The staff that work in here are brilliant, very polite and very professional at their jobs. They will help you with booking taxis if you need them, they will also help you by booking your trips that you wish to go on, giving you that peace of mind about weather or not it’s booked. The food is lovely, well layed out. The service from the staff regarding food is brilliant, they always make you feel welcome and always there topping food and drink up. The rooms are amazing, so so clean and very good open space. I really can’t fault the rooms. They are always cleaned, everyday and you always come back to the room how you found it on the day you checked in. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone wishing to stay here. They are very good for catering for people from all over the world and speaking different languages. There is a mini bar in the room, which is handy for the end of the night to have a drink after exploring the wonders Prague have to offer!This hotel in my eyes is 5*, very very clean, professional, and helpful. I will definitely be back here on my next trip to Prague. Thank you for a lovely stay.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights and it was an ideal hotel for a good price. The staff were professional and helpful. The rooms were quite big for a city hotel, very clean and had all the amenities you could need. In our room there was a smart phone you could use for free for sightseeing and planning your day, which we had never seen before and thought was a great idea! It was not too far from all the main tourist spots- we used public transport for the three days, with stops close to the hotel. The breakfast had plenty of choice and the cakes and pastries were especially good. Also a long breakfast period between 6:30am and 10am which was helpful as we had an early flight on the day we left. I would also recommend the Matylda restaurant next door for traditional Czech food.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good and clean near bus station but not very large room and good breakfast. I asked from reservation for late check out and he said no problem but day charge me for checking out late.Why he didn't say before
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I liked this hotel. We received a very pleasant welcome and the staff were always very nice to us. They asked us where we were from and tried to talk to us in our native language. They even changed us a couple of dollars to take the subway because we hadn't had the chance to visit an exchange house. There's a subway station in the very corner of the hotel. The rooms were nice and comfortable. Definitely recommend it if you want to visit Prague but be able to sleep well, without all the noise and bustle of the city center. By train, it takes about 12 minutes to be in downtown Prague. Finally, breakfast was wonderful! 9 out of 10.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic location,very clean but the staff are miserable borderline rude...The hotel had no atmosphere what so ever..Not once in our 3 night stay did any member of staff smile,let alone speak to us... avoid breakfast at all costs,food is ok but waiting staff are miserable and could quite easily turn the milk sour...
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived in the late evening greeted by the friendly receptionist by name, which is a nice touch even though we've never been here before! A swift guided tour of the city via a free map and we're off to our spacious, well equipped room! Safety box, iron and ironing board, kettle, plenty of storage and coat hangers, fully stocked mini bar that was cheaper than I expected, there was a hair dryer in the bathroom too. Two big windows give a view of a bustling city, just visible are the tops of the twin spires of St. Ludmila Church which is a pretty good landmark to use when getting your bearings as you can see it from the river! The breakfast isn't bad, standard stuff really, but lots of choice, hot food, cold meat and cheeses, fruit and vegetables, different breads, croissants, pain aux chocolat etc... lots of choice of juice, flavoured water, tea and coffee etc... The hotel is situated in a busy but not so touristy part of Prague, there are several restaurants, bars and shops in the area. Lots of variety for food and drink, if your a fast food fan your sorted, if you like fine dining that box is also ticked, but there's pretty much everything you'd want right on your doorstep. If your in doubt ask at reception, they'll tell you all you need to know! There is a metro station 2 minutes walk from the hotel which will whisk you off to all corners of prague, buy a 3 day ticket and you can use it on all the public transport so you won't have to worry about sight seeing. Wenceslas square is one stop away on the metro or 10-15 minutes walk away. In summary this a great hotel, friendly, good location with plenty to see and do in the local area!
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Whether youre staying a single night or a week in Prague, I highly recommend this hotel to stay. The price is way bellow what they deserve. Beautiful cleaned up rooms and a very professional service. Ideal location - 2 minutes of walk from metro/tram, 10 minutes of walk from the very centre of the city. Cant be any more satisfied. Whatever you ask for is done in just seconds and with a smile.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would recommend this hotel to everyone! As soon as we arrived we were impressed by how friendly and helpful the staff were. We were very impressed with the room too, warm, comfortable and plenty of room.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is situated in a beautiful place that it is very close to metro and tram stations. Old Town is very close. You don't need to use transportation. You can find all world's famous dishes near the hotel. Hotel staff are very kind and they always simile when you talk to them. Breakfast is continental. You don't need to go anywhere.It is our last day in Prag. I will always recommend my friends to stay in this hotel. And if I come Prag again, I'll be here. Thanks Clarion Hotel for everything.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location was fine for exploring the city. We had booked for 4 nights but to be honest, 3 were more than enough to see the sights and so we headed home a day early. Breakfast was nice enough and plenty to chose from. We asked reception for some help one day regards to taxi prices and ended up being interrupted due to Police that were in the reception speaking with the Hotel Manageress about whatever. The room was clean and bathroom very nice. It was lovely and quiet so we managed to rest well after walking our feet off on all 3 days. Perhaps the staff just do not have any English? Prague in general were much the same. We missed the usual interaction we have wherever we go with the locals. Overall made the place grey, cold and uninviting. Anyway, glad we went and had a good explore but won't be rushing back.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is in good location, near downtown. Interior is modern, nothing fancy. Rooms are clean, for business traveler more then enough, for family i wouldnt recommend. I am definetlly going to stay here again.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What an amazing hotel! Everyone is so helpful and friendly. Forgot our adapter and they had one which they lent us. Wanted to change rooms as we were in the attic space, hence velux windows and we wanted a window to look out of, nothing was too much trouble and as soon as a room became available we moved. Definitely recommend staying here!
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights after booking a last minute trip to Prague. Have been rather impressed with our stay. Helpful staff. (Martin @ reception). Rooms are exactly as pictured, clean and functional as well as quiet. Breakfast is pleasant and tasty. Great location as right next to tram and metro. All in all lovely stay thanks to this hotel. Will be back when visiting Prague again.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel clarion is a delightful hotel from the moment you check in the reception staff are very helpful as we arrived late evening they informed us which restaurants were open and showed us there location. Only booked for B&B food choice very good and plentiful. The room was lovely and clean with minibar which we did not use .location of hotel was less than ten minutes walk from the centure of Prague. Would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
