review_body: We have just had a 4 night stay at the clarion, very nice hotel everyone friendly, room warm and very quiet, the carpet on the landings is a very good idea, maybe the bar could have stayed open a little longer on an evening but we found some very good bars within minutes of the hotel, once again nice hotel with good staff
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a nice Clarion hotel. Situated on the edge of the city center you can just walk straight into town. The rooms are nice and specious, its clean and a big classy but not too much. Breakfast is good and in the neighborhood there are plenty of restaurants to go to for dinner.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for 4 nights and enjoyed my time. The room was classy and clean, breakfast tasty with great selection of food, internet fast, hotel quiet, the area is fabulous. I especially loves the surroundings. Staff kind. Pokoj byl pekny a cisty, hotel klidny. Snidane byla vyborna s velkym vyberem pokrmu. Rychly internet, mily personal. Okoli hotelu je obzvlast hezke.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very very convenient. The location is great, just a little walk away from the city attractions and still far enough so the area is quiet, friendly. Around the hotel you will find both local and chain coffeehouses (including Starbucks of course!), a supermarket and many nice restaurants. There even is a tiny farmers market nearby in which they bring fresh fruits from nearby.Breakfast in the hotel is good and offers a variety of options.The staff is friendly and the rooms are nice, clean and modern.I would definitely return and recommend it !
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a weekend. The location is OK and it helps to have a metro stop right around the corner. The rooms are both clean and decent in size, and there is minimal to no noise from the street outside. The breakfast was also good.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay at Clarion Hotel was very pleasant. The location is excellent, just behind the wonderful Convent of St Agnes and within walking distance from the main attractions; the staff are friendly and helpful; the breakfast buffet is absolutely superb. Recommended!
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel in a great location, very nice stuff, nice breackfast and the room was great. With a nice big window to the trees and cafe, kfc and mcdonalds near, and farmecy. The hotel is super clean loved it!!!!!
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel 2 nights, bussiness trip. Hotel has a good location, close to metro IP Pavlova. By walk to the city 10 minutes. Around very nice calm garden restaurants with great czech beer and cheap food.Hotel was very clean, large room for one. Very poor was servise at reception. Young girl wasn´t very friendly, zero help, no information about lift, breakfast, made mistake on my room card, issue of invoice was a job for 20 minutes...no smile, no greeting, no wish of good stay. Really poor.Breakfast was very sufficient, great offer of sweet cakes. Good coffee. Large choice of everything. Breakfast super!! Staff there too!Wi-fi was quick and without any problem with connection.I like that hotel, only negatives was this receptionist, which didn´t let you to feel as wel comed guest. Thank you!
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A clean and modern hotel, staff pleasant and helpful, room for 2 was small but a great use of space with lots of clothes hanging space, beds comfortable and a very good air conditioning system in the room. Breakfast was very good although only a small selection of fruit. The main disadvantage of the hotel is that it's reception area is very small, cramped in fact. It also has a bar but this was closed for the 4 nights we were there so to get a drink we had to find a bar elsewhere. I think the bar only opens for business when the hotel has a function. The hotel location is a bit out from the city centre, although the underground is only a short walk from the hotel. A plus is that the hotel has good free wifi. Would I stay there again ? No, it is too far out from the centre of Prague.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was on a business trip and we (business partners and me) choose this hotel with a purpose – placed in the city centre, tramp station near hotel on the main street, also walking distance from the river and old part of the town. Hotel has quite suitable prices, so our decision was good. Services in the hotel are good; breakfast offers enough choices of food for everybody.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There was really no space to put a second suitcase to unpack except the desk, but this was the only negative. Breakfast was excellent, staff was friendly and helpful, only a 10 minute walk to main plaza.
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for our first trip to Prague and could not have been any more impressed with the service received. The hotel is very smart and the rooms are very reasonably sized. I must say we were impressed with the mini bar too ;)Breakfast was good every day, you'd need to be very fussy to not find anything that you like.Well located, with tram stops just around the corner, and the reception staff are always happy to direct you anywhere that you would like to go. Will definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After a long journey we finally arrived at the Clarion where we wanted to check in. Unfortunately the Clarion Prague City accepts only guests with Passports even we had a international approved Military ID which is fully legal to travel within Europe. After the comment that maybe the police comes and we might get in trouble we decided not to check in this Hotel. The NH did welcome us without problems and a free drink for a better price. Been treated like a criminal was an experience I never had before and hope that will never happen again. For sure Clarion lost a customer
hotelName:
26    Clarion Hotel Prague City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for some nights to discover Prag. The hotel is close by the Wencleass Place so the old city area is in walking distance. The fotos I saw make me believe that it is a stylish hotel. I could see that those room exists we do had one of other ones.It was not stylish but clean and big enough. But since it had small windows and dark brown furnitures it looked more than a cave. I believe that the hotel was just in the upper floors of this building so instead having a fitness room they had stairs. But to be fair there was also an elevator. So the location is execellent for tourists. It is in walking distance to the main station and to the must-see places in this nice town.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wenceslas Square Hotel is conveniently located close to the train station and just outside the tourist-crammed old town, perfect for our stay. The hotel has some old world charm to it and rooms are nice and clean and well air-conditioned. The shower was placed under a slanted roof with a handheld shower head, making showering a bit awkward when trying to avoid splashing water all over the wooden floor.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked at the last minute as the hotel we were booked into was terrible. Lovely welcome from the lady on reception. Room was right at the top in the attic space but was lovely, unfortunately the lift was broke during our stay and it was a long way up, otherwise I would have rated it 5. Superb location and something for everyone at breakfast, we will definately be returning!
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there for 2 nights in a big room on the 5th floor. There is a wall in the room, separating the two single beds from the big bed in the other room. There is even a small "lounge" area, up 3-4 steps and there there were 2 chairs, 2 windows to see the awesome view and a mini bar, perfect to sit there and relax. Two big closets in our room too. 2 more windows, high up. And an aircon !!!
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My initial impression of this hotel was quite good. When we arrived it was mid morning but check in wasn't until 2pm which wasn't a big deal. We didn't really have a problem waiting till then and decided to go for a wander around the area. The reception staff apologised and said they would try to get our room ready as soon as possible but as they said it was 2pm before we got in. There was two of us and we were given a room that slept 8 people. There was no air conditioning in the room but there was a fan which didn't really help too much in the heat of mid June when the temperature was up at 34°c. There was a fridge in the room for the mini bar but as always you have to pay for what you use. My friend and I emptied the bar so we could put our own juice and water in as we preferred fruit juice and still water as opposed to Sparling and fizzy. As our flight to go home was really early and we knew we wouldn't be up for the trek on the metro, tram and bus back to the airport we opted to pay for a taxi which we booked with the hotel for the price of 670 krowns. Now I know for a fact that the staff member I spoke to write down the correct time I asked her to book it for as I said it atleast four times and I watched her write it down but on the day we left the taxi arrived half and hour early and the staff member that day insisted that it was booked for 6.15 instead of 6.45 and because we weren't ready the taxi had to wait for us and we were then charged another 130 krowns for the wait. We queried this and we're told it was cause the taxi had to wait. It was obvious the hotel and taxi company were in cahoots and like i said the hotel shafted us. So if you stay in this hotel I wouldn't recommend booking taxis with the hotel unless you wait until you check out and ask them to phone for one then. Now I know it wasn't alot of money to pay extra but what if we hadn't had any money left to pay the wait fee? I am not happy with this and I hope others will see this review and take note.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was third time that I've been here - and if I go to Prague next time, I will choose this hotel again. Everything was fine, I can't tell anything wrong - neither if I want to. I gladly recommend the deluxe rooms, it has beautiful panorama to the city and there's some surprise from the staff. I absolutely enjoyed my stay there.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in Prague for 3 days, from our visit to Bavaria. Prague is beautiful. When we checked in the Manger shared that the only elevator was out of commission due to 12 people attempting to ride the night prior. Our room was on the 5th floor & nothing available closer to 1! 5 flights of stairs with suitcase & tote bag & none of us are "spring chickens" was too much. There was no offer of assistance with luggage due to elevator being out. ALso, we asked about the hop on hop off tour & manager again said oh I have a much better tour - it's the best in the city. IT's 6 hours & I reiterated that I didn't want to walk for 6 hours & he said oh no - the car actually picks you up at the hotel & takes you to the bus. That part was true & then we walked for 6 hours - well 5 since we stopped at hour 4.5 for 45 min lunch & we bailed not up for walking another hour immediately following heavy meal. Also, no fan - we had window open but some party animals made it difficult to sleep.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is quirky and quite old-fashioned but it is very clean and the staff were excellent and really helpful. The breakfast was also very good. The location is ideal for walking to all the main city sites and the nearest Metro station is only 5 minutes' walk.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights in May half term for a short but packed visit to Prague. The hotel is in an ideal place to explore the whole city and nowhere is far to walk. The staff were lovely, the room was comfortable and very stylish and all very clean. We loved it and would definitely recommend it.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is close to a metro link or a 20 minute walk from main square. Pleasant staff speak very good English. Room basic but very clean and reasonable size. Roof terrace has fantastic views across the city. No restaurant but plenty of near by eating places. Located very near to main railway station.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel at a convenient location provide a good room service and nice breakfast. Staffs will tidy up the staying room every day. Also, the quality of breakfast is good with acceptable price. The receptionists are helpful and willing to help you. Next time, if i stay in Prague, i still consider to stay in the same hotel.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Private rooftop where we had a stunning view over the Castle and Charles bridge.One of our friends had her birthday and we got a birthday card and abottle of wine to our room.friendly service!Thank you ver ymuch for the great time, we are definetly coming back.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The street front rooms are very noisy. The beds are comfortable, the breakfast is lavish and delicious. The staff is kind. Very close to the railway station and the city center as well. I recommend the hotel but stay away from the street side rooms.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The guy at the reception with short dark hair was superbly helpful. He went the extra miles for us and we are in our 50's and the place was right in the center of town and yet on a quieter side. Breakfast was tasty.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 5 days and had an amazing time, our room was cozy and the staff were really kind and helpful. There’s a café on the rooftop with great views and the lady who works there was so nice. There are a lot of stairs to get to some of the rooms on the 4th/5th but they also have great views, so it was worth it for us. If you need a more accessible room, a room on a lower floor would be better. The restaurant is also really good, the gnocchi was amazing. I’ll definitely stay here again next time I’m in Prague.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wauuu there are not enough stars to rate them. Perfect location, staff...7 stars hotel doesn't have people like them,knowledge, smile, willing to help with everything anticipating anything that you might need, that attention to detail. My words will never be enough for what they offered. From the receptionist that made my parking easier than at my house, the guy that helped with the luggage to the beautiful smile room steward.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great time in Prague staying at this well-positioned and appointed hotel. The location is excellent for Wenceslas and Old Town Squares with plenty of fantastic places to explore from your doorstep. The room was clean and beds comfortable, we were on the top floor which meant that we had quiet nights sleep. There was no tea and coffee making facilities but the minibar was well stocked. The breakfast was excellent with a wide variety of buffet options to suit all tastes. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly,offering lots of local insight and advice. As mentioned in the title, it was my birthday during our stay and I was very pleased to find a bottle of wine and a birthday note in the room when we arrived back. A very thoughtful gesture indeed. Great base for exploring this picturesque and fascinating city; highly recommended.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel and the location was ok being at the top of Wenceslas square but unfortunately it was on a very busy road. We tried breakfast once but it wasn’t for us so we went elsewhere there were many other places close by to do this. The room top bar was non existent and no body was there when we went up. The rooms are cheap ish but none of us will unfortunately return as we would rather go somewhere else and pay more. I wouldn’t go in the front downstairs room number 8 friend ms did for one night and got no sleep due to the road, noisy people and the door being heavy and slamming. We were opposite in room 9 which really it was the door and staff being inconsiderate in the morning which was annoying for us, one time being 630am in a Sunday morning. The issues with these 2 rooms is its where the downstairs toilet is along with either a staff room or cleaning room, not great. Somebody called Daniel was very kind and moved my friends in room 8 in the end but with little help from other staff we had tried to talk to and then call/email while we were out during the day. I would have really liked a coffee/tea making stuff in the room.this is the first time without snd it will be the last.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here as a family of 5 we had 2 rooms which were lovely big and clean. And was on top floor great for getting to roof top cafe the view is just breathtaking we were lucky to have 3 days of good weather. The staff are so friendly and helpful helped us out a lot booking trips. Breakfast had a great choice to choose from only thing room not very big so need to watch times u go if a big group. Very close to main square for getting everywhere. Also had a nice sitting area out the back. Would deffo use again.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great location for exploring Prague, and close to all the local amenities.Staff were friendly and helpful.Room was small and a bit cramped, bed was very small. Our room faced the main road and add such there was a lot of road noise, which resulted in is not having much sleep. We also had a waste water pump in the bathroom which constantly made noises.As some other reviews note, the photos on the website could be a little misleading.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location. Wi-fi was weak and super slow.The room was clean. TV had channels in multiple languages. Quick check in and out. Nice new bathroom. No A/C. Toiletries are provided. Staff were friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good service, centrally located, roof top terrace with view of Prague and a tasty breakfast buffe. Staff was welcoming. The room was cozy with a big bed. Located at the upper Wencelas square one has walking distance to all cultural establishments and a big offer of pubs and restaurants.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great small hotel. Stuff very helpful and friendly.Nice breakfast, a little bit pricey.But it’s your choice to get it or not. We got it, after got “fuel “,we could explore this fabulous city long time. Very good location. Close to everything:famous tourist places, stores,restaurants, bars and c.t.r.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived late at night but check in was easy & fast. I stayed in a attic room which was quiet, cosy & very comfortable. Booking direct with the hotel gives will give you the bonus of a later check out .
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights and found it to be a great little hotel, close to most things and was nice coming out and seeing the museum on your doorstep. Down side to the room was no tea facilities and only had a bath with a hand held shower head so was hard to have a quick wash. Great little bar if you go right out of the hotel then first right and it'll be on your right. Enjoyed Prague but more than likely won't go back plus it isn't as cheap as everyone makes out unless you go out of the city which you won't probably do.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay in a spacious room with heater. Room clean and tidy.Great location close to all Prague´s landmarks.Reasonable price for a stay.Perfect breakfast to start your day, surprisingly very great coffee.Would come back, maybe next year ;)
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely stay at The Wenceslas Hotel. The room was lovely and warm with the heater on (although couldn’t sleep under the skylight window as was a little crafty). The receptionists we’re incredibly helpful and friendly. The hotel is a walk a away from all the sights we didn’t have to get a taxi once (other than to and from the airport). I would definitely stay here again, would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel room very spacious , our room had 4 double beds and a cot . Not too bad for 2 adults and one child . Slightly dated but kept clean by the maid , shower a bit small but bathroom cleanliness was ok . We didn't include breakfast in our package as there are loads of coffee and sandwich bars on Wenceslas Square. Hotel was fine hadn't much interaction with staff as we left early in the morning and returned late in the evening . Lift was slow which was a pain but really no other issues
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel in the centre of Prague next to all the amenities including the Metro.Great rooms and Breakfast with helpful staff.You are only minitues away from the Museums and nite life of the city.Recomend to all
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this hotel last weekend and it was lovely - rooms were spacious, warm and clean. Good powerful showers too! The WiFi was fast and staff were helpful. The hotel is a minute walk from Wenceslas Square so is very convenient and central! The roof top cafe has great views of the city too Would definitely stay here again :)
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Simple, unassuming atmosphere. Clean bathroom, firm beds, and spacious bedroom. Very central, right by Muzeum metro station and Wenceslas Square, which means most of the city centre can be traversed by walking from the hotel.The good:-Clean-Simple (no unnecessary amenities)-Central-Comfortable beds-Cheap-Breakfast not included (so you may choose)-Proper hot water in the shower-AC outlet in the bathroom and a generous amount in the roomThe bad:-Certain rooms only have ceiling windows (mine did, could not see out of it)-Thin white curtain to block daylight. Not very effective.-Traffic noise from nearby street (sirens especially)-Thin walls – other guests coming & going and talking can be heard-No bath, very simple shower without shower hose-Fluorescent lighting only – effective illumination but not cosy-HOT. Floor heating is nice, but room temperatures were close to 30°C (86°F) when I checked in and it took a long time before it dropped to the mid-20's after I turned all the way down. Toasty.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A long Spanding road , visual and broad accessible with trams and hotels either side lists of choice eateries , bars , casinos. , seating areas with quotes from various figures in history, and explainations with the Czech history with the Germany war and bombing of it . Enjoying the atmosphere and views of the square could watch the word go by
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great stay here! Great location and lovely staff! Right off the main square and really convenient for everywhere central!Rooms are spacious and comfortable and will definitely come back and stay here next time I'm in Prague!
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were blown away by the room we were allocated, it was amazing for the price and allowed us breathtaking views of the city. Staff we so friendly and helpful and went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and comfortable as well as recommending places to visit and eat. We would definitely come back and recommend this place to any others planning a trip.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We decided to drive to Prague from Hungary on a whim but realized that finding parking in the city was going to be difficult. After going from hotel to hotel, someone recommended this one and it’s a good thing that they did. They had rooms at a great rate along with different options for parking. The garage was full but they had a virtual parking option that allowed us to leave our car on the street overnight within the blue lines for a small fee. We also purchased the breakfast option which allowed us to get a quicker start to the day because we did not have to go searching for breakfast. The room was a good size and the beds were very comfortable. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. The location of the hotel was also very nice as it was walking distance from food and public transit. I would recommend this hotel whether you are driving to the city or not.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this hotel was fantastic! It is right across the street from the Prague National Museum and very close to the nearest metro. There were lots of cafes, restaurants, bars, shopping, etc... that was within close walking distance of the hotel. Our room was good, clean, but very basic. The beds were comfortable, but the pillows were pretty flat (we made it work and didn't want to make it an issue). The towels were sometimes changed out but not always. At least one day, 2 of our 4 towels were taken away but not replaced with new ones. The 2 that were left were still damp. Since there wasn't a phone in the room, we had to go down to the lobby to request towels...a minor inconvenience. The staff were friendly and helpful. I would stay here again because of the great location!
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Superb location for tram and all amenities, Breakfast had everything including a superb coffee machine. The rooms were clean and comfortable! Very pleasant and helpful staff. The lift within the hotel was excellent, as well as having someone to help us bring our luggage to our room! Fantastic holiday!
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good value for money. Basic and clean. Good for families as location is amazing. Basic wifi (not enough for surfing ). Our bathroom and shower were separated , very retro for North American tourists. Not at all luxurious but perfect after a day of sight seeing
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel overall was good. It was top season so we were offered a room with a backyard view and we couldnt change it but it was fully booked. Breakfast was more or less the same everyday. What is really missing is the lobby, it is an old building with a lot of stairs but there is no lobby where you can stay except magnificent roof cafe but to reach it you should take 2 flights of stairs .
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice, clean room.The only thing is that the window did not close completely.Pleased with a variety of breakfasts.The big downside was only that the room had to go up to the third floor in the evening tired, it was difficult.But the location of the hotel made up for everything)
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Breathtaking views room outstanding cleanliness outstanding so spacious service excellentbreakfast excellent location went to visit christmas markets just like a fairy tale couldnt ask for anything more
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found this hotel very convenient for walking to the major sites in Prague; it is kept clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was nice and unhurried with a good choice that was kept topped up by efficient waitresses. We would have liked to have had a room that had a proper window rather than a skylight and to have had a little more control over the level of heating but, on balance, we felt the hotel fulfilled our needs and was reasonably priced. We had a lovely stay in Prague; December is a magical time there with the Christmas markets and concerts along with festive feel in the restaurants.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This little Gem is just off the top off Wenceslas Square by the National Museum. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable and eager to help. The breakfast can only be described as plentiful and varied. There's a superb rooftop terrace with spectacular views over the city and a cute little bar to accompany it. The room was practically an apartment. With lounge, shower and toilet, the bedroom upstairs. My only comment was that the bed was a little hard. Coming back to a freshened up room every day, was certainly a plus. Give it a try if you are looking for accommodation in Prague
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel in fantastic location walking distance to all tourist attractions. Hotel staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast was amazing. Rooms were clean and very comfortable. We had a great view of the castle!! Great shopping would definitely recommend this hotel and Prague for a short break!!!! Would definitely go back!!!!
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel nice staff anything was great close to all main areas ps only gripe is no kettle in room but everything was good breakfast was great easy check in no prob with transfer nice place to stay
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located at the Museum end of the square the hotel is handily placed for the area . Hotel itself was nice and the room myself and two others shared was huge . Breakfast which was included in rate was very good .Only thing preventing a higher rating was an unfortunate incident with our shower blocking and flooding the bathroom the reaction time to which was very poor .Notwithstanding this incident would recommend the hotel .
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a lovely stay at this well kept, friendly, comfortable hotel. Hotel staff were all very helpful,ordered taxis and booked restaurants for us when needed.Our room was quite small but had everything we needed, spotlessly clean and very comfortable beds. The roof terrace is worth visiting as it has spectacular views and reasonably priced refreshments.Also we enjoyed a really well prepared breakfast each morning, would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Traditional hotel with beautiful spiral staircase, rooms are very clean. Breakfast has plenty of choice, the staff are very efficient and helpful . Perfect location for the exploration of the city of Prague would definitely recommend staying at this establishment. Great views from the roof top cafe
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all, i want to compliment reception staff. They are always ready to solve your problems or help with room service. Also i want to note hotel breakfast, it was unexpectedly full of dishes.It was amazing panaramic view to Praha centre (Petřín Lookout Tower and St. Vitus Cathedral).I definitely will stay in this hotel next time.From Russia with love :)
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have had a wonderful time at wenceslas square hotel. Friendly staff. Ideally situated to see all of Prague. Rooms clean and tidy. On the top of the hotel there is a wonderful cafe /bar allowing a great view of the city.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful hotel located opposite the National Museum at the end of Wenceslas Square, handy for metro and trams. If you can, ask for room 065 … it has a balcony (shared with next door room) that has views over the city you would pay a lot for. An amazing place to watch the sun go down over Prague's landmarks
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in this hotel for three weeks as part of a business trip for work. I can't speak highly enough of every member of staff who I encountered - especially the lady on breakfast duty who came to recognise me every morning. It's a nice friendly touch especially because some members of staff on breakfast duty didn't seem to be morning people.The breakfast buffet itself is superb and well worth the (very affordable) price. There's everything you could possibly want for breakfast, although at times the toaster wasn't working. There were even homemade cakes available, a couple of which were so divine I went back for more. It definitely helps to set you up for the day with a wide range of vegetarian options instead of the meatier ones available. There were salads, cooked and cold meats, eggs, breads and toast with a whole load of toppings, pancakes on weekends, fresh fruit, a massive range of hot drinks, as well as homemade cold drinks like the ginger lemonade or just ice water. The location of this hotel just can't be beaten as Wenceslas Square and the Metro are within two minutes walk away! Once the new museum nearby has finished renovations (could be soon I think) it will be even better for tourists I think. If you don't know your way around Prague the front-desk reception provide a map and talk you through some of the must-see attractions, which was a really nice gesture. Prague is very easy to navigate and everywhere is accessible by foot, with some gorgeous architecture to admire as you make your way to your chosen destination.The slight hang-up of my stay was that I was on the very top floor. There is a lift that takes you to floor five but there were two flights of steps to go up - luckily I'm not too unfit but after three weeks of going up and down those stairs I was definitely made fitter haha It wasn't a big issue for me and it's admirable the hotel owners made the most of the space :) The views over the city especially during the morning and evening were really quite something - as you come out of the lift and look through the window on the right I was always taken aback by the beauty, so being so high up had its benefits.I was recommended to visit the rooftop bar but never quite managed to go, sadly! Next time I come to Prague I would consider this hotel and will make sure to go up there. If you're considering this hotel definitely book it.Thank you to the staff who made my stay so welcomed.
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location perfect, Hotel services perfect, Room clean BUT noisy caused by airco AND the street; no real noise insulation, no straight sunlight and view from room roofwindow.Neigbour Czech restaurant was very good!
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a location, 20 yards from the Wenceslas statue at the top of the Square. Warm greeting on arrival and lovely clean room, we were at the front of the hotel which suffers from road noise and we were in the attic so we only had a dormer window but when you go to the rooftop bar it is amazing, with the whole of Prague laid out before you. The rooms aren't enormous but nor are they tiny so they were great for a base of operations complete with TV, air conditioner and writing desk, which was a Skoda sewing machine!!! but no kettle in the room. The breakfast was good with porridge, eggs, cold meats, cheese and breads and lots of cakes??? Tea is available in the breakfast room to wash your cakes down and any other breakfast you may choose. The hotel had lots of interesting articles dotted about, typewriters, artwork etc. The restaurant was lovely with a great range of local and international foods and at a great price with great local beer to wash it all down.All in it was a great hotel which I will use again when I next visit and I will look for others in the group
hotelName:
27    Wenceslas Square Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Julian is located a 15/20 min walk away from Charles Bridge. For us the location was perfect. A nice quiet area, away from the crowds with a very pleasant walk to the main attractions. The rooms were very clean and comfortable as was the entire hotel. The roof terrace is very pleasant affording a view of the Cathedral which looks spectacular at night. Breakfast was excellent and the wonderful staff working in the breakfast room kept the place immaculate. The food was good, with options for a hot meal, cereal or delicious fresh breads and pastries. There were several fresh juice options and a variety of teas and coffee. The reception staff were all extremely friendly and helpful advising us on local transport routes. Our only niggle was the restaurant area- we arrived in the evening and the restaurant seemed very short staffed with the man on duty seeming quite stressed about managing the bar and the restaurant. (He also has to deal with lots of requests for ice as the machine was broken) We did manage to have a meal there but felt it was difficult for him to arrange and that he really wanted to close up. ( it was 9.45pm and we were lead to believe the restaurant was open until 11pm ) The food was good - unfortunately the atmosphere was not. Overall we would definitely stay here again as we ate out for the remainder of our stay and everything else was faultless.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As well-seasoned travelers, this hotel was perfect for our first visit to Prague. With impeccable and friendly attention from the staff, the hotel offers a convenient location just outside of the crowded tourist centers. Spotlessly clean, it has classic lobby seating, and a very sweet roof patio. The room was spacious though not overly large. The hotel staff arranged a convenient and reasonably priced transfer from the airport (including the cost on our hotel tab), and also helped master us the public transportation system, including selling us day passes. The hotel is very reasonably priced.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister and I enjoyed a lovely 3 night stay at Hotel Julian. We received a warm welcome on arrival with a glass of prosecco, a map, plus tips of where to visit in the surrounding area. All staff were polite, friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble. Our attic suite was very spacious, well equipped, comfortable and spotlessly clean. Great choice at breakfast and we ate in the hotel twice in the evening which was delicious. We also enjoyed gin and tonics on the roof terrace in the sunshine with a view of the castle. On the day of our departure a locker was provided for our luggage after we had checked out of our suite.The hotel is in an excellent location for those who enjoy walking being in close proximity to the river, Castle, Charles Bridge, the Old town and Little Venice. We caught a tram a few minutes away from the hotel on one occasion with tickets supplied by the hotel which have to be stamped once on the tram. This took us to the castle area in minutes. We liked the fact that the hotel is in a quiet area away from the crowds of the Old Town whilst still accessible to all amenities. Based on our stay we can highly recommend Hotel Julian.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we stepped in the door, we were sincerely welcomed to our home away from home. The hotel is wonderfully situated within walking distance to all sightseeing, yet is located in a quiet neighborhood. The tram is just a few steps away if walking is not your choice. Our room was large, clean, quiet, and comfortable. Lobby area was very inviting with edible treats always available. Would definitely return to this gem in the future!!!
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 nights here and it was fabulous! Very cosy, great atmosphere. The breakfast was fantastic and we used the spa room which was just amazing. Will definitely stay again when back in Prague. Thumbs up
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rick Steves recommends this place, so you might need to book in advance. It's a great small hotel with a nice location. The location is great because it's on the #9 tram line. That tram comes about every 5 minutes and will whisk you to the main train station or to the edge of the old town. Take it one stop, change to the #22, and you'll be at the castle.The staff care about your stay. They want you to be comfortable and happy. They've got a very nice breakfast in the morning. Though the building is old, the rooms are maintained.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed 4 nights as first stop of trip.Jan was great host.quiet area away from bustle of Old but close enough to walk to Charles bridge and old Town.Solid breakfast.Check out roof top area for.breakfast or drinks.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel Julian was our favorite hotel for this European trip. The staff, especially Jahn (maybe Johan, it's a Czech equivalent for John) and Marcella, made our stay in Prague relaxing, comfortable, and memorable. They made excellent recommendations and were helpful in making arrangements for tours and meals.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Hotel Julian for a week while visiting Prague and we absolutely loved it. The hotel itself is beautiful and cozy. There is a lounge area and a library in the downstairs lobby which is a bit British in style....very nice to sit and enjoy a nightcap in the evening which we did most nights. The hotel also has an onsite restaurant in the lower level which is very small and very unique in that it is three levels, with circular wrought iron staircases which connect the levels. The food here is very good and the service, as in the entire hotel is excellent. Our room was very large with a queen and a single bed and plenty of room for the extra chair and coffee table. The bathroom was great as was the cleanliness. We just loved the staff here. Very welcoming and helpful and offered us a free proseco or beer upon our arrival along with some information and a map which was very helpful. I would definitely stay here again. It is a good 15-20 walk from the hotel to the Charles Bridge but unless you have mobility issues it was not far at all.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first trip to Prague and I'm so glad my husband and I chose Hotel Julian. We were initially a little worried that it was outside Old Town, but public transportation was very simple and amazingly reliable, and it was also a very nice 15-20 minute walk into old town as well if we felt like it. We were given a very cool top floor room, which felt very spacious with clean decor. I loved how the windows opened out and the shades that completely blacked out the room (helped with jet lag). The breakfast every morning was delicious with both hot and cold offerings, a delightful array of pastries, and a wonderful coffee/latte machine. Hotel Julian, with its elegant public rooms decor, felt calm and peaceful. We didn't eat at the on site restaurant downstairs, but we did pick up a couple of pilsners (what else would we get, right?) and a dessert to take up to the outdoor terrace. There was a lovely view of the castle as well as the spires in old town. Last, and most important, all the staff were warm and attentive. Special call out to Jan, Radka, Ivana, and Marcela. Thank you for making us feel so welcome!
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Hotel Julian for four night gets and loved it. The manager Jon and all desk staff were so helpful. I had a serious issue while or there and he escorted me to the embassy!!! The breakfast buffet was excellent with fresh fruits and vegetables and many choices. The room was beautiful and large, with a comfortable bed and unexpected amenities such as a drying rack. The public spaces are sumptuous. The rooftop area and restaurant are great spaces. The location is an easy walk to Old Town but also close to the tram. We used uber easily. Thanks s was an unexpected pleasure.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed a three night stay at this hotel. The hotel is close to a tram stop on a quiet street.The reception is manned 24 hours and they are friendly and helpful. We stayed in the top floor apartment and enjoyed the rooftop terrace for views of Prague.Highly recommended!
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 8 nights in May. The beds were very comfortable. The front desk staff was helpful and friendly. We also really enjoyed the location as we were close to a well connected tram stop and not too far of a walk from the tourists areas while still enjoying being able to open our window at night due to the quiet location. We also visited the mall that is close by for essentials. The only reason that I would deduct a star is for the spotty wifi. I could not connect to the wifi reliably and while it wasn't a deal breaker for my husband and I, had I brought my young adult son, the wifi issue would have been stressful. There is a desktop available in the lobby, but if it's important to you to relax in your room on your laptop I wouldn't count on being able to do that.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 4 nights at Hotel Julian last week 19-22 May and enjoyed our stay. Our room was nice with everything you need however we felt the hotel itself was a little too quiet for our liking. The restaurant/bar is in the basement which I think is wasted and there was never anyone in when I looked in!! There's a library/sitting area beside reception which is nice but again all very quiet. Breakfast was ok although not a lot of choice in cereals and gets a bit repetitive after a couple of days. The city's main attractions are about a 20 minute walk away which is fine if it's not raining but we suffered two days of rain and got a little damp walking back to the hotel on these days!! There's a really nice roof terrace which would be ideal on a warm sunny day but unfortunately for us we only got spells of sunshine whilst there.All in all I would definitely return to Prague but would probably stay closer to the city's main attractions in a livelier hotel. I would like to mention Marcela on reception who was a lovely friendly woman who offered us some great pointers on the city.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Antiques galore, great breakfast, beautiful roof top deck. Room had too few outlets and tough to get to them. In house restaurant was very good. Room was spacious but old and could have used a more thorough cleaning as we find the baseboards dust laden and the bathroom towel warmer rack as well. Great front desk staff, very helpful. We were greeted with a beer and an overview of the area we were staying in.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed four nights in this very comfortable small hotel. The room was at the back of the hotel and very quiet. Breakfast was varied each day with a very good selection. Staff were uniformly friendly, helpful and pleasant.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Julian is situated close to the river and The Charles Bridge in a quiet neighborhood.Upon arrival you are offered a glass of beer or wine.The room is big, the beds are very comfortable and there is a bathtub.The minibar is well equipped - the prices are fair.Breakfast is poor after Danish hotel standard - but what you can eat is good.We recommend this hotel at any time.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Julian is one of the best hotels I’ve ever stayed. The hotel is located in Prague 5 and is a 10 minute walk to Prague Castle The receptionists at the desk were very helpful with all of our questions. When we checked in we were both offered a complimentary beer and given a map of old town Prague. The receptionist went over the map with us and highlighted key areas to visit and areas to stray from and also gave us some tips on how to “act like a local”. When we checked into our room we were amazed with how sparkling clean it was. The bed was huge and extremely comfortable. The bathroom was fairly big with a huge tub. There was also a mini bar with beer, wine, water and snacks. The hotel has an access to a roof top terrace with beautiful views of Prague. A great place to relax and have a few drinks. We also booked a massage with the hotel masseuse. The masseuse was extremely professional. I would recommend this hotel to any couple visiting Prague.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel located in the quieter Mala Strana (Lesser Town) area of Prague, close to a tram stop, within a 15 minute walk from the popular Charles Bridge, 10 minutes from Kampa Park and within walking distance to the Old Town.The staff were helpful and friendly, the standard double room was quiet, bright, modern and clean as was the bathroom although the sink was chipped. We dined in the cosy hotel restaurant which restored some of my faith in Czech cuisine after having had an awful meal at a neighbouring restaurant the previous evening. The hotel has a historic feel to it with a comfortable lounge and wide staircases. Definately to be recommended.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A Friendly staff that welcomes you to a great hotel in a perfect location. Not to far from everything but far enough from the masses. We got the room next to the amazing rooftop, and it’s really just perfect. I would bring nespresso capsule though on the next trip. Highly recommend and would come back again.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 8 wonderful nights in Hotel Julian with excellent hospitality. The entire staff from checkin, to breakfast, for touring information was flawless. Staff even knows which tram or bus to take to where you want to go. They arrange anything you need such as an airport pickup, concert tickets, massage, or any other Prague type activity. The entire hotel is beautiful like a mini museum. Our room was just right, comfortable beds, plenty of space, sound proof windows, hot water that never runs out in the shower, high ceilings. Location is good we walked to most attractions and took the tram a few times. To top it off the breakfast is practically gourmet with their own latte, expresso machine. Just behind the hotel is a beautiful park that we spent a full day hiking the well maintained trails. We liked this hotel so much we rebooked for our return to Prague to catch our flight home after touring other countries.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The boking made directly with the hotel went very smoothly. Upon arrival and all through the stay, the staff was very friendly, really doing its best to assist. The room was spacious, certainly for this location, fully in town. The breakfast was appropriate for this level of hotel. The plus point were peeled and sliced fresh oranges, pineapples and grapefruits replacing the usual and standard macedoine of fruits. Also, proposing slices of ginseng with thee was a nice surprise. Another plus point are the lockers for those having to check out and stilling willing to visit Prague before departure. Furthermore, they benefit of a very practical bathroom with shower, toilet and even all what is needed for ironing ! Location is excellent ! 200m from public transport, 10 minutes from the Kampa island and the same walking distance to the huge shopping mall U Andela (also metro station). Certainly to recommend (and get back !).
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a perfect boutique hotel with charm, excellent breakfast, comfortable rooms, and a fantastic staff. The location is on the castle side of the river and a pleasant walk to the Charles Bridge. Although there are no other hotels nearby, there are plenty of good and reasonably priced restaurants. It’s also close to the Hunger Wall and the beautiful hilly park it is built upon. We also stayed at a higher priced hotel near old town (which was nice), but for the money the Hotel Julian was the better choice. Special thanks to the very friendly and helpful staff from those at the front desk, the breakfast staff, and housekeeping.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location on the quieter side of Prague but still within walking distance of the main sights. Location is very good for airport bus/tram connection as the stop for a number 20 tram (Švandovo divadlo) is just around the corner.Very good hotel with friendly and helpful staff, we arrived slightly earlier than expected so our rooms were not quite ready but we were offered chilled beer on arrival while Jan, the hotel manager, talked us through some of Prague’s highlights.Breakfast choice was varied and good quality. A very enjoyable stay and the Hotel Julian is one I would defintaley recommend and return to.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and me stayed 3 days at Hotel Julian. We found an excellent hotel in everything: the room, the cleanliness, the breakfast, the restaurant, location, everything was perfect. But the personal treatment and the service were extraordinary. In our case, we arrived at the hotel with a problem due to the loss of some documents and the support we had from the hotel staff was amazing. In regards to attitudes and service of the staff is the best hotel.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel and staff could not have been anymore perfect for my Birthday week. They are helpful and informative. Welcoming, and comfortable rooms with a good restaurant although so many more places to find and eat in surrounding area. Roof terrace with a great view of the castle and area. Great location about 15 mins from anywhere. Would go there again.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay. They had friendly staff, great breakfast, and well kept rooms. Staff gave us some recommendations of things to do during our stay. The lobby is great for just hanging out. They have a lift so you don’t have to climb stairs, a great restaurant, and a rooftop terrace.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was wonderful, the property is excellent and the location is right on the tram - highly recommend. The staff took the time to introduce us to the hotel, great us by name and know our plans. Included breakfast was of high quality.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel recently for 4 nights. I require a wheelchair accessible room and this was available exactly as required. It had a full roll in shower with a seat and well positioned grab bars and rails. All the staff were very helpful and nothing was a problem to them. I would like to mention in particular John and Marcella who were prepared to go the extra mile to help us. We were supplied with a glass of Prosecco on arrival and as we could not access the restaurant they served us dinner in the library. Breakfast was fab and plenty of variety. All in all this hotel made our stay in Prague very relaxing and enjoyable and we would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Prague.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great hotel the staff are lovely and very helpful my brother in law was in a wheelchair and the staff were great. John went out of his way to help us as did all the other staff. We dined in the hotel on one of the nights and the food was great, we also got a glass of Proseco on arrival. The breakfast was great plenty to choose from. I cant recommend this hotel enough.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very good and friendly staff the all the receptions were brilliant but the bed was very hard also the room was quite plain the wooden chair was very hard it did not have any padding on it just solid wood also there was only one chair other person had to sit on the bed and that was very hard
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a gem of a hotel, this boutique hotel was very impressive. From the moment we arrived, quite late at night, we were invited to sit down and offered a lovely welcome drink. We were then given the low down on the hotel and the area, giving my husband and I a great in sight into the area. The hotel was spotless and the staff were most helpful. I was extremely impressed by the quality and quantity of the breakfast. The hotel was ideally located to explore beautiful Prague, both on foot or on the trams. I'd certainly return to this hotel.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As part of an extended European trip, my wife and I were scheduled to spend three days in Prague in the first week of March 2019, for which we chose Hotel Julian. The hotel is located about 20 mins from the airport (by taxi). Located very near to the heart of the city, it is a quaint hotel in semi-busy neighbourhood, with several restaurants and pubs at a walking distance. Upon entering the hotel premises, we received a warm welcome by John Novacek, the client relations manager (his exact job title might be slightly different), who made us feel comfortable from the very first minute of entering. John was very helpful and informative and helped us finalise our itinerary and suggested some of the best restaurants / pubs we could visit (add U Modre Kachnicky to your list right now!). The interior of the hotel is a perfect hybrid of vintage décor and latest technology. The highlight of our stay was the staff members (primarily John and one of their reception attendants Marcela) who were very helpful, polite and friendly. Their breakfast buffet was excellent and was managed seamlessly by a lady who always had a smile on her face. Every facility we used was flawless and our stay at Julian was the highlight of our entire trip. The room prices were very competitive, and worth every cent we spent there. I would highly recommend a stay at Hotel Julian to everyone planning a visit to Prague.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A wonderful staff, very comfortable beds, nice breakfast, beautiful old timey lobby... We had the best time here, got recommendations for the city, and felt very welcome here. Close to the tram, with a rooftop terrace.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Planned a birthday vacation in March 2019. First time Prague. They sent an email in advance asking for preferences. When checked in they took us through the map and advised on the places to visit. It’s just amazing. The staff is extremely hospitable. The hotel is Extremely clean. Shout out to John and Marcela! You were brilliant. Thank you.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is very nice and central and lots of good places are just all closeby. The views are nice. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The spa was a delight and was a very nice experience. The staff are very polite and helpful.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed three nights in lovely Hotel Julian. The fron t of house staff were amazing. So helpful, knowledgeable, and kind. They made our family feel very welcome in Prague in winter.Easy tram ride across to the Castle.Sights: ensure you visit the Strahov library, and the Czechoslavakia museum of industry
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Julian was a wonderful experience from the time I made the reservation until departure. Staff are very helpful and friendly. The Hotel communicated with me regularly to ensure any needs we had were met. They arranged drivers to and from the train station, provide touring information. They greeted us with a welcome prosecco and definitely made us feel like very welcome and important guests every single day. Good and quiet location, approx 15 minute walk from the Charles Bridge. Breakfast was satisfying and dinner in their restaurant a real treat - great ambiance! Would totally recommend
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was a great find for our weekend away in Prague. The hotel is cosy, clean and friendly. Hotel room was immaculate and the breakfast was to a high standard/ plenty of savoury/ sweet choices to choose from. For the price, can’t complain and would recommend anyone to stay here. 5*
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very warm amd welcoming staff. Great room. Which was spacious and in a perfect location. The hotel was very clean, not too big, very friendly, great breakfast. We would definitely recommend. It would be lovely to sit on the roof terrace in the summer
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the Hotel Julian on New Years Eve and for 5 additional days. Very comfortable accommodations. Stayed in the two room suite with a small kitchenette. Very roomy and spotless. Had a exceptional New Year’s Eve dinner in the hotel’s restaurant—very charming and cozy. Thrilled by the 360 degree views of the New Years fireworks from the rooftop terrace. The buffet breakfast was delicious each day as we set our to explore with expert assistance from the welcoming front desk staff. All the sites are within walking district or a quick ride on the Metro. When we departed very early for the airport, the front desk arranged for our transportation and provided breakfast to send along with us. As a world traveler, I highly recommend the Hotel Julian...it’s truly a memorable experience.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed Hotel Julian so very much! Attractive rooms, comfy beds and pillows, quiet ambiance, yummy breakfast, nice restaurant, good location, friendly and helpful staff—I really cant say enough positive things about this place! The only small criticism is that the in-room Wi-fi isn’t very strong (which annoyed our teenager). However, we could go to the lobby or other locations for a stronger signal. Thank you to the staff of Hotel Julian for a wonderful visit to Prague! Happy New Year!
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very welcoming hotel, the rooms are big enough and the beds are of good quality. The bathroom is well equipped (handicap person).The breakfast is very good with a lot of variety of food. The location is also very good, not too far away from Charles Bridge (+/- 20 minutes walk), tram 22 and 09 can also bring you almost everywhere. The hotel is located in a very quite location so you can sleep in late.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a beauty. Just far enough away from the centre to be quiet but close enough that a 10 minute walk will get you to the centre. Well appointed rooms, very comfortable beds and very clean bathroom. The breakfast included in the tariff is good enough to ensure you can save on lunch and the staff are very friendly and efficient.I don't generally net in hotels but gave it a try and wasn't disappointed.Should you be looking a comfortable night's sleep at a reasonable price this will exceed expectations.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Were there for christmass , we loved it so much, Really friendly specially the Jan the Blond Guy Also the Manager , my wife called him Ben Afleck, My Daughter loved a lot specialky the Hall with the fire Place, where we spent few evenings, Is Just perfect Place for Christmas In prague, For Families, Pretty close to old town and from Charle s bridge , Room nice And warm, Lady of the service always with a smile BIG THUMB UP HOTEL JULIAN
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There are a number of positives about this hotel. The first is the staff. Everyone we encountered during our stay was helpful, warm and friendly. They clearly wanted to ensure that the guests had a great time. The second is cleanliness. Everything was clean. The third is the hotel's location. It is a very pleasant 20 minute walk to Prague Castle and a 25 minute walk to the Old Town. It is close to some great restaurants and is in a quiet part of town.However, I am surprised that this hotel has received such a large number of positive reviews. The standard of the room we stayed in was very poor. The beds were extremely small and, much worse, had mattresses which are very uncomfortable and clearly extremely old. The decor of the rooms is dated and the air conditioning unit did not work. The lighting was depressing. There was also an unpleasant smell that did not dissipate throughout our 4 night stay. Although the bathroom was clean, the shower was basic (to say the least). The TV was small and had a very limited selection of channels (and no Smart functionality or anything similar). Although following previous reviews the management has stated that the wifi has been upgraded, it was unusably slow throughout our stay.I have noticed that in response to previous reviews the management has complained that guests have not given them a chance to rectify issues. However, this hotel advertises itself as a 4* hotel and the quality of the room we stayed in was 2* at best. It is not the responsibility of the guest to ensure that the room they receive is adequate and as advertised. In our case, the hotel was fully booked during our stay and so even if there were an opportunity for us to switch to a room which was adequate then it would have meant placing guests in our inadequate room.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our third stay at Hotel Julian didn’t disappoint. Everything about this hotel is amazing... from the welcome by staff to the generous room beautifully decorated, comfortable and clean, we couldn’t fault it. Hotel Julian is within walking distance of many beautiful historic buildings in Prague and there are some good restaurants close by...great value..!!
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights in December. The rooms were clean and tidy and the shower in the bathroom had hot water and a good flow. The beds were not the most comfortable and i doubt if i could have stayed in them for longer than 3 nights. The radiators were controllable so you could set them up to be warm when you came in after a night out. We went to eat in the restaurant one night but we found it to be a bit cold and lacking in atmosphere. We had one drink in the restaurant but took drinks to the lounge for the rest of the time. Most nights the fire was well lit and therefore very inviting - we almost went to put our pyjamas on!!
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After a brief stay in January 2018 - part business and part leisure - we decided to return again to the city and once more to the Hotel Julian.The location provides easy access to the "old" city - tram stops nearby but we like the leisurely stroll along the river though if the weather was poor it would be public transport for us!When we arrived (yesterday) we'd been delayed 4 hours at Prague airport (due to bomb threat on our plane!!). The warm welcome from front desk was perfect and instantly made us feel the pressure of the last 6 hours fade away.Our room was much improved on the last visit and had obviously been updated - though the previous room was lovely too!The whole hotel atmosphere is one of relaxation and comfort. Breakfast wasn't crowded and the lounge areas are ideal for some light reading or just letting the day flow by.We're mid-visit as I prepare this review and already we're talking about coming back here again .... something we rarely do with any hotel!
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was very dated the beds were really hard and not able to sleep in and room was freezing on the last night no heating on. The breakfast Was very limited and not enough room staff were friendly and helpful
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed with friends for 2 nights before heading to a Danube cruise. The staff was extremely friendly and welcoming. The hotel has a quaint feel and interesting decor. Th3 food for breakfast and in the restaurant was excellent with a nice variety. We highly recommend this hotel for a fun Prague visit. We will stay there again if the opportunity to visit Prague comes along again.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In August 2018 we stayed for three days at this fantastic hotel. When we arrived we were offered something to drink, we took a cold beer, and then one of the staff members sat down with us. He explained everything about the hotel and made good advices about what to do in Prague. The hotel is just very cozy, perfect breakfast and a very nice library. We had a great three bed room with ac. The rooftop bar had a nice view over the city. At last, the service at Hotel Julian is 100% professional, service minded and welcoming.Magnus Lidström, Sweden
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed an exceptionally warm welcome at Hotel Julian that included a very nice glass of Prosecco!The hotel is in the Little Quarter district and was a 30 minute ride by taxi from the airport.(we used Rideways to book a taxi and if was great value at just over £16.00 each way)Our room was on the fourth floor and was more than comfortable.There is a fifth floor with a doorway to a roof terrace that gives a good view of the Palace to the North but it was a little too cold to spend any time out there in November!There was a good choice of options for breakfast, the only negative comment being that some of the hot food could be a little tepid if you are a late eater.The hotel is well situated with around a 10-15 minute walk North to the Charles Bridge and 20-25 minutes south to Vysehrad castle.There is a small bar next to the hotel where you can get a 0.4l glass of beer for 40ckn, and an excellent Italian just around the corner called Einstein that does pizza's in a wood fired oven as well as great pasta dishes.Also to the south, just a 5-7 minute walk away is Avdel station if you are looking to use the underground metro. There is also a wide range of eating and drinking options here if you are looking for a change of scenery from the hustle and bustle of the Old Town as well as a large supermarket.It may be a year or two until we go back to Prague but when we do we will be looking to stay at the Hotel Julian again.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Prior to landing we phoned the hotel to arrange a transfer from the airport to the hotel, we were greeted with a glass of Prosecco upon arrival and shown tourist spots etc. The room was on the first floor and was very spacious, the bath was big enough for two! Maids came everyday and room was looking spotless. Breakfast was perfect just what was needed, good selection of fruit, yoghurt, cereal, pastries, meats, fruit juices, tea, coffee, bread, and warm choices such as bacon, scrambled egg and veg. Hotel staff were very helpful when asked about surrounding areas, tourists sports, places to eat and shop etc and also booked our taxi back to the airport. Would have liked to try out the spa but unfortunately did not have time. Has a wander up to the roof terrace which would have been lovely to sit out on in summer unfortunately in November this was all frosted over however blankets are provided. Hotel is situated around a ten minute walk to the Charles bridge, the old town around 20 minutes but all flat and short distance on foot, many supermarkets 5 min walk away. All in all a lovely hotel enjoyed our stay would definitely recommend and if we ever return to Prague I would book this hotel again.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Julian
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not a lot to add to the other reviews other than to confirm that’s it’s an excellent place to stay in Prague for its location (Close to castle & Charles Bridge), super-friendly staff (can’t do enough to help) rooms (cosy was fine for us) and value for money etc etcDefinitely recommended!
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here three nights and cannot say enough positive things about this small, family-run hotel. It was wonderful. Location is great. It's in the "Little Quarter" area, about a 10 minute walk from the Charles Bridge. The Prague Castle is also walkable (maybe 15 minutes); the staff will tell you a short cut from the hotel. The street is quiet - across from German embassy and near U.S. embassy - outside the Old Town madness but still close enough for visits. We had planned to use trams to get around but ended up walking only because the location was that good. (Admittedly, we are big walkers, and walked about 10 miles each day.)The hotel itself is in a 500 year old building which has been beautifully restored. Our room had en suite modern bathroom with nice shower. We also had air conditioning which was very welcome during the heat wave that hit Prague during our visit. The beds (two twin, pulled together, as is typical in many European hotels) was comfortable. We also had chairs to sit. It was a great room.Breakfast is included and it is a nice breakfast with yogurt, breads, ham & cheese, scrambled eggs, fruit, and juices, coffee & tea. I also want to give a shout out to the staff because they even provided us breakfast on our final day when we left the house at 4:00 a.m. for a 6:00 flight. They prepared ham & cheese sandwiches & juice for us, which they left in the common fridge; they offered coffee (which they would have left in a Thermos) and yogurt. I was really impressed that they went the "extra mile" (or would it be kilometer?) to make sure we were fed.Speaking of the common fridge, they have an honor fridge, from which you can take juice, soda, water, wine or beer. Then when you settle you bill, you tell them what you consumed from the honor fridge. It was so much more convenient than a vending machine or the likes and we were glad to remember what we consumed and pay the reasonable charge for it. Coffee and tea are always available without charge.The staff are very helpful, and the owners live on site. Among the helpful services the staff provided were arranging pick up at the train station (which I was glad we did - I think it might have been hard to find) as well as transfer to the airport at the end with a very nice car service. They also suggested restaurants, both Czech and international - and we happily tried - and enjoyed - their suggestions for all three of our dinners in Prague. Note that they are a cash only establishment - no credit cards. They told us this when we made our reservation so we were prepared and it worked out fine. They accept payment in Euros, dollars or, of course, Czech Koruna (and I think other currencies, too).Also, though I said we only walked & happily did so, it is fair to note that it is downhill to the Charles Bridge so naturally, it's uphill to the house. On the first night, I felt like we would never get there as we climbed back up the hill but after that I was fine. All in all, this was an absolutely wonderful stay and I would return there in a heartbeat. I highly recommend the House at the Big Boot!
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I came for a week of work in Prague. My husband came with me for sightseeing. We had been booked at a hotel that didn’t have air conditioning and since the forecast called for extreme heat, we scrambled and found the house at the big boot, which thankfully was air-conditioned. Because of our last-minute switch, we stayed in three different rooms. We loved all of them! Really cozy and well appointed, charming antique furniture, super duper clean and modern bathrooms. Jan and his staff truly make the place seem feel like a home away from home. When jan overheard that I needed to get up early for work, he volunteered to wake up and make me breakfast himself. His son Tom is a tour guide and took my husband on a two hour tour that was very enjoyable. The neighborhood literally can’t be beat. It’s right off of the main square of Male Strane, Really close to the Charles Bridge, castle and public transportation. yet it is the quietest, cutest street you could imagine. I hope I have the occasion to return!
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
