Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here in early June for a few days. This is truly a great location. It's close enough to the sites you want to see without having to stay in the middle of the mass of tourist. The location is quiet and the staff is incredible. The check in itself stood apart from any other property we stayed during our trip. We were offered coffee and provided with information about the city, where to go when to avoid the crowds, and other locations that may not be on your radar away from the crowds. Don't skip breakfast, it makes for a good start. Would definitely recommend this place.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A memorable stay at this delightful BnB / Hotel. Wonderfully located its staff are well trained. The rooms are spacious, the bathrooms modern and clean and the breakfast sumptuous. Throw in warm hospitality, the convenience of the hotel car to take you to the airport, and its proximity to everything there is to do and see in Prague then you'd be crazy to stay anywhere else.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Funky historic hotel recommended by Rick Steves in a good location. The problems we encountered out weighted its charm. Our room was on the third floor with a “private” terrace (which other guests accessed). All rooms have foam mattresses, which we found to be too soft, very hot, and quite amortized. There was noise from other rooms, and creaking floors which is to be expected in an older building. We did not sleep well. The bathroom is small, with no sink stopper. The host requires cash payment in Euros or Czech Koruna, which is inconvenient. We heard one couple remark they felt like they were doing a drug deal. The breakfast was adequate, with average selection. Don’t expect fresh fruit of the season, home-made breads or a selection of deli meats and cheese – though ham and cheese was offered to us once during our stay. The staff on the other hand made every effort to make us feel welcome. They were friendly, and spoke English well. We went with their recommendation to use a private taxi to avoid rip-offs at the train station. We do not recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely B&B, up from the American Embassy and across from the German Embassy. Each receptionist had plenty of suggestions for food and things to do in Prague as well as vet accommodating. Rooms were very comfortable, clean and quiet. Upon request a mini air conditioner was brought in since the evenings were not cooling down. I love the family style breakfast, but plenty of tables if you are not into joining others.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a well-located, charming hotel. I love that it is family owned. Unfortunately, there was a lot of loud road work right outside. The owner kindly gave us a discount and put is in a better room that was even more charming. I like the location that is quieter neighborhood. It is a short walk to the Charles Bridge and many nice restaurants.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First the welcome was outstanding. Since we arrived late Laura gave us a quick overview so we could get a late night meal. In the morning she gave us a detailed orientation. Our room was incredible! The furniture was beautiful. We stayed in the small apartment which was actually quite large. The doors were fascinating...So small in height. Everything was very clean. Jan gave us such a nice greeting each morning and cooked eggs any way you would like. The breakfast was yummy! The coffee was great! We were so busy touring that we did not take advantage of the tea that was always available. We also enjoyed the walk past the German and US embassy as we headed into town. It was a very safe area. We had the property arrange for our transportation to and from the airport and we are thankful we did that. it was a wonderful weekend get away! We would definitely go again and stay here! Thank you Jan and Laura!!!
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a more than perfect stay in the "House of the Big Boots". We got a very warm welcome and we enjoyed it very very much staying there for only two days. Jan and his team did everything that is possible to make us feeling better than at home. A absolutely perfect stay and we will come back again, if we ever need to stay in Prague again.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I visited Prague for her birthday April 2019 and stayed in the superior attic suite at the House at the Big Boot for four nights. The room was fantastic with a comfortable deck that overlooked Prague homes to the north, west of the Vltava River, and a great view of Prague Castle. The entire staff was outstanding and very helpful regarding sightseeing and restaurant suggestions, and Laura was especially helpful with our check-in and ensuring our stay was the best it could be. We spoke with the owner, Jan, most evenings from our deck while taking in the beautiful view over a bottle of wine. The room accommodations were very comfortable, just be prepared to walk the 67 concrete spiral steps several times each day if you choose the attic suite. I'm sure rooms on the lower floors are just as nice, but for us, the attic suite was well worth the climb.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved this hotel. A great location in a quiet area but within a quick walk of restaurants and the castle. The room was very comfortable and the breakfast is delicious. The best part is the amazing people who work there. They are so friendly and helpful in every way. They gave us suggestions on where to go, made dinner reservations, tour and concert reservations, and lots of help with directions. And I even got help with how to use a map offline on my phone.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic bed and breakfast in quiet location. Really friendly and helpful owner and staff. My room was upgraded for no particular reason and at no extra cost. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting Prague. Thank you for a perfect stay in a lovely house.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This small family hotel is an absolute winner! From the first welcome Jan and his team made us feel very special. The rooms are comfortable and spacious, the location is great (close to, but away from all the tourist mayhem in a quiet street) and the breakfast is terrific. Nothing was too much trouble - be it booking a concert, finding somewhere for us for dinner or giving us advice on the best sites for views of the Castle. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an excellent place to stay. It has a top notch location in walking distance to most attractions in Prague and still far away from the noise of the downtown core which can be extremely busy and noisy on weekends. This hotel feels like coming home after a very busy day of sightseeing. The hotel is very comfortable and relaxing. The staff is among the best we have have met in all of our travels. They are very helpful and patience when answering a multitude of questions. On our first day, we met with two of the staff to discuss our vacation itentiary. Breakfast is excellent with your choice of eggs cooked specifically to your liking along with having a variety of cereals, juices and fresh bakery breads. We would highly recommend this hotel when staying in Prague. You will not be disappointed. It is simply the best!
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Prague and our 5 day stay at the Dum u velke boty is one of our very special travel memories. The owners and staff of the "House at the Big Boot" are genuinely welcoming, warm, and helpful. Each morning we were treated to a delicious breakfast including made to order eggs. In the evening we returned to a clean, comfortable, quiet room. The location of the property is ideal...safe and convenient to everything. From the front door of the House at the Big Boot, we were able to walk the entire city. Our biggest compliment - we are so eager to return!
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We returned recently to the Dum, having stayed there before, and it was as special as ever. It's a lovely place and has been in the same family for many years. It has beautiful rooms, friendly staff and their breakfast is a pleasure. It's totally relaxing, peaceful, and is in a great location. Please do try it !
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for a couple of nights only but felt like home instantly. The owner made us feel really welcome. Each day we enjoyed the breakfast and so we had plenty of energy to explore the city. Everything was clean and tidy. And the location is just the best. It's super quiet at night but very close to Prague castle and Charles Bridge. We're glad we stayed at Lesser Town. It's so much better than right side of the river (which is full of clubs and drunk people at night).
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This gets a big 5 stars from me (and I don't offer give them out!). The welcome was warm and friendly and our room a delight. I would stay again in a heart-beat. Located on the other side of the Charles Most and not far from the Castle. Our host got up very early the morning we left - especially to cook us breakfast - thank you! That was most kind. Probably the best scrambled egg I have ever had. Definitely recommend. There are stairs.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A little walk from the castle and main bridge. A good location for our family holiday to Prague. Large rooms with historic value. Quiet rooms for sleeping. Good breakfast- speciality is scrambled eggs. A very welcoming stay.Highly recommended for couples and families.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 9 nights here during a recent visit to Prague. It is in a great location, within walking distance of all the major sites. Located on a quiet side street in old town, it is a lovely small inn. The breakfast is substantial and the hospitality is lovely. The shower was much larger than is typical in Europe. We will definitely go back on our next visit.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My traveling companion and I spent 5 nights at the House at the Big Boot. Our experience was excellent. As others have mentioned, this is a family owned and operated business -- Jan, Jakob, and Tomas (as well as other family members perhaps) -- are knowledgeable and gracious hosts. Both friendly and professional.My companion and I stayed in one of their "cozy" rooms, which I assumed would be tiny. It was not. It was large enough to have a small sitting area and the bathroom was quite large with a big shower. The whole house is architecturally interesting as well as well maintained and immaculately clean.Every morning Jan made eggs to order and they were delicious. The rest of the breakfast options included ham and cheese, yogurt, an assortment of breads/pastries, jams/butter, fresh fruit, juice, cereal, tea, and coffee. It was bountiful and fresh.The location is also quite wonderful. It is far enough away from the craziness of Old Town Square but within walking distance (about 10-15 minutes). The Castle, Petrin Park, the Charles Bridge, and Kampa Park is very close as are various pubs, restaurants, interesting shops, and minimarkets. The innkeepers will also arrange transportation for you to/from the airport, train station, or (I assume) other places as well at very reasonable prices. One last thing, the prices at the House at the Big Boot cannot be beat! I have paid as much as twice as much at other places for the same (or less!) amenities, ambience, and location that I experienced at the House at the Big Boot. Would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's hard to say enough about what makes the Big Boot such a wonderful place to stay. It is an easy walk to the Charles Bridge, but far enough away to be completely quiet, in an area near embassies and below the castle. Beds were comfortable, breakfasts excellent, and the staff were extraordinary. Not only were they helpful during our stay, but when our next plans unraveled, they assisted us in mapping out a new plan and let us stay an extra day. One of the best overall experiences I can remember in all my travels. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 2 nights. The hotel is up a lovely quiet road opposite the German embassy so no passing traffic. We had the downstairs room by the front door and were a little worried it might be noisy but it was blissfully calm. Breakfast was hearty with a choice of juices, cereal, fruit, breads, pastries and eggs. Easy walking to Prague castle and the Charles bridge. We will be back.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Last Minute Trip to Prague so places and hotels were at a premium - Really got lucky and found this place at the very last minuteOrganised transfers via hotel from airport (Easier and Simpler than trying to book from airport)Location 10 minutes uphill walk from West End of Charles Bridge in diplomatic area - Lots of embassies nearby so with police and security felt safe throughout our stay. The hotel is an old 4 storey building with lots of charm and charisma, amazing artwork and touches from dining area to corridors and bedroom. There are no lifts so bear this in mind if travelling with children / lots of luggage or elderly companionsWe stayed in the attic room on the 04th floor (which was massive) - it could easily fit 5 or 6 people. Nice little balcony and sitting area facing Prague castle and was great place to just chill out and relax after long day exploring the sightsMy one issue - there was no curtains or window shades in the attic room so room did get quite bright - However we had our own eye-masks so this was not really an issueFacilities were clean and in excellent condition - shower and bathroom were spotless / Wi-Fi was super quick - Attic Room included a large double end / lounge area and fridge / sink and other basics. Continental breakfast with eggs cooked to order with local breads and fruits were super fresh and delicious and set us up for our two amazing days in Prague.The staff really made our stay - from checkin to checkout - as well as emails / calls before our stay. Each guest was made feel extremely welcome and was briefed on all the things to do in Prague - sights, bars, restaurants etc - and even when they were busy each guest received the same level of attentionThe owner (I never got his name) was incredibly hospitable and incredibly dedicated to the guesthouse and his customers. Extremely nice guy and excellent attention to detail from both him and the rest of his staffOverall an easy 5* to give and an even easier place to recommend.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our second trip to Prague. The first time we stayed in a large modern hotel which was fine. However, we really enjoyed the ambiance of this small inn. We also loved the location and found that it was a pleasant walk to most of the places that we wanted to go. The breakfast was also very enjoyable.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 3 days in the Attic Apt with balcony and had a wonderful time. Granted its no 5-star palace, it was comfortable for a B&B midrange and was what I expected. Attic room is huge, but high angle ceiling limits the usages of some spots closer to the walls. King bed could use an extra pillow for each person but was comfortable and firm so no sore backs! Bathroom was clean and functional and came with a small kitchenette that we didn't use ( no fridge). Rear balcony was nice...quiet with a view to the castle and grounds. Wonderful architecture surrounding you. To the front was the German Embassy and 2 policemen 24/7. Whole street is embassies with a guarded entrance so you are guaranteed safety!If you are average fitness you can walk straight to the castle in 10 minutes, maybe 10 minutes to the Charles Bridge too. Plenty of places to grub and drink near the square 5 minutes away. Only transport we used was the bus-tram from airport and an Uber to the central train station. Walked everywhere else.Staff is A+++++++ helping us with everything we needed from getting train tickets to Vienna at half the price on cd train ticket site, to a list of wonderful places to eat with locals rather than tourist traps.Breakfast was plentiful with egg choices cooked to order, meats/cheeses, and cereals, breads, youghart.Only downside was that the room being in the Attic was a little warm so we had front window open at night and all it takes is one car on those cobbles to generate a racket!All in all a great choice and probably our best hotel experience of our 9 night trip throughout Eastern Europe.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the House at the Big Boot! We are a family of 4 with 2 small children (2 and 4 years old) and the hotel was perfect. We selected the top floor family room that had 2 rooms - one with twin beds and one with a king size bed. The room was fantastic and very spacious. We appreciate the the location is a bit away from the busy scene across the bridge. The hotel has a great location and we were able to walk everywhere that we wanted to go. Jakub and Jan were incredibly helpful with ideas and plans about where to go and when to go - especially with the kids. Breakfast was simple and got us going in the morning. We also appreciated that there is a drink fridge where you help yourself and square up at the end. Parking is about one block down and it fit our oversized vehicle. The hotel also had a books and a few toys for the kids. Bottom line - when we go back to Prague we will stay here again. A fantastic trip and much of it was due to this wonderful hotel.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our group of 3 couples had 2 wonderful with nights here. Everything was great: the location, the rooms, the staff, the breakfasts. Everyone was helpful, friendly, and knowledgeable. The breakfast is as much as you could eat and kept us going all morning. Easy walk to old town, the castle, and great neighborhood restaurants. Really a great place!
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful building, rooms, location, people.. The lot! Breakfasts were lovely, delicious coffee and eggs and pastries. We had to leave very early one morning on a day trip and they made us sandwiches, left biscuits and yoghurts for us in the fridge and had warmed coffee and take-away cups waiting for us. This place really goes the extra mile. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were greeted, on arrival, by Laura. We were offered a drink, a map was awaiting us, and all the sites and best places to eat were marked out and discussed along with some historical facts about the city and country.We were then shown to our room which was situated on the ground floor, and which had once been the Cobbler’s workshop.The room was spacious, clean and well furnished, with rich coloured wooden beams and wooden floor.Thank you to Jan, family and staff for your help, friendliness and for being so welcoming. Also for the delicious breakfasts.All attractions were within walking distance but local transport is also available if preferred.Wish we could have stayed longer to take in a few of the concerts.We will be back!!
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Family run small hotel which caters to your every need. We started with a breakfast that was yummy and filling; we had scrambled eggs with ham one day, bacon and fried eggs another. Everyone from family to staff were engaging and helpful. We loved the area, away from the crazy busyness of the old town but close enough to enjoy. Room was very roomy and clean. Go don't hesitate.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In love with the House of the Big Boot from the moment Jan picked us up at the airport. Our flight was late but there was still a warm greeting and we felt so welcome. Jakub had recommended a smaller room since I wanted a pretty view. It was so lovely.Daniel went over the map of the city and off we went to enjoy our first day in Prague.These folks were kind to everyone and at all times.Breakfast was terrific. I just can't say enough about this charming hotel. Found it in Rick Steve's travel book.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great 3 nights in Prague at this hotel.The room was spacious, well furnished and clean.The breakfast was generous and tasty, but best of all the staff were very informed and assisted us in seeing some hidden gems of Prague, and how to enjoy some of the many sights without the masses of tourists.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very pleased with our stay at this family-owned hotel. Jakub, the son of the original owner, met us and insisted that his staff assist us with our bags. We were grateful as we counted 58 steps up the winding stairwell to the 3rd floor. We were two couples and stayed in the two-room suite with a shared bathroom. The rooms were spacious and the wooden furniture beautiful. (We were meticulous about not leaving wet towels anywhere!) Jakub gave us a thorough overview of Prague before we went exploring. Location was great; only about 10 minutes walk to the Charles bridge, but the street is somewhat of a low traffic area, so we enjoyed quiet nights. His recommendations for restaurants was helpful as well. The service from the staff made us feel like we were family. The same staff member who carried our luggage upstairs, served us breakfast the next morning. Jakub's father, Jan, cooked our eggs for the more than adequate breakfast. Our nights were very comfortable and we were glad for this find. The bonus was that at our host's prompting we made a visit to the German Embassy across the street; they had their yearly open house the day we were there; we found that this Embassy played a significant part in the re-unification of Germany in 1989, after literally thousands of East Germans sought refuge here. Our hosts were also part of this as well, providing food and accommodation for many.Oh, and the name? Apparently this would have been the house and shop of the shoemaker in days gone by.Highly recommended.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I were booked into this adorable hotel by the tour that we were on and it was a delightful experience! Our room was large and decorated with lovely furnishings and the location was super convenient. We stayed for a week and enjoyed our time there and plan on returning next time we are in Prague. I can't say enough about this charming place and the helpful staff that works there!
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice room, good locality, good hosts, kind and caring. Good English breakfast. Good access to the city, Big spacious rooms, A heritage building of sorts. Makes you feel special. Tea , coffee round the clock. The hostesses help you and one feels at home. Makes you want to go back.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for one night on a cycling tour of Europe. The family and staff were extremely welcoming and were focussed on the well being of their guests before all else. I arrived at 9.30 am and expected to get the normal " your room is not ready" but no my room was ready and I was offered breakfast immediately. I then need help on my bike and got driven to a bike repair shop and helped out. this then made it easy for me to spend time exploring the city. The hotel is on the quit side of Prague but only 10 minutes walk to the magnificent Charles Bridge and inspirational Lennon Wall. This stay set me up well for the rest of my tour along the Elbe.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the family suite and it was terrific, lots of room. A lovely building with lots of charm and in a great, quiet area but still close to everything.Amazing scrambled eggs at breakfast!Very helpful team.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything about our stay here was wonderful! The owners and staff were extremely friendly and helpful. They suggested restaurants and even called to make reservations for us. When we inquired about a Laundromat, they offered to take care of our laundry, and it was done perfectly and for a very reasonable charge. Our rooms were lovely and spacious. I loved being in the Little Quarter and away from the crush of loud partying tourists in Old Town; yet we were an easy walk to almost everywhere we wanted to go. Breakfast was delicious, with eggs cooked to order. I would absolutely stay here again next time I'm in Prague!
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Prague was the third and final leg of our 3-city European tour and Dum U Velke Boty helped make it our favorite! We were warmly welcomed by Laura who gave us an overview of Prague and Mala Strana. Over the course of our stay, we had lovely interactions with the owner (who cooked and served us breakfast on our final early morning), his sons (one of whom drove us to the airport), Laura and other staff. Our two rooms were super comfortable. Our teenage sons stayed in Room 37, while my husband and I had the room with the terrace and view of the Prague Castle. This room was was well worth 10 extra Euros per night. Reading, relaxing and having a glass of wine outside was wonderful given the very warm weather and no AC. Though very quiet, the location is walkable to all the classic tourist sights as well as those off the beaten track. Breakfast was tasty and filling: enough to last through an early dinner. We followed Laura's restaurant recommendations and liked them all. There is no doubt, when we are next in Prague, we will stay here again!
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: House at the Big Boot was recommended by a friend and I am glad I chose to stay here. It’s in a quite location opposite the German Embassy but only 15 mins walk away from the hustle and bustle of Charles Bridge. It is in the Little Quarter and I think you would agree this is a good spot not far from the castle. We had a second floor room which was lovely and big with a good sized bathroom, no air con but this is a 500 year old house and didn’t stop us from enjoying our stay. The hotel has been renovated and furnished in a traditional style and is really very nice.Breakfast was good and prepared by the owner who, along with everyone else, was very welcoming and friendly and gave us lots of useful information - thank you. I would have no hesitation recommending this hotel and would definitely come back should we visit Prague again. There is tea making facilities on the ground floor but the one thing that would make it even better would be to have a small kettle in the room to make a hot drink.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the House at the Big Boot (Dum U Velke Boty) in Prague for 6 nights. This is a lovely place. Besides of its excellent location , walkable to Prague Castle , Charles Bridge, Old town, etc.The owner and his staff are so nice and helpful. The breakfast is so good , I am spoiled. I like the room , makes you feel you are at home, plenty of space and relaxing. When we leave (private car to the airport) the owner is there to make sure Everything is ok. Thanks again to the owner and his staff. This is the B&B you want to stay.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolute perfect stay here at this lovely B&B! Perfect location, rich in history, amazingly helpful and friendly staff, wonderful abundant breakfast and the best and most comfortable bed you will ever sleep in! Our thanks to Jon. Jakob and all for the most pleasurable stay! All that and and walk to absolutely everything!!
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I booked the two small double rooms and were delighted with them. The very modern bathrooms - linked to the traditional bedrooms - worked extremely well. In addition we loved the garden view from our windows. Location was perfect - combining the quiet and peace of the area but within a short walk of restaurants and shops. Conveniently situated between the Castle area and Charles Bridge.Everyone who looked after us, was very helpful and pleasant but in particular we would like to say a special 'Thank you' to Laura our Receptionist. Her ability to work out the logistics of getting us to various destinations with full instructions was so helpful. On our last evening we had left it rather late to have dinner and then go on to a Jazz Club and we almost abandoned the idea. However, Laura stepped in and magically booked a table at a convenient restaurant and the jazz club - plus a taxi and within minutes we were wizzing off - and had a wonderful final evening.Just a couple of points that we believe would have enhanced our visit - (a) A tea/coffee making facility in our room - This facility was offered in the entrance lobby but we would have welcomed the opportunity to have this facility in our room in order to make it first thing in the morning.(b) I found the breakfast arrangement a bit chaotic insofar as the cooked breakfast was served to table but sometimes one was overlooked or forgotten.Apart from these two issues I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a very pleasant experience.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just back from an 8-day stay at Dum u Velke Boty in Prague and I highly recommend staying here. In the best part of town, Prague 1, below the castle & monastery grounds. It's a quiet yet incredibly convenient location - easy walking distance to most sites and to all public transportation. Our room was spacious, lovely, comfortable & exceptionally clean. Breakfast was excellent, and they stock a fridge with water, beer, wine for guests. Most of all, the staff were incredible - welcoming, friendly, helpful - they made the stay extra enjoyable. Can't imagine staying anywhere else when I'm back in Prague!
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had two rooms on the top floor facing the embassy. The rooms were huge and with 3 kids the space was so welcomed!Loved meeting and chatting with owners. They speak English and hearing the history of the area from them made us love Prague even more.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is a hidden gem! Family run and super friendly! The owners go out of their way for you and will help you with every little detail of your trip. Our room was large and super clean! The neighborhood is charming and there are bars and restaurants everywhere. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely family run hotel. Lovely large and clean rooms, comfy beds and staff that can't do enough for you. It's an old hotel up near the USA and German embassies, so about 5-10 min walk from the west side of the George's bridge. Handy for town but also on the way up to the castle. Lovely freshly cooked breakfasts and tea and coffee on tap all day.Would definitely recommend and will stay again.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this family run B and B! We stayed here on reccomendation of friends, so alot of their business is word of mouth. Be sure to ask for a room on an upper floor, the rooms there are bigger and a couple have a view of the castle on the back of the house. We were originally on the ground floor in a small room, but requested to change to another room. Our host graciously allowed us to trade rooms with another couple who also were switching rooms due to street noise. They are often full in season, so be sure to ask for this ahead. Breakfasts were generous and delicious. We were able to arrange with the owner a ride from the train station on arrival, and a ride to the airport when we left for a very reasonable fee. Be warned however that they take payment only in cash, Euros are accepted. Prague is a very walkable city, and the Big Boot is near the castle, and the bridge to the old city.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stay here for 2+5 nights (so a total of 7) during our Central Europe Trip. After some flight delays, we arrived late but the staff rebooked our transfers for us and warmly welcomed us quite late at night. As we were travelling with two children we were given a suite on the first floor which had a separate small bedroom for the children and two bathrooms. The main suite was very large, nicely furnished and overlooked the cobblestone roads and German embassy. There’s a small park about 100m away too. Breakfast was very good with breads, cereals, yogurt, cheese, fruit, cake, ham, eggs and bacon. We were also treated to delicious hot chocolates too. But the highlight of our trip were the staff. Jakub and Jan were fantastic but so were their young staff! We had luggage go missing from our airline and were lucky to have such wonderful people to help with our language barrier. We stayed at some lovely places during our trip but the hospitality of dum u velke boty made this our whole family’s favourite! Oh there is a great little restaurant (u magistra Kelly) less than 50m away)
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have this thing about finding a place to stay in the place I travel that enables me to humbly experience a life like the locals. I found this house because of its impressive review by the Guardian and lucky enough, they were available. They don't need advance payment (I was quite surprised) but happy to know their level of trust :)We wanted to stay in Mala Strana to stay a bit away from the crowded Old Town Sq and could enjoy the beautiful landscape from the Prague Castle. It does require a bit of walk, but after first night we were getting used to it. The room is very pretty and huge for the price we paid and it feels like a home away from home to us both. All the staff are very attentive and basically helped us with any guide we need! That includes finding good local restaurant and even find us a ticket to a Vivaldi Concert because of course it is easier to speak with their language. We arrived early and Jan was at the top of his service, allowed us to have breakfast before check in (without add cost) and allowed us to have very early check in (10 AM) so we can change and spend the day exploring. Breakfast is fulfilling and enough to keep us full up until lunchtime and it is a very quiet hotel so I am sure couples will enjoy this!A very short walk to Prague Castle and Charles Bridge - and we provided a map to help us walking around ourselves. All in all it is a very pretty hotel and always nice to know that it is not every day they host traveler from my country (Indonesia). Will recommend this to anyone and come back here anytime soon!
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Big Boot House is beyond ideal if you're a 'tourist' who doesn't want to suffer Prague's Old Town's over-tourism. Nestled in a quiet street, the family owners couldn't be more charming, really. They'll helpfully point out the tram stops, the epic castle's that's 5 mins away, & the lovely walk over the nearby hill. Prague's much more interesting than having to suffer the epic tourist crap that's offered as authentic.The Big Boot House is likewise genuine, and that's an authentic recomandation. I'll return too, I loved the place that much.
hotelName:
29    House at the Big Boot
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for three nights at the House at the Big Boot (Dum U Velke Boty). What a perfect choice! The house itself is tucked in among the Embassies quite near the Castle. It's a family home that has been lovingly updated with all the modern conveniences. Each room has its own style. Our room in the front overlooked the German Embassy and was HUGE! Breakfast was substantial and varied, and we took advantage of our hosts' willingness to transport us to and from the airport as well. Just a lovely and convenient place to stay would have been wonderful, but what makes this place really special is the people. Both the family and the staff members are AMAZING! They spend a lot of time when you arrive orienting you to the city and giving you tips on how to make the most of your time there. No matter how crazy busy they are, they stop and help you with whatever you might need. What to do? Where to eat? Laundry? Transportation? Check, check, check. Emailed questions before and after the trip got fast & thorough responses, and they have gone way above and beyond to be helpful! The ride to the airport was a mini tour & we learned a bit about their experience under Communist rule. They will even do private walking tours. Beautiful place + gracious and generous hosts = Magical stay.
